7.hebrew: ††щ“»р≈аъƒй, д«щћ—…ојшƒйн д«бјм≈й-щ—»еја; †† е«а¬рƒй, а∆м-йјде»д бћ»и»зјъћƒй.
7.english: I hate them that regard lying vanities; but I trust in the LORD.

8.hebrew: ††а»вƒйм»д еја∆щ“јојз»д, †† бћјз«сјгћ∆к»:а¬щ—∆ш ш»аƒйъ», а∆ъ-т»рјйƒй; †† й»г«тјъћ», бћјц»ше…ъ р«фјщ—ƒй.
8.english: I will be glad and rejoice in Thy lovingkindness; {N}for Thou hast seen mine affliction, Thou hast taken cognizance of the troubles of my soul,

9.hebrew: ††ејм…а дƒсјвћ«шјъћ«рƒй, бћјй«г-ае…й≈б; †† д∆тЅо«гјъћ» б«оћ∆шјз»б ш«вјм»й.
9.english: And Thou hast not given me over into the hand of the enemy; Thou hast set my feet in a broad place.

10.hebrew: ††з»рћ≈рƒй йјде»д, †† лћƒй ц«ш-мƒй:т»щ—јщ—»д бјл«т«с т≈йрƒй; †† р«фјщ—ƒй ећбƒијрƒй.
10.english: Be gracious unto me, O LORD, for I am in distress; {N}mine eye wasteth away with vexation, yea, my soul and my body.

11.hebrew: ††лћƒй л»мећ бјй»ве…п, з«йћ«й-- †† ећщ—јре…ъ«й бћ«а¬р»з»д:лћ»щ—«м бћ«т¬е рƒй л…зƒй; †† е«т¬ц»о«й т»щ—≈щ—ећ.
11.english: For my life is spent in sorrow, and my years in sighing; {N}my strength faileth because of mine iniquity, and my bones are wasted away.

12.hebrew: ††оƒлћ»м-ц…шјш«й д»йƒйъƒй з∆шјфћ»д, ејмƒщ—јл≈р«й оја…г-- †† ећф«з«г мƒојйЋгћ»т»й:ш…а«й бћ«зећх-- †† р»гјгећ оƒоћ∆рћƒй.
12.english: Because of all mine adversaries I am become a reproach, yea, unto my neighbours exceedingly, and a dread to mine acquaintance; {N}they that see me without flee from me.

13.hebrew: ††рƒщ—јлћ«зјъћƒй, лћјо≈ъ оƒмћ≈б; †† д»йƒйъƒй, лћƒлјмƒй а…б≈г.
13.english: I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind; I am like a useless vessel.

14.hebrew: ††лћƒй щ—»о«тјъћƒй, гћƒбћ«ъ ш«бћƒйн-- †† о»ве…ш оƒсћ»бƒйб:бћјдƒећ»сјг»н й«з«г т»м«й; †† м»ч«з«ъ р«фјщ—ƒй ж»о»оећ.
14.english: For I have heard the whispering of many, terror on every side; {N}while they took counsel together against me, they devised to take away my life.

15.hebrew: ††е«а¬рƒй, т»м∆йк» б»и«зјъћƒй йјде»д; †† а»о«шјъћƒй, аЅм…д«й а»ъћ»д.
15.english: But as for me, I have trusted in Thee, O LORD; I have said: 'Thou art my God.'

16.hebrew: ††бћјй»гјк» тƒъћ…ъ»й; †† д«цћƒйм≈рƒй оƒйћ«г-ае…йјб«й, ећо≈ш…гјф»й.
16.english: My times are in Thy hand; deliver me from the hand of mine enemies, and from them that persecute me.

17.hebrew: ††д»аƒйш»д ф»р∆йк», т«м-т«бјгћ∆к»; †† де…щ—ƒйт≈рƒй бјз«сјгћ∆к».
17.english: Make Thy face to shine upon Thy servant; save me in Thy lovingkindness.

18.hebrew: ††йјде»д--а«м-а≈бе…щ—»д, лћƒй чјш»аъƒйк»; †† й≈б…щ—ећ шјщ—»тƒйн, йƒгћјоећ мƒщ—јае…м.
18.english: O LORD, let me not be ashamed, for I have called upon Thee; let the wicked be ashamed, let them be put to silence in the nether-world.

19.hebrew: ††ъћ≈а»м«ојр»д, щ“ƒфјъ≈й-щ—»ч∆ш: †† д«гћ…бјше…ъ т«м-ц«гћƒйч т»ъ»ч--бћјв«а¬е»д е»бећж.
19.english: Let the lying lips be dumb, which speak arrogantly against the righteous, with pride and contempt.

20.hebrew: ††о»д ш«б-иећбјк», †† а¬щ—∆ш-ц»ф«рјъћ» мћƒйш≈а∆йк»:фћ»т«мјъћ», м«з…сƒйн бћ»кј; †† р∆в∆г, бћјр≈й а»г»н.
20.english: Oh how abundant is Thy goodness, which Thou hast laid up for them that fear Thee; {N}which Thou hast wrought for them that take their refuge in Thee, in the sight of the sons of men!

21.hebrew: ††ъћ«сјъћƒйш≈н, бћјс≈ъ∆ш фћ»р∆йк»-- †† о≈шЋлјс≈й-аƒйщ—:ъћƒцјфћјр≈н бћјсЋлћ»д; †† о≈шƒйб мјщ—…ре…ъ.
21.english: Thou hidest them in the covert of Thy presence from the plottings of man; {N}Thou concealest them in a pavilion from the strife of tongues.

22.hebrew: ††бћ»шећкј йјде»д: †† лћƒй дƒфјмƒйа з«сјгће… мƒй, бћјтƒйш о»це…ш.
22.english: Blessed be the LORD; for He hath shown me His wondrous lovingkindness in an entrenched city.

23.hebrew: ††е«а¬рƒй, а»о«шјъћƒй бјз»фјжƒй-- †† рƒвјш«жјъћƒй, оƒрћ∆в∆г т≈йр∆йк»:а»л≈п--щ—»о«тјъћ», че…м ъћ«з¬рећр«й; †† бћјщ—«ећјтƒй а≈м∆йк».
23.english: As for me, I said in my haste: 'I am cut off from before Thine eyes'; {N}nevertheless Thou heardest the voice of my supplications when I cried unto Thee.

24.hebrew: ††а∆дЅбећ а∆ъ-йјде»д, †† лћ»м-з¬сƒйг»йе:аЅоећрƒйн, р…ц≈ш йјде»д; †† ећојщ—«мћ≈н т«м-й∆ъ∆ш, т…щ“≈д в«а¬е»д.
24.english: O love the LORD, all ye His godly ones; {N}the LORD preserveth the faithful, and plentifully repayeth him that acteth haughtily.

25.hebrew: ††зƒжјчећ, ејй«а¬о≈х мјб«бјл∆н-- †† лћ»м-д«ојй«з¬мƒйн, м«йде»д.
25.english: Be strong, and let your heart take courage, all ye that wait for the LORD. {P}

1.hebrew: ìÀãÈåÄã, îÇùÒÀëÌÄéì:    àÇùÑÀøÅé ðÀùÒåÌé-ôÌÆùÑÇò; ëÌÀñåÌé çÂèÈàÈä.
1.english: [A Psalm] of David. Maschil. Happy is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is pardoned.

2.hebrew: àÇùÑÀøÅé àÈãÈí--ìÉà éÇçÀùÑÉá éÀäåÈä ìåÉ òÈåÊï;    åÀàÅéï áÌÀøåÌçåÉ øÀîÄéÌÈä.
2.english: Happy is the man unto whom the LORD counteth not iniquity, and in whose spirit there is no guile.

3.hebrew: ëÌÄé-äÆçÁøÇùÑÀúÌÄé, áÌÈìåÌ òÂöÈîÈé--    áÌÀùÑÇàÂâÈúÄé, ëÌÈì-äÇéÌåÉí.
3.english: When I kept silence, my bones wore away through my groaning all the day long.

4.hebrew: ëÌÄé, éåÉîÈí åÈìÇéÀìÈä--    úÌÄëÀáÌÇã òÈìÇé, éÈãÆêÈ:ðÆäÀôÌÇêÀ ìÀùÑÇãÌÄé--    áÌÀçÇøÀáÉðÅé ÷ÇéÄõ ñÆìÈä.
4.english: For day and night Thy hand was heavy upon me; {N}my sap was turned as in the droughts of summer. Selah

5.hebrew: çÇèÌÈàúÄé àåÉãÄéòÂêÈ,    åÇòÂåÊðÄé ìÉà-ëÄñÌÄéúÄé--àÈîÇøÀúÌÄé,    àåÉãÆä òÂìÅé ôÀùÑÈòÇé ìÇéäåÈä;åÀàÇúÌÈä ðÈùÒÈàúÈ òÂåÊï çÇèÌÈàúÄé    ñÆìÈä.
5.english: I acknowledged my sin unto Thee, and mine iniquity have I not hid; {N}I said: 'I will make confession concerning my transgressions unto the LORD'-- {N}and Thou, Thou forgavest the iniquity of my sin. Selah

6.hebrew: òÇì-æÉàú, éÄúÀôÌÇìÌÅì ëÌÈì-çÈñÄéã àÅìÆéêÈ--    ìÀòÅú îÀöÉà:øÇ÷, ìÀùÑÅèÆó îÇéÄí øÇáÌÄéí--    àÅìÈéå, ìÉà éÇâÌÄéòåÌ.
6.english: For this let every one that is godly pray unto Thee in a time when Thou mayest be found; {N}surely, when the great waters overflow, they will not reach unto him.

7.hebrew: àÇúÌÈä, ñÅúÆø ìÄé--    îÄöÌÇø úÌÄöÌÀøÅðÄé:øÈðÌÅé ôÇìÌÅè;    úÌÀñåÉáÀáÅðÄé ñÆìÈä.
7.english: Thou art my hiding-place; Thou wilt preserve me from the adversary; {N}with songs of deliverance Thou wilt compass me about. Selah

8.hebrew: àÇùÒÀëÌÄéìÀêÈ, åÀàåÉøÀêÈ--áÌÀãÆøÆêÀ-æåÌ úÅìÅêÀ;    àÄéòÂöÈä òÈìÆéêÈ òÅéðÄé.
8.english: 'I will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shalt go; I will give counsel, Mine eye being upon thee.'

9.hebrew: àÇì-úÌÄäÀéåÌ, ëÌÀñåÌñ ëÌÀôÆøÆã--    àÅéï äÈáÄéï:áÌÀîÆúÆâ-åÈøÆñÆï òÆãÀéåÉ ìÄáÀìåÉí;    áÌÇì, ÷ÀøÉá àÅìÆéêÈ.
9.english: Be ye not as the horse, or as the mule, which have no understanding; {N}whose mouth must be held in with bit and bridle, that they come not near unto thee.

10.hebrew: øÇáÌÄéí îÇëÀàåÉáÄéí, ìÈøÈùÑÈò:    åÀäÇáÌåÉèÅçÇ áÌÇéäåÈä--çÆñÆã, éÀñåÉáÀáÆðÌåÌ.
10.english: Many are the sorrows of the wicked; but he that trusteth in the LORD, mercy compasseth him about.

11.hebrew: ùÒÄîÀçåÌ áÇéäåÈä åÀâÄéìåÌ, öÇãÌÄé÷Äéí;    åÀäÇøÀðÄéðåÌ, ëÌÈì-éÄùÑÀøÅé-ìÅá.
11.english: Be glad in the LORD, and rejoice, ye righteous; and shout for joy, all ye that are upright in heart. {P}

1.hebrew: רַנְּנוּ צַדִּיקִים, בַּיהוָה;    לַיְשָׁרִים, נָאוָה תְהִלָּה.
1.english: Rejoice in the LORD, O ye righteous, praise is comely for the upright.

2.hebrew: הוֹדוּ לַיהוָה בְּכִנּוֹר;    בְּנֵבֶל עָשׂוֹר, זַמְּרוּ-לוֹ.
2.english: Give thanks unto the LORD with harp, sing praises unto Him with the psaltery of ten strings.

3.hebrew: שִׁירוּ-לוֹ, שִׁיר חָדָשׁ;    הֵיטִיבוּ נַגֵּן, בִּתְרוּעָה.
3.english: Sing unto Him a new song; play skilfully amid shouts of joy.

4.hebrew: כִּי-יָשָׁר דְּבַר-יְהוָה;    וְכָל-מַעֲשֵׂהוּ, בֶּאֱמוּנָה.
4.english: For the word of the LORD is upright; and all His work is done in faithfulness.

5.hebrew: אֹהֵב, צְדָקָה וּמִשְׁפָּט;    חֶסֶד יְהוָה, מָלְאָה הָאָרֶץ.
5.english: He loveth righteousness and justice; the earth is full of the lovingkindness of the LORD.

6.hebrew: בִּדְבַר יְהוָה, שָׁמַיִם נַעֲשׂוּ;    וּבְרוּחַ פִּיו, כָּל-צְבָאָם.
6.english: By the word of the LORD were the heavens made; and all the host of them by the breath of His mouth.

7.hebrew: כֹּנֵס כַּנֵּד, מֵי הַיָּם;    נֹתֵן בְּאוֹצָרוֹת תְּהוֹמוֹת.
7.english: He gathereth the waters of the sea together as a heap; He layeth up the deeps in storehouses.

8.hebrew: יִירְאוּ מֵיְהוָה, כָּל-הָאָרֶץ;    מִמֶּנּוּ יָגוּרוּ, כָּל-יֹשְׁבֵי תֵבֵל.
8.english: Let all the earth fear the LORD; let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of Him.

9.hebrew: כִּי הוּא אָמַר וַיֶּהִי;    הוּא-צִוָּה, וַיַּעֲמֹד.
9.english: For He spoke, and it was; He commanded, and it stood.

10.hebrew: יְהוָה, הֵפִיר עֲצַת-גּוֹיִם;    הֵנִיא, מַחְשְׁבוֹת עַמִּים.
10.english: The LORD bringeth the counsel of the nations to nought; He maketh the thoughts of the peoples to be of no effect.

11.hebrew: עֲצַת יְהוָה, לְעוֹלָם תַּעֲמֹד;    מַחְשְׁבוֹת לִבּוֹ, לְדֹר וָדֹר.
11.english: The counsel of the LORD standeth for ever, the thoughts of His heart to all generations.

12.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵי הַגּוֹי, אֲשֶׁר-יְהוָה אֱלֹהָיו;    הָעָם, בָּחַר לְנַחֲלָה לוֹ.
12.english: Happy is the nation whose God is the LORD; the people whom He hath chosen for His own inheritance.

13.hebrew: מִשָּׁמַיִם, הִבִּיט יְהוָה;    רָאָה, אֶת-כָּל-בְּנֵי הָאָדָם.
13.english: The LORD looketh from heaven; He beholdeth all the sons of men;

14.hebrew: מִמְּכוֹן-שִׁבְתּוֹ הִשְׁגִּיחַ--    אֶל כָּל-יֹשְׁבֵי הָאָרֶץ.
14.english: From the place of His habitation He looketh intently upon all the inhabitants of the earth;

15.hebrew: הַיֹּצֵר יַחַד לִבָּם;    הַמֵּבִין, אֶל-כָּל-מַעֲשֵׂיהֶם.
15.english: He that fashioneth the hearts of them all, that considereth all their doings.

16.hebrew: אֵין-הַמֶּלֶךְ, נוֹשָׁע בְּרָב-חָיִל;    גִּבּוֹר, לֹא-יִנָּצֵל בְּרָב-כֹּחַ.
16.english: A king is not saved by the multitude of a host; a mighty man is not delivered by great strength.

17.hebrew: שֶׁקֶר הַסּוּס, לִתְשׁוּעָה;    וּבְרֹב חֵילוֹ, לֹא יְמַלֵּט.
17.english: A horse is a vain thing for safety; neither doth it afford escape by its great strength.

18.hebrew: הִנֵּה עֵין יְהוָה, אֶל-יְרֵאָיו;    לַמְיַחֲלִים לְחַסְדּוֹ.
18.english: Behold, the eye of the LORD is toward them that fear Him, toward them that wait for His mercy;

19.hebrew: לְהַצִּיל מִמָּוֶת נַפְשָׁם;    וּלְחַיּוֹתָם, בָּרָעָב.
19.english: To deliver their soul from death, and to keep them alive in famine.

20.hebrew: נַפְשֵׁנוּ, חִכְּתָה לַיהוָה;    עֶזְרֵנוּ וּמָגִנֵּנוּ הוּא.
20.english: Our soul hath waited for the LORD; He is our help and our shield.

21.hebrew: כִּי-בוֹ, יִשְׂמַח לִבֵּנוּ:    כִּי בְשֵׁם קָדְשׁוֹ בָטָחְנוּ.
21.english: For in Him doth our heart rejoice, because we have trusted in His holy name.

22.hebrew: יְהִי-חַסְדְּךָ יְהוָה עָלֵינוּ:    כַּאֲשֶׁר, יִחַלְנוּ לָךְ.
22.english: Let Thy mercy, O LORD, be upon us, according as we have waited for Thee. {P}

1.hebrew: לְדָוִד--    בְּשַׁנּוֹתוֹ אֶת-טַעְמוֹ, לִפְנֵי אֲבִימֶלֶךְ; וַיְגָרְשֵׁהוּ, וַיֵּלַךְ.
1.english: [A Psalm] of David; when he changed his demeanour before Abimelech, who drove him away, and he departed.

2.hebrew: אֲבָרְכָה אֶת-יְהוָה בְּכָל-עֵת;    תָּמִיד, תְּהִלָּתוֹ בְּפִי.
2.english: I will bless the LORD at all times; His praise shall continually be in my mouth.

3.hebrew: בַּיהוָה, תִּתְהַלֵּל נַפְשִׁי;    יִשְׁמְעוּ עֲנָוִים וְיִשְׂמָחוּ.
3.english: My soul shall glory in the LORD; the humble shall hear thereof, and be glad.

4.hebrew: גַּדְּלוּ לַיהוָה אִתִּי;    וּנְרוֹמְמָה שְׁמוֹ יַחְדָּו.
4.english: O magnify the LORD with me, and let us exalt His name together.

5.hebrew: דָּרַשְׁתִּי אֶת-יְהוָה וְעָנָנִי;    וּמִכָּל-מְגוּרוֹתַי הִצִּילָנִי.
5.english: I sought the LORD, and He answered me, and delivered me from all my fears.

6.hebrew: הִבִּיטוּ אֵלָיו וְנָהָרוּ;    וּפְנֵיהֶם, אַל-יֶחְפָּרוּ.
6.english: They looked unto Him, and were radiant; and their faces shall never be abashed.

7.hebrew: זֶה עָנִי קָרָא, וַיהוָה שָׁמֵעַ;    וּמִכָּל-צָרוֹתָיו, הוֹשִׁיעוֹ.
7.english: This poor man cried, and the LORD heard, and saved him out of all his troubles.

8.hebrew: חֹנֶה מַלְאַךְ-יְהוָה סָבִיב לִירֵאָיו;    וַיְחַלְּצֵם.
8.english: The angel of the LORD encampeth round about them that fear Him, and delivereth them.

9.hebrew: טַעֲמוּ וּרְאוּ, כִּי-טוֹב יְהוָה;    אַשְׁרֵי הַגֶּבֶר, יֶחֱסֶה-בּוֹ.
9.english: O consider and see that the LORD is good; happy is the man that taketh refuge in Him.

10.hebrew: יְראוּ אֶת-יְהוָה קְדֹשָׁיו:    כִּי-אֵין מַחְסוֹר, לִירֵאָיו.
10.english: O fear the LORD, ye His holy ones; for there is no want to them that fear Him.

11.hebrew: כְּפִירִים, רָשׁוּ וְרָעֵבוּ;    וְדֹרְשֵׁי יְהוָה, לֹא-יַחְסְרוּ כָל-טוֹב.
11.english: The young lions do lack, and suffer hunger; but they that seek the LORD want not any good thing.

12.hebrew: לְכוּ-בָנִים, שִׁמְעוּ-לִי;    יִרְאַת יְהוָה, אֲלַמֶּדְכֶם.
12.english: Come, ye children, hearken unto me; I will teach you the fear of the LORD.

13.hebrew: מִי-הָאִישׁ, הֶחָפֵץ חַיִּים;    אֹהֵב יָמִים, לִרְאוֹת טוֹב.
13.english: Who is the man that desireth life, and loveth days, that he may see good therein?

14.hebrew: נְצֹר לְשׁוֹנְךָ מֵרָע;    וּשְׂפָתֶיךָ, מִדַּבֵּר מִרְמָה.
14.english: Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile.

15.hebrew: סוּר מֵרָע, וַעֲשֵׂה-טוֹב;    בַּקֵּשׁ שָׁלוֹם וְרָדְפֵהוּ.
15.english: Depart from evil, and do good; seek peace, and pursue it.

16.hebrew: עֵינֵי יְהוָה, אֶל-צַדִּיקִים;    וְאָזְנָיו, אֶל-שַׁוְעָתָם.
16.english: The eyes of the LORD are toward the righteous, and His ears are open unto their cry.

17.hebrew: פְּנֵי יְהוָה, בְּעֹשֵׂי רָע;    לְהַכְרִית מֵאֶרֶץ זִכְרָם.
17.english: The face of the LORD is against them that do evil, to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.

18.hebrew: צָעֲקוּ, וַיהוָה שָׁמֵעַ;    וּמִכָּל-צָרוֹתָם, הִצִּילָם.
18.english: They cried, and the LORD heard, and delivered them out of all their troubles.

19.hebrew: קָרוֹב יְהוָה, לְנִשְׁבְּרֵי-לֵב;    וְאֶת-דַּכְּאֵי-רוּחַ יוֹשִׁיעַ.
19.english: The LORD is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart, and saveth such as are of a contrite spirit.

20.hebrew: רַבּוֹת, רָעוֹת צַדִּיק;    וּמִכֻּלָּם, יַצִּילֶנּוּ יְהוָה.
20.english: Many are the ills of the righteous, but the LORD delivereth him out of them all.

21.hebrew: שֹׁמֵר כָּל-עַצְמוֹתָיו;    אַחַת מֵהֵנָּה, לֹא נִשְׁבָּרָה.
21.english: He keepeth all his bones; not one of them is broken.

22.hebrew: תְּמוֹתֵת רָשָׁע רָעָה;    וְשֹׂנְאֵי צַדִּיק יֶאְשָׁמוּ.
22.english: Evil shall kill the wicked; and they that hate the righteous shall be held guilty.

23.hebrew: פֹּדֶה יְהוָה, נֶפֶשׁ עֲבָדָיו;    וְלֹא יֶאְשְׁמוּ, כָּל-הַחֹסִים בּוֹ.
23.english: The LORD redeemeth the soul of His servants; and none of them that take refuge in Him shall be desolate. {P}

1.hebrew: לְדָוִד:  רִיבָה יְהוָה, אֶת-יְרִיבַי;    לְחַם, אֶת-לֹחֲמָי.
1.english: A Psalm of David. Strive, O LORD, with them that strive with me; fight against them that fight against me.

2.hebrew: הַחֲזֵק מָגֵן וְצִנָּה;    וְקוּמָה, בְּעֶזְרָתִי.
2.english: Take hold of shield and buckler, and rise up to my help.

3.hebrew: וְהָרֵק חֲנִית וּסְגֹר, לִקְרַאת רֹדְפָי;    אֱמֹר לְנַפְשִׁי, יְשֻׁעָתֵךְ אָנִי.
3.english: Draw out also the spear, and the battle-axe, against them that pursue me; say unto my soul: 'I am thy salvation.'

4.hebrew: יֵבֹשׁוּ וְיִכָּלְמוּ, מְבַקְשֵׁי נַפְשִׁי:    יִסֹּגוּ אָחוֹר וְיַחְפְּרוּ--חֹשְׁבֵי, רָעָתִי.
4.english: Let them be ashamed and brought to confusion that seek after my soul; let them be turned back and be abashed that devise my hurt.

5.hebrew: יִהְיוּ, כְּמֹץ לִפְנֵי-רוּחַ;    וּמַלְאַךְ יְהוָה דּוֹחֶה.
5.english: Let them be as chaff before the wind, the angel of the LORD thrusting them.

6.hebrew: יְהִי-דַרְכָּם, חֹשֶׁךְ וַחֲלַקְלַקֹּת;    וּמַלְאַךְ יְהוָה, רֹדְפָם.
6.english: Let their way be dark and slippery, the angel of the LORD pursuing them.

7.hebrew: כִּי-חִנָּם טָמְנוּ-לִי, שַׁחַת רִשְׁתָּם;    חִנָּם, חָפְרוּ לְנַפְשִׁי.
7.english: For without cause have they hid for me the pit, even their net, without cause have they digged for my soul.

8.hebrew: תְּבוֹאֵהוּ שׁוֹאָה,    לֹא-יֵדָע:וְרִשְׁתּוֹ אֲשֶׁר-טָמַן תִּלְכְּדוֹ;    בְּשׁוֹאָה, יִפָּל-בָּהּ.
8.english: Let destruction come upon him unawares; {N}and let his net that he hath hid catch himself; with destruction let him fall therein.

9.hebrew: וְנַפְשִׁי, תָּגִיל בַּיהוָה;    תָּשִׂישׂ, בִּישׁוּעָתוֹ.
9.english: And my soul shall be joyful in the LORD; it shall rejoice in His salvation.

10.hebrew: כָּל עַצְמוֹתַי, תֹּאמַרְנָה--    יְהוָה, מִי כָמוֹךָ:מַצִּיל עָנִי, מֵחָזָק מִמֶּנּוּ;    וְעָנִי וְאֶבְיוֹן, מִגֹּזְלוֹ.
10.english: All my bones shall say: 'LORD, who is like unto Thee, {N}who deliverest the poor from him that is too strong for him, yea, the poor and the needy from him that spoileth him?'

11.hebrew: יְקוּמוּן, עֵדֵי חָמָס:    אֲשֶׁר לֹא-יָדַעְתִּי, יִשְׁאָלוּנִי.
11.english: Unrighteous witnesses rise up; they ask me of things that I know not.

12.hebrew: יְשַׁלְּמוּנִי רָעָה, תַּחַת טוֹבָה:    שְׁכוֹל לְנַפְשִׁי.
12.english: They repay me evil for good; bereavement is come to my soul.

13.hebrew: וַאֲנִי, בַּחֲלוֹתָם לְבוּשִׁי שָׂק--    עִנֵּיתִי בַצּוֹם נַפְשִׁי;וּתְפִלָּתִי,    עַל-חֵיקִי תָשׁוּב.
13.english: But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth, I afflicted my soul with fasting; {N}and my prayer, may it return into mine own bosom.

14.hebrew: כְּרֵעַ-כְּאָח לִי, הִתְהַלָּכְתִּי;    כַּאֲבֶל-אֵם, קֹדֵר שַׁחוֹתִי.
14.english: I went about as though it had been my friend or my brother; I bowed down mournful, as one that mourneth for his mother.

15.hebrew: וּבְצַלְעִי,    שָׂמְחוּ וְנֶאֱסָפוּ:נֶאֶסְפוּ עָלַי נֵכִים,    וְלֹא יָדַעְתִּי;קָרְעוּ    וְלֹא-דָמּוּ.
15.english: But when I halt they rejoice, and gather themselves together; {N}the abjects gather themselves together against me, and those whom I know not; {N}they tear me, and cease not;

16.hebrew: בְּחַנְפֵי, לַעֲגֵי מָעוֹג--    חָרֹק עָלַי שִׁנֵּימוֹ.
16.english: With the profanest mockeries of backbiting they gnash at me with their teeth.

17.hebrew: אֲדֹנָי,    כַּמָּה תִּרְאֶה:הָשִׁיבָה נַפְשִׁי, מִשֹּׁאֵיהֶם;    מִכְּפִירִים, יְחִידָתִי.
17.english: Lord, how long wilt Thou look on? {N}Rescue my soul from their destructions, mine only one from the lions.

18.hebrew: אוֹדְךָ, בְּקָהָל רָב;    בְּעַם עָצוּם אֲהַלְלֶךָּ.
18.english: I will give Thee thanks in the great congregation; I will praise Thee among a numerous people.

19.hebrew: אַל-יִשְׂמְחוּ-לִי אֹיְבַי שֶׁקֶר;    שֹׂנְאַי חִנָּם, יִקְרְצוּ-עָיִן.
19.english: Let not them that are wrongfully mine enemies rejoice over me; neither let them wink with the eye that hate me without a cause.

20.hebrew: כִּי לֹא שָׁלוֹם, יְדַבֵּרוּ:    וְעַל רִגְעֵי-אֶרֶץ--דִּבְרֵי מִרְמוֹת, יַחֲשֹׁבוּן.
20.english: For they speak not peace; but they devise deceitful matters against them that are quiet in the land.

21.hebrew: וַיַּרְחִיבוּ עָלַי, פִּיהֶם:    אָמְרוּ, הֶאָח הֶאָח; רָאֲתָה עֵינֵנוּ.
21.english: Yea, they open their mouth wide against me; they say: 'Aha, aha, our eye hath seen it.'

22.hebrew: רָאִיתָה יְהוָה, אַל-תֶּחֱרַשׁ;    אֲדֹנָי, אַל-תִּרְחַק מִמֶּנִּי.
22.english: Thou hast seen, O LORD; keep not silence; O Lord, be not far from me.

23.hebrew: הָעִירָה וְהָקִיצָה, לְמִשְׁפָּטִי;    אֱלֹהַי וַאדֹנָי לְרִיבִי.
23.english: Rouse Thee, and awake to my judgment, even unto my cause, my God and my Lord.

24.english: Judge me, O LORD my God, according to Thy righteousness; and let them not rejoice over me.

25.hebrew: אַל-יֹאמְרוּ בְלִבָּם, הֶאָח נַפְשֵׁנוּ;    אַל-יֹאמְרוּ, בִּלַּעֲנוּהוּ.
25.english: Let them not say in their heart: 'Aha, we have our desire'; let them not say: 'We have swallowed him up.'

26.hebrew: יֵבֹשׁוּ וְיַחְפְּרוּ, יַחְדָּו--    שְׂמֵחֵי רָעָתִי:יִלְבְּשׁוּ-בֹשֶׁת וּכְלִמָּה--    הַמַּגְדִּילִים עָלָי.
26.english: Let them be ashamed and abashed together that rejoice at my hurt; {N}let them be clothed with shame and confusion that magnify themselves against me.

27.hebrew: יָרֹנּוּ וְיִשְׂמְחוּ,    חֲפֵצֵי צִדְקִי:וְיֹאמְרוּ תָמִיד, יִגְדַּל יְהוָה;    הֶחָפֵץ, שְׁלוֹם עַבְדּוֹ.
27.english: Let them shout for joy, and be glad, that delight in my righteousness; {N}yea, let them say continually: 'Magnified be the LORD, who delighteth in the peace of His servant.'

28.english: And my tongue shall speak of Thy righteousness, and of Thy praise all the day. {P}

1.hebrew: ††м«ојр«цћ≈з« мјт∆б∆г-йјде»д мјг»еƒг.
1.english: For the Leader. [A Psalm] of David the servant of the LORD.

2.hebrew: ††рјаЋн-фћ∆щ—«т м»ш»щ—»т, бћјч∆ш∆б мƒбћƒй; †† а≈йп-фћ«з«г аЅм…дƒйн, мјр∆в∆г т≈йр»йе.

3.hebrew: ††лћƒй-д∆зЅмƒйч а≈м»йе бћјт≈йр»йе; †† мƒојц…а т¬е ре… мƒщ“јр…а.

5.hebrew: ††а»е∆п, й«зјщ—…б--т«м-оƒщ—јлћ»бе…: †† йƒъјй«цћ≈б, т«м-гћ∆ш∆кј м…а-ие…б; ш»т, м…а йƒоја»с.

6.hebrew: ††йјде»д, бћјд«щћ—»о«йƒн з«сјгћ∆к»; †† аЅоећр»ъјк», т«г-щ—јз»чƒйн.

7.hebrew: ††цƒгјч»ъјк», лћјд«шјш≈й-а≈м--оƒщ—јфћ»и∆йк», ъћјде…н ш«бћ»д; †† а»г»н ећбјд≈о»д ъе…щ—ƒйт« йјде»д.

8.hebrew: ††о«д-йћ»ч»ш з«сјгћјк», аЅм…дƒйн: †† ећбјр≈й а»г»н--бћјц≈м лћјр»ф∆йк», й∆зЅс»йећп.

9.hebrew: ††йƒшјејйЋп, оƒгћ∆щ—∆п бћ≈йъ∆к»; †† ејр«з«м т¬г»р∆йк» ъ«щ—јч≈н.
9.english: They are abundantly satisfied with the fatness of Thy house; and Thou makest them drink of the river of Thy pleasures.

10.hebrew: ††лћƒй-тƒоћјк», ојче…ш з«йћƒйн; †† бћјае…шјк», рƒшја∆д-ае…ш.

11.hebrew: ††ојщ—…кј з«сјгћјк», мјй…гјт∆йк»; †† ејцƒгјч»ъјк», мјйƒщ—јш≈й-м≈б.

12.hebrew: ††а«м-ъћјбе…а≈рƒй, ш∆в∆м вћ«а¬е»д; †† ејй«г-шјщ—»тƒйн, а«м-ъћјрƒг≈рƒй.
12.english: Let not the foot of pride overtake me, and let not the hand of the wicked drive me away.

13.hebrew: ††щ—»н р»фјмећ, фћ…т¬м≈й а»е∆п; †† гћ…зећ, ејм…а-й»лјмећ чећн.
13.english: There are the workers of iniquity fallen; they are thrust down, and are not able to rise. {P}

1.hebrew: לְדָוִד:  אַל-תִּתְחַר בַּמְּרֵעִים;    אַל-תְּקַנֵּא, בְּעֹשֵׂי עַוְלָה.
1.english: [A Psalm] of David. Fret not thyself because of evil-doers, neither be thou envious against them that work unrighteousness.

2.hebrew: כִּי כֶחָצִיר, מְהֵרָה יִמָּלוּ;    וּכְיֶרֶק דֶּשֶׁא, יִבּוֹלוּן.
2.english: For they shall soon wither like the grass, and fade as the green herb.

3.hebrew: בְּטַח בַּיהוָה, וַעֲשֵׂה-טוֹב;    שְׁכָן-אֶרֶץ, וּרְעֵה אֱמוּנָה.
3.english: Trust in the LORD, and do good; dwell in the land, and cherish faithfulness.

4.hebrew: וְהִתְעַנַּג עַל-יְהוָה;    וְיִתֶּן-לְךָ, מִשְׁאֲלֹת לִבֶּךָ.
4.english: So shalt thou delight thyself in the LORD; and He shall give thee the petitions of thy heart.

5.hebrew: גּוֹל עַל-יְהוָה דַּרְכֶּךָ;    וּבְטַח עָלָיו, וְהוּא יַעֲשֶׂה.
5.english: Commit thy way unto the LORD; trust also in Him, and He will bring it to pass.

6.hebrew: וְהוֹצִיא כָאוֹר צִדְקֶךָ;    וּמִשְׁפָּטֶךָ, כַּצָּהֳרָיִם.
6.english: And He will make thy righteousness to go forth as the light, and thy right as the noonday.

7.hebrew: דּוֹם, לַיהוָה--    וְהִתְחוֹלֵל-לוֹ:אַל-תִּתְחַר, בְּמַצְלִיחַ דַּרְכּוֹ;    בְּאִישׁ, עֹשֶׂה מְזִמּוֹת.
7.english: Resign thyself unto the LORD, and wait patiently for Him; {N}fret not thyself because of him who prospereth in his way, because of the man who bringeth wicked devices to pass.

8.hebrew: הֶרֶף מֵאַף, וַעֲזֹב חֵמָה;    אַל-תִּתְחַר, אַךְ-לְהָרֵעַ.
8.english: Cease from anger, and forsake wrath; fret not thyself, it tendeth only to evil-doing.

9.hebrew: כִּי-מְרֵעִים, יִכָּרֵתוּן;    וְקֹוֵי יְהוָה, הֵמָּה יִירְשׁוּ-אָרֶץ.
9.english: For evil-doers shall be cut off; but those that wait for the LORD, they shall inherit the land.

10.hebrew: וְעוֹד מְעַט, וְאֵין רָשָׁע;    וְהִתְבּוֹנַנְתָּ עַל-מְקוֹמוֹ וְאֵינֶנּוּ.
10.english: And yet a little while, and the wicked is no more; yea, thou shalt look well at his place, and he is not.

11.hebrew: וַעֲנָוִים יִירְשׁוּ-אָרֶץ;    וְהִתְעַנְּגוּ, עַל-רֹב שָׁלוֹם.
11.english: But the humble shall inherit the land, and delight themselves in the abundance of peace.

12.hebrew: זֹמֵם רָשָׁע, לַצַּדִּיק;    וְחֹרֵק עָלָיו שִׁנָּיו.
12.english: The wicked plotteth against the righteous, and gnasheth at him with his teeth.

13.hebrew: אֲדֹנָי יִשְׂחַק-לוֹ:    כִּי-רָאָה, כִּי-יָבֹא יוֹמוֹ.
13.english: The Lord doth laugh at him; for He seeth that his day is coming.

14.hebrew: חֶרֶב, פָּתְחוּ רְשָׁעִים--    וְדָרְכוּ קַשְׁתָּם:לְהַפִּיל, עָנִי וְאֶבְיוֹן;    לִטְבוֹחַ, יִשְׁרֵי-דָרֶךְ.
14.english: The wicked have drawn out the sword, and have bent their bow; {N}to cast down the poor and needy, to slay such as are upright in the way;

15.hebrew: חַרְבָּם, תָּבוֹא בְלִבָּם;    וְקַשְּׁתוֹתָם, תִּשָּׁבַרְנָה.
15.english: Their sword shall enter into their own heart, and their bows shall be broken.

16.hebrew: טוֹב-מְעַט, לַצַּדִּיק--    מֵהֲמוֹן, רְשָׁעִים רַבִּים.
16.english: Better is a little that the righteous hath than the abundance of many wicked.

17.hebrew: כִּי זְרוֹעוֹת רְשָׁעִים, תִּשָּׁבַרְנָה;    וְסוֹמֵךְ צַדִּיקִים יְהוָה.
17.english: For the arms of the wicked shall be broken; but the LORD upholdeth the righteous.

18.hebrew: יוֹדֵעַ יְהוָה, יְמֵי תְמִימִם;    וְנַחֲלָתָם, לְעוֹלָם תִּהְיֶה.
18.english: The LORD knoweth the days of them that are wholehearted; and their inheritance shall be for ever.

19.hebrew: לֹא-יֵבֹשׁוּ, בְּעֵת רָעָה;    וּבִימֵי רְעָבוֹן יִשְׂבָּעוּ.
19.english: They shall not be ashamed in the time of evil; and in the days of famine they shall be satisfied.

20.hebrew: כִּי רְשָׁעִים, יֹאבֵדוּ, וְאֹיְבֵי יְהוָה, כִּיקַר כָּרִים;    כָּלוּ בֶעָשָׁן כָּלוּ.
20.english: For the wicked shall perish, and the enemies of the LORD shall be as the fat of lambs--they shall pass away in smoke, they shall pass away.

21.hebrew: לֹוֶה רָשָׁע, וְלֹא יְשַׁלֵּם;    וְצַדִּיק, חוֹנֵן וְנוֹתֵן.
21.english: The wicked borroweth, and payeth not; but the righteous dealeth graciously, and giveth.

22.hebrew: כִּי מְבֹרָכָיו, יִירְשׁוּ אָרֶץ;    וּמְקֻלָּלָיו, יִכָּרֵתוּ.
22.english: For such as are blessed of Him shall inherit the land; and they that are cursed of Him shall be cut off.

23.hebrew: מֵיְהוָה, מִצְעֲדֵי-גֶבֶר כּוֹנָנוּ;    וְדַרְכּוֹ יֶחְפָּץ.
23.english: It is of the LORD that a man's goings are established; and He delighted in his way.

24.english: Though he fall, he shall not be utterly cast down; for the LORD upholdeth his hand.

25.hebrew: נַעַר, הָיִיתִי--    גַּם-זָקַנְתִּי:וְלֹא-רָאִיתִי, צַדִּיק נֶעֱזָב;    וְזַרְעוֹ, מְבַקֶּשׁ-לָחֶם.
25.english: I have been young, and now am old; {N}yet have I not seen the righteous forsaken, nor his seed begging bread.

26.english: All the day long he dealeth graciously, and lendeth; and his seed is blessed.

27.english: Depart from evil, and do good; and dwell for evermore.

28.hebrew: כִּי יְהוָה, אֹהֵב מִשְׁפָּט,    וְלֹא-יַעֲזֹב אֶת-חֲסִידָיו, לְעוֹלָם נִשְׁמָרוּ;וְזֶרַע רְשָׁעִים    נִכְרָת.
28.english: For the LORD loveth justice, and forsaketh not His saints; they are preserved for ever; {N}but the seed of the wicked shall be cut off.

29.english: The righteous shall inherit the land, and dwell therein for ever.

30.hebrew: פִּי-צַדִּיק, יֶהְגֶּה חָכְמָה;    וּלְשׁוֹנוֹ, תְּדַבֵּר מִשְׁפָּט.
30.english: The mouth of the righteous uttereth wisdom, and his tongue speaketh justice.

31.hebrew: תּוֹרַת אֱלֹהָיו בְּלִבּוֹ;    לֹא תִמְעַד אֲשֻׁרָיו.
31.english: The law of his God is in his heart; none of his steps slide.

32.english: The wicked watcheth the righteous, and seeketh to slay him.

33.hebrew: יְהוָה, לֹא-יַעַזְבֶנּוּ בְיָדוֹ;    וְלֹא יַרְשִׁיעֶנּוּ, בְּהִשָּׁפְטוֹ.
33.english: The LORD will not leave him in his hand, nor suffer him to be condemned when he is judged.

34.hebrew: קַוֵּה אֶל-יְהוָה, וּשְׁמֹר דַּרְכּוֹ,    וִירוֹמִמְךָ, לָרֶשֶׁת אָרֶץ;בְּהִכָּרֵת רְשָׁעִים    תִּרְאֶה.
34.english: Wait for the LORD, and keep His way, and He will exalt thee to inherit the land; {N}when the wicked are cut off, thou shalt see it.

35.hebrew: רָאִיתִי, רָשָׁע עָרִיץ;    וּמִתְעָרֶה, כְּאֶזְרָח רַעֲנָן.
35.english: I have seen the wicked in great power, and spreading himself like a leafy tree in its native soil.

36.hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֹר, וְהִנֵּה אֵינֶנּוּ;    וָאֲבַקְשֵׁהוּ, וְלֹא נִמְצָא.
36.english: But one passed by, and, lo, he was not; yea, I sought him, but he could not be found.

37.hebrew: שְׁמָר-תָּם, וּרְאֵה יָשָׁר:    כִּי-אַחֲרִית לְאִישׁ שָׁלוֹם.
37.english: Mark the man of integrity, and behold the upright; for there is a future for the man of peace.

38.hebrew: וּפֹשְׁעִים, נִשְׁמְדוּ יַחְדָּו;    אַחֲרִית רְשָׁעִים נִכְרָתָה.
38.english: But transgressors shall be destroyed together; the future of the wicked shall be cut off.

39.hebrew: וּתְשׁוּעַת צַדִּיקִים, מֵיְהוָה;    מָעוּזָּם, בְּעֵת צָרָה.
39.english: But the salvation of the righteous is of the LORD; He is their stronghold in the time of trouble.

40.hebrew: וַיַּעְזְרֵם יְהוָה, וַיְפַלְּטֵם:    יְפַלְּטֵם מֵרְשָׁעִים, וְיוֹשִׁיעֵם--כִּי-חָסוּ בוֹ.
40.english: And the LORD helpeth them, and delivereth them; He delivereth them from the wicked, and saveth them, because they have taken refuge in Him. {P}

1.english: A Psalm of David, to make memorial.

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ, מִזְמוֹר לְדָוִד.
1.english: For the Leader. A Psalm of David.

2.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵי, מַשְׂכִּיל אֶל-דָּל;    בְּיוֹם רָעָה, יְמַלְּטֵהוּ יְהוָה.
2.english: Happy is he that considereth the poor; the LORD will deliver him in the day of evil.

3.hebrew: יְהוָה, יִשְׁמְרֵהוּ וִיחַיֵּהוּ--יאשר (וְאֻשַּׁר) בָּאָרֶץ;    וְאַל-תִּתְּנֵהוּ, בְּנֶפֶשׁ אֹיְבָיו.
3.english: The LORD preserve him, and keep him alive, let him be called happy in the land; and deliver not Thou him unto the greed of his enemies.

4.hebrew: יְהוָה--יִסְעָדֶנּוּ, עַל-עֶרֶשׂ דְּוָי;    כָּל-מִשְׁכָּבוֹ, הָפַכְתָּ בְחָלְיוֹ.
4.english: The LORD support him upon the bed of illness; mayest Thou turn all his lying down in his sickness.

5.hebrew: אֲנִי-אָמַרְתִּי, יְהוָה חָנֵּנִי;    רְפָאָה נַפְשִׁי, כִּי-חָטָאתִי לָךְ.
5.english: As for me, I said: 'O LORD, be gracious unto me; heal my soul; for I have sinned against Thee.'

6.hebrew: אוֹיְבַי--יֹאמְרוּ רַע לִי;    מָתַי יָמוּת, וְאָבַד שְׁמוֹ.
6.english: Mine enemies speak evil of me: 'When shall he die, and his name perish?'

7.hebrew: וְאִם-בָּא לִרְאוֹת, שָׁוְא יְדַבֵּר--לִבּוֹ, יִקְבָּץ-אָוֶן לוֹ;    יֵצֵא לַחוּץ יְדַבֵּר.
7.english: And if one come to see me, he speaketh falsehood; his heart gathereth iniquity to itself; when he goeth abroad, he speaketh of it.

8.hebrew: יַחַד--עָלַי יִתְלַחֲשׁוּ, כָּל-שֹׂנְאָי;    עָלַי--יַחְשְׁבוּ רָעָה לִי.
8.english: All that hate me whisper together against me, against me do they devise my hurt:

9.hebrew: דְּבַר-בְּלִיַּעַל, יָצוּק בּוֹ;    וַאֲשֶׁר שָׁכַב, לֹא-יוֹסִיף לָקוּם.
9.english: 'An evil thing cleaveth fast unto him; and now that he lieth, he shall rise up no more.'

10.hebrew: גַּם-אִישׁ שְׁלוֹמִי, אֲשֶׁר-בָּטַחְתִּי בוֹ--    אוֹכֵל לַחְמִי;הִגְדִּיל עָלַי    עָקֵב.
10.english: Yea, mine own familiar friend, in whom I trusted, who did eat of my bread, {N}hath lifted up his heel against me.

11.hebrew: וְאַתָּה יְהוָה, חָנֵּנִי וַהֲקִימֵנִי;    וַאֲשַׁלְּמָה לָהֶם.
11.english: But Thou, O LORD, be gracious unto me, and raise me up, that I may requite them.

12.hebrew: בְּזֹאת יָדַעְתִּי, כִּי-חָפַצְתָּ בִּי:    כִּי לֹא-יָרִיעַ אֹיְבִי עָלָי.
12.english: By this I know that Thou delightest in me, that mine enemy doth not triumph over me.

13.hebrew: וַאֲנִי--בְּתֻמִּי, תָּמַכְתָּ בִּי;    וַתַּצִּיבֵנִי לְפָנֶיךָ לְעוֹלָם.
13.english: And as for me, Thou upholdest me because of mine integrity, and settest me before Thy face for ever.

14.hebrew: בָּרוּךְ יְהוָה, אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל--מֵהָעוֹלָם, וְעַד הָעוֹלָם:    אָמֵן וְאָמֵן.
14.english: Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, from everlasting and to everlasting. Amen, and Amen. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ, מַשְׂכִּיל לִבְנֵי-קֹרַח.
1.english: For the Leader; Maschil of the sons of Korah.

2.hebrew: כְּאַיָּל, תַּעֲרֹג עַל-אֲפִיקֵי-מָיִם--    כֵּן נַפְשִׁי תַעֲרֹג אֵלֶיךָ אֱלֹהִים.
2.english: As the hart panteth after the water brooks, so panteth my soul after Thee, O God.

3.hebrew: צָמְאָה נַפְשִׁי, לֵאלֹהִים--    לְאֵל חָי:מָתַי אָבוֹא;    וְאֵרָאֶה, פְּנֵי אֱלֹהִים.
3.english: My soul thirsteth for God, for the living God: {N}'When shall I come and appear before God?'

4.hebrew: הָיְתָה-לִּי דִמְעָתִי לֶחֶם,    יוֹמָם וָלָיְלָה;בֶּאֱמֹר אֵלַי כָּל-הַיּוֹם,    אַיֵּה אֱלֹהֶיךָ.
4.english: My tears have been my food day and night, {N}while they say unto me all the day: 'Where is thy God?'

5.hebrew: אֵלֶּה אֶזְכְּרָה,    וְאֶשְׁפְּכָה עָלַי נַפְשִׁי--כִּי אֶעֱבֹר בַּסָּךְ,    אֶדַּדֵּם עַד-בֵּית אֱלֹהִים:בְּקוֹל-רִנָּה וְתוֹדָה;    הָמוֹן חוֹגֵג.
5.english: These things I remember, and pour out my soul within me, {N}how I passed on with the throng, and led them to the house of God, {N}with the voice of joy and praise, a multitude keeping holyday.

6.hebrew: מַה-תִּשְׁתּוֹחֲחִי, נַפְשִׁי--    וַתֶּהֱמִי עָלָי:הוֹחִלִי לֵאלֹהִים, כִּי-עוֹד אוֹדֶנּוּ--    יְשׁוּעוֹת פָּנָיו.
6.english: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why moanest thou within me? {N}Hope thou in God; for I shall yet praise Him for the salvation of His countenance.

7.hebrew: אֱלֹהַי--    עָלַי, נַפְשִׁי תִשְׁתּוֹחָח:עַל-כֵּן--אֶזְכָּרְךָ, מֵאֶרֶץ יַרְדֵּן;    וְחֶרְמוֹנִים, מֵהַר מִצְעָר.
7.english: O my God, my soul is cast down within me; {N}therefore do I remember Thee from the land of Jordan, and the Hermons, from the hill Mizar.

8.hebrew: תְּהוֹם-אֶל-תְּהוֹם קוֹרֵא,    לְקוֹל צִנּוֹרֶיךָ;כָּל-מִשְׁבָּרֶיךָ וְגַלֶּיךָ,    עָלַי עָבָרוּ.
8.english: Deep calleth unto deep at the voice of Thy cataracts; {N}all Thy waves and Thy billows are gone over me.

9.hebrew: יוֹמָם, יְצַוֶּה יְהוָה חַסְדּוֹ,    וּבַלַּיְלָה, שִׁירֹה עִמִּי--תְּפִלָּה,    לְאֵל חַיָּי.
9.english: By day the LORD will command His lovingkindness, and in the night His song shall be with me, {N}even a prayer unto the God of my life.

10.hebrew: אוֹמְרָה, לְאֵל סַלְעִי--    לָמָה שְׁכַחְתָּנִי:לָמָּה-קֹדֵר אֵלֵךְ--    בְּלַחַץ אוֹיֵב.
10.english: I will say unto God my Rock: 'Why hast Thou forgotten me? {N}Why go I mourning under the oppression of the enemy?'

11.hebrew: בְּרֶצַח, בְּעַצְמוֹתַי--    חֵרְפוּנִי צוֹרְרָי;בְּאָמְרָם אֵלַי כָּל-הַיּוֹם,    אַיֵּה אֱלֹהֶיךָ.
11.english: As with a crushing in my bones, mine adversaries taunt me; {N}while they say unto me all the day: 'Where is thy God?'

12.hebrew: מַה-תִּשְׁתּוֹחֲחִי, נַפְשִׁי--    וּמַה-תֶּהֱמִי עָלָי:הוֹחִילִי לֵאלֹהִים, כִּי-עוֹד אוֹדֶנּוּ--    יְשׁוּעֹת פָּנַי, וֵאלֹהָי.
12.english: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why moanest thou within me? {N}Hope thou in God; for I shall yet praise Him, the salvation of my countenance, and my God. {P}

1.hebrew: שָׁפְטֵנִי אֱלֹהִים, וְרִיבָה רִיבִי--    מִגּוֹי לֹא-חָסִיד;מֵאִישׁ מִרְמָה וְעַוְלָה    תְפַלְּטֵנִי.
1.english: Be Thou my judge, O God, and plead my cause against an ungodly nation; {N}O deliver me from the deceitful and unjust man.

2.hebrew: כִּי-אַתָּה, אֱלֹהֵי מָעוּזִּי--    לָמָה זְנַחְתָּנִי:לָמָּה-קֹדֵר אֶתְהַלֵּךְ,    בְּלַחַץ אוֹיֵב.
2.english: For Thou art the God of my strength; why hast Thou cast me off? {N}Why go I mourning under the oppression of the enemy?

3.hebrew: שְׁלַח-אוֹרְךָ וַאֲמִתְּךָ,    הֵמָּה יַנְחוּנִי;יְבִיאוּנִי אֶל-הַר-קָדְשְׁךָ,    וְאֶל-מִשְׁכְּנוֹתֶיךָ.
3.english: O send out Thy light and Thy truth; let them lead me; {N}let them bring me unto Thy holy mountain, and to Thy dwelling-places.

4.hebrew: וְאָבוֹאָה, אֶל-מִזְבַּח אֱלֹהִים--    אֶל-אֵל, שִׂמְחַת גִּילִי:וְאוֹדְךָ בְכִנּוֹר--    אֱלֹהִים אֱלֹהָי.
4.english: Then will I go unto the altar of God, unto God, my exceeding joy; {N}and praise Thee upon the harp, O God, my God.

5.hebrew: מַה-תִּשְׁתּוֹחֲחִי, נַפְשִׁי--    וּמַה-תֶּהֱמִי עָלָי:הוֹחִילִי לֵאלֹהִים, כִּי-עוֹד אוֹדֶנּוּ--    יְשׁוּעֹת פָּנַי, וֵאלֹהָי.
5.english: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why moanest thou within me? {N}Hope thou in God; for I shall yet praise Him, the salvation of my countenance, and my God. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ לִבְנֵי-קֹרַח מַשְׂכִּיל.
1.english: For the Leader; [a Psalm] of the sons of Korah. Maschil.

2.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים, בְּאָזְנֵינוּ שָׁמַעְנוּ--    אֲבוֹתֵינוּ סִפְּרוּ-לָנוּ:פֹּעַל פָּעַלְתָּ בִימֵיהֶם,    בִּימֵי קֶדֶם.
2.english: O God, we have heard with our ears, our fathers have told us; {N}a work Thou didst in their days, in the days of old.

3.hebrew: אַתָּה, יָדְךָ גּוֹיִם הוֹרַשְׁתָּ--    וַתִּטָּעֵם;תָּרַע לְאֻמִּים,    וַתְּשַׁלְּחֵם.
3.english: Thou with Thy hand didst drive out the nations, and didst plant them in; {N}Thou didst break the peoples, and didst spread them abroad.

4.hebrew: כִּי לֹא בְחַרְבָּם, יָרְשׁוּ אָרֶץ,    וּזְרוֹעָם, לֹא-הוֹשִׁיעָה-לָּמוֹ:כִּי-יְמִינְךָ וּזְרוֹעֲךָ, וְאוֹר פָּנֶיךָ--    כִּי רְצִיתָם.
4.english: For not by their own sword did they get the land in possession, neither did their own arm save them; {N}but Thy right hand, and Thine arm, and the light of Thy countenance, because Thou wast favourable unto them.

5.hebrew: אַתָּה-הוּא מַלְכִּי אֱלֹהִים;    צַוֵּה, יְשׁוּעוֹת יַעֲקֹב.
5.english: Thou art my King, O God; command the salvation of Jacob.

6.hebrew: בְּךָ, צָרֵינוּ נְנַגֵּחַ;    בְּשִׁמְךָ, נָבוּס קָמֵינוּ.
6.english: Through Thee do we push down our adversaries; through Thy name do we tread them under that rise up against us.

7.hebrew: כִּי לֹא בְקַשְׁתִּי אֶבְטָח;    וְחַרְבִּי, לֹא תוֹשִׁיעֵנִי.
7.english: For I trust not in my bow, neither can my sword save me.

8.hebrew: כִּי הוֹשַׁעְתָּנוּ, מִצָּרֵינוּ;    וּמְשַׂנְאֵינוּ הֱבִישׁוֹתָ.
8.english: But Thou hast saved us from our adversaries, and hast put them to shame that hate us.

9.hebrew: בֵּאלֹהִים, הִלַּלְנוּ כָל-הַיּוֹם;    וְשִׁמְךָ, לְעוֹלָם נוֹדֶה סֶלָה.
9.english: In God have we gloried all the day, and we will give thanks unto Thy name for ever. Selah

10.hebrew: אַף-זָנַחְתָּ, וַתַּכְלִימֵנוּ;    וְלֹא-תֵצֵא, בְּצִבְאוֹתֵינוּ.
10.english: Yet Thou hast cast off, and brought us to confusion; and goest not forth with our hosts.

11.hebrew: תְּשִׁיבֵנוּ אָחוֹר, מִנִּי-צָר;    וּמְשַׂנְאֵינוּ, שָׁסוּ לָמוֹ.
11.english: Thou makest us to turn back from the adversary; and they that hate us spoil at their will.

12.hebrew: תִּתְּנֵנוּ, כְּצֹאן מַאֲכָל;    וּבַגּוֹיִם, זֵרִיתָנוּ.
12.english: Thou hast given us like sheep to be eaten; and hast scattered us among the nations.

13.hebrew: תִּמְכֹּר-עַמְּךָ בְלֹא-הוֹן;    וְלֹא-רִבִּיתָ, בִּמְחִירֵיהֶם.
13.english: Thou sellest Thy people for small gain, and hast not set their prices high.

14.hebrew: תְּשִׂימֵנוּ חֶרְפָּה, לִשְׁכֵנֵינוּ;    לַעַג וָקֶלֶס, לִסְבִיבוֹתֵינוּ.
14.english: Thou makest us a taunt to our neighbours, a scorn and a derision to them that are round about us.

15.hebrew: תְּשִׂימֵנוּ מָשָׁל, בַּגּוֹיִם;    מְנוֹד-רֹאשׁ, בַּלְאֻמִּים.
15.english: Thou makest us a byword among the nations, a shaking of the head among the peoples.

16.hebrew: כָּל-הַיּוֹם, כְּלִמָּתִי נֶגְדִּי;    וּבֹשֶׁת פָּנַי כִּסָּתְנִי.
16.english: All the day is my confusion before me, and the shame of my face hath covered me,

17.hebrew: מִקּוֹל, מְחָרֵף וּמְגַדֵּף;    מִפְּנֵי אוֹיֵב, וּמִתְנַקֵּם.
17.english: For the voice of him that taunteth and blasphemeth; by reason of the enemy and the revengeful.

18.hebrew: כָּל-זֹאת בָּאַתְנוּ, וְלֹא שְׁכַחֲנוּךָ;    וְלֹא-שִׁקַּרְנוּ, בִּבְרִיתֶךָ.
18.english: All this is come upon us; yet have we not forgotten Thee, neither have we been false to Thy covenant.

19.hebrew: לֹא-נָסוֹג אָחוֹר לִבֵּנוּ;    וַתֵּט אֲשֻׁרֵינוּ, מִנִּי אָרְחֶךָ.
19.english: Our heart is not turned back, neither have our steps declined from Thy path;

20.hebrew: כִּי דִכִּיתָנוּ, בִּמְקוֹם תַּנִּים;    וַתְּכַס עָלֵינוּ בְצַלְמָוֶת.
20.english: Though Thou hast crushed us into a place of jackals, and covered us with the shadow of death.

21.hebrew: אִם-שָׁכַחְנוּ, שֵׁם אֱלֹהֵינוּ;    וַנִּפְרֹשׂ כַּפֵּינוּ, לְאֵל זָר.
21.english: If we had forgotten the name of our God, or spread forth our hands to a strange god;

22.hebrew: הֲלֹא אֱלֹהִים, יַחֲקָר-זֹאת:    כִּי-הוּא יֹדֵעַ, תַּעֲלֻמוֹת לֵב.
22.english: Would not God search this out? For He knoweth the secrets of the heart.

23.hebrew: כִּי-עָלֶיךָ, הֹרַגְנוּ כָל-הַיּוֹם;    נֶחְשַׁבְנוּ, כְּצֹאן טִבְחָה.
23.english: Nay, but for Thy sake are we killed all the day; we are accounted as sheep for the slaughter.

24.hebrew: עוּרָה, לָמָּה תִישַׁן אֲדֹנָי;    הָקִיצָה, אַל-תִּזְנַח לָנֶצַח.
24.english: Awake, why sleepest Thou, O Lord? Arouse Thyself, cast not off for ever.

25.hebrew: לָמָּה-פָנֶיךָ תַסְתִּיר;    תִּשְׁכַּח עָנְיֵנוּ וְלַחֲצֵנוּ.
25.english: Wherefore hidest Thou Thy face, and forgettest our affliction and our oppression?

26.hebrew: כִּי שָׁחָה לֶעָפָר נַפְשֵׁנוּ;    דָּבְקָה לָאָרֶץ בִּטְנֵנוּ.
26.english: For our soul is bowed down to the dust; our belly cleaveth unto the earth.

27.hebrew: קוּמָה, עֶזְרָתָה לָּנוּ;    וּפְדֵנוּ, לְמַעַן חַסְדֶּךָ.
27.english: Arise for our help, and redeem us for Thy mercy's sake. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ עַל-שֹׁשַׁנִּים, לִבְנֵי-קֹרַח;    מַשְׂכִּיל, שִׁיר יְדִידֹת.
1.english: For the Leader; upon Shoshannim; [a Psalm] of the sons of Korah. Maschil. A Song of loves.

2.hebrew: רָחַשׁ לִבִּי, דָּבָר טוֹב--    אֹמֵר אָנִי, מַעֲשַׂי לְמֶלֶךְ;לְשׁוֹנִי,    עֵט סוֹפֵר מָהִיר.
2.english: My heart overfloweth with a goodly matter; I say: 'My work is concerning a king'; {N}my tongue is the pen of a ready writer.

3.hebrew: יָפְיָפִיתָ, מִבְּנֵי אָדָם--    הוּצַק חֵן, בְּשִׂפְתוֹתֶיךָ;עַל-כֵּן בֵּרַכְךָ אֱלֹהִים    לְעוֹלָם.
3.english: Thou art fairer than the children of men; grace is poured upon thy lips; {N}therefore God hath blessed thee for ever.

4.hebrew: חֲגוֹר-חַרְבְּךָ עַל-יָרֵךְ גִּבּוֹר--    הוֹדְךָ, וַהֲדָרֶךָ.
4.english: Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O mighty one, thy glory and thy majesty.

5.hebrew: וַהֲדָרְךָ, צְלַח רְכַב--    עַל-דְּבַר-אֱמֶת, וְעַנְוָה-צֶדֶק;וְתוֹרְךָ נוֹרָאוֹת    יְמִינֶךָ.
5.english: And in thy majesty prosper, ride on, in behalf of truth and meekness and righteousness; {N}and let thy right hand teach thee tremendous things.

6.hebrew: חִצֶּיךָ, שְׁנוּנִים:    עַמִּים, תַּחְתֶּיךָ יִפְּלוּ; בְּלֵב, אוֹיְבֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ.
6.english: Thine arrows are sharp--the peoples fall under thee--[they sink] into the heart of the king's enemies.

7.hebrew: כִּסְאֲךָ אֱלֹהִים, עוֹלָם וָעֶד;    שֵׁבֶט מִישֹׁר, שֵׁבֶט מַלְכוּתֶךָ.
7.english: Thy throne given of God is for ever and ever; a sceptre of equity is the sceptre of thy kingdom.

8.hebrew: אָהַבְתָּ צֶּדֶק,    וַתִּשְׂנָא-רֶשַׁע:עַל-כֵּן מְשָׁחֲךָ אֱלֹהִים אֱלֹהֶיךָ, שֶׁמֶן שָׂשׂוֹן--    מֵחֲבֵרֶךָ.
8.english: Thou hast loved righteousness, and hated wickedness; {N}therefore God, thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.

9.hebrew: מֹר-וַאֲהָלוֹת קְצִיעוֹת, כָּל-בִּגְדֹתֶיךָ;    מִן-הֵיכְלֵי שֵׁן, מִנִּי שִׂמְּחוּךָ.
9.english: Myrrh, and aloes, and cassia are all thy garments; out of ivory palaces stringed instruments have made thee glad.

10.hebrew: בְּנוֹת מְלָכִים, בְּיִקְּרוֹתֶיךָ;    נִצְּבָה שֵׁגַל לִימִינְךָ, בְּכֶתֶם אוֹפִיר.
10.english: Kings' daughters are among thy favourites; at thy right hand doth stand the queen in gold of Ophir.

11.hebrew: שִׁמְעִי-בַת וּרְאִי, וְהַטִּי אָזְנֵךְ;    וְשִׁכְחִי עַמֵּךְ, וּבֵית אָבִיךְ.
11.english: 'Hearken, O daughter, and consider, and incline thine ear; forget also thine own people, and thy father's house;

12.hebrew: וְיִתְאָו הַמֶּלֶךְ יָפְיֵךְ:    כִּי-הוּא אֲדֹנַיִךְ, וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוִי-לוֹ.
12.english: So shall the king desire thy beauty; for he is thy lord; and do homage unto him.

13.hebrew: וּבַת-צֹר:    בְּמִנְחָה, פָּנַיִךְ יְחַלּוּ--עֲשִׁירֵי עָם.
13.english: And, O daughter of Tyre, the richest of the people shall entreat thy favour with a gift.'

14.hebrew: כָּל-כְּבוּדָּה בַת-מֶלֶךְ פְּנִימָה;    מִמִּשְׁבְּצוֹת זָהָב לְבוּשָׁהּ.
14.english: All glorious is the king's daughter within the palace; her raiment is of chequer work inwrought with gold.

15.hebrew: לִרְקָמוֹת, תּוּבַל לַמֶּלֶךְ:    בְּתוּלוֹת אַחֲרֶיהָ, רֵעוֹתֶיהָ--מוּבָאוֹת לָךְ.
15.english: She shall be led unto the king on richly woven stuff; the virgins her companions in her train being brought unto thee.

16.hebrew: תּוּבַלְנָה, בִּשְׂמָחֹת וָגִיל;    תְּבֹאֶינָה, בְּהֵיכַל מֶלֶךְ.
16.english: They shall be led with gladness and rejoicing; they shall enter into the king's palace.

17.hebrew: תַּחַת אֲבֹתֶיךָ, יִהְיוּ בָנֶיךָ;    תְּשִׁיתֵמוֹ לְשָׂרִים, בְּכָל-הָאָרֶץ.
17.english: Instead of thy fathers shall be thy sons, whom thou shalt make princes in all the land.

18.hebrew: אַזְכִּירָה שִׁמְךָ, בְּכָל-דֹּר וָדֹר;    עַל-כֵּן עַמִּים יְהוֹדוּךָ, לְעֹלָם וָעֶד.
18.english: I will make thy name to be remembered in all generations; therefore shall the peoples praise thee for ever and ever. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ לִבְנֵי-קֹרַח--    עַל-עֲלָמוֹת שִׁיר.
1.english: For the Leader; [a Psalm] of the sons of Korah; upon Alamoth. A Song.

2.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים לָנוּ, מַחֲסֶה וָעֹז;    עֶזְרָה בְצָרוֹת, נִמְצָא מְאֹד.
2.english: God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.

3.hebrew: עַל-כֵּן לֹא-נִירָא, בְּהָמִיר אָרֶץ;    וּבְמוֹט הָרִים, בְּלֵב יַמִּים.
3.english: Therefore will we not fear, though the earth do change, and though the mountains be moved into the heart of the seas;

4.hebrew: יֶהֱמוּ יֶחְמְרוּ מֵימָיו;    יִרְעֲשׁוּ הָרִים בְּגַאֲוָתוֹ סֶלָה.
4.english: Though the waters thereof roar and foam, though the mountains shake at the swelling thereof. Selah

5.hebrew: נָהָר--פְּלָגָיו, יְשַׂמְּחוּ עִיר-אֱלֹהִים;    קְדֹשׁ, מִשְׁכְּנֵי עֶלְיוֹן.
5.english: There is a river, the streams whereof make glad the city of God, the holiest dwelling-place of the Most High.

6.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים בְּקִרְבָּהּ, בַּל-תִּמּוֹט;    יַעְזְרֶהָ אֱלֹהִים, לִפְנוֹת בֹּקֶר.
6.english: God is in the midst of her, she shall not be moved; God shall help her, at the approach of morning.

7.hebrew: הָמוּ גוֹיִם, מָטוּ מַמְלָכוֹת;    נָתַן בְּקוֹלוֹ, תָּמוּג אָרֶץ.
7.english: Nations were in tumult, kingdoms were moved; He uttered His voice, the earth melted.

8.hebrew: יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת עִמָּנוּ;    מִשְׂגָּב-לָנוּ אֱלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב סֶלָה.
8.english: The LORD of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our high tower. Selah

9.hebrew: לְכוּ-חֲזוּ, מִפְעֲלוֹת יְהוָה--    אֲשֶׁר-שָׂם שַׁמּוֹת בָּאָרֶץ.
9.english: Come, behold the works of the LORD, who hath made desolations in the earth.

10.hebrew: מַשְׁבִּית מִלְחָמוֹת,    עַד-קְצֵה הָאָרֶץ:קֶשֶׁת יְשַׁבֵּר, וְקִצֵּץ חֲנִית;    עֲגָלוֹת, יִשְׂרֹף בָּאֵשׁ.
10.english: He maketh wars to cease unto the end of the earth; {N}He breaketh the bow, and cutteth the spear in sunder; He burneth the chariots in the fire.

11.hebrew: הַרְפּוּ וּדְעוּ, כִּי-אָנֹכִי אֱלֹהִים;    אָרוּם בַּגּוֹיִם, אָרוּם בָּאָרֶץ.
11.english: 'Let be, and know that I am God; I will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted in the earth.'

12.hebrew: יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת עִמָּנוּ;    מִשְׂגָּב-לָנוּ אֱלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב סֶלָה.
12.english: The LORD of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our high tower. Selah {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ לִבְנֵי-קֹרַח מִזְמוֹר.
1.english: For the Leader; a Psalm for the sons of Korah.

2.hebrew: כָּל-הָעַמִּים, תִּקְעוּ-כָף;    הָרִיעוּ לֵאלֹהִים, בְּקוֹל רִנָּה.
2.english: O clap your hands, all ye peoples; shout unto God with the voice of triumph.

3.hebrew: כִּי-יְהוָה עֶלְיוֹן נוֹרָא;    מֶלֶךְ גָּדוֹל, עַל-כָּל-הָאָרֶץ.
3.english: For the LORD is most high, awful; a great King over all the earth.

4.hebrew: יַדְבֵּר עַמִּים תַּחְתֵּינוּ;    וּלְאֻמִּים, תַּחַת רַגְלֵינוּ.
4.english: He subdueth peoples under us, and nations under our feet.

5.hebrew: יִבְחַר-לָנוּ אֶת-נַחֲלָתֵנוּ;    אֶת גְּאוֹן יַעֲקֹב אֲשֶׁר-אָהֵב סֶלָה.
5.english: He chooseth our inheritance for us, the pride of Jacob whom He loveth. Selah

6.hebrew: עָלָה אֱלֹהִים, בִּתְרוּעָה;    יְהוָה, בְּקוֹל שׁוֹפָר.
6.english: God is gone up amidst shouting, the LORD amidst the sound of the horn.

7.hebrew: זַמְּרוּ אֱלֹהִים זַמֵּרוּ;    זַמְּרוּ לְמַלְכֵּנוּ זַמֵּרוּ.
7.english: Sing praises to God, sing praises; sing praises unto our King, sing praises.

8.hebrew: כִּי מֶלֶךְ כָּל-הָאָרֶץ אֱלֹהִים--    זַמְּרוּ מַשְׂכִּיל.
8.english: For God is the King of all the earth; sing ye praises in a skilful song.

9.hebrew: מָלַךְ אֱלֹהִים, עַל-גּוֹיִם;    אֱלֹהִים, יָשַׁב עַל-כִּסֵּא קָדְשׁוֹ.
9.english: God reigneth over the nations; God sitteth upon His holy throne.

10.hebrew: נְדִיבֵי עַמִּים, נֶאֱסָפוּ--    עַם, אֱלֹהֵי אַבְרָהָם:כִּי לֵאלֹהִים, מָגִנֵּי-אֶרֶץ--    מְאֹד נַעֲלָה.
10.english: The princes of the peoples are gathered together, the people of the God of Abraham; {N}for unto God belong the shields of the earth; He is greatly exalted. {P}

1.hebrew: שִׁיר מִזְמוֹר, לִבְנֵי-קֹרַח.
1.english: A Song; a Psalm of the sons of Korah.

2.hebrew: גָּדוֹל יְהוָה וּמְהֻלָּל מְאֹד--    בְּעִיר אֱלֹהֵינוּ, הַר-קָדְשׁוֹ.
2.english: Great is the LORD, and highly to be praised, in the city of our God, His holy mountain,

3.hebrew: יְפֵה נוֹף,    מְשׂוֹשׂ כָּל-הָאָרֶץ:הַר-צִיּוֹן, יַרְכְּתֵי צָפוֹן;    קִרְיַת, מֶלֶךְ רָב.
3.english: Fair in situation, the joy of the whole earth; {N}even mount Zion, the uttermost parts of the north, the city of the great King.

4.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים בְּאַרְמְנוֹתֶיהָ,    נוֹדַע לְמִשְׂגָּב.
4.english: God in her palaces hath made Himself known for a stronghold.

5.hebrew: כִּי-הִנֵּה הַמְּלָכִים, נוֹעֲדוּ;    עָבְרוּ יַחְדָּו.
5.english: For, lo, the kings assembled themselves, they came onward together.

6.hebrew: הֵמָּה רָאוּ, כֵּן תָּמָהוּ;    נִבְהֲלוּ נֶחְפָּזוּ.
6.english: They saw, straightway they were amazed; they were affrighted, they hasted away.

7.hebrew: רְעָדָה, אֲחָזָתַם שָׁם;    חִיל, כַּיּוֹלֵדָה.
7.english: Trembling took hold of them there, pangs, as of a woman in travail.

8.hebrew: בְּרוּחַ קָדִים--    תְּשַׁבֵּר, אֳנִיּוֹת תַּרְשִׁישׁ.
8.english: With the east wind Thou breakest the ships of Tarshish.

9.hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁר שָׁמַעְנוּ,    כֵּן רָאִינוּ--בְּעִיר-יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת,    בְּעִיר אֱלֹהֵינוּ:אֱלֹהִים יְכוֹנְנֶהָ עַד-עוֹלָם    סֶלָה.
9.english: As we have heard, so have we seen {N}in the city of the LORD of hosts, in the city of our God-- {N}God establish it for ever. Selah

10.hebrew: דִּמִּינוּ אֱלֹהִים חַסְדֶּךָ--    בְּקֶרֶב, הֵיכָלֶךָ.
10.english: We have thought on Thy lovingkindness, O God, in the midst of Thy temple.

11.hebrew: כְּשִׁמְךָ אֱלֹהִים--    כֵּן תְּהִלָּתְךָ, עַל-קַצְוֵי-אֶרֶץ;צֶדֶק,    מָלְאָה יְמִינֶךָ.
11.english: As is Thy name, O God, so is Thy praise unto the ends of the earth; {N}Thy right hand is full of righteousness.

12.hebrew: יִשְׂמַח, הַר צִיּוֹן--תָּגֵלְנָה, בְּנוֹת יְהוּדָה:    לְמַעַן, מִשְׁפָּטֶיךָ.
12.english: Let mount Zion be glad, let the daughters of Judah rejoice, because of Thy judgments.

13.hebrew: סֹבּוּ צִיּוֹן, וְהַקִּיפוּהָ;    סִפְרוּ, מִגְדָּלֶיהָ.
13.english: Walk about Zion, and go round about her; count the towers thereof.

14.hebrew: שִׁיתוּ לִבְּכֶם, לְחֵילָה--פַּסְּגוּ אַרְמְנוֹתֶיהָ:    לְמַעַן תְּסַפְּרוּ, לְדוֹר אַחֲרוֹן.
14.english: Mark ye well her ramparts, traverse her palaces; that ye may tell it to the generation following.

15.hebrew: כִּי זֶה, אֱלֹהִים אֱלֹהֵינוּ--עוֹלָם וָעֶד;    הוּא יְנַהֲגֵנוּ עַל-מוּת.
15.english: For such is God, our God, for ever and ever; He will guide us eternally. {P}

1.english: For the Leader; a Psalm of the sons of Korah.

10.hebrew: ††еƒйзƒй-те…г м»р∆ц«з; †† м…а йƒшја∆д д«щћ—»з«ъ.
