11.hebrew: ††лћƒй йƒшја∆д, з¬л»оƒйн й»оећъећ-- †† й«з«г лћјсƒйм е»б«т«ш й…аб≈гећ;ејт»жјбећ м«а¬з≈шƒйн †† з≈йм»н.
11.english: For he seeth that wise men die, the fool and the brutish together perish, {N}and leave their wealth to others.

12.hebrew: ††чƒшјбћ»н бћ»ъћ≈йое…, мјте…м»н-- †† оƒщ—јлћјр…ъ»н, мјге…ш е»г…ш;ч»шјаећ бƒщ—јое…ъ»н, †† т¬м≈й а¬г»ое…ъ.
12.english: Their inward thought is, that their houses shall continue for ever, and their dwelling-places to all generations; {N}they call their lands after their own names.

13.hebrew: ††еја»г»н бћƒйч»ш, бћ«м-й»мƒйп; †† рƒојщ—«м лћ«бћјд≈ое…ъ рƒгјоећ.
13.english: But man abideth not in honour; he is like the beasts that perish.

14.hebrew: ††ж∆д г«шјлћ»н, лћ≈с∆м м»ое…; †† еја«з¬ш≈йд∆н, бћјфƒйд∆н йƒшјцећ с∆м»д.
14.english: This is the way of them that are foolish, and of those who after them approve their sayings. Selah

15.hebrew: ††лћ«цћ…ап, мƒщ—јае…м щ—«ъћећ-- †† о»е∆ъ йƒшјт≈н:е«йћƒшјгћећ б»н йјщ—»шƒйн, м«бћ…ч∆ш--ецйшн (ејцећш»н), мјб«мће…ъ щ—јае…м; †† оƒжћјбЋм ме….
15.english: Like sheep they are appointed for the nether-world; death shall be their shepherd; {N}and the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning; and their form shall be for the nether-world to wear away, that there be no habitation for it.

16.hebrew: ††а«кј-аЅм…дƒйн--йƒфјгћ∆д р«фјщ—ƒй, оƒйћ«г-щ—јае…м: †† лћƒй йƒчћ»з≈рƒй с∆м»д.
16.english: But God will redeem my soul from the power of the nether-world; for He shall receive me. Selah

17.hebrew: ††а«м-ъћƒйш»а, лћƒй-й«т¬щ—ƒш аƒйщ—: †† лћƒй-йƒшјбћ∆д, лћјбе…г бћ≈йъе….
17.english: Be not thou afraid when one waxeth rich, when the wealth of his house is increased;

18.hebrew: ††лћƒй м…а бјое…ъе…, йƒчћ«з д«лћ…м; †† м…а-й≈ш≈г а«з¬ш»йе лћјбе…ге….
18.english: For when he dieth he shall carry nothing away; his wealth shall not descend after him.

19.hebrew: ††лћƒй-р«фјщ—е…, бћјз«йћ»йе йјб»ш≈кј; †† ејйе…гЋк», лћƒй-ъ≈йиƒйб м»кј.
19.english: Though while he lived he blessed his soul: 'Men will praise thee, when thou shalt do well to thyself';

20.hebrew: ††ъћ»бе…а, т«г-гће…ш а¬бе…ъ»йе; †† т«г-р≈ц«з, м…а йƒшјаећ-ае…ш.
20.english: It shall go to the generation of his fathers; they shall never see the light.

21.hebrew: ††а»г»н бћƒйч»ш, ејм…а й»бƒйп; †† рƒојщ—«м лћ«бћјд≈ое…ъ рƒгјоећ.
21.english: Man that is in honour understandeth not; he is like the beasts that perish. {P}

1.hebrew: מִזְמוֹר, לְאָסָף:אֵל, אֱלֹהִים יְהוָה--    דִּבֶּר וַיִּקְרָא-אָרֶץ;מִמִּזְרַח-שֶׁמֶשׁ,    עַד-מְבֹאוֹ.
1.english: A Psalm of Asaph. {N}God, God, the LORD, hath spoken, and called the earth {N}from the rising of the sun unto the going down thereof.

2.hebrew: מִצִּיּוֹן מִכְלַל-יֹפִי--    אֱלֹהִים הוֹפִיעַ.
2.english: Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God hath shined forth.

3.hebrew: יָבֹא אֱלֹהֵינוּ,    וְאַל-יֶחֱרַשׁ:אֵשׁ-לְפָנָיו תֹּאכֵל;    וּסְבִיבָיו, נִשְׂעֲרָה מְאֹד.
3.english: Our God cometh, and doth not keep silence; {N}a fire devoureth before Him, and round about Him it stormeth mightily.

4.hebrew: יִקְרָא אֶל-הַשָּׁמַיִם מֵעָל;    וְאֶל-הָאָרֶץ, לָדִין עַמּוֹ.
4.english: He calleth to the heavens above, and to the earth, that He may judge His people:

5.hebrew: אִסְפוּ-לִי חֲסִידָי--    כֹּרְתֵי בְרִיתִי עֲלֵי-זָבַח.
5.english: 'Gather My saints together unto Me; those that have made a covenant with Me by sacrifice.'

6.hebrew: וַיַּגִּידוּ שָׁמַיִם צִדְקוֹ:    כִּי-אֱלֹהִים, שֹׁפֵט הוּא סֶלָה.
6.english: And the heavens declare His righteousness; for God, He is judge. Selah

7.hebrew: שִׁמְעָה עַמִּי, וַאֲדַבֵּרָה--    יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְאָעִידָה בָּךְ:אֱלֹהִים אֱלֹהֶיךָ    אָנֹכִי.
7.english: 'Hear, O My people, and I will speak; O Israel, and I will testify against thee: {N}God, thy God, am I.

8.hebrew: לֹא עַל-זְבָחֶיךָ, אוֹכִיחֶךָ;    וְעוֹלֹתֶיךָ לְנֶגְדִּי תָמִיד.
8.english: I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices; and thy burnt-offerings are continually before Me.

9.hebrew: לֹא-אֶקַּח מִבֵּיתְךָ פָר;    מִמִּכְלְאֹתֶיךָ, עַתּוּדִים.
9.english: I will take no bullock out of thy house, nor he-goats out of thy folds.

10.hebrew: כִּי-לִי כָל-חַיְתוֹ-יָעַר;    בְּהֵמוֹת, בְּהַרְרֵי-אָלֶף.
10.english: For every beast of the forest is Mine, and the cattle upon a thousand hills.

11.hebrew: יָדַעְתִּי, כָּל-עוֹף הָרִים;    וְזִיז שָׂדַי, עִמָּדִי.
11.english: I know all the fowls of the mountains; and the wild beasts of the field are Mine.

12.hebrew: אִם-אֶרְעַב, לֹא-אֹמַר לָךְ:    כִּי-לִי תֵבֵל, וּמְלֹאָהּ.
12.english: If I were hungry, I would not tell thee; for the world is Mine, and the fulness thereof.

13.hebrew: הַאוֹכַל, בְּשַׂר אַבִּירִים;    וְדַם עַתּוּדִים אֶשְׁתֶּה.
13.english: Do I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of goats?

14.hebrew: זְבַח לֵאלֹהִים תּוֹדָה;    וְשַׁלֵּם לְעֶלְיוֹן נְדָרֶיךָ.
14.english: Offer unto God the sacrifice of thanksgiving; and pay thy vows unto the Most High;

15.hebrew: וּקְרָאֵנִי, בְּיוֹם צָרָה;    אֲחַלֶּצְךָ, וּתְכַבְּדֵנִי.
15.english: And call upon Me in the day of trouble; I will deliver thee, and thou shalt honour Me.'

16.hebrew: וְלָרָשָׁע, אָמַר אֱלֹהִים, מַה-לְּךָ, לְסַפֵּר חֻקָּי;    וַתִּשָּׂא בְרִיתִי עֲלֵי-פִיךָ.
16.english: But unto the wicked God saith: 'What hast thou to do to declare My statutes, and that thou hast taken My covenant in thy mouth?

17.hebrew: וְאַתָּה, שָׂנֵאתָ מוּסָר;    וַתַּשְׁלֵךְ דְּבָרַי אַחֲרֶיךָ.
17.english: Seeing thou hatest instruction, and castest My words behind thee.

18.hebrew: אִם-רָאִיתָ גַנָּב, וַתִּרֶץ עִמּוֹ;    וְעִם מְנָאֲפִים חֶלְקֶךָ.
18.english: When thou sawest a thief, thou hadst company with him, and with adulterers was thy portion.

19.hebrew: פִּיךָ, שָׁלַחְתָּ בְרָעָה;    וּלְשׁוֹנְךָ, תַּצְמִיד מִרְמָה.
19.english: Thou hast let loose thy mouth for evil, and thy tongue frameth deceit.

20.hebrew: תֵּשֵׁב, בְּאָחִיךָ תְדַבֵּר;    בְּבֶן-אִמְּךָ, תִּתֶּן-דֹּפִי.
20.english: Thou sittest and speakest against thy brother; thou slanderest thine own mother's son.

21.hebrew: אֵלֶּה עָשִׂיתָ, וְהֶחֱרַשְׁתִּי--    דִּמִּיתָ, הֱיוֹת-אֶהְיֶה כָמוֹךָ;אוֹכִיחֲךָ וְאֶעֶרְכָה    לְעֵינֶיךָ.
21.english: These things hast thou done, and should I have kept silence? Thou hadst thought that I was altogether such a one as thyself; {N}but I will reprove thee, and set the cause before thine eyes.

22.hebrew: בִּינוּ-נָא זֹאת, שֹׁכְחֵי אֱלוֹהַּ:    פֶּן-אֶטְרֹף, וְאֵין מַצִּיל.
22.english: Now consider this, ye that forget God, lest I tear in pieces, and there be none to deliver.

23.hebrew: זֹבֵחַ תּוֹדָה, יְכַבְּדָנְנִי:    וְשָׂם דֶּרֶךְ--אַרְאֶנּוּ, בְּיֵשַׁע אֱלֹהִים.
23.english: Whoso offereth the sacrifice of thanksgiving honoureth Me; and to him that ordereth his way aright will I show the salvation of God.' {P}

1.hebrew: ††м«ојр«цћ≈з«, оƒжјое…ш мјг»еƒг.
1.english: For the Leader. A Psalm of David;

2.hebrew: ††бћјбе…а-а≈м»йе, р»ъ»п д«рћ»бƒйа-- †† лћ«а¬щ—∆ш-бћ»а, а∆м-бћ«ъ-щ—»б«т.
2.english: When Nathan the prophet came unto him, after he had gone in to Bath-sheba.

3.hebrew: ††з»рћ≈рƒй аЅм…дƒйн лћјз«сјгћ∆к»; †† лћјш…б ш«з¬о∆йк», ојз≈д фјщ—»т»й.
3.english: Be gracious unto me, O God, according to Thy mercy; according to the multitude of Thy compassions blot out my transgressions.

4.hebrew: ††дшбд (д∆ш∆б), лћ«бћјс≈рƒй о≈т¬е рƒй; †† ећо≈з«ић»аъƒй и«д¬ш≈рƒй.
4.english: Wash me thoroughly from mine iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin.

5.hebrew: ††лћƒй-фјщ—»т«й, а¬рƒй а≈г»т; †† ејз«ић»аъƒй р∆вјгћƒй ъ»оƒйг.
5.english: For I know my transgressions; and my sin is ever before me.

6.hebrew: ††мјк» мјб«гћјк», з»и»аъƒй, †† ејд»ш«т бћјт≈йр∆йк», т»щ“ƒйъƒй:мјо«т«п, ъћƒцјгћ«ч бћјг»бјш∆к»-- †† ъћƒжјлћ∆д бјщ—»фји∆к».
6.english: Against Thee, Thee only, have I sinned, and done that which is evil in Thy sight; {N}that Thou mayest be justified when Thou speakest, and be in the right when Thou judgest.

7.hebrew: ††д≈п-бћјт»ее…п зе…м»мјъћƒй; †† ећбјз≈ија, й∆зЅо«ъјрƒй аƒоћƒй.
7.english: Behold, I was brought forth in iniquity, and in sin did my mother conceive me.

8.hebrew: ††д≈п-аЅо∆ъ, з»ф«цјъћ» б«ићЋзе…ъ; †† ећбјс»ъЋн, з»лјо»д ъе…гƒйт≈рƒй.
8.english: Behold, Thou desirest truth in the inward parts; make me, therefore, to know wisdom in mine inmost heart.

9.hebrew: ††ъћјз«ићја≈рƒй бја≈же…б еја∆ијд»ш; †† ъћјл«бћјс≈рƒй, ећоƒщћ—∆м∆в а«мјбћƒйп.
9.english: Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean; wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.

10.hebrew: ††ъћ«щ—јоƒйт≈рƒй, щ“»щ“е…п ејщ“ƒојз»д; †† ъћ»в≈мјр»д, т¬ц»ое…ъ гћƒлћƒйъ».
10.english: Make me to hear joy and gladness; that the bones which Thou hast crushed may rejoice.

11.hebrew: ††д«сјъћ≈ш фћ»р∆йк», о≈з¬и»а»й; †† ејл»м-т¬е р…ъ«й ојз≈д.
11.english: Hide Thy face from my sins, and blot out all mine iniquities.

12.hebrew: ††м≈б и»де…ш, бћјш»а-мƒй аЅм…дƒйн; †† ејшећз« р»ле…п, з«гћ≈щ— бћјчƒшјбћƒй.
12.english: Create me a clean heart, O God; and renew a stedfast spirit within me.

13.hebrew: ††а«м-ъћ«щ—јмƒйл≈рƒй оƒмћјф»р∆йк»; †† ејшећз« ч»гјщ—јк», а«м-ъћƒчћ«з оƒоћ∆рћƒй.
13.english: Cast me not away from Thy presence; and take not Thy holy spirit from me.

14.hebrew: ††д»щ—ƒйб»д мћƒй, щ“јщ“е…п йƒщ—јт∆к»; †† ејшећз« рјгƒйб»д ъƒсјојл≈рƒй.
14.english: Restore unto me the joy of Thy salvation; and let a willing spirit uphold me.

15.hebrew: ††а¬м«оћјг»д ф…щ—јтƒйн гћјш»л∆йк»; †† ејз«ић»аƒйн, а≈м∆йк» й»щ—ећбећ.
15.english: Then will I teach transgressors Thy ways; and sinners shall return unto Thee.

16.hebrew: ††д«цћƒйм≈рƒй оƒгћ»оƒйн, аЅм…дƒйн-- †† аЅм…д≈й ъјщ—ећт»ъƒй:ъћјш«рћ≈п мјщ—е…рƒй, †† цƒгјч»ъ∆к».
16.english: Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, Thou God of my salvation; {N}so shall my tongue sing aloud of Thy righteousness.

17.hebrew: ††а¬г…р»й, щ“јф»ъ«й ъћƒфјъћ»з; †† ећфƒй, й«вћƒйг ъћјдƒмћ»ъ∆к».
17.english: O Lord, open Thou my lips; and my mouth shall declare Thy praise.

18.hebrew: ††лћƒй, м…а-ъ«зјфћ…х ж∆б«з еја∆ъћ≈р»д; †† те…м»д, м…а ъƒшјц∆д.
18.english: For Thou delightest not in sacrifice, else would I give it; Thou hast no pleasure in burnt-offering.

19.hebrew: ††жƒбјз≈й аЅм…дƒйн, †† шећз« рƒщ—јбћ»ш»д:м≈б-рƒщ—јбћ»ш ејрƒгјлћ∆д-- †† аЅм…дƒйн, м…а ъƒбјж∆д.
19.english: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit; {N}a broken and a contrite heart, O God, Thou wilt not despise.

20.hebrew: ††д≈йиƒйб»д бƒшјце…рјк», а∆ъ-цƒйће…п; †† ъћƒбјр∆д, зе…ое…ъ йјшећщ—»м»ƒн.
20.english: Do good in Thy favour unto Zion; build Thou the walls of Jerusalem.

21.hebrew: ††а»ж ъћ«зјфћ…х жƒбјз≈й-ц∆г∆ч, †† те…м»д ејл»мƒйм;а»ж й«т¬мећ т«м-оƒжјбћ«з¬к» †† ф»шƒйн.
21.english: Then wilt Thou delight in the sacrifices of righteousness, in burnt-offering and whole offering; {N}then will they offer bullocks upon Thine altar. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ, מַשְׂכִּיל לְדָוִד.
1.english: For the Leader. Maschil of David;

2.hebrew: בְּבוֹא, דּוֹאֵג הָאֲדֹמִי--    וַיַּגֵּד לְשָׁאוּל:וַיֹּאמֶר לוֹ--    בָּא דָוִד, אֶל-בֵּית אֲחִימֶלֶךְ.
2.english: when Doeg the Edomite came and told Saul, {N}and said unto him: 'David is come to the house of Ahimelech.'

3.hebrew: מַה-תִּתְהַלֵּל בְּרָעָה, הַגִּבּוֹר;    חֶסֶד אֵל, כָּל-הַיּוֹם.
3.english: Why boastest thou thyself of evil, O mighty man? The mercy of God endureth continually.

4.hebrew: הַוּוֹת, תַּחְשֹׁב לְשׁוֹנֶךָ;    כְּתַעַר מְלֻטָּשׁ, עֹשֵׂה רְמִיָּה.
4.english: Thy tongue deviseth destruction; like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.

5.hebrew: אָהַבְתָּ רָּע מִטּוֹב;    שֶׁקֶר, מִדַּבֵּר צֶדֶק סֶלָה.
5.english: Thou lovest evil more than good; falsehood rather than speaking righteousness. Selah

6.hebrew: אָהַבְתָּ כָל-דִּבְרֵי-בָלַע;    לְשׁוֹן מִרְמָה.
6.english: Thou lovest all devouring words, the deceitful tongue.

7.hebrew: גַּם-אֵל,    יִתָּצְךָ לָנֶצַח:יַחְתְּךָ וְיִסָּחֲךָ מֵאֹהֶל;    וְשֵׁרֶשְׁךָ מֵאֶרֶץ חַיִּים סֶלָה.
7.english: God will likewise break thee for ever, {N}He will take thee up, and pluck thee out of thy tent, and root thee out of the land of the living. Selah

8.hebrew: וְיִרְאוּ צַדִּיקִים וְיִירָאוּ; וְעָלָיו יִשְׂחָקוּ.
8.english: The righteous also shall see, and fear, and shall laugh at him:

9.hebrew: הִנֵּה הַגֶּבֶר--    לֹא יָשִׂים אֱלֹהִים, מָעוּזּוֹ:וַיִּבְטַח, בְּרֹב עָשְׁרוֹ;    יָעֹז, בְּהַוָּתוֹ.
9.english: 'Lo, this is the man that made not God his stronghold; {N}but trusted in the abundance of his riches, and strengthened himself in his wickedness.'

10.hebrew: וַאֲנִי, כְּזַיִת רַעֲנָן--    בְּבֵית אֱלֹהִים;בָּטַחְתִּי בְחֶסֶד-אֱלֹהִים,    עוֹלָם וָעֶד.
10.english: But as for me, I am like a leafy olive-tree in the house of God; {N}I trust in the mercy of God for ever and ever.

11.hebrew: אוֹדְךָ לְעוֹלָם, כִּי עָשִׂיתָ;    וַאֲקַוֶּה שִׁמְךָ כִי-טוֹב, נֶגֶד חֲסִידֶיךָ.
11.english: I will give Thee thanks for ever, because Thou hast done it; and I will wait for Thy name, for it is good, in the presence of Thy saints. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ עַל-מָחֲלַת, מַשְׂכִּיל לְדָוִד.
1.english: For the Leader; upon Mahalath. Maschil of David.

2.hebrew: אָמַר נָבָל בְּלִבּוֹ,    אֵין אֱלֹהִים;הִשְׁחִיתוּ, וְהִתְעִיבוּ עָוֶל--    אֵין עֹשֵׂה-טוֹב.
2.english: The fool hath said in his heart: 'There is no God'; {N}they have dealt corruptly, and have done abominable iniquity; there is none that doeth good.

3.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים--    מִשָּׁמַיִם, הִשְׁקִיף עַל-בְּנֵי-אָדָם:לִרְאוֹת, הֲיֵשׁ מַשְׂכִּיל--    דֹּרֵשׁ, אֶת-אֱלֹהִים.
3.english: God looked forth from heaven upon the children of men, {N}to see if there were any man of understanding, that did seek after God.

4.hebrew: כֻּלּוֹ סָג, יַחְדָּו נֶאֱלָחוּ:    אֵין עֹשֵׂה-טוֹב; אֵין, גַּם-אֶחָד.
4.english: Every one of them is unclean, they are together become impure; there is none that doeth good, no, not one.

5.hebrew: הֲלֹא יָדְעוּ, פֹּעֲלֵי-אָוֶן:    אֹכְלֵי עַמִּי, אָכְלוּ לֶחֶם; אֱלֹהִים, לֹא קָרָאוּ.
5.english: 'Shall not the workers of iniquity know it, who eat up My people as they eat bread, and call not upon God?'

6.hebrew: שָׁם, פָּחֲדוּ פַחַד--    לֹא-הָיָה-פָחַד:כִּי-אֱלֹהִים--פִּזַּר, עַצְמוֹת חֹנָךְ;    הֱבִשֹׁתָה, כִּי-אֱלֹהִים מְאָסָם.
6.english: There are they in great fear, where no fear was; {N}for God hath scattered the bones of him that encampeth against thee; Thou hast put them to shame, because God hath rejected them.

7.hebrew: מִי יִתֵּן מִצִּיּוֹן,    יְשֻׁעוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל:בְּשׁוּב אֱלֹהִים, שְׁבוּת עַמּוֹ;    יָגֵל יַעֲקֹב, יִשְׂמַח יִשְׂרָאֵל.
7.english: Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion! {N}When God turneth the captivity of His people, let Jacob rejoice, let Israel be glad. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ בִּנְגִינֹת, מַשְׂכִּיל לְדָוִד.
1.english: For the Leader; with string-music. Maschil of David:

2.hebrew: בְּבֹא הַזִּיפִים, וַיֹּאמְרוּ לְשָׁאוּל:    הֲלֹא דָוִד, מִסְתַּתֵּר עִמָּנוּ.
2.english: when the Ziphites came and said to Saul: 'Doth not David hide himself with us?'

3.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים, בְּשִׁמְךָ הוֹשִׁיעֵנִי;    וּבִגְבוּרָתְךָ תְדִינֵנִי.
3.english: O God, save me by Thy name, and right me by Thy might.

4.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים, שְׁמַע תְּפִלָּתִי;    הַאֲזִינָה, לְאִמְרֵי-פִי.
4.english: O God, hear my prayer; give ear to the words of my mouth.

5.hebrew: כִּי זָרִים, קָמוּ עָלַי--    וְעָרִיצִים, בִּקְשׁוּ נַפְשִׁי;לֹא שָׂמוּ אֱלֹהִים לְנֶגְדָּם    סֶלָה.
5.english: For strangers are risen up against me, and violent men have sought after my soul; {N}they have not set God before them. Selah

6.hebrew: הִנֵּה אֱלֹהִים, עֹזֵר לִי;    אֲדֹנָי, בְּסֹמְכֵי נַפְשִׁי.
6.english: Behold, God is my helper; the Lord is for me as the upholder of my soul.

7.hebrew: ישוב (יָשִׁיב) הָרַע, לְשֹׁרְרָי;    בַּאֲמִתְּךָ, הַצְמִיתֵם.
7.english: He will requite the evil unto them that lie in wait for me; destroy Thou them in Thy truth.

8.hebrew: בִּנְדָבָה אֶזְבְּחָה-לָּךְ;    אוֹדֶה שִּׁמְךָ יְהוָה כִּי-טוֹב.
8.english: With a freewill-offering will I sacrifice unto Thee; I will give thanks unto Thy name, O LORD, for it is good.

9.hebrew: כִּי מִכָּל-צָרָה, הִצִּילָנִי;    וּבְאֹיְבַי, רָאֲתָה עֵינִי.
9.english: For He hath delivered me out of all trouble; and mine eye hath gazed upon mine enemies. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ בִּנְגִינֹת, מַשְׂכִּיל לְדָוִד.
1.english: For the Leader; with string-music. Maschil of David.

2.hebrew: הַאֲזִינָה אֱלֹהִים, תְּפִלָּתִי;    וְאַל-תִּתְעַלַּם, מִתְּחִנָּתִי.
2.english: Give ear, O God, to my prayer; and hide not Thyself from my supplication.

3.hebrew: הַקְשִׁיבָה לִּי וַעֲנֵנִי;    אָרִיד בְּשִׂיחִי וְאָהִימָה.
3.english: Attend unto me, and hear me; I am distraught in my complaint, and will moan;

4.hebrew: מִקּוֹל אוֹיֵב--מִפְּנֵי, עָקַת רָשָׁע:    כִּי-יָמִיטוּ עָלַי אָוֶן, וּבְאַף יִשְׂטְמוּנִי.
4.english: Because of the voice of the enemy, because of the oppression of the wicked; for they cast mischief upon me, and in anger they persecute me.

5.hebrew: לִבִּי, יָחִיל בְּקִרְבִּי;    וְאֵימוֹת מָוֶת, נָפְלוּ עָלָי.
5.english: My heart doth writhe within me; and the terrors of death are fallen upon me.

6.hebrew: יִרְאָה וָרַעַד, יָבֹא בִי;    וַתְּכַסֵּנִי, פַּלָּצוּת.
6.english: Fear and trembling come upon me, and horror hath overwhelmed me.

7.hebrew: וָאֹמַר--מִי-יִתֶּן-לִי אֵבֶר, כַּיּוֹנָה:    אָעוּפָה וְאֶשְׁכֹּנָה.
7.english: And I said: 'Oh that I had wings like a dove! then would I fly away, and be at rest.

8.hebrew: הִנֵּה, אַרְחִיק נְדֹד;    אָלִין בַּמִּדְבָּר סֶלָה.
8.english: Lo, then would I wander far off, I would lodge in the wilderness. Selah

9.hebrew: אָחִישָׁה מִפְלָט לִי--    מֵרוּחַ סֹעָה מִסָּעַר.
9.english: I would haste me to a shelter from the stormy wind and tempest.'

10.hebrew: בַּלַּע אֲדֹנָי, פַּלַּג לְשׁוֹנָם:    כִּי-רָאִיתִי חָמָס וְרִיב בָּעִיר.
10.english: Destroy, O Lord, and divide their tongue; for I have seen violence and strife in the city.

11.hebrew: יוֹמָם וָלַיְלָה--יְסוֹבְבֻהָ עַל-חוֹמֹתֶיהָ;    וְאָוֶן וְעָמָל בְּקִרְבָּהּ.
11.english: Day and night they go about it upon the walls thereof; iniquity also and mischief are in the midst of it.

12.hebrew: הַוּוֹת בְּקִרְבָּהּ;    וְלֹא-יָמִישׁ מֵרְחֹבָהּ, תֹּךְ וּמִרְמָה.
12.english: Wickedness is in the midst thereof; oppression and guile depart not from her broad place.

13.hebrew: כִּי לֹא-אוֹיֵב יְחָרְפֵנִי,    וְאֶשָּׂא:לֹא-מְשַׂנְאִי, עָלַי הִגְדִּיל;    וְאֶסָּתֵר מִמֶּנּוּ.
13.english: For it was not an enemy that taunted me, then I could have borne it; {N}neither was it mine adversary that did magnify himself against me, then I would have hid myself from him.

14.hebrew: וְאַתָּה אֱנוֹשׁ כְּעֶרְכִּי;    אַלּוּפִי, וּמְיֻדָּעִי.
14.english: But it was thou, a man mine equal, my companion, and my familiar friend;

15.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר יַחְדָּו, נַמְתִּיק סוֹד;    בְּבֵית אֱלֹהִים, נְהַלֵּךְ בְּרָגֶשׁ.
15.english: We took sweet counsel together, in the house of God we walked with the throng.

16.hebrew: ישימות (יַשִּׁי מָוֶת), עָלֵימוֹ--יֵרְדוּ שְׁאוֹל חַיִּים:    כִּי-רָעוֹת בִּמְגוּרָם בְּקִרְבָּם.
16.english: May He incite death against them, let them go down alive into the nether-world; for evil is in their dwelling, and within them.

17.hebrew: אֲנִי, אֶל-אֱלֹהִים אֶקְרָא;    וַיהוָה, יוֹשִׁיעֵנִי.
17.english: As for me, I will call upon God; and the LORD shall save me.

18.hebrew: עֶרֶב וָבֹקֶר וְצָהֳרַיִם, אָשִׂיחָה וְאֶהֱמֶה;    וַיִּשְׁמַע קוֹלִי.
18.english: Evening, and morning, and at noon, will I complain, and moan; and He hath heard my voice.

19.hebrew: פָּדָה בְשָׁלוֹם נַפְשִׁי, מִקְּרָב-לִי:    כִּי-בְרַבִּים, הָיוּ עִמָּדִי.
19.english: He hath redeemed my soul in peace so that none came nigh me; for they were many that strove with me.

20.hebrew: יִשְׁמַע אֵל, וְיַעֲנֵם--    וְיֹשֵׁב קֶדֶם, סֶלָה:אֲשֶׁר אֵין חֲלִיפוֹת לָמוֹ;    וְלֹא יָרְאוּ אֱלֹהִים.
20.english: God shall hear, and humble them, even He that is enthroned of old, Selah {N}such as have no changes, and fear not God.

21.hebrew: שָׁלַח יָדָיו, בִּשְׁלֹמָיו;    חִלֵּל בְּרִיתוֹ.
21.english: He hath put forth his hands against them that were at peace with him; he hath profaned his covenant.

22.hebrew: חָלְקוּ, מַחְמָאֹת פִּיו--    וּקְרָב-לִבּוֹ:רַכּוּ דְבָרָיו מִשֶּׁמֶן;    וְהֵמָּה פְתִחוֹת.
22.english: Smoother than cream were the speeches of his mouth, but his heart was war; {N}his words were softer than oil, yet were they keen-edged swords.

23.hebrew: הַשְׁלֵךְ עַל-יְהוָה, יְהָבְךָ--    וְהוּא יְכַלְכְּלֶךָ:לֹא-יִתֵּן לְעוֹלָם מוֹט--    לַצַּדִּיק.
23.english: Cast thy burden upon the LORD, and He will sustain thee; {N}He will never suffer the righteous to be moved.

24.hebrew: וְאַתָּה אֱלֹהִים,    תּוֹרִדֵם לִבְאֵר שַׁחַת--אַנְשֵׁי דָמִים וּמִרְמָה,    לֹא-יֶחֱצוּ יְמֵיהֶם;וַאֲנִי,    אֶבְטַח-בָּךְ.
24.english: But Thou, O God, wilt bring them down into the nethermost pit; {N}men of blood and deceit shall not live out half their days; {N}but as for me, I will trust in Thee. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ, עַל-יוֹנַת אֵלֶם רְחֹקִים--    לְדָוִד מִכְתָּם:בֶּאֱחֹז אוֹתוֹ פְלִשְׁתִּים    בְּגַת.
1.english: For the Leader; upon Jonath-elem-rehokim. [A Psalm] of David; Michtam; {N}when the Philistines took him in Gath.

2.hebrew: חָנֵּנִי אֱלֹהִים, כִּי-שְׁאָפַנִי אֱנוֹשׁ;    כָּל-הַיּוֹם, לֹחֵם יִלְחָצֵנִי.
2.english: Be gracious unto me, O God, for man would swallow me up; all the day he fighting oppresseth me.

3.hebrew: שָׁאֲפוּ שׁוֹרְרַי, כָּל-הַיּוֹם:    כִּי-רַבִּים לֹחֲמִים לִי מָרוֹם.
3.english: They that lie in wait for me would swallow me up all the day; for they are many that fight against me, O Most High,

4.hebrew: יוֹם אִירָא--    אֲנִי, אֵלֶיךָ אֶבְטָח.
4.english: In the day that I am afraid, I will put my trust in Thee.

5.hebrew: בֵּאלֹהִים,    אֲהַלֵּל דְּבָרוֹ:בֵּאלֹהִים בָּטַחְתִּי, לֹא אִירָא;    מַה-יַּעֲשֶׂה בָשָׂר לִי.
5.english: In God--I will praise His word-- {N}in God do I trust, I will not be afraid; what can flesh do unto me?

6.hebrew: כָּל-הַיּוֹם, דְּבָרַי יְעַצֵּבוּ;    עָלַי כָּל-מַחְשְׁבֹתָם לָרָע.
6.english: All the day they trouble mine affairs; all their thoughts are against me for evil.

7.hebrew: יָגוּרוּ, יצפינו (יִצְפּוֹנוּ)--הֵמָּה, עֲקֵבַי יִשְׁמֹרוּ:    כַּאֲשֶׁר, קִוּוּ נַפְשִׁי.
7.english: They gather themselves together, they hide themselves, they mark my steps; according as they have waited for my soul.

8.hebrew: עַל-אָוֶן פַּלֶּט-לָמוֹ;    בְּאַף, עַמִּים הוֹרֵד אֱלֹהִים.
8.english: Because of iniquity cast them out; in anger bring down the peoples, O God.

9.hebrew: נֹדִי, סָפַרְתָּה-אָתָּה:    שִׂימָה דִמְעָתִי בְנֹאדֶךָ; הֲלֹא, בְּסִפְרָתֶךָ.
9.english: Thou has counted my wanderings; put Thou my tears into Thy bottle; are they not in Thy book?

10.hebrew: אָז יָשׁוּבוּ אוֹיְבַי אָחוֹר, בְּיוֹם אֶקְרָא;    זֶה-יָדַעְתִּי, כִּי-אֱלֹהִים לִי.
10.english: Then shall mine enemies turn back in the day that I call; this I know, that God is for me.

11.hebrew: בֵּאלֹהִים, אֲהַלֵּל דָּבָר;    בַּיהוָה, אֲהַלֵּל דָּבָר.
11.english: In God--I will praise His word--in the LORD--I will praise His word--

12.hebrew: בֵּאלֹהִים בָּטַחְתִּי, לֹא אִירָא;    מַה-יַּעֲשֶׂה אָדָם לִי.
12.english: In God do I trust, I will not be afraid; what can man do unto me?

13.hebrew: עָלַי אֱלֹהִים נְדָרֶיךָ;    אֲשַׁלֵּם תּוֹדֹת לָךְ.
13.english: Thy vows are upon me, O God; I will render thank-offerings unto Thee.

14.hebrew: כִּי הִצַּלְתָּ נַפְשִׁי, מִמָּוֶת--    הֲלֹא רַגְלַי, מִדֶּחִי:לְהִתְהַלֵּךְ, לִפְנֵי אֱלֹהִים--    בְּאוֹר, הַחַיִּים.
14.english: For Thou hast delivered my soul from death; hast Thou not delivered my feet from stumbling? {N}that I may walk before God in the light of the living. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ אַל-תַּשְׁחֵת, לְדָוִד מִכְתָּם--    בְּבָרְחוֹ מִפְּנֵי-שָׁאוּל, בַּמְּעָרָה.
1.english: For the Leader; Al-tashheth. [A Psalm] of David; Michtam; when he fled from Saul, in the cave.

2.hebrew: חָנֵּנִי אֱלֹהִים, חָנֵּנִי--    כִּי בְךָ, חָסָיָה נַפְשִׁי:וּבְצֵל-כְּנָפֶיךָ אֶחְסֶה--    עַד, יַעֲבֹר הַוּוֹת.
2.english: Be gracious unto me, O God, be gracious unto me, for in Thee hath my soul taken refuge; {N}yea, in the shadow of Thy wings will I take refuge, until calamities be overpast.

3.hebrew: אֶקְרָא, לֵאלֹהִים עֶלְיוֹן;    לָאֵל, גֹּמֵר עָלָי.
3.english: I will cry unto God Most high; unto God that accomplisheth it for me.

4.hebrew: יִשְׁלַח מִשָּׁמַיִם, וְיוֹשִׁיעֵנִי--    חֵרֵף שֹׁאֲפִי סֶלָה;יִשְׁלַח אֱלֹהִים,    חַסְדּוֹ וַאֲמִתּוֹ.
4.english: He will send from heaven, and save me, when he that would swallow me up taunteth; Selah {N}God shall send forth His mercy and His truth.

5.hebrew: נַפְשִׁי, בְּתוֹךְ לְבָאִם--    אֶשְׁכְּבָה לֹהֲטִים:בְּנֵי-אָדָם--שִׁנֵּיהֶם, חֲנִית וְחִצִּים;    וּלְשׁוֹנָם, חֶרֶב חַדָּה.
5.english: My soul is among lions, I do lie down among them that are aflame; {N}even the sons of men, whose teeth are spears and arrows, and their tongue a sharp sword.

6.hebrew: רוּמָה עַל-הַשָּׁמַיִם אֱלֹהִים;    עַל כָּל-הָאָרֶץ כְּבוֹדֶךָ.
6.english: Be Thou exalted, O God, above the heavens; Thy glory be above all the earth.

7.hebrew: רֶשֶׁת, הֵכִינוּ לִפְעָמַי--    כָּפַף נַפְשִׁי:כָּרוּ לְפָנַי שִׁיחָה;    נָפְלוּ בְתוֹכָהּ סֶלָה.
7.english: They have prepared a net for my steps, my soul is bowed down; {N}they have digged a pit before me, they are fallen into the midst thereof themselves. Selah

8.hebrew: נָכוֹן לִבִּי אֱלֹהִים, נָכוֹן לִבִּי;    אָשִׁירָה, וַאֲזַמֵּרָה.
8.english: My heart is stedfast, O God, my heart is stedfast; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises.

9.hebrew: עוּרָה כְבוֹדִי--עוּרָה, הַנֵּבֶל וְכִנּוֹר;    אָעִירָה שָּׁחַר.
9.english: Awake, my glory; awake, psaltery and harp; I will awake the dawn.

10.hebrew: אוֹדְךָ בָעַמִּים אֲדֹנָי;    אֲזַמֶּרְךָ, בַּלְאֻמִּים.
10.english: I will give thanks unto Thee, O Lord, among the peoples; I will sing praises unto Thee among the nations.

11.hebrew: כִּי-גָדֹל עַד-שָׁמַיִם חַסְדֶּךָ;    וְעַד-שְׁחָקִים אֲמִתֶּךָ.
11.english: For Thy mercy is great unto the heavens, and Thy truth unto the skies.

12.hebrew: רוּמָה עַל-שָׁמַיִם אֱלֹהִים;    עַל כָּל-הָאָרֶץ כְּבוֹדֶךָ.
12.english: Be Thou exalted, O God, above the heavens; Thy glory be above all the earth. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ אַל-תַּשְׁחֵת, לְדָוִד מִכְתָּם.
1.english: For the Leader; Al-tashheth. [A Psalm] of David; Michtam.

2.hebrew: הַאֻמְנָם--אֵלֶם צֶדֶק, תְּדַבֵּרוּן;    מֵישָׁרִים תִּשְׁפְּטוּ, בְּנֵי אָדָם.
2.english: Do ye indeed speak as a righteous company? Do ye judge with equity the sons of men?

3.hebrew: אַף-בְּלֵב, עוֹלֹת תִּפְעָלוּן:    בָּאָרֶץ--חֲמַס יְדֵיכֶם, תְּפַלֵּסוּן.
3.english: Yea, in heart ye work wickedness; ye weigh out in the earth the violence of your hands.

4.hebrew: זֹרוּ רְשָׁעִים מֵרָחֶם;    תָּעוּ מִבֶּטֶן, דֹּבְרֵי כָזָב.
4.english: The wicked are estranged from the womb; the speakers of lies go astray as soon as they are born.

5.hebrew: חֲמַת-לָמוֹ, כִּדְמוּת חֲמַת-נָחָשׁ;    כְּמוֹ-פֶתֶן חֵרֵשׁ, יַאְטֵם אָזְנוֹ.
5.english: Their venom is like the venom of a serpent; they are like the deaf asp that stoppeth her ear;

6.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר לֹא-יִשְׁמַע, לְקוֹל מְלַחֲשִׁים;    חוֹבֵר חֲבָרִים מְחֻכָּם.
6.english: Which hearkeneth not to the voice of charmers, or of the most cunning binder of spells.

7.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים--הֲרָס שִׁנֵּימוֹ בְּפִימוֹ;    מַלְתְּעוֹת כְּפִירִים, נְתֹץ יְהוָה.
7.english: Break their teeth, O God, in their mouth; break out the cheek-teeth of the young lions, O LORD.

8.hebrew: יִמָּאֲסוּ כְמוֹ-מַיִם,    יִתְהַלְּכוּ-לָמוֹ;יִדְרֹךְ חִצָּו,    כְּמוֹ יִתְמֹלָלוּ.
8.english: Let them melt away as water that runneth apace; {N}when he aimeth his arrows, let them be as though they were cut off.

9.hebrew: כְּמוֹ שַׁבְּלוּל, תֶּמֶס יַהֲלֹךְ;    נֵפֶל אֵשֶׁת, בַּל-חָזוּ שָׁמֶשׁ.
9.english: Let them be as a snail which melteth and passeth away; like the untimely births of a woman, that have not seen the sun.

10.hebrew: בְּטֶרֶם, יָבִינוּ סִּירֹתֵכֶם אָטָד;    כְּמוֹ-חַי כְּמוֹ-חָרוֹן, יִשְׂעָרֶנּוּ.
10.english: Before your pots can feel the thorns, He will sweep it away with a whirlwind, the raw and the burning alike.

11.hebrew: יִשְׂמַח צַדִּיק, כִּי-חָזָה נָקָם;    פְּעָמָיו יִרְחַץ, בְּדַם הָרָשָׁע.
11.english: The righteous shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance; he shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.

12.hebrew: וְיֹאמַר אָדָם, אַךְ-פְּרִי לַצַּדִּיק;    אַךְ יֵשׁ-אֱלֹהִים, שֹׁפְטִים בָּאָרֶץ.
12.english: And men shall say: 'Verily there is a reward for the righteous; verily there is a God that judgeth in the earth.' {P}

1.hebrew: ††м«ојр«цћ≈з« а«м-ъћ«щ—јз≈ъ, мјг»еƒг оƒлјъћ»н: †† бћƒщ—јм…з« щ—»аећм;е«йћƒщ—јојшећ а∆ъ-д«бћ«йƒъ, †† м«д¬оƒйъе….
1.english: For the Leader; Al-tashheth. [A Psalm] of David; Michtam; when Saul sent, {N}and they watched the house to kill him.

2.hebrew: ††д«цћƒйм≈рƒй о≈а…йјб«й аЅм…д»й; †† оƒоћƒъјче…ојо«й ъћјщ“«вћјб≈рƒй.
2.english: Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God; set me on high from them that rise up against me.

3.hebrew: ††д«цћƒйм≈рƒй, оƒфћ…т¬м≈й а»е∆п; †† ећо≈а«рјщ—≈й г»оƒйн, де…щ—ƒйт≈рƒй.
3.english: Deliver me from the workers of iniquity, and save me from the men of blood.

4.hebrew: ††лћƒй дƒрћ≈д а»шјбећ, мјр«фјщ—ƒй-- †† й»већшећ т»м«й т«жћƒйн;м…а-фƒщ—јтƒй ејм…а-з«ић»аъƒй †† йјде»д.
4.english: For, lo, they lie in wait for my soul; the impudent gather themselves together against me; {N}not for my transgression, nor for my sin, O LORD.

5.hebrew: ††бћјмƒй-т»е п, йјшЋцећп ејйƒлће…р»рећ; †† тећш»д мƒчјш»аъƒй ећшја≈д.
5.english: Without my fault, they run and prepare themselves; awake Thou to help me, and behold.

6.hebrew: ††еја«ъћ»д йјде»д-аЅм…дƒйн цјб»ае…ъ, аЅм…д≈й йƒщ“јш»а≈м-- †† д»чƒйц»д, мƒфјч…г лћ»м-д«вће…йƒн;а«м-ъћ»з…п лћ»м-бћ…вјг≈й а»е∆п †† с∆м»д.
6.english: Thou therefore, O LORD God of hosts, the God of Israel, arouse Thyself to punish all the nations; {N}show no mercy to any iniquitous traitors. Selah

7.hebrew: ††й»щ—ећбећ м»т∆ш∆б, й∆дЅоећ л«лћ»м∆б; †† еƒйсе…бјбећ тƒйш.
7.english: They return at evening, they howl like a dog, and go round about the city.

8.hebrew: ††дƒрћ≈д, й«бћƒйтећп бћјфƒйд∆н--з¬ш»бе…ъ, бћјщ“ƒфјъе…ъ≈йд∆н: †† лћƒй-оƒй щ—…о≈т«.
8.english: Behold, they belch out with their mouth; swords are in their lips: 'For who doth hear?'

9.hebrew: ††еја«ъћ»д йјде»д, ъћƒщ“јз«ч-м»ое…; †† ъћƒмјт«в, мјл»м-вће…йƒн.
9.english: But Thou, O LORD, shalt laugh at them; Thou shalt have all the nations in derision.

10.hebrew: ††тЋжће…, а≈м∆йк» а∆щ—јо…ш»д: †† лћƒй-аЅм…дƒйн, оƒщ“јвћ«бћƒй.
10.english: Because of his strength, I will wait for Thee; for God is my high tower.

11.hebrew: ††аЅм…д≈й зсге (з«сјгћƒй) йјч«гћјо≈рƒй; †† аЅм…дƒйн, й«шја≈рƒй бјщ—…шјш»й.
11.english: The God of my mercy will come to meet me; God will let me gaze upon mine adversaries.

12.hebrew: ††а«м-ъћ«д«шјв≈н, фћ∆п йƒщ—јлћјзећ т«оћƒй--д¬рƒйт≈ое… бјз≈ймјк», ејде…шƒйг≈ое…: †† о»вƒрћ≈рећ а¬г…р»й.
12.english: Slay them not, lest my people forget, make them wander to and fro by Thy power, and bring them down, O Lord our shield.

13.hebrew: ††з«ић«аъ-фћƒйое…, †† гћјб«ш-щ“јф»ъ≈йое…:ејйƒмћ»лјгећ бƒвјае…р»н; †† ећо≈а»м»д ећоƒлћ«з«щ— йјс«фћ≈шећ.
13.english: For the sin of their mouth, and the words of their lips, {N}let them even be taken in their pride, and for cursing and lying which they speak.

14.hebrew: ††лћ«мћ≈д бјз≈о»д, †† лћ«мћ≈д еја≈йр≈ое…:ејй≈гјтећ--лћƒй-аЅм…дƒйн, о…щ—≈м бћјй«т¬ч…б; †† мја«фјс≈й д»а»ш∆х с∆м»д.
14.english: Consume them in wrath, consume them, that they be no more; {N}and let them know that God ruleth in Jacob, unto the ends of the earth. Selah

15.hebrew: ††ејй»щ—Ћбећ м»т∆ш∆б, й∆дЅоећ л«лћ»м∆б; †† еƒйсе…бјбећ тƒйш.
15.english: And they return at evening, they howl like a dog, and go round about the city;

16.hebrew: ††д≈оћ»д, йретеп (йјрƒйтећп) м∆аЅл…м-- †† аƒн-м…а йƒщ“јбћјтећ, е«йћ»мƒйрећ.
16.english: They wander up and down to devour, and tarry all night if they have not their fill.

17.hebrew: ††е«а¬рƒй, а»щ—ƒйш тЋжћ∆к»-- †† е«а¬ш«рћ≈п м«бћ…ч∆ш, з«сјгћ∆к»:лћƒй-д»йƒйъ» оƒщ“јвћ»б мƒй; †† ећо»ре…с, бћјйе…н ц«ш-мƒй.
17.english: But as for me, I will sing of Thy strength; yea, I will sing aloud of Thy mercy in the morning; {N}for Thou hast been my high tower, and a refuge in the day of my distress.

18.hebrew: ††тЋжћƒй, а≈м∆йк» а¬ж«оћ≈ш»д: †† лћƒй-аЅм…дƒйн оƒщ“јвћ«бћƒй, аЅм…д≈й з«сјгћƒй.
18.english: O my strength, unto Thee will I sing praises; for God is my high tower, the God of my mercy. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ, עַל-שׁוּשַׁן עֵדוּת;    מִכְתָּם לְדָוִד לְלַמֵּד.
1.english: For the Leader; upon Shushan Eduth; Michtam of David, to teach;

2.hebrew: בְּהַצּוֹתוֹ, אֶת אֲרַם נַהֲרַיִם--    וְאֶת-אֲרַם צוֹבָה:וַיָּשָׁב יוֹאָב, וַיַּךְ אֶת-אֱדוֹם בְּגֵיא-מֶלַח--    שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר אָלֶף.
2.english: when he strove with Aram-naharaim and with Aram-zobah, {N}and Joab returned, and smote of Edom in the Valley of Salt twelve thousand.

3.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים, זְנַחְתָּנוּ פְרַצְתָּנוּ;    אָנַפְתָּ, תְּשׁוֹבֵב לָנוּ.
3.english: O God, Thou hast cast us off, Thou hast broken us down; Thou hast been angry; O restore us.

4.hebrew: הִרְעַשְׁתָּה אֶרֶץ פְּצַמְתָּהּ;    רְפָה שְׁבָרֶיהָ כִי-מָטָה.
4.english: Thou hast made the land to shake, Thou hast cleft it; heal the breaches thereof; for it tottereth.

5.hebrew: הִרְאִיתָ עַמְּךָ קָשָׁה;    הִשְׁקִיתָנוּ, יַיִן תַּרְעֵלָה.
5.english: Thou hast made Thy people to see hard things; Thou hast made us to drink the wine of staggering.

6.hebrew: נָתַתָּה לִּירֵאֶיךָ נֵּס, לְהִתְנוֹסֵס--    מִפְּנֵי, קֹשֶׁט סֶלָה.
6.english: Thou hast given a banner to them that fear Thee, that it may be displayed because of the truth. Selah

7.hebrew: לְמַעַן, יֵחָלְצוּן יְדִידֶיךָ;    הוֹשִׁיעָה יְמִינְךָ ועננו (וַעֲנֵנִי).
7.english: That Thy beloved may be delivered, save with Thy right hand, and answer me.

8.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים, דִּבֶּר בְּקָדְשׁוֹ--אֶעְלֹזָה:    אֲחַלְּקָה שְׁכֶם; וְעֵמֶק סֻכּוֹת אֲמַדֵּד.
8.english: God spoke in His holiness, that I would exult; that I would divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.

9.hebrew: לִי גִלְעָד, וְלִי מְנַשֶּׁה, וְאֶפְרַיִם, מָעוֹז רֹאשִׁי;    יְהוּדָה, מְחֹקְקִי.
9.english: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the defence of my head; Judah is my sceptre.

10.hebrew: מוֹאָב, סִיר רַחְצִי--עַל-אֱדוֹם, אַשְׁלִיךְ נַעֲלִי;    עָלַי, פְּלֶשֶׁת הִתְרוֹעָעִי.
10.english: Moab is my washpot; upon Edom do I cast my shoe; Philistia, cry aloud because of me!

11.hebrew: מִי יֹבִלֵנִי, עִיר מָצוֹר;    מִי נָחַנִי עַד-אֱדוֹם.
11.english: Who will bring me into the fortified city? Who will lead me unto Edom?

12.hebrew: הֲלֹא-אַתָּה אֱלֹהִים זְנַחְתָּנוּ;    וְלֹא-תֵצֵא אֱלֹהִים, בְּצִבְאוֹתֵינוּ.
12.english: Hast not Thou, O God, cast us off? And Thou goest not forth, O God, with our hosts.

13.hebrew: הָבָה-לָּנוּ עֶזְרָת מִצָּר;    וְשָׁוְא, תְּשׁוּעַת אָדָם.
13.english: Give us help against the adversary; for vain is the help of man.

14.hebrew: בֵּאלֹהִים נַעֲשֶׂה-חָיִל;    וְהוּא, יָבוּס צָרֵינוּ.
14.english: Through God we shall do valiantly; for He it is that will tread down our adversaries. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ עַל-נְגִינַת לְדָוִד.
1.english: For the Leader; with string-music. [A Psalm] of David.

2.hebrew: שִׁמְעָה אֱלֹהִים, רִנָּתִי;    הַקְשִׁיבָה, תְּפִלָּתִי.
2.english: Hear my cry, O God; attend unto my prayer.

3.hebrew: מִקְצֵה הָאָרֶץ, אֵלֶיךָ אֶקְרָא--    בַּעֲטֹף לִבִּי;בְּצוּר-יָרוּם מִמֶּנִּי    תַנְחֵנִי.
3.english: From the end of the earth will I call unto Thee, when my heart fainteth; {N}lead me to a rock that is too high for me.

4.hebrew: כִּי-הָיִיתָ מַחְסֶה לִי;    מִגְדַּל-עֹז, מִפְּנֵי אוֹיֵב.
4.english: For Thou hast been a refuge for me, a tower of strength in the face of the enemy.

5.hebrew: אָגוּרָה בְאָהָלְךָ, עוֹלָמִים;    אֶחֱסֶה בְסֵתֶר כְּנָפֶיךָ סֶּלָה.
5.english: I will dwell in Thy Tent for ever; I will take refuge in the covert of Thy wings. Selah

6.hebrew: כִּי-אַתָּה אֱלֹהִים, שָׁמַעְתָּ לִנְדָרָי;    נָתַתָּ יְרֻשַּׁת, יִרְאֵי שְׁמֶךָ.
6.english: For Thou, O God, hast heard my vows; Thou hast granted the heritage of those that fear Thy name.

7.hebrew: יָמִים עַל-יְמֵי-מֶלֶךְ תּוֹסִיף;    שְׁנוֹתָיו, כְּמוֹ-דֹר וָדֹר.
7.english: Mayest Thou add days unto the king's days! May his years be as many generations!

8.hebrew: יֵשֵׁב עוֹלָם, לִפְנֵי אֱלֹהִים;    חֶסֶד וֶאֱמֶת, מַן יִנְצְרֻהוּ.
8.english: May he be enthroned before God for ever! Appoint mercy and truth, that they may preserve him.

9.hebrew: כֵּן אֲזַמְּרָה שִׁמְךָ לָעַד--    לְשַׁלְּמִי נְדָרַי, יוֹם יוֹם.
9.english: So will I sing praise unto Thy name for ever, that I may daily perform my vows. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ עַל-יְדוּתוּן--    מִזְמוֹר לְדָוִד.
1.english: For the Leader; for Jeduthun. A Psalm of David.

2.hebrew: אַךְ אֶל-אֱלֹהִים, דּוּמִיָּה נַפְשִׁי;    מִמֶּנּוּ, יְשׁוּעָתִי.
2.english: Only for God doth my soul wait in stillness; from Him cometh my salvation.

3.hebrew: אַךְ-הוּא צוּרִי, וִישׁוּעָתִי;    מִשְׂגַּבִּי, לֹא-אֶמּוֹט רַבָּה.
3.english: He only is my rock and my salvation, my high tower, I shall not be greatly moved.

4.hebrew: עַד-אָנָה, תְּהוֹתְתוּ עַל-אִישׁ--    תְּרָצְּחוּ כֻלְּכֶם:כְּקִיר נָטוּי;    גָּדֵר, הַדְּחוּיָה.
4.english: How long will ye set upon a man, that ye may slay him, all of you, {N}as a leaning wall, a tottering fence?

5.hebrew: אַךְ מִשְּׂאֵתוֹ, יָעֲצוּ לְהַדִּיחַ--    יִרְצוּ כָזָב:בְּפִיו יְבָרֵכוּ;    וּבְקִרְבָּם, יְקַלְלוּ-סֶלָה.
5.english: They only devise to thrust him down from his height, delighting in lies; {N}they bless with their mouth, but they curse inwardly. Selah

6.hebrew: אַךְ לֵאלֹהִים, דּוֹמִּי נַפְשִׁי:    כִּי-מִמֶּנּוּ, תִּקְוָתִי.
6.english: Only for God wait thou in stillness, my soul; for from Him cometh my hope.

7.hebrew: אַךְ-הוּא צוּרִי, וִישׁוּעָתִי;    מִשְׂגַּבִּי, לֹא אֶמּוֹט.
7.english: He only is my rock and my salvation, my high tower, I shall not be moved.

8.hebrew: עַל-אֱלֹהִים, יִשְׁעִי וּכְבוֹדִי;    צוּר-עֻזִּי מַחְסִי, בֵּאלֹהִים.
8.english: Upon God resteth my salvation and my glory; the rock of my strength, and my refuge, is in God.

9.hebrew: בִּטְחוּ בוֹ בְכָל-עֵת, עָם--    שִׁפְכוּ-לְפָנָיו לְבַבְכֶם;אֱלֹהִים מַחֲסֶה-לָּנוּ    סֶלָה.
9.english: Trust in Him at all times, ye people; pour out your heart before Him; {N}God is a refuge for us. Selah

10.hebrew: אַךְ, הֶבֶל בְּנֵי-אָדָם--    כָּזָב בְּנֵי-אִישׁ:בְּמֹאזְנַיִם לַעֲלוֹת;    הֵמָּה, מֵהֶבֶל יָחַד.
10.english: Men of low degree are vanity, and men of high degree are a lie; {N}if they be laid in the balances, they are together lighter than vanity.

11.hebrew: אַל-תִּבְטְחוּ בְעֹשֶׁק,    וּבְגָזֵל אַל-תֶּהְבָּלוּ:חַיִל כִּי-יָנוּב--    אַל-תָּשִׁיתוּ לֵב.
11.english: Trust not in oppression, and put not vain hope in robbery; {N}if riches increase, set not your heart thereon.

12.hebrew: אַחַת, דִּבֶּר אֱלֹהִים--שְׁתַּיִם-זוּ שָׁמָעְתִּי:    כִּי עֹז, לֵאלֹהִים.
12.english: God hath spoken once, twice have I heard this: that strength belongeth unto God;

13.hebrew: וּלְךָ-אֲדֹנָי חָסֶד:    כִּי-אַתָּה תְשַׁלֵּם לְאִישׁ כְּמַעֲשֵׂהוּ.
13.english: Also unto Thee, O Lord, belongeth mercy; for Thou renderest to every man according to his work. {P}

1.hebrew: מִזְמוֹר לְדָוִד;    בִּהְיוֹתוֹ, בְּמִדְבַּר יְהוּדָה.
1.english: A Psalm of David, when he was in the wilderness of Judah.

2.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים, אֵלִי אַתָּה--    אֲשַׁחֲרֶךָּ:צָמְאָה לְךָ, נַפְשִׁי--    כָּמַהּ לְךָ בְשָׂרִי;בְּאֶרֶץ-צִיָּה וְעָיֵף    בְּלִי-מָיִם.
2.english: O God, Thou art my God, earnestly will I seek Thee; {N}my soul thirsteth for Thee, my flesh longeth for Thee, {N}in a dry and weary land, where no water is.

3.hebrew: כֵּן, בַּקֹּדֶשׁ חֲזִיתִךָ--    לִרְאוֹת עֻזְּךָ, וּכְבוֹדֶךָ.
3.english: So have I looked for Thee in the sanctuary, to see Thy power and Thy glory.

4.hebrew: כִּי-טוֹב חַסְדְּךָ, מֵחַיִּים;    שְׂפָתַי יְשַׁבְּחוּנְךָ.
4.english: For Thy lovingkindness is better than life; my lips shall praise Thee.

5.hebrew: כֵּן אֲבָרֶכְךָ בְחַיָּי;    בְּשִׁמְךָ, אֶשָּׂא כַפָּי.
5.english: So will I bless Thee as long as I live; in Thy name will I lift up my hands.

6.hebrew: כְּמוֹ חֵלֶב וָדֶשֶׁן, תִּשְׂבַּע נַפְשִׁי;    וְשִׂפְתֵי רְנָנוֹת, יְהַלֶּל-פִּי.
6.english: My soul is satisfied as with marrow and fatness; and my mouth doth praise Thee with joyful lips;

7.hebrew: אִם-זְכַרְתִּיךָ עַל-יְצוּעָי--    בְּאַשְׁמֻרוֹת, אֶהְגֶּה-בָּךְ.
7.english: When I remember Thee upon my couch, and meditate on Thee in the night-watches.

8.hebrew: כִּי-הָיִיתָ עֶזְרָתָה לִּי;    וּבְצֵל כְּנָפֶיךָ אֲרַנֵּן.
8.english: For Thou hast been my help, and in the shadow of Thy wings do I rejoice.

9.hebrew: דָּבְקָה נַפְשִׁי אַחֲרֶיךָ;    בִּי, תָּמְכָה יְמִינֶךָ.
9.english: My soul cleaveth unto Thee; Thy right hand holdeth me fast.

10.hebrew: וְהֵמָּה--לְשׁוֹאָה, יְבַקְשׁוּ נַפְשִׁי;    יָבֹאוּ, בְּתַחְתִּיּוֹת הָאָרֶץ.
10.english: But those that seek my soul, to destroy it, shall go into the nethermost parts of the earth.

11.hebrew: יַגִּירֻהוּ, עַל-יְדֵי-חָרֶב;    מְנָת שֻׁעָלִים יִהְיוּ.
11.english: They shall be hurled to the power of the sword; they shall be a portion for foxes.

12.hebrew: וְהַמֶּלֶךְ,    יִשְׂמַח בֵּאלֹהִים:יִתְהַלֵּל, כָּל-הַנִּשְׁבָּע בּוֹ--    כִּי יִסָּכֵר, פִּי דוֹבְרֵי-שָׁקֶר.
12.english: But the king shall rejoice in God; {N}every one that sweareth by Him shall glory; for the mouth of them that speak lies shall be stopped. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ, מִזְמוֹר לְדָוִד.
1.english: For the Leader. A Psalm of David.

2.hebrew: שְׁמַע-אֱלֹהִים קוֹלִי בְשִׂיחִי;    מִפַּחַד אוֹיֵב, תִּצֹּר חַיָּי.
2.english: Hear my voice, O God, in my complaint; preserve my life from the terror of the enemy.

3.hebrew: תַּסְתִּירֵנִי, מִסּוֹד מְרֵעִים;    מֵרִגְשַׁת, פֹּעֲלֵי אָוֶן.
3.english: Hide me from the council of evil-doers; from the tumult of the workers of iniquity;

4.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר שָׁנְנוּ כַחֶרֶב לְשׁוֹנָם;    דָּרְכוּ חִצָּם, דָּבָר מָר.
4.english: Who have whet their tongue like a sword, and have aimed their arrow, a poisoned word;

5.hebrew: לִירֹת בַּמִּסְתָּרִים תָּם;    פִּתְאֹם יֹרֻהוּ, וְלֹא יִירָאוּ.
5.english: That they may shoot in secret places at the blameless; suddenly do they shoot at him, and fear not.

6.hebrew: יְחַזְּקוּ-לָמוֹ, דָּבָר רָע--    יְסַפְּרוּ, לִטְמוֹן מוֹקְשִׁים;אָמְרוּ,    מִי יִרְאֶה-לָּמוֹ.
6.english: They encourage one another in an evil matter; they converse of laying snares secretly; {N}they ask, who would see them.

7.hebrew: יַחְפְּשׂוּ עוֹלֹת--    תַּמְנוּ, חֵפֶשׂ מְחֻפָּשׂ;וְקֶרֶב אִישׁ,    וְלֵב עָמֹק.
7.english: They search out iniquities, they have accomplished a diligent search; {N}even in the inward thought of every one, and the deep heart.

8.hebrew: וַיֹּרֵם, אֱלֹהִים:    חֵץ פִּתְאוֹם--הָיוּ, מַכּוֹתָם.
8.english: But God doth shoot at them with an arrow suddenly; thence are their wounds.

9.hebrew: וַיַּכְשִׁילוּהוּ עָלֵימוֹ לְשׁוֹנָם;    יִתְנֹדְדוּ, כָּל-רֹאֵה בָם.
9.english: So they make their own tongue a stumbling unto themselves; all that see them shake the head.

10.hebrew: וַיִּירְאוּ, כָּל-אָדָם:    וַיַּגִּידוּ, פֹּעַל אֱלֹהִים; וּמַעֲשֵׂהוּ הִשְׂכִּילוּ.
10.english: And all men fear; and they declare the work of God, and understand His doing.

11.hebrew: יִשְׂמַח צַדִּיק בַּיהוָה, וְחָסָה בוֹ;    וְיִתְהַלְלוּ, כָּל-יִשְׁרֵי-לֵב.
11.english: The righteous shall be glad in the LORD, and shall take refuge in Him; and all the upright in heart shall glory. {P}

1.hebrew: ††м«ојр«цћ≈з« оƒжјое…ш, мјг»еƒг щ—ƒйш.
1.english: For the Leader. A Psalm. A Song of David.

5.english: Happy is the man whom Thou choosest, and bringest near, that he may dwell in Thy courts; {N}may we be satisfied with the goodness of Thy house, the holy place of Thy temple!

6.hebrew: ††ре…ш»ае…ъ, бћјц∆г∆ч ъћ«т¬р≈рећ-- †† аЅм…д≈й йƒщ—јт≈рећ;оƒбји»з лћ»м-ч«цје≈й-а∆ш∆х, †† ејй»н шјз…чƒйн.
6.english: With wondrous works dost Thou answer us in righteousness, O God of our salvation; {N}Thou the confidence of all the ends of the earth, and of the far distant seas;

7.hebrew: ††о≈лƒйп д»шƒйн бћјл…зе…; †† р∆ајж»ш, бћƒвјбећш»д.
7.english: Who by Thy strength settest fast the mountains, who art girded about with might;

8.hebrew: ††о«щ—јбћƒйз«, щ—јае…п й«оћƒйн--щ—јае…п вћ«мћ≈йд∆н; †† е«д¬ое…п мјаЋоћƒйн.
8.english: Who stillest the roaring of the seas, the roaring of their waves, and the tumult of the peoples;

9.hebrew: ††е«йћƒйшјаећ, й…щ—јб≈й чјц»е ъ--о≈ае…ъ…ъ∆йк»; †† ое…ц»а≈й б…ч∆ш е»т∆ш∆б ъћ«шјрƒйп.
9.english: So that they that dwell in the uttermost parts stand in awe of Thy signs; Thou makest the outgoings of the morning and evening to rejoice.

10.hebrew: ††фћ»ч«гјъћ» д»а»ш∆х е«ъћјщ—…чјч∆д», ш«бћ«ъ ъћ«тјщ—јш∆рћ»д-- †† фћ∆м∆в аЅм…дƒйн, о»м≈а о»йƒн;ъћ»лƒйп гћјв»р»н, †† лћƒй-л≈п ъћјлƒйр∆д».
10.english: Thou hast remembered the earth, and watered her, greatly enriching her, with the river of God that is full of water; {N}Thou preparest them corn, for so preparest Thou her.

11.hebrew: ††ъћјм»о∆йд» ш«ећ≈д, р«з≈ъ вћјгећг∆д»; †† бћƒшјбƒйбƒйн ъћјо…вјв∆рћ»д, цƒојз»дћ ъћјб»ш≈кј.
11.english: Watering her ridges abundantly, settling down the furrows thereof, Thou makest her soft with showers; Thou blessest the growth thereof.

12.hebrew: ††тƒић«шјъћ», щ—јр«ъ ие…б»ъ∆к»; †† ећо«тјвћ»м∆йк», йƒшјт¬фећп гћ»щ—∆п.
12.english: Thou crownest the year with Thy goodness; and Thy paths drop fatness.

13.hebrew: ††йƒшјт¬фећ, рјае…ъ оƒгјбћ»ш; †† ејвƒйм, вћјб»те…ъ ъћ«зјвћ…шјр»д.
13.english: The pastures of the wilderness do drop; and the hills are girded with joy.

14.hebrew: ††м»бјщ—ећ л»шƒйн, д«цћ…ап-- †† е«т¬о»чƒйн й«т«ијфећ-б»ш;йƒъјше…т¬тећ, †† а«у-й»щ—ƒйшећ.
14.english: The meadows are clothed with flocks; the valleys also are covered over with corn; {N}they shout for joy, yea, they sing. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ, שִׁיר מִזְמוֹר:    הָרִיעוּ לֵאלֹהִים, כָּל-הָאָרֶץ.
1.english: For the Leader. A Song, a Psalm. Shout unto God, all the earth;

2.hebrew: זַמְּרוּ כְבוֹד-שְׁמוֹ;    שִׂימוּ כָבוֹד, תְּהִלָּתוֹ.
2.english: Sing praises unto the glory of His name; make His praise glorious.

3.hebrew: אִמְרוּ לֵאלֹהִים, מַה-נּוֹרָא מַעֲשֶׂיךָ;    בְּרֹב עֻזְּךָ, יְכַחֲשׁוּ לְךָ אֹיְבֶיךָ.
3.english: Say unto God: 'How tremendous is Thy work! Through the greatness of Thy power shall Thine enemies dwindle away before Thee.

4.hebrew: כָּל-הָאָרֶץ, יִשְׁתַּחֲווּ לְךָ--וִיזַמְּרוּ-לָךְ;    יְזַמְּרוּ שִׁמְךָ סֶלָה.
4.english: All the earth shall worship Thee, and shall sing praises unto Thee; they shall sing praises to Thy name.' Selah

5.hebrew: לְכוּ וּרְאוּ, מִפְעֲלוֹת אֱלֹהִים;    נוֹרָא עֲלִילָה, עַל-בְּנֵי אָדָם.
5.english: Come, and see the works of God; He is terrible in His doing toward the children of men.

6.hebrew: הָפַךְ יָם, לְיַבָּשָׁה--בַּנָּהָר, יַעַבְרוּ בְרָגֶל;    שָׁם, נִשְׂמְחָה-בּוֹ.
6.english: He turned the sea into dry land; they went through the river on foot; there let us rejoice in Him!

7.hebrew: מֹשֵׁל בִּגְבוּרָתוֹ, עוֹלָם--    עֵינָיו, בַּגּוֹיִם תִּצְפֶּינָה;הַסּוֹרְרִים,    אַל-ירימו (יָרוּמוּ) לָמוֹ סֶלָה.
7.english: Who ruleth by His might for ever; His eyes keep watch upon the nations; {N}let not the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah

8.hebrew: בָּרְכוּ עַמִּים אֱלֹהֵינוּ;    וְהַשְׁמִיעוּ, קוֹל תְּהִלָּתוֹ.
8.english: Bless our God, ye peoples, and make the voice of His praise to be heard;

9.hebrew: הַשָּׂם נַפְשֵׁנוּ, בַּחַיִּים;    וְלֹא-נָתַן לַמּוֹט רַגְלֵנוּ.
9.english: Who hath set our soul in life, and suffered not our foot to be moved,

10.hebrew: כִּי-בְחַנְתָּנוּ אֱלֹהִים;    צְרַפְתָּנוּ, כִּצְרָף-כָּסֶף.
10.english: For Thou, O God, hast tried us; Thou hast refined us, as silver is refined.

11.hebrew: הֲבֵאתָנוּ בַמְּצוּדָה;    שַׂמְתָּ מוּעָקָה בְמָתְנֵינוּ.
11.english: Thou didst bring us into the hold; Thou didst lay constraint upon our loins.

12.hebrew: הִרְכַּבְתָּ אֱנוֹשׁ, לְרֹאשֵׁנוּ:    בָּאנוּ-בָאֵשׁ וּבַמַּיִם; וַתּוֹצִיאֵנוּ, לָרְוָיָה.
12.english: Thou hast caused men to ride over our heads; we went through fire and through water; but Thou didst bring us out unto abundance.

13.hebrew: אָבוֹא בֵיתְךָ בְעוֹלוֹת;    אֲשַׁלֵּם לְךָ נְדָרָי.
13.english: I will come into Thy house with burnt-offerings, I will perform unto Thee my vows,

14.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר-פָּצוּ שְׂפָתָי;    וְדִבֶּר-פִּי, בַּצַּר-לִי.
14.english: Which my lips have uttered, and my mouth hath spoken, when I was in distress.

15.hebrew: עֹלוֹת מֵיחִים אַעֲלֶה-לָּךְ,    עִם-קְטֹרֶת אֵילִים;אֶעֱשֶׂה בָקָר עִם-עַתּוּדִים    סֶלָה.
15.english: I will offer unto Thee burnt-offerings of fatlings, with the sweet smoke of rams; {N}I will offer bullocks with goats. Selah

16.hebrew: לְכוּ-שִׁמְעוּ וַאֲסַפְּרָה, כָּל-יִרְאֵי אֱלֹהִים:    אֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה לְנַפְשִׁי.
16.english: Come, and hearken, all ye that fear God, and I will declare what He hath done for my soul.

17.hebrew: אֵלָיו פִּי-קָרָאתִי;    וְרוֹמַם, תַּחַת לְשׁוֹנִי.
17.english: I cried unto Him with my mouth, and He was extolled with my tongue.

18.hebrew: אָוֶן, אִם-רָאִיתִי בְלִבִּי--    לֹא יִשְׁמַע אֲדֹנָי.
18.english: If I had regarded iniquity in my heart, the Lord would not hear;

19.hebrew: אָכֵן, שָׁמַע אֱלֹהִים;    הִקְשִׁיב, בְּקוֹל תְּפִלָּתִי.
19.english: But verily God hath heard; He hath attended to the voice of my prayer.

20.hebrew: בָּרוּךְ אֱלֹהִים--    אֲשֶׁר לֹא-הֵסִיר תְּפִלָּתִי וְחַסְדּוֹ, מֵאִתִּי.
20.english: Blessed be God, who hath not turned away my prayer, nor His mercy from me. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ בִּנְגִינֹת, מִזְמוֹר שִׁיר.
1.english: For the Leader; with string-music. A Psalm, a Song.

2.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים, יְחָנֵּנוּ וִיבָרְכֵנוּ;    יָאֵר פָּנָיו אִתָּנוּ סֶלָה.
2.english: God be gracious unto us, and bless us; may He cause His face to shine toward us; Selah

3.hebrew: לָדַעַת בָּאָרֶץ דַּרְכֶּךָ;    בְּכָל-גּוֹיִם, יְשׁוּעָתֶךָ.
3.english: That Thy way may be known upon earth, Thy salvation among all nations.

4.hebrew: יוֹדוּךָ עַמִּים אֱלֹהִים:    יוֹדוּךָ, עַמִּים כֻּלָּם.
4.english: Let the peoples give thanks unto Thee, O God; let the peoples give thanks unto Thee, all of them.

5.hebrew: יִשְׂמְחוּ וִירַנְּנוּ,    לְאֻמִּים:כִּי-תִשְׁפֹּט עַמִּים מִישֹׁר;    וּלְאֻמִּים, בָּאָרֶץ תַּנְחֵם סֶלָה.
5.english: O let the nations be glad and sing for joy; {N}for Thou wilt judge the peoples with equity, and lead the nations upon earth. Selah

6.hebrew: יוֹדוּךָ עַמִּים אֱלֹהִים:    יוֹדוּךָ, עַמִּים כֻּלָּם.
6.english: Let the peoples give thanks unto Thee, O God; let the peoples give thanks unto Thee, all of them.

7.hebrew: אֶרֶץ, נָתְנָה יְבוּלָהּ;    יְבָרְכֵנוּ, אֱלֹהִים אֱלֹהֵינוּ.
7.english: The earth hath yielded her increase; may God, our own God, bless us.

8.hebrew: יְבָרְכֵנוּ אֱלֹהִים;    וְיִירְאוּ אוֹתוֹ, כָּל-אַפְסֵי-אָרֶץ.
8.english: May God bless us; and let all the ends of the earth fear Him. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ לְדָוִד, מִזְמוֹר שִׁיר.
1.english: For the Leader. A Psalm of David, a Song.

2.hebrew: יָקוּם אֱלֹהִים, יָפוּצוּ אוֹיְבָיו;    וְיָנוּסוּ מְשַׂנְאָיו, מִפָּנָיו.
2.english: Let God arise, let His enemies be scattered; and let them that hate Him flee before Him.

3.hebrew: כְּהִנְדֹּף עָשָׁן,    תִּנְדֹּף:כְּהִמֵּס דּוֹנַג, מִפְּנֵי-אֵשׁ--    יֹאבְדוּ רְשָׁעִים, מִפְּנֵי אֱלֹהִים.
3.english: As smoke is driven away, so drive them away; {N}as wax melteth before the fire, so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.

4.hebrew: וְצַדִּיקִים--יִשְׂמְחוּ יַעַלְצוּ, לִפְנֵי אֱלֹהִים;    וְיָשִׂישׂוּ בְשִׂמְחָה.
4.english: But let the righteous be glad, let them exult before God; yea, let them rejoice with gladness.

5.hebrew: שִׁירוּ, לֵאלֹהִים--    זַמְּרוּ שְׁמוֹ:סֹלּוּ, לָרֹכֵב בָּעֲרָבוֹת--בְּיָהּ שְׁמוֹ;    וְעִלְזוּ לְפָנָיו.
5.english: Sing unto God, sing praises to His name; {N}extol Him that rideth upon the skies, whose name is the LORD; and exult ye before Him.

6.hebrew: אֲבִי יְתוֹמִים, וְדַיַּן אַלְמָנוֹת--    אֱלֹהִים, בִּמְעוֹן קָדְשׁוֹ.
6.english: A father of the fatherless, and a judge of the widows, is God in His holy habitation.

7.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים, מוֹשִׁיב יְחִידִים בַּיְתָה--    מוֹצִיא אֲסִירִים, בַּכּוֹשָׁרוֹת;אַךְ סוֹרְרִים,    שָׁכְנוּ צְחִיחָה.
7.english: God maketh the solitary to dwell in a house; He bringeth out the prisoners into prosperity; {N}the rebellious dwell but in a parched land.

8.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים--בְּצֵאתְךָ, לִפְנֵי עַמֶּךָ;    בְּצַעְדְּךָ בִישִׁימוֹן סֶלָה.
8.english: O God, when Thou wentest forth before Thy people, when Thou didst march through the wilderness; Selah

9.hebrew: אֶרֶץ רָעָשָׁה, אַף-שָׁמַיִם נָטְפוּ--    מִפְּנֵי אֱלֹהִים:זֶה סִינַי--    מִפְּנֵי אֱלֹהִים, אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל.
9.english: The earth trembled, the heavens also dropped at the presence of God; {N}even yon Sinai trembled at the presence of God, the God of Israel.

10.hebrew: גֶּשֶׁם נְדָבוֹת, תָּנִיף אֱלֹהִים;    נַחֲלָתְךָ וְנִלְאָה, אַתָּה כוֹנַנְתָּהּ.
10.english: A bounteous rain didst Thou pour down, O God; when Thine inheritance was weary, Thou didst confirm it.

11.hebrew: חַיָּתְךָ יָשְׁבוּ-בָהּ;    תָּכִין בְּטוֹבָתְךָ לֶעָנִי אֱלֹהִים.
11.english: Thy flock settled therein; Thou didst prepare in Thy goodness for the poor, O God.

12.hebrew: אֲדֹנָי יִתֶּן-אֹמֶר;    הַמְבַשְּׂרוֹת, צָבָא רָב.
12.english: The Lord giveth the word; the women that proclaim the tidings are a great host.

13.hebrew: מַלְכֵי צְבָאוֹת, יִדֹּדוּן יִדֹּדוּן;    וּנְוַת-בַּיִת, תְּחַלֵּק שָׁלָל.
13.english: Kings of armies flee, they flee; and she that tarrieth at home divideth the spoil.

14.hebrew: אִם-תִּשְׁכְּבוּן,    בֵּין שְׁפַתָּיִם:כַּנְפֵי יוֹנָה, נֶחְפָּה בַכֶּסֶף;    וְאֶבְרוֹתֶיהָ, בִּירַקְרַק חָרוּץ.
14.english: When ye lie among the sheepfolds, {N}the wings of the dove are covered with silver, and her pinions with the shimmer of gold.

15.hebrew: בְּפָרֵשׂ שַׁדַּי מְלָכִים בָּהּ--    תַּשְׁלֵג בְּצַלְמוֹן.
15.english: When the Almighty scattereth kings therein, it snoweth in Zalmon.

16.hebrew: הַר-אֱלֹהִים הַר-בָּשָׁן:    הַר גַּבְנֻנִּים, הַר-בָּשָׁן.
16.english: A mountain of God is the mountain of Bashan; a mountain of peaks is the mountain of Bashan.

17.hebrew: לָמָּה, תְּרַצְּדוּן--    הָרִים גַּבְנֻנִּים:הָהָר--חָמַד אֱלֹהִים לְשִׁבְתּוֹ;    אַף-יְהוָה, יִשְׁכֹּן לָנֶצַח.
17.english: Why look ye askance, ye mountains of peaks, {N}at the mountain which God hath desired for His abode? Yea, the LORD will dwell therein for ever.

18.hebrew: רֶכֶב אֱלֹהִים, רִבֹּתַיִם אַלְפֵי שִׁנְאָן;    אֲדֹנָי בָם, סִינַי בַּקֹּדֶשׁ.
18.english: The chariots of God are myriads, even thousands upon thousands; the Lord is among them, as in Sinai, in holiness.

19.hebrew: עָלִיתָ לַמָּרוֹם, שָׁבִיתָ שֶּׁבִי--    לָקַחְתָּ מַתָּנוֹת, בָּאָדָם;וְאַף סוֹרְרִים,    לִשְׁכֹּן יָהּ אֱלֹהִים.
19.english: Thou hast ascended on high, Thou hast led captivity captive; Thou hast received gifts among men, {N}yea, among the rebellious also, that the LORD God might dwell there.

20.hebrew: בָּרוּךְ אֲדֹנָי, יוֹם יוֹם:    יַעֲמָס-לָנוּ--הָאֵל יְשׁוּעָתֵנוּ סֶלָה.
20.english: Blessed be the Lord, day by day He beareth our burden, even the God who is our salvation. Selah

21.hebrew: הָאֵל לָנוּ, אֵל לְמוֹשָׁעוֹת:    וְלֵיהוִה אֲדֹנָי--לַמָּוֶת, תֹּצָאוֹת.
21.english: God is unto us a God of deliverances; and unto GOD the Lord belong the issues of death.

22.hebrew: אַךְ-אֱלֹהִים--יִמְחַץ, רֹאשׁ אֹיְבָיו:    קָדְקֹד שֵׂעָר--מִתְהַלֵּךְ, בַּאֲשָׁמָיו.
22.english: Surely God will smite through the head of His enemies, the hairy scalp of him that goeth about in his guiltiness.

23.hebrew: אָמַר אֲדֹנָי, מִבָּשָׁן אָשִׁיב;    אָשִׁיב, מִמְּצֻלוֹת יָם.
23.english: The Lord said: 'I will bring back from Bashan, I will bring them back from the depths of the sea;

24.hebrew: לְמַעַן, תִּמְחַץ רַגְלְךָ--בְּדָם:    לְשׁוֹן כְּלָבֶיךָ--מֵאֹיְבִים מִנֵּהוּ.
24.english: That thy foot may wade through blood, that the tongue of thy dogs may have its portion from thine enemies.'

25.hebrew: רָאוּ הֲלִיכוֹתֶיךָ אֱלֹהִים;    הֲלִיכוֹת אֵלִי מַלְכִּי בַקֹּדֶשׁ.
25.english: They see Thy goings, O God, even the goings of my God, my King, in holiness.

26.hebrew: קִדְּמוּ שָׁרִים, אַחַר נֹגְנִים;    בְּתוֹךְ עֲלָמוֹת, תּוֹפֵפוֹת.
26.english: The singers go before, the minstrels follow after, in the midst of damsels playing upon timbrels.

27.hebrew: בְּמַקְהֵלוֹת, בָּרְכוּ אֱלֹהִים;    אֲדֹנָי, מִמְּקוֹר יִשְׂרָאֵל.
27.english: 'Bless ye God in full assemblies, even the Lord, ye that are from the fountain of Israel.'

28.hebrew: שָׁם בִּנְיָמִן, צָעִיר רֹדֵם--שָׂרֵי יְהוּדָה, רִגְמָתָם;    שָׂרֵי זְבֻלוּן, שָׂרֵי נַפְתָּלִי.
28.english: There is Benjamin, the youngest, ruling them, the princes of Judah their council, the princes of Zebulun, the princes of Naphtali.

29.hebrew: צִוָּה אֱלֹהֶיךָ, עֻזֶּךָ:    עוּזָּה אֱלֹהִים--זוּ, פָּעַלְתָּ לָּנוּ.
29.english: Thy God hath commanded thy strength; be strong, O God, Thou that hast wrought for us

30.hebrew: מֵהֵיכָלֶךָ, עַל-יְרוּשָׁלִָם--    לְךָ יוֹבִילוּ מְלָכִים שָׁי.
30.english: Out of Thy temple at Jerusalem, whither kings shall bring presents unto Thee.

31.hebrew: גְּעַר חַיַּת קָנֶה, עֲדַת אַבִּירִים בְּעֶגְלֵי עַמִּים--    מִתְרַפֵּס בְּרַצֵּי-כָסֶף;בִּזַּר עַמִּים,    קְרָבוֹת יֶחְפָּצוּ.
31.english: Rebuke the wild beast of the reeds, the multitude of the bulls, with the calves of the peoples, every one submitting himself with pieces of silver; {N}He hath scattered the peoples that delight in war!

32.hebrew: יֶאֱתָיוּ חַשְׁמַנִּים, מִנִּי מִצְרָיִם;    כּוּשׁ תָּרִיץ יָדָיו, לֵאלֹהִים.
32.english: Nobles shall come out of Egypt; Ethiopia shall hasten to stretch out her hands unto God.

33.hebrew: מַמְלְכוֹת הָאָרֶץ, שִׁירוּ לֵאלֹהִים;    זַמְּרוּ אֲדֹנָי סֶלָה.
33.english: Sing unto God, ye kingdoms of the earth; O sing praises unto the Lord; Selah

34.hebrew: לָרֹכֵב, בִּשְׁמֵי שְׁמֵי-קֶדֶם--    הֵן יִתֵּן בְּקוֹלוֹ, קוֹל עֹז.
34.english: To Him that rideth upon the heavens of heavens, which are of old; lo, He uttereth His voice, a mighty voice.

35.hebrew: תְּנוּ עֹז, לֵאלֹהִים:    עַל-יִשְׂרָאֵל גַּאֲוָתוֹ; וְעֻזּוֹ, בַּשְּׁחָקִים.
35.english: Ascribe ye strength unto God; His majesty is over Israel, and His strength is in the skies.

36.hebrew: נוֹרָא אֱלֹהִים,    מִמִּקְדָּשֶׁיךָ:אֵל יִשְׂרָאֵל--    הוּא נֹתֵן עֹז וְתַעֲצֻמוֹת לָעָם;בָּרוּךְ אֱלֹהִים.
36.english: Awful is God out of thy holy places; {N}the God of Israel, He giveth strength and power unto the people; {N}blessed be God. {P}

1.hebrew: ††м«ојр«цћ≈з« т«м-щ—е…щ—«рћƒйн мјг»еƒг.
1.english: For the Leader; upon Shoshannim. [A Psalm] of David.

2.english: Save me, O God; for the waters are come in even unto the soul.

3.hebrew: ††и»б«тјъћƒй, бћƒйе≈п ојцећм»д-- †† еја≈йп о»т√о»г;бћ»аъƒй бјо«т¬о«чћ≈й-о«йƒн, †† ејщ—ƒбћ…м∆ъ щ—ји»ф»ъјрƒй.
