4.hebrew: ††й»в«тјъћƒй бјч»шјаƒй, рƒз«ш вћјше…рƒй: †† лћ»мећ т≈йр«й--ојй«з≈м, м≈ам…д»й.
4.english: I am weary of my crying; my throat is dried; mine eyes fail while I wait for my God.

5.hebrew: ††ш«бћећ, оƒщћ“«т¬ше…ъ ш…ащ—ƒй-- †† щ“…рја«й зƒрћ»н:т»цјоећ о«цјоƒйъ«й, а…йјб«й щ—∆ч∆ш-- †† а¬щ—∆ш м…а-в»ж«мјъћƒй, а»ж а»щ—ƒйб.
5.english: They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head; {N}they that would cut me off, being mine enemies wrongfully, are many; should I restore that which I took not away?

6.hebrew: ††аЅм…дƒйн--а«ъћ»д й»г«тјъћ», мјаƒећ«мјъћƒй; †† еја«щ—јое…ъ«й, оƒоћјк» м…а-рƒлјз»гећ.
6.english: O God, Thou knowest my folly; and my trespasses are not hid from Thee.

7.hebrew: ††а«м-й≈б…щ—ећ бƒй, ч…е∆йк»-- †† а¬г…р»й йјдеƒд, цјб»ае…ъ:а«м-йƒлћ»мјоећ бƒй ојб«чјщ—∆йк»-- †† аЅм…д≈й, йƒщ“јш»а≈м.
7.english: Let not them that wait for Thee be ashamed through me, O Lord GOD of hosts; {N}let not those that seek Thee be brought to confusion through me, O God of Israel.

8.hebrew: ††лћƒй-т»м∆йк», р»щ“»аъƒй з∆шјфћ»д; †† лћƒсћјъ»д лјмƒоћ»д ф»р»й.
8.english: Because for Thy sake I have borne reproach; confusion hath covered my face.

9.hebrew: ††оећж»ш, д»йƒйъƒй мја∆з»й; †† ејр»лјшƒй, мƒбјр≈й аƒоћƒй.
9.english: I am become a stranger unto my brethren, and an alien unto my mother's children.

10.hebrew: ††лћƒй-чƒрја«ъ бћ≈йъјк» а¬л»м»ъјрƒй; †† ејз∆шјфће…ъ зе…шјф∆йк», р»фјмећ т»м»й.
10.english: Because zeal for Thy house hath eaten me up, and the reproaches of them that reproach Thee are fallen upon me.

11.hebrew: ††е»а∆бјлћ∆д б«цће…н р«фјщ—ƒй; †† е«ъћјдƒй м«з¬ш»фе…ъ мƒй.
11.english: And I wept with my soul fasting, and that became unto me a reproach.

12.hebrew: ††е»а∆ъћјр»д мјбећщ—ƒй щ“»ч; †† е»аЅдƒй м»д∆н мјо»щ—»м.
12.english: I made sackcloth also my garment, and I became a byword unto them.

13.hebrew: ††й»щ“ƒйзећ бƒй, й…щ—јб≈й щ—»т«ш; †† ећрјвƒйре…ъ, щ—е…ъ≈й щ—≈л»ш.
13.english: They that sit in the gate talk of me; and I am the song of the drunkards.

14.hebrew: ††е«а¬рƒй ъјфƒмћ»ъƒй-мјк» йјде»д, т≈ъ ш»це…п-- †† аЅм…дƒйн бћјш»б-з«сјгћ∆к»;т¬р≈рƒй, †† бћ∆аЅо∆ъ йƒщ—јт∆к».
14.english: But as for me, let my prayer be unto Thee, O LORD, in an acceptable time; O God, in the abundance of Thy mercy, {N}answer me with the truth of Thy salvation.

15.hebrew: ††д«цћƒйм≈рƒй оƒићƒйи, еја«м-а∆ијбћ»т»д; †† аƒрћ»цјм»д оƒщћ“…рја«й, ећоƒоћ«т¬о«чћ≈й о»йƒн.
15.english: Deliver me out of the mire, and let me not sink; let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.

16.hebrew: ††а«м-ъћƒщ—јијф≈рƒй, щ—ƒбћ…м∆ъ о«йƒн-- †† еја«м-ъћƒбјм»т≈рƒй ојцећм»д;еја«м-ъћ∆аји«ш-т»м«й бћја≈ш †† фћƒйд».
16.english: Let not the waterflood overwhelm me, neither let the deep swallow me up; {N}and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.

17.hebrew: ††т¬р≈рƒй йјде»д, лћƒй-ие…б з«сјгћ∆к»; †† лћјш…б ш«з¬о∆йк», фћјр≈д а≈м»й.
17.english: Answer me, O LORD, for Thy mercy is good; according to the multitude of Thy compassions turn Thou unto me.

18.hebrew: ††еја«м-ъћ«сјъћ≈ш фћ»р∆йк», о≈т«бјгћ∆к»: †† лћƒй-ц«ш-мƒй, о«д≈ш т¬р≈рƒй.
18.english: And hide not Thy face from Thy servant; for I am in distress; answer me speedily.

19.hebrew: ††ч»шјб»д а∆м-р«фјщ—ƒй вја»м»дћ; †† мјо«т«п а…йјб«й фћјг≈рƒй.
19.english: Draw nigh unto my soul, and redeem it; ransom me because of mine enemies.

20.hebrew: ††а«ъћ»д й»г«тјъћ»--з∆шјфћ»ъƒй ећб»щ—јъћƒй, ећлјмƒоћ»ъƒй; †† р∆вјгћјк», лћ»м-це…шјш»й.
20.english: Thou knowest my reproach, and my shame, and my confusion; mine adversaries are all before Thee.

21.hebrew: ††з∆шјфћ»д, щ—»бјш»д мƒбћƒй-- †† е»а»рећщ—»д:е»а¬ч«ећ∆д м»рећг е»а«йƒп; †† ејм«ојр«з¬оƒйн, ејм…а о»ц»аъƒй.
21.english: Reproach hath broken my heart; and I am sore sick; {N}and I looked for some to show compassion, but there was none; and for comforters, but I found none.

22.hebrew: ††е«йћƒъћјрећ бћјб»шећъƒй ш…ащ—; †† ејмƒцјо»аƒй, й«щ—јчећрƒй з…о∆х.
22.english: Yea, they put poison into my food; and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.

23.hebrew: ††йјдƒй-щ—Ћмјз»р»н мƒфјр≈йд∆н мјф»з; †† ејмƒщ—јме…оƒйн мјое…ч≈щ—.
23.english: Let their table before them become a snare; and when they are in peace, let it become a trap.

24.english: Let their eyes be darkened, that they see not; and make their loins continually to totter.

25.hebrew: ††щ—јф»кј-т¬м≈йд∆н ж«тјо∆к»; †† е«з¬ше…п а«фћјк», й«щћ“ƒйв≈н.
25.english: Pour out Thine indignation upon them, and let the fierceness of Thine anger overtake them.

26.english: Let their encampment be desolate; let none dwell in their tents.

27.english: For they persecute him whom Thou hast smitten; and they tell of the pain of those whom Thou hast wounded.

28.english: Add iniquity unto their iniquity; and let them not come into Thy righteousness.

29.english: Let them be blotted out of the book of the living, and not be written with the righteous.

30.english: But I am afflicted and in pain; let Thy salvation, O God, set me up on high.

31.english: I will praise the name of God with a song, and will magnify Him with thanksgiving.

32.english: And it shall please the LORD better than a bullock that hath horns and hoofs.

33.hebrew: ††ш»аећ т¬р»еƒйн йƒщ“јо»зећ; †† гћ…шјщ—≈й аЅм…дƒйн, еƒйзƒй мјб«бјл∆н.
33.english: The humble shall see it, and be glad; ye that seek after God, let your heart revive.

34.english: For the LORD hearkeneth unto the needy, and despiseth not His prisoners.

35.english: Let heaven and earth praise Him, the seas, and every thing that moveth therein.

36.hebrew: ††лћƒй аЅм…дƒйн, йе…щ—ƒйт« цƒйће…п, ејйƒбјр∆д, т»ш≈й йјдећг»д; †† ејй»щ—јбећ щ—»н, еƒйш≈щ—ећд».
36.english: For God will save Zion, and build the cities of Judah; and they shall abide there, and have it in possession.

37.english: The seed also of His servants shall inherit it; and they that love His name shall dwell therein. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ, לְדָוִד לְהַזְכִּיר.   אֱלֹהִים לְהַצִּילֵנִי; יְהוָה, לְעֶזְרָתִי חוּשָׁה.
1.english: For the Leader. [A Psalm] of David; to make memorial.  2 O God, to deliver me, O LORD, to help me, make haste.

2.hebrew: יֵבֹשׁוּ וְיַחְפְּרוּ, מְבַקְשֵׁי נַפְשִׁי:    יִסֹּגוּ אָחוֹר, וְיִכָּלְמוּ; חֲפֵצֵי, רָעָתִי.
2.english: Let them be ashamed and abashed that seek after my soul; let them be turned backward and brought to confusion that delight in my hurt.

3.hebrew: יָשׁוּבוּ, עַל-עֵקֶב בָּשְׁתָּם--    הָאֹמְרִים, הֶאָח הֶאָח.
3.english: Let them be turned back by reason of their shame that say: 'Aha, aha.'

4.hebrew: יָשִׂישׂוּ וְיִשְׂמְחוּ, בְּךָ--    כָּל-מְבַקְשֶׁיךָ:וְיֹאמְרוּ תָמִיד, יִגְדַּל אֱלֹהִים--    אֹהֲבֵי, יְשׁוּעָתֶךָ.
4.english: Let all those that seek Thee rejoice and be glad in Thee; {N}and let such as love Thy salvation say continually: 'Let God be magnified.'

5.hebrew: וַאֲנִי, עָנִי וְאֶבְיוֹן--    אֱלֹהִים חוּשָׁה-לִּי:עֶזְרִי וּמְפַלְטִי אַתָּה;    יְהוָה, אַל-תְּאַחַר.
5.english: But I am poor and needy; O God, make haste unto me; {N}Thou art my help and my deliverer; O LORD, tarry not. {P}

1.hebrew: בְּךָ-יְהוָה חָסִיתִי;    אַל-אֵבוֹשָׁה לְעוֹלָם.
1.english: In Thee, O LORD, have I taken refuge; let me never be ashamed.

2.hebrew: בְּצִדְקָתְךָ, תַּצִּילֵנִי וּתְפַלְּטֵנִי;    הַטֵּה-אֵלַי אָזְנְךָ, וְהוֹשִׁיעֵנִי.
2.english: Deliver me in Thy righteousness, and rescue me; incline Thine ear unto me, and save me.

3.hebrew: הֱיֵה לִי, לְצוּר מָעוֹן לָבוֹא--    תָּמִיד, צִוִּיתָ לְהוֹשִׁיעֵנִי:כִּי-סַלְעִי וּמְצוּדָתִי    אָתָּה.
3.english: Be Thou to me a sheltering rock, whereunto I may continually resort, which Thou hast appointed to save me; {N}for Thou art my rock and my fortress.

4.hebrew: אֱלֹהַי--פַּלְּטֵנִי, מִיַּד רָשָׁע;    מִכַּף מְעַוֵּל וְחוֹמֵץ.
4.english: O my God, rescue me out of the hand of the wicked, out of the grasp of the unrighteous and ruthless man.

5.hebrew: כִּי-אַתָּה תִקְוָתִי;    אֲדֹנָי יְהוִה, מִבְטַחִי מִנְּעוּרָי.
5.english: For Thou art my hope; O Lord GOD, my trust from my youth.

6.hebrew: עָלֶיךָ, נִסְמַכְתִּי מִבֶּטֶן--מִמְּעֵי אִמִּי, אַתָּה גוֹזִי;    בְּךָ תְהִלָּתִי תָמִיד.
6.english: Upon Thee have I stayed myself from birth; Thou art He that took me out of my mother's womb; my praise is continually of Thee.

7.hebrew: כְּמוֹפֵת, הָיִיתִי לְרַבִּים;    וְאַתָּה, מַחֲסִי-עֹז.
7.english: I am as a wonder unto many; but Thou art my strong refuge.

8.hebrew: יִמָּלֵא פִי, תְּהִלָּתֶךָ;    כָּל-הַיּוֹם, תִּפְאַרְתֶּךָ.
8.english: My mouth shall be filled with Thy praise, and with Thy glory all the day.

9.hebrew: אַל-תַּשְׁלִיכֵנִי, לְעֵת זִקְנָה;    כִּכְלוֹת כֹּחִי, אַל-תַּעַזְבֵנִי.
9.english: Cast me not off in the time of old age; when my strength faileth, forsake me not.

10.hebrew: כִּי-אָמְרוּ אוֹיְבַי לִי;    וְשֹׁמְרֵי נַפְשִׁי, נוֹעֲצוּ יַחְדָּו.
10.english: For mine enemies speak concerning me, and they that watch for my soul take counsel together,

11.hebrew: לֵאמֹר, אֱלֹהִים עֲזָבוֹ;    רִדְפוּ וְתִפְשׂוּהוּ, כִּי-אֵין מַצִּיל.
11.english: Saying: 'God hath forsaken him; pursue and take him; for there is none to deliver.'

12.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים, אַל-תִּרְחַק מִמֶּנִּי;    אֱלֹהַי, לְעֶזְרָתִי חישה (חוּשָׁה).
12.english: O God, be not far from me; O my God, make haste to help me.

13.hebrew: יֵבֹשׁוּ יִכְלוּ, שֹׂטְנֵי נַפְשִׁי:    יַעֲטוּ חֶרְפָּה, וּכְלִמָּה--מְבַקְשֵׁי, רָעָתִי.
13.english: Let them be ashamed and consumed that are adversaries to my soul; let them be covered with reproach and confusion that seek my hurt.

14.hebrew: וַאֲנִי, תָּמִיד אֲיַחֵל;    וְהוֹסַפְתִּי, עַל-כָּל-תְּהִלָּתֶךָ.
14.english: But as for me, I will hope continually, and will praise Thee yet more and more.

15.hebrew: פִּי, יְסַפֵּר צִדְקָתֶךָ--כָּל-הַיּוֹם תְּשׁוּעָתֶךָ:    כִּי לֹא יָדַעְתִּי סְפֹרוֹת.
15.english: My mouth shall tell of Thy righteousness, and of Thy salvation all the day; for I know not the numbers thereof.

16.hebrew: אָבוֹא--בִּגְבֻרוֹת, אֲדֹנָי יְהוִה;    אַזְכִּיר צִדְקָתְךָ לְבַדֶּךָ.
16.english: I will come with Thy mighty acts, O Lord GOD; I will make mention of Thy righteousness, even of Thine only.

17.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים, לִמַּדְתַּנִי מִנְּעוּרָי;    וְעַד-הֵנָּה, אַגִּיד נִפְלְאוֹתֶיךָ.
17.english: O God, Thou hast taught me from my youth; and until now do I declare Thy wondrous works.

18.hebrew: וְגַם עַד-זִקְנָה, וְשֵׂיבָה--    אֱלֹהִים אַל-תַּעַזְבֵנִי:עַד-אַגִּיד זְרוֹעֲךָ לְדוֹר;    לְכָל-יָבוֹא, גְּבוּרָתֶךָ.
18.english: And even unto old age and hoary hairs, O God, forsake me not; {N}until I have declared Thy strength unto the next generation, Thy might to every one that is to come.

19.hebrew: וְצִדְקָתְךָ אֱלֹהִים,    עַד-מָרוֹם:אֲשֶׁר-עָשִׂיתָ גְדֹלוֹת;    אֱלֹהִים, מִי כָמוֹךָ.
19.english: Thy righteousness also, O God, which reacheth unto high heaven; {N}Thou who hast done great things, O God, who is like unto Thee?

20.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר הראיתנו (הִרְאִיתַנִי), צָרוֹת רַבּוֹת--    וְרָעוֹת:תָּשׁוּב תחינו (תְּחַיֵּנִי);    וּמִתְּהֹמוֹת הָאָרֶץ, תָּשׁוּב תַּעֲלֵנִי.
20.english: Thou, who hast made me to see many and sore troubles, {N}wilt quicken me again, and bring me up again from the depths of the earth.

21.hebrew: תֶּרֶב גְּדֻלָּתִי;    וְתִסֹּב תְּנַחֲמֵנִי.
21.english: Thou wilt increase my greatness, and turn and comfort me.

22.hebrew: גַּם-אֲנִי, אוֹדְךָ בִכְלִי-נֶבֶל--    אֲמִתְּךָ אֱלֹהָי:אֲזַמְּרָה לְךָ בְכִנּוֹר--    קְדוֹשׁ, יִשְׂרָאֵל.
22.english: I also will give thanks unto Thee with the psaltery, even unto Thy truth, O my God; {N}I will sing praises unto Thee with the harp, O Thou Holy One of Israel.

23.hebrew: תְּרַנֵּנָּה שְׂפָתַי, כִּי אֲזַמְּרָה-לָּךְ;    וְנַפְשִׁי, אֲשֶׁר פָּדִיתָ.
23.english: My lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing praises unto Thee; and my soul, which Thou hast redeemed.

24.hebrew: גַּם-לְשׁוֹנִי--    כָּל-הַיּוֹם, תֶּהְגֶּה צִדְקָתֶךָ:כִּי-בֹשׁוּ כִי-חָפְרוּ,    מְבַקְשֵׁי רָעָתִי.
24.english: My tongue also shall tell of Thy righteousness all the day; {N}for they are ashamed, for they are abashed, that seek my hurt. {P}

1.hebrew: לִשְׁלֹמֹה:    אֱלֹהִים--מִשְׁפָּטֶיךָ, לְמֶלֶךְ תֵּן; וְצִדְקָתְךָ לְבֶן-מֶלֶךְ.
1.english: [A Psalm] of Solomon. Give the king Thy judgments, O God, and Thy righteousness unto the king's son;

2.hebrew: יָדִין עַמְּךָ בְצֶדֶק;    וַעֲנִיֶּיךָ בְמִשְׁפָּט.
2.english: That he may judge Thy people with righteousness, and Thy poor with justice.

3.hebrew: יִשְׂאוּ הָרִים שָׁלוֹם לָעָם;    וּגְבָעוֹת, בִּצְדָקָה.
3.english: Let the mountains bear peace to the people, and the hills, through righteousness.

4.hebrew: יִשְׁפֹּט, עֲנִיֵּי-עָם--יוֹשִׁיעַ, לִבְנֵי אֶבְיוֹן;    וִידַכֵּא עוֹשֵׁק.
4.english: May he judge the poor of the people, and save the children of the needy, and crush the oppressor.

5.hebrew: יִירָאוּךָ עִם-שָׁמֶשׁ;    וְלִפְנֵי יָרֵחַ, דּוֹר דּוֹרִים.
5.english: They shall fear Thee while the sun endureth, and so long as the moon, throughout all generations.

6.hebrew: יֵרֵד, כְּמָטָר עַל-גֵּז;    כִּרְבִיבִים, זַרְזִיף אָרֶץ.
6.english: May he come down like rain upon the mown grass, as showers that water the earth.

7.hebrew: יִפְרַח-בְּיָמָיו צַדִּיק;    וְרֹב שָׁלוֹם, עַד-בְּלִי יָרֵחַ.
7.english: In his days let the righteous flourish, and abundance of peace, till the moon be no more.

8.hebrew: וְיֵרְדְּ, מִיָּם עַד-יָם;    וּמִנָּהָר, עַד-אַפְסֵי-אָרֶץ.
8.english: May he have dominion also from sea to sea, and from the River unto the ends of the earth.

9.hebrew: לְפָנָיו, יִכְרְעוּ צִיִּים;    וְאֹיְבָיו, עָפָר יְלַחֵכוּ.
9.english: Let them that dwell in the wilderness bow before him; and his enemies lick the dust.

10.hebrew: מַלְכֵי תַרְשִׁישׁ וְאִיִּים,    מִנְחָה יָשִׁיבוּ;מַלְכֵי שְׁבָא וּסְבָא,    אֶשְׁכָּר יַקְרִיבוּ.
10.english: The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall render tribute; {N}the kings of Sheba and Seba shall offer gifts.

11.hebrew: וְיִשְׁתַּחֲווּ-לוֹ כָל-מְלָכִים;    כָּל-גּוֹיִם יַעַבְדוּהוּ.
11.english: Yea, all kings shall prostrate themselves before him; all nations shall serve him.

12.hebrew: כִּי-יַצִּיל, אֶבְיוֹן מְשַׁוֵּעַ;    וְעָנִי, וְאֵין-עֹזֵר לוֹ.
12.english: For he will deliver the needy when he crieth; the poor also, and him that hath no helper.

13.hebrew: יָחֹס, עַל-דַּל וְאֶבְיוֹן;    וְנַפְשׁוֹת אֶבְיוֹנִים יוֹשִׁיעַ.
13.english: He will have pity on the poor and needy, and the souls of the needy he will save.

14.hebrew: מִתּוֹךְ וּמֵחָמָס, יִגְאַל נַפְשָׁם;    וְיֵיקַר דָּמָם בְּעֵינָיו.
14.english: He will redeem their soul from oppression and violence, and precious will their blood be in his sight;

15.hebrew: וִיחִי--    וְיִתֶּן-לוֹ, מִזְּהַב שְׁבָא:וְיִתְפַּלֵּל בַּעֲדוֹ תָמִיד;    כָּל-הַיּוֹם, יְבָרְכֶנְהוּ.
15.english: That they may live, and that he may give them of the gold of Sheba, {N}that they may pray for him continually, yea, bless him all the day.

16.hebrew: יְהִי פִסַּת-בַּר, בָּאָרֶץ--    בְּרֹאשׁ הָרִים:יִרְעַשׁ כַּלְּבָנוֹן פִּרְיוֹ;    וְיָצִיצוּ מֵעִיר, כְּעֵשֶׂב הָאָרֶץ.
16.english: May he be as a rich cornfield in the land upon the top of the mountains; {N}may his fruit rustle like Lebanon; and may they blossom out of the city like grass of the earth.

17.hebrew: יְהִי שְׁמוֹ, לְעוֹלָם--    לִפְנֵי-שֶׁמֶשׁ, ינין (יִנּוֹן) שְׁמוֹ:וְיִתְבָּרְכוּ בוֹ;    כָּל-גּוֹיִם יְאַשְּׁרוּהוּ.
17.english: May his name endure for ever; may his name be continued as long as the sun; {N}may men also bless themselves by him; may all nations call him happy.

18.hebrew: בָּרוּךְ, יְהוָה אֱלֹהִים--אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל:    עֹשֵׂה נִפְלָאוֹת לְבַדּוֹ.
18.english: Blessed be the LORD God, the God of Israel, who only doeth wondrous things;

19.hebrew: וּבָרוּךְ, שֵׁם כְּבוֹדוֹ--    לְעוֹלָם:וְיִמָּלֵא כְבוֹדוֹ, אֶת-כֹּל הָאָרֶץ--    אָמֵן וְאָמֵן.
19.english: And blessed be His glorious name for ever; {N}and let the whole earth be filled with His glory. Amen, and Amen.

20.hebrew: כָּלּוּ תְפִלּוֹת--    דָּוִד, בֶּן-יִשָׁי.
20.english: The prayers of David the son of Jesse are ended. {P}

1.hebrew: מִזְמוֹר, לְאָסָף:אַךְ טוֹב לְיִשְׂרָאֵל אֱלֹהִים,    לְבָרֵי לֵבָב.
1.english: A Psalm of Asaph. {N}Surely God is good to Israel, even to such as are pure in heart.

2.hebrew: וַאֲנִי--כִּמְעַט, נטוי (נָטָיוּ) רַגְלָי;    כְּאַיִן, שפכה (שֻׁפְּכוּ) אֲשֻׁרָי.
2.english: But as for me, my feet were almost gone; my steps had well nigh slipped.

3.hebrew: כִּי-קִנֵּאתִי, בַּהוֹלְלִים;    שְׁלוֹם רְשָׁעִים אֶרְאֶה.
3.english: For I was envious at the arrogant, when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.

4.hebrew: כִּי אֵין חַרְצֻבּוֹת לְמוֹתָם;    וּבָרִיא אוּלָם.
4.english: For there are no pangs at their death, and their body is sound.

5.hebrew: בַּעֲמַל אֱנוֹשׁ אֵינֵמוֹ;    וְעִם-אָדָם, לֹא יְנֻגָּעוּ.
5.english: In the trouble of man they are not; neither are they plagued like men.

6.hebrew: לָכֵן, עֲנָקַתְמוֹ גַאֲוָה;    יַעֲטָף-שִׁית, חָמָס לָמוֹ.
6.english: Therefore pride is as a chain about their neck; violence covereth them as a garment.

7.hebrew: יָצָא, מֵחֵלֶב עֵינֵמוֹ;    עָבְרוּ, מַשְׂכִּיּוֹת לֵבָב.
7.english: Their eyes stand forth from fatness; they are gone beyond the imaginations of their heart.

8.hebrew: יָמִיקוּ, וִידַבְּרוּ בְרָע עֹשֶׁק;    מִמָּרוֹם יְדַבֵּרוּ.
8.english: They scoff, and in wickedness utter oppression; they speak as if there were none on high.

9.hebrew: שַׁתּוּ בַשָּׁמַיִם פִּיהֶם;    וּלְשׁוֹנָם, תִּהֲלַךְ בָּאָרֶץ.
9.english: They have set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue walketh through the earth.

10.hebrew: לָכֵן, ישיב (יָשׁוּב) עַמּוֹ הֲלֹם;    וּמֵי מָלֵא, יִמָּצוּ לָמוֹ.
10.english: Therefore His people return hither; and waters of fullness are drained out by them.

11.hebrew: וְאָמְרוּ, אֵיכָה יָדַע-אֵל;    וְיֵשׁ דֵּעָה בְעֶלְיוֹן.
11.english: And they say: 'How doth God know? And is there knowledge in the Most High?'

12.hebrew: הִנֵּה-אֵלֶּה רְשָׁעִים;    וְשַׁלְוֵי עוֹלָם, הִשְׂגּוּ-חָיִל.
12.english: Behold, such are the wicked; and they that are always at ease increase riches.

13.hebrew: אַךְ-רִיק, זִכִּיתִי לְבָבִי;    וָאֶרְחַץ בְּנִקָּיוֹן כַּפָּי.
13.english: Surely in vain have I cleansed my heart, and washed my hands in innocency;

14.hebrew: וָאֱהִי נָגוּעַ, כָּל-הַיּוֹם;    וְתוֹכַחְתִּי, לַבְּקָרִים.
14.english: For all the day have I been plagued, and my chastisement came every morning.

15.hebrew: אִם-אָמַרְתִּי, אֲסַפְּרָה כְמוֹ;    הִנֵּה דוֹר בָּנֶיךָ בָגָדְתִּי.
15.english: If I had said: 'I will speak thus', behold, I had been faithless to the generation of Thy children.

16.hebrew: וָאֲחַשְּׁבָה, לָדַעַת זֹאת;    עָמָל היא (הוּא) בְעֵינָי.
16.english: And when I pondered how I might know this, it was wearisome in mine eyes;

17.hebrew: עַד-אָבוֹא, אֶל-מִקְדְּשֵׁי-אֵל;    אָבִינָה, לְאַחֲרִיתָם.
17.english: Until I entered into the sanctuary of God, and considered their end.

18.hebrew: אַךְ בַּחֲלָקוֹת, תָּשִׁית לָמוֹ;    הִפַּלְתָּם, לְמַשּׁוּאוֹת.
18.english: Surely Thou settest them in slippery places; Thou hurlest them down to utter ruin.

19.hebrew: אֵיךְ הָיוּ לְשַׁמָּה כְרָגַע;    סָפוּ תַמּוּ, מִן-בַּלָּהוֹת.
19.english: How are they become a desolation in a moment! They are wholly consumed by terrors.

20.hebrew: כַּחֲלוֹם מֵהָקִיץ--    אֲדֹנָי, בָּעִיר צַלְמָם תִּבְזֶה.
20.english: As a dream when one awaketh, so, O Lord, when Thou arousest Thyself, Thou wilt despise their semblance.

21.hebrew: כִּי, יִתְחַמֵּץ לְבָבִי;    וְכִלְיוֹתַי, אֶשְׁתּוֹנָן.
21.english: For my heart was in a ferment, and I was pricked in my reins.

22.hebrew: וַאֲנִי-בַעַר, וְלֹא אֵדָע;    בְּהֵמוֹת, הָיִיתִי עִמָּךְ.
22.english: But I was brutish, and ignorant; I was as a beast before Thee.

23.hebrew: וַאֲנִי תָמִיד עִמָּךְ;    אָחַזְתָּ, בְּיַד-יְמִינִי.
23.english: Nevertheless I am continually with Thee; Thou holdest my right hand.

24.english: Thou wilt guide me with Thy counsel, and afterward receive me with glory.

25.hebrew: מִי-לִי בַשָּׁמָיִם;    וְעִמְּךָ, לֹא-חָפַצְתִּי בָאָרֶץ.
25.english: Whom have I in heaven but Thee? And beside Thee I desire none upon earth.

26.hebrew: כָּלָה שְׁאֵרִי, וּלְבָבִי:    צוּר-לְבָבִי וְחֶלְקִי--אֱלֹהִים לְעוֹלָם.
26.english: My flesh and my heart faileth; but God is the rock of my heart and my portion for ever.

27.hebrew: כִּי-הִנֵּה רְחֵקֶיךָ יֹאבֵדוּ;    הִצְמַתָּה, כָּל-זוֹנֶה מִמֶּךָּ.
27.english: For, lo, they that go far from Thee shall perish; Thou dost destroy all them that go astray from Thee.

28.hebrew: וַאֲנִי, קִרְבַת אֱלֹהִים--    לִי-טוֹב:שַׁתִּי, בַּאדֹנָי יְהוִה מַחְסִי;    לְסַפֵּר, כָּל-מַלְאֲכוֹתֶיךָ.
28.english: But as for me, the nearness of God is my good; {N}I have made the Lord GOD my refuge, that I may tell of all Thy works. {P}

1.hebrew: מַשְׂכִּיל, לְאָסָף:לָמָה אֱלֹהִים, זָנַחְתָּ לָנֶצַח;    יֶעְשַׁן אַפְּךָ, בְּצֹאן מַרְעִיתֶךָ.
1.english: Maschil of Asaph. {N}Why, O God, hast Thou cast us off for ever? Why doth Thine anger smoke against the flock of Thy pasture?

2.hebrew: זְכֹר עֲדָתְךָ, קָנִיתָ קֶּדֶם--    גָּאַלְתָּ, שֵׁבֶט נַחֲלָתֶךָ;הַר-צִיּוֹן,    זֶה שָׁכַנְתָּ בּוֹ.
2.english: Remember Thy congregation, which Thou hast gotten of old, which Thou hast redeemed to be the tribe of Thine inheritance; {N}and mount Zion, wherein Thou hast dwelt.

3.hebrew: הָרִימָה פְעָמֶיךָ, לְמַשֻּׁאוֹת נֶצַח;    כָּל-הֵרַע אוֹיֵב בַּקֹּדֶשׁ.
3.english: Lift up Thy steps because of the perpetual ruins, even all the evil that the enemy hath done in the sanctuary.

4.hebrew: שָׁאֲגוּ צֹרְרֶיךָ, בְּקֶרֶב מוֹעֲדֶךָ;    שָׂמוּ אוֹתֹתָם אֹתוֹת.
4.english: Thine adversaries have roared in the midst of Thy meeting-place; they have set up their own signs for signs.

5.hebrew: יִוָּדַע, כְּמֵבִיא לְמָעְלָה;    בִּסְבָךְ-עֵץ, קַרְדֻּמּוֹת.
5.english: It seemed as when men wield upwards axes in a thicket of trees.

6.hebrew: ועת (וְעַתָּה), פִּתּוּחֶיהָ יָּחַד--    בְּכַשִּׁיל וְכֵילַפּוֹת, יַהֲלֹמוּן.
6.english: And now all the carved work thereof together they strike down with hatchet and hammers.

7.hebrew: שִׁלְחוּ בָאֵשׁ, מִקְדָּשֶׁךָ;    לָאָרֶץ, חִלְּלוּ מִשְׁכַּן-שְׁמֶךָ.
7.english: They have set Thy sanctuary on fire; they have profaned the dwelling-place of Thy name even to the ground.

8.hebrew: אָמְרוּ בְלִבָּם, נִינָם יָחַד;    שָׂרְפוּ כָל-מוֹעֲדֵי-אֵל בָּאָרֶץ.
8.english: They said in their heart: 'Let us make havoc of them altogether'; they have burned up all the meeting-places of God in the land.

9.hebrew: אוֹתֹתֵינוּ, לֹא רָאִינוּ:    אֵין-עוֹד נָבִיא; וְלֹא-אִתָּנוּ, יֹדֵעַ עַד-מָה.
9.english: We see not our signs; there is no more any prophet; neither is there among us any that knoweth how long.

10.hebrew: עַד-מָתַי אֱלֹהִים, יְחָרֶף צָר;    יְנָאֵץ אוֹיֵב שִׁמְךָ לָנֶצַח.
10.english: How long, O God, shall the adversary reproach? Shall the enemy blaspheme Thy name for ever?

11.hebrew: לָמָּה תָשִׁיב יָדְךָ, וִימִינֶךָ;    מִקֶּרֶב חוקך (חֵיקְךָ) כַלֵּה.
11.english: Why withdrawest Thou Thy hand, even Thy right hand? Draw it out of Thy bosom and consume them.

12.hebrew: וֵאלֹהִים, מַלְכִּי מִקֶּדֶם;    פֹּעֵל יְשׁוּעוֹת, בְּקֶרֶב הָאָרֶץ.
12.english: Yet God is my King of old, working salvation in the midst of the earth.

13.hebrew: אַתָּה פוֹרַרְתָּ בְעָזְּךָ יָם;    שִׁבַּרְתָּ רָאשֵׁי תַנִּינִים, עַל-הַמָּיִם.
13.english: Thou didst break the sea in pieces by Thy strength; Thou didst shatter the heads of the sea-monsters in the waters.

14.hebrew: אַתָּה רִצַּצְתָּ, רָאשֵׁי לִוְיָתָן;    תִּתְּנֶנּוּ מַאֲכָל, לְעָם לְצִיִּים.
14.english: Thou didst crush the heads of leviathan, Thou gavest him to be food to the folk inhabiting the wilderness.

15.hebrew: אַתָּה בָקַעְתָּ, מַעְיָן וָנָחַל;    אַתָּה הוֹבַשְׁתָּ, נַהֲרוֹת אֵיתָן.
15.english: Thou didst cleave fountain and brook; Thou driedst up ever-flowing rivers.

16.hebrew: לְךָ יוֹם, אַף-לְךָ לָיְלָה;    אַתָּה הֲכִינוֹתָ, מָאוֹר וָשָׁמֶשׁ.
16.english: Thine is the day, Thine also the night; Thou hast established luminary and sun.

17.hebrew: אַתָּה הִצַּבְתָּ, כָּל-גְּבוּלוֹת אָרֶץ;    קַיִץ וָחֹרֶף, אַתָּה יְצַרְתָּם.
17.english: Thou hast set all the borders of the earth; Thou hast made summer and winter.

18.hebrew: זְכָר-זֹאת--אוֹיֵב, חֵרֵף יְהוָה;    וְעַם נָבָל, נִאֲצוּ שְׁמֶךָ.
18.english: Remember this, how the enemy hath reproached the LORD, and how a base people have blasphemed Thy name.

19.hebrew: אַל-תִּתֵּן לְחַיַּת, נֶפֶשׁ תּוֹרֶךָ;    חַיַּת עֲנִיֶּיךָ, אַל-תִּשְׁכַּח לָנֶצַח.
19.english: O deliver not the soul of Thy turtle-dove unto the wild beast; forget not the life of Thy poor for ever.

20.hebrew: הַבֵּט לַבְּרִית:    כִּי מָלְאוּ מַחֲשַׁכֵּי-אֶרֶץ, נְאוֹת חָמָס.
20.english: Look upon the covenant; for the dark places of the land are full of the habitations of violence.

21.hebrew: אַל-יָשֹׁב דַּךְ נִכְלָם;    עָנִי וְאֶבְיוֹן, יְהַלְלוּ שְׁמֶךָ.
21.english: O let not the oppressed turn back in confusion; let the poor and needy praise Thy name.

22.hebrew: קוּמָה אֱלֹהִים, רִיבָה רִיבֶךָ;    זְכֹר חֶרְפָּתְךָ מִנִּי-נָבָל, כָּל-הַיּוֹם.
22.english: Arise, O God, plead Thine own cause; remember Thy reproach all the day at the hand of the base man.

23.hebrew: אַל-תִּשְׁכַּח, קוֹל צֹרְרֶיךָ;    שְׁאוֹן קָמֶיךָ, עֹלֶה תָמִיד.
23.english: Forget not the voice of Thine adversaries, the tumult of those that rise up against Thee which ascendeth continually. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ אַל-תַּשְׁחֵת; מִזְמוֹר לְאָסָף שִׁיר.
1.english: For the Leader; Al-tashheth. A Psalm of Asaph, a Song.

2.hebrew: הוֹדִינוּ לְּךָ, אֱלֹהִים--הוֹדִינוּ, וְקָרוֹב שְׁמֶךָ;    סִפְּרוּ, נִפְלְאוֹתֶיךָ.
2.english: We give thanks unto Thee, O God, we give thanks, and Thy name is near; men tell of Thy wondrous works.

3.hebrew: כִּי, אֶקַּח מוֹעֵד;    אֲנִי, מֵישָׁרִים אֶשְׁפֹּט.
3.english: 'When I take the appointed time, I Myself will judge with equity.

4.hebrew: נְמֹגִים, אֶרֶץ וְכָל-יֹשְׁבֶיהָ;    אָנֹכִי תִכַּנְתִּי עַמּוּדֶיהָ סֶּלָה.
4.english: When the earth and all the inhabitants thereof are dissolved, I Myself establish the pillars of it.' Selah

5.hebrew: אָמַרְתִּי לַהוֹלְלִים, אַל-תָּהֹלּוּ;    וְלָרְשָׁעִים, אַל-תָּרִימוּ קָרֶן.
5.english: I say unto the arrogant: 'Deal not arrogantly'; and to the wicked: 'Lift not up the horn.'

6.hebrew: אַל-תָּרִימוּ לַמָּרוֹם קַרְנְכֶם;    תְּדַבְּרוּ בְצַוָּאר עָתָק.
6.english: Lift not up your horn on high; speak not insolence with a haughty neck.

7.hebrew: כִּי לֹא מִמּוֹצָא, וּמִמַּעֲרָב;    וְלֹא, מִמִּדְבַּר הָרִים.
7.english: For neither from the east, nor from the west, nor yet from the wilderness, cometh lifting up.

8.hebrew: כִּי-אֱלֹהִים שֹׁפֵט;    זֶה יַשְׁפִּיל, וְזֶה יָרִים.
8.english: For God is judge; He putteth down one, and lifteth up another.

9.hebrew: כִּי כוֹס בְּיַד-יְהוָה, וְיַיִן חָמַר מָלֵא מֶסֶךְ--    וַיַּגֵּר מִזֶּה:אַךְ-שְׁמָרֶיהָ, יִמְצוּ יִשְׁתּוּ;    כֹּל, רִשְׁעֵי-אָרֶץ.
9.english: For in the hand of the LORD there is a cup, with foaming wine, full of mixture, and He poureth out of the same; {N}surely the dregs thereof, all the wicked of the earth shall drain them, and drink them.

10.hebrew: וַאֲנִי, אַגִּיד לְעֹלָם;    אֲזַמְּרָה, לֵאלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב.
10.english: But as for me, I will declare for ever, I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.

11.hebrew: וְכָל-קַרְנֵי רְשָׁעִים אֲגַדֵּעַ;    תְּרוֹמַמְנָה, קַרְנוֹת צַדִּיק.
11.english: All the horns of the wicked also will I cut off; but the horns of the righteous shall be lifted up. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ בִּנְגִינֹת; מִזְמוֹר לְאָסָף שִׁיר.
1.english: For the Leader; with string-music. A Psalm of Asaph, a Song.

2.hebrew: נוֹדָע בִּיהוּדָה אֱלֹהִים;    בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל, גָּדוֹל שְׁמוֹ.
2.english: In Judah is God known; His name is great in Israel.

3.hebrew: וַיְהִי בְשָׁלֵם סוּכּוֹ;    וּמְעוֹנָתוֹ בְצִיּוֹן.
3.english: In Salem also is set His tabernacle, and His dwelling-place in Zion.

4.hebrew: שָׁמָּה, שִׁבַּר רִשְׁפֵי-קָשֶׁת;    מָגֵן וְחֶרֶב וּמִלְחָמָה סֶלָה.
4.english: There He broke the fiery shafts of the bow; the shield, and the sword, and the battle. Selah

5.hebrew: נָאוֹר, אַתָּה אַדִּיר--    מֵהַרְרֵי-טָרֶף.
5.english: Glorious art Thou and excellent, coming down from the mountains of prey.

6.hebrew: אֶשְׁתּוֹלְלוּ, אַבִּירֵי לֵב--    נָמוּ שְׁנָתָם;וְלֹא-מָצְאוּ כָל-אַנְשֵׁי-חַיִל    יְדֵיהֶם.
6.english: The stout-hearted are bereft of sense, they sleep their sleep; {N}and none of the men of might have found their hands.

7.hebrew: מִגַּעֲרָתְךָ, אֱלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב;    נִרְדָּם, וְרֶכֶב וָסוּס.
7.english: At Thy rebuke, O God of Jacob, they are cast into a dead sleep, the riders also and the horses.

8.hebrew: אַתָּה, נוֹרָא אַתָּה--וּמִי-יַעֲמֹד לְפָנֶיךָ;    מֵאָז אַפֶּךָ.
8.english: Thou, even Thou, art terrible; and who may stand in Thy sight when once Thou art angry?

9.hebrew: מִשָּׁמַיִם, הִשְׁמַעְתָּ דִּין;    אֶרֶץ יָרְאָה וְשָׁקָטָה.
9.english: Thou didst cause sentence to be heard from heaven; the earth feared, and was still,

10.hebrew: בְּקוּם-לַמִּשְׁפָּט אֱלֹהִים--    לְהוֹשִׁיעַ כָּל-עַנְוֵי-אֶרֶץ סֶלָה.
10.english: When God arose to judgment, to save all the humble of the earth. Selah

11.hebrew: כִּי-חֲמַת אָדָם תּוֹדֶךָּ;    שְׁאֵרִית חֵמֹת תַּחְגֹּר.
11.english: Surely the wrath of man shall praise Thee; the residue of wrath shalt Thou gird upon Thee.

12.hebrew: נִדְרוּ וְשַׁלְּמוּ, לַיהוָה אֱלֹהֵיכֶם:    כָּל-סְבִיבָיו--יֹבִילוּ שַׁי, לַמּוֹרָא.
12.english: Vow, and pay unto the LORD your God; let all that are round about Him bring presents unto Him that is to be feared;

13.hebrew: יִבְצֹר, רוּחַ נְגִידִים;    נוֹרָא, לְמַלְכֵי-אָרֶץ.
13.english: He minisheth the spirit of princes; He is terrible to the kings of the earth. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ עַל-ידיתון (יְדוּתוּן); לְאָסָף מִזְמוֹר.
1.english: For the Leader; for Jeduthun. A Psalm of Asaph.

2.hebrew: קוֹלִי אֶל-אֱלֹהִים וְאֶצְעָקָה;    קוֹלִי אֶל-אֱלֹהִים, וְהַאֲזִין אֵלָי.
2.english: I will lift up my voice unto God, and cry; I will lift up my voice unto God, that He may give ear unto me.

3.hebrew: בְּיוֹם צָרָתִי,    אֲדֹנָי דָּרָשְׁתִּי:יָדִי, לַיְלָה נִגְּרָה--וְלֹא תָפוּג;    מֵאֲנָה הִנָּחֵם נַפְשִׁי.
3.english: In the day of my trouble I seek the Lord; {N}with my hand uplifted, [mine eye] streameth in the night without ceasing; my soul refuseth to be comforted.

4.hebrew: אֶזְכְּרָה אֱלֹהִים וְאֶהֱמָיָה;    אָשִׂיחָה, וְתִתְעַטֵּף רוּחִי סֶלָה.
4.english: When I think thereon, O God, I must moan; when I muse thereon, my spirit fainteth. Selah

5.hebrew: אָחַזְתָּ, שְׁמֻרוֹת עֵינָי;    נִפְעַמְתִּי, וְלֹא אֲדַבֵּר.
5.english: Thou holdest fast the lids of mine eyes; I am troubled, and cannot speak.

6.hebrew: חִשַּׁבְתִּי יָמִים מִקֶּדֶם--    שְׁנוֹת, עוֹלָמִים.
6.english: I have pondered the days of old, the years of ancient times.

7.hebrew: אֶזְכְּרָה נְגִינָתִי, בַּלָּיְלָה:    עִם-לְבָבִי אָשִׂיחָה; וַיְחַפֵּשׂ רוּחִי.
7.english: In the night I will call to remembrance my song; I will commune with mine own heart; and my spirit maketh diligent search:

8.hebrew: הַלְעוֹלָמִים, יִזְנַח אֲדֹנָי;    וְלֹא-יֹסִיף לִרְצוֹת עוֹד.
8.english: 'Will the Lord cast off for ever? And will He be favourable no more?

9.hebrew: הֶאָפֵס לָנֶצַח חַסְדּוֹ;    גָּמַר אֹמֶר, לְדֹר וָדֹר.
9.english: Is His mercy clean gone for ever? Is His promise come to an end for evermore?

10.hebrew: הֲשָׁכַח חַנּוֹת אֵל;    אִם-קָפַץ בְּאַף, רַחֲמָיו סֶלָה.
10.english: Hath God forgotten to be gracious? Hath He in anger shut up his compassions?' Selah

11.hebrew: וָאֹמַר, חַלּוֹתִי הִיא--    שְׁנוֹת, יְמִין עֶלְיוֹן.
11.english: And I say: 'This is my weakness, that the right hand of the Most High could change.

12.hebrew: אזכיר (אֶזְכּוֹר) מַעַלְלֵי-יָהּ:    כִּי-אֶזְכְּרָה מִקֶּדֶם פִּלְאֶךָ.
12.english: I will make mention of the deeds of the LORD; yea, I will remember Thy wonders of old.

13.hebrew: וְהָגִיתִי בְכָל-פָּעֳלֶךָ;    וּבַעֲלִילוֹתֶיךָ אָשִׂיחָה.
13.english: I will meditate also upon all Thy work, and muse on Thy doings.'

14.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים, בַּקֹּדֶשׁ דַּרְכֶּךָ;    מִי-אֵל גָּדוֹל, כֵּאלֹהִים.
14.english: O God, Thy way is in holiness; who is a great god like unto God?

15.hebrew: אַתָּה הָאֵל, עֹשֵׂה פֶלֶא;    הוֹדַעְתָּ בָעַמִּים עֻזֶּךָ.
15.english: Thou art the God that doest wonders; Thou hast made known Thy strength among the peoples.

16.hebrew: גָּאַלְתָּ בִּזְרוֹעַ עַמֶּךָ;    בְּנֵי-יַעֲקֹב וְיוֹסֵף סֶלָה.
16.english: Thou hast with Thine arm redeemed Thy people, the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah

17.hebrew: רָאוּךָ מַּיִם, אֱלֹהִים--רָאוּךָ מַּיִם יָחִילוּ;    אַף, יִרְגְּזוּ תְהֹמוֹת.
17.english: The waters saw Thee, O God; the waters saw Thee, they were in pain; the depths also trembled.

18.hebrew: זֹרְמוּ מַיִם, עָבוֹת--קוֹל, נָתְנוּ שְׁחָקִים;    אַף-חֲצָצֶיךָ, יִתְהַלָּכוּ.
18.english: The clouds flooded forth waters; the skies sent out a sound; Thine arrows also went abroad.

19.hebrew: קוֹל רַעַמְךָ, בַּגַּלְגַּל--הֵאִירוּ בְרָקִים תֵּבֵל;    רָגְזָה וַתִּרְעַשׁ הָאָרֶץ.
19.english: The voice of Thy thunder was in the whirlwind; the lightnings lighted up the world; the earth trembled and shook.

20.hebrew: בַּיָּם דַּרְכֶּךָ--ושביליך (וּשְׁבִילְךָ), בְּמַיִם רַבִּים;    וְעִקְּבוֹתֶיךָ, לֹא נֹדָעוּ.
20.english: Thy way was in the sea, and Thy path in the great waters, and Thy footsteps were not known.

21.hebrew: נָחִיתָ כַצֹּאן עַמֶּךָ--    בְּיַד-מֹשֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן.
21.english: Thou didst lead Thy people like a flock, by the hand of Moses and Aaron. {P}

1.hebrew: ††о«щ“јлћƒйм, мја»с»у:д«а¬жƒйр»д т«оћƒй, ъће…ш»ъƒй; †† д«ићећ а»жјрјл∆н, мјаƒојш≈й-фƒй.
1.english: Maschil of Asaph. {N}Give ear, O my people, to my teaching; incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

2.hebrew: ††а∆фјъћјз»д бјо»щ—»м фћƒй; †† а«бћƒйт»д зƒйге…ъ, оƒрћƒй-ч∆г∆н.

3.hebrew: ††а¬щ—∆ш щ—»о«тјрећ, е«рћ≈г»т≈н; †† е«а¬бе…ъ≈йрећ, сƒфћјшећ-м»рећ.

4.english: We will not hide from their children, telling to the generation to come the praises of the LORD, {N}and His strength, and His wondrous works that He hath done.

5.hebrew: ††е«йћ»ч∆н т≈гећъ, бћјй«т¬ч…б, †† ејъе…ш»д, щ“»н бћјйƒщ“јш»а≈м:а¬щ—∆ш цƒећ»д, а∆ъ-а¬бе…ъ≈йрећ-- †† мјде…гƒйт»н, мƒбјр≈йд∆н.
5.english: For He established a testimony in Jacob, and appointed a law in Israel, {N}which He commanded our fathers, that they should make them known to their children;

6.hebrew: ††мјо«т«п й≈гјтећ, гће…ш а«з¬ше…п--бћ»рƒйн йƒећ»м≈гећ; †† й»чЋоећ, еƒйс«фћјшећ мƒбјр≈йд∆н.
6.english: That the generation to come might know them, even the children that should be born; who should arise and tell them to their children,

7.hebrew: ††ејй»щ“ƒйоећ б≈ам…дƒйн, лћƒсјм»н: †† ејм…а йƒщ—јлћјзећ, о«т«мјм≈й-а≈м; ећоƒцје ъ»йе йƒрјц…шећ.
7.english: That they might put their confidence in God, and not forget the works of God, but keep His commandments;

8.hebrew: ††ејм…а йƒдјйећ, лћ«а¬бе…ъ»н-- †† гће…ш, се…ш≈ш ећо…ш∆д:гће…ш, м…а-д≈лƒйп мƒбће…; †† ејм…а-р∆а∆ојр»д а∆ъ-а≈м шећзе….
8.english: And might not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation; {N}a generation that set not their heart aright, and whose spirit was not stedfast with God.

9.hebrew: ††бћјр≈й-а∆фјш«йƒн, ре…щ—јч≈й ше…о≈й-ч»щ—∆ъ; †† д»фјлећ, бћјйе…н чјш»б.
9.english: The children of Ephraim were as archers handling the bow, that turned back in the day of battle.

10.hebrew: ††м…а щ—»ојшећ, бћјшƒйъ аЅм…дƒйн; †† ећбјъе…ш»ъе…, о≈а¬рећ м»м∆л∆ъ.
10.english: They kept not the covenant of God, and refused to walk in His law;

11.hebrew: ††е«йћƒщ—јлћјзећ т¬мƒйме…ъ»йе; †† ејрƒфјмјае…ъ»йе, а¬щ—∆ш д∆шја»н.
11.english: And they forgot His doings, and His wondrous works that He had shown them.

12.hebrew: ††р∆в∆г а¬бе…ъ»н, т»щ“»д ф∆м∆а; †† бћја∆ш∆х оƒцјш«йƒн щ“јг≈д-ц…т«п.
12.english: Marvellous things did He in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.

13.hebrew: ††бћ»ч«т й»н, е«йћ«т¬бƒйш≈н; †† е«йћ«цћ∆б-о«йƒн лћјое…-р≈г.
13.english: He cleaved the sea, and caused them to pass through; and He made the waters to stand as a heap.

14.hebrew: ††е«йћ«рјз≈н бћ∆т»р»п йе…о»н; †† ејл»м-д«мћ«йјм»д, бћјае…ш а≈щ—.
14.english: By day also He led them with a cloud, and all the night with a light of fire.

15.hebrew: ††йјб«чћ«т цЋшƒйн, бћ«оћƒгјбћ»ш; †† е«йћ«щ—јчј, лћƒъјд…ое…ъ ш«бћ»д.
15.english: He cleaved rocks in the wilderness, and gave them drink abundantly as out of the great deep.

16.hebrew: ††е«йће…цƒа ре…жјмƒйн оƒсћ»м«т; †† е«йће…ш∆г лћ«рћјд»ше…ъ о»йƒн.
16.english: He brought streams also out of the rock, and caused waters to run down like rivers.

17.hebrew: ††е«йће…сƒйфећ те…г, м«з¬и…а-ме…-- †† м«ојше…ъ т∆мјйе…п, бћ«цћƒйћ»д.
17.english: Yet went they on still to sin against Him, to rebel against the Most High in the desert.

18.hebrew: ††е«йјр«сћећ-а≈м бћƒмјб»б»н-- †† мƒщ—ја»м-а…л∆м мјр«фјщ—»н.
18.english: And they tried God in their heart by asking food for their craving.

19.hebrew: ††е«йјг«бћјшећ, бћ≈ам…дƒйн: †† а»ојшећ, д¬йећл«м а≈м--м«т¬ш…кј щ—Ћмјз»п, бћ«оћƒгјбћ»ш.
19.english: Yea, they spoke against God; they said: 'Can God prepare a table in the wilderness?

20.hebrew: ††д≈п дƒлћ»д-цећш, е«йћ»жећбећ о«йƒн-- †† ећрјз»мƒйн йƒщ—ји…фећ:д¬в«н-м∆з∆н, йећл«м ъћ≈ъ; †† аƒн-й»лƒйп щ—ја≈ш мјт«оће….
20.english: Behold, He smote the rock, that waters gushed out, and streams overflowed; {N}can He give bread also? or will He provide flesh for His people?'

21.hebrew: ††м»л≈п, щ—»о«т йјде»д-- †† е«йћƒъјт«бћ»ш:еја≈щ—, рƒщћ“јч»д бјй«т¬ч…б; †† ејв«н-а«у, т»м»д бјйƒщ“јш»а≈м.
21.english: Therefore the LORD heard, and was wroth; {N}and a fire was kindled against Jacob, and anger also went up against Israel;

22.hebrew: ††лћƒй м…а д∆аЅоƒйрећ, бћ≈ам…дƒйн; †† ејм…а б»ијзећ, бћƒйщ—ећт»ъе….
22.english: Because they believed not in God, and trusted not in His salvation.

23.hebrew: ††е«йјц«е щ—јз»чƒйн оƒоћ»т«м; †† ејг«мјъ≈й щ—»о«йƒн фћ»ъ»з.
23.english: And He commanded the skies above, and opened the doors of heaven;

24.hebrew: ††е«йћ«оји≈ш т¬м≈йд∆н о»п м∆аЅл…м; †† ећгјв«п-щ—»о«йƒн, р»ъ«п м»ое….
24.english: And He caused manna to rain upon them for food, and gave them of the corn of heaven.

25.hebrew: ††м∆з∆н а«бћƒйшƒйн, а»л«м аƒйщ—; †† ц≈йг»д щ—»м«з м»д∆н м»щ“…б«т.
25.english: Man did eat the bread of the mighty; He sent them provisions to the full.

26.english: He caused the east wind to set forth in heaven; and by His power He brought on the south wind.

27.hebrew: ††е«йћ«оји≈ш т¬м≈йд∆н лћ∆т»ф»ш щ—ја≈ш; †† ећлјзе…м й«оћƒйн, те…у лћ»р»у.
27.english: He caused flesh also to rain upon them as the dust, and winged fowl as the sand of the seas;

28.english: And He let it fall in the midst of their camp, round about their dwellings.

29.english: So they did eat, and were well filled; and He gave them that which they craved.

30.english: They were not estranged from their craving, their food was yet in their mouths,

31.hebrew: ††еја«у аЅм…дƒйн, т»м»д б»д∆н, †† е«йћ«д¬ш…в, бћјоƒщ—јо«рћ≈йд∆н;ећб«зећш≈й йƒщ“јш»а≈м †† дƒлјшƒйт«.
31.english: When the anger of God went up against them, and slew of the lustieth among them, {N}and smote down the young men of Israel.

32.english: For all this they sinned still, and believed not in His wondrous works.

33.english: Therefore He ended their days as a breath, and their years in terror.

34.english: When He slew them, then they would inquire after Him, and turn back and seek God earnestly.

35.english: And they remembered that God was their Rock, and the Most High God their redeemer.

36.english: But they beguiled Him with their mouth, and lied unto Him with their tongue.

37.english: For their heart was not stedfast with Him, neither were they faithful in His covenant.

38.hebrew: ††ејдећа ш«зећн, йјл«фћ≈ш т»е п-- †† ејм…а-й«щ—јзƒйъ:ејдƒшјбћ»д, мјд»щ—ƒйб а«фће…; †† ејм…а-й»тƒйш, лћ»м-з¬о»ъе….
38.english: But He, being full of compassion, forgiveth iniquity, and destroyeth not; {N}yea, many a time doth He turn His anger away, and doth not stir up all His wrath.

39.hebrew: ††е«йћƒжјлћ…ш, лћƒй-б»щ“»ш д≈оћ»д; †† шећз« де…м≈кј, ејм…а й»щ—ећб.
39.english: So He remembered that they were but flesh, a wind that passeth away, and cometh not again.

40.english: How oft did they rebel against Him in the wilderness, and grieve Him in the desert!

41.english: And still again they tried God, and set bounds to the Holy One of Israel.

42.english: They remembered not His hand, nor the day when He redeemed them from the adversary.

43.english: How He set His signs in Egypt, and His wonders in the field of Zoan;

44.english: And turned their rivers into blood, so that they could not drink their streams.

45.english: He sent among them swarms of flies, which devoured them; and frogs, which destroyed them.

46.english: He gave also their increase unto the caterpillar, and their labour unto the locust.

47.english: He destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycamore-trees with frost.

48.english: He gave over their cattle also to the hail, and their flocks to fiery bolts.

49.hebrew: ††йјщ—«мћ«з-бћ»н, з¬ше…п а«фће…--т∆бјш»д е»ж«т«н ејц»ш»д; †† оƒщ—јм«з«ъ, о«мја¬л≈й ш»тƒйн.
49.english: He sent forth upon them the fierceness of His anger, wrath, and indignation, and trouble, a sending of messengers of evil.

50.hebrew: ††йјф«мћ≈с р»ъƒйб, мја«фће…: †† м…а-з»щ“«кј оƒоћ»е∆ъ р«фјщ—»н; ејз«йћ»ъ»н, м«гћ∆б∆ш дƒсјвћƒйш.
50.english: He levelled a path for His anger; He spared not their soul from death, but gave their life over to the pestilence;

51.english: And smote all the first-born in Egypt, the first-fruits of their strength in the tents of Ham;

52.english: But He made His own people to go forth like sheep, and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.

53.hebrew: ††е«йћ«рјз≈н м»б∆и«з, ејм…а ф»з»гећ; †† еја∆ъ-ае…йјб≈йд∆н, лћƒсћ»д д«йћ»н.
53.english: And He led them safely, and they feared not; but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.

54.english: And He brought them to His holy border, to the mountain, which His right hand had gotten.

55.hebrew: ††е«йјв»ш∆щ— оƒфћјр≈йд∆н, вће…йƒн-- †† е«йћ«фћƒйм≈н, бћјз∆б∆м р«з¬м»д;е«йћ«щ—јлћ≈п бћја»д√м≈йд∆н, †† щ—ƒбји≈й йƒщ“јш»а≈м.
55.english: He drove out the nations also before them, and allotted them for an inheritance by line, {N}and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.

56.hebrew: ††е«йјр«сћећ е«йћ«ојшећ, а∆ъ-аЅм…дƒйн т∆мјйе…п; †† ејт≈ге…ъ»йе, м…а щ—»о»шећ.
56.english: Yet they tried and provoked God, the Most High, and kept not His testimonies;

57.english: But turned back, and dealt treacherously like their fathers; they were turned aside like a deceitful bow.

58.english: For they provoked Him with their high places, and moved Him to jealousy with their graven images.

59.english: God heard, and was wroth, and He greatly abhorred Israel;

60.english: And He forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent which He had made to dwell among men;

61.english: And delivered His strength into captivity, and His glory into the adversary's hand.

62.english: He gave His people over also unto the sword; and was wroth with His inheritance.

63.english: Fire devoured their young men; and their virgins had no marriage-song.

64.english: Their priests fell by the sword; and their widows made no lamentation.

65.english: Then the Lord awaked as one asleep, like a mighty man recovering from wine.

66.english: And He smote His adversaries backward; He put upon them a perpetual reproach.

67.hebrew: ††е«йћƒоја«с, бћја…д∆м йе…с≈у; †† ећбјщ—≈б∆и а∆фјш«йƒн, м…а б»з»ш.
67.english: Moreover He abhorred the tent of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim;

68.hebrew: ††е«йћƒбјз«ш, а∆ъ-щ—≈б∆и йјдећг»д; †† а∆ъ-д«ш цƒйће…п, а¬щ—∆ш а»д≈б.
68.english: But chose the tribe of Judah, the mount Zion which He loved.

69.english: And He built His sanctuary like the heights, like the earth which He hath founded for ever.

70.english: He chose David also His servant, and took him from the sheepfolds;

71.hebrew: ††о≈а«з«ш т»ме…ъ, дЅбƒйае…: †† мƒшјте…ъ, бћјй«т¬ч…б т«оће…; ећбјйƒщ“јш»а≈м, р«з¬м»ъе….
71.english: From following the ewes that give suck He brought him, to be shepherd over Jacob His people, and Israel His inheritance.

72.english: So he shepherded them according to the integrity of his heart; and lead them by the skilfulness of his hands. {P}

1.hebrew: ††оƒжјое…ш, мја»с»у:аЅм…дƒйн, бћ»аећ ве…йƒн бћјр«з¬м»ъ∆к»-- †† иƒоћјаећ, а∆ъ д≈йл«м ч»гјщ—∆к»;щ“»оећ а∆ъ-йјшећщ—»м«ƒн †† мјтƒйћƒйн.
1.english: A Psalm of Asaph. {N}O God, the heathen are come into Thine inheritance; they have defiled Thy holy temple; {N}they have made Jerusalem into heaps.

2.hebrew: ††р»ъјрећ, а∆ъ-рƒбјм«ъ т¬б»г∆йк»-- †† о«а¬л»м, мјте…у д«щћ—»о»йƒн;бћјщ“«ш з¬сƒйг∆йк», †† мјз«йјъе…-а»ш∆х.
2.english: They have given the dead bodies of Thy servants to be food unto the fowls of the heaven, {N}the flesh of Thy saints unto the beasts of the earth.

3.hebrew: ††щ—»фјлећ г»о»н, лћ«оћ«йƒн--сјбƒйбе…ъ йјшећщ—»м»ƒн; †† еја≈йп че…б≈ш.
3.english: They have shed their blood like water round about Jerusalem, with none to bury them.

4.hebrew: ††д»йƒйрећ з∆шјфћ»д, мƒщ—јл≈р≈йрећ; †† м«т«в е»ч∆м∆с, мƒсјбƒйбе…ъ≈йрећ.
4.english: We are become a taunt to our neighbours, a scorn and derision to them that are round about us.

5.hebrew: ††т«г-о»д йјде»д, ъћ∆аЅр«у м»р∆ц«з; †† ъћƒбјт«ш лћјое…-а≈щ—, чƒрја»ъ∆к».
5.english: How long, O LORD, wilt Thou be angry for ever? How long will Thy jealousy burn like fire?

6.hebrew: ††щ—јф…кј з¬о»ъјк»-- †† а∆м д«вће…йƒн, а¬щ—∆ш м…а-йјг»тећк»:ејт«м о«ојм»ле…ъ-- †† а¬щ—∆ш бћјщ—ƒојк», м…а ч»ш»аећ.
6.english: Pour out Thy wrath upon the nations that know Thee not, {N}and upon the kingdoms that call not upon Thy name.

7.hebrew: ††лћƒй, а»л«м а∆ъ-й«т¬ч…б; †† еја∆ъ-р»е≈дећ д≈щ—«оћећ.
7.english: For they have devoured Jacob, and laid waste his habitation.

8.hebrew: ††а«м-ъћƒжјлћ»ш-м»рећ, †† т¬е р…ъ шƒащ—…рƒйн:о«д≈ш, йјч«гћјоећрећ ш«з¬о∆йк»-- †† лћƒй г«мће…рећ оја…г.
8.english: Remember not against us the iniquities of our forefathers; {N}let Thy compassions speedily come to meet us; for we are brought very low.

9.hebrew: ††т»жјш≈рећ, аЅм…д≈й йƒщ—јт≈рећ-- †† т«м-гћјб«ш лћјбе…г-щ—јо∆к»;ејд«цћƒйм≈рећ ејл«фћ≈ш т«м-з«ић…аъ≈йрећ, †† мјо«т«п щ—јо∆к».
9.english: Help us, O God of our salvation, for the sake of the glory of Thy name; {N}and deliver us, and forgive our sins, for Thy name's sake.

10.hebrew: ††м»оћ»д, й…аојшећ д«вће…йƒн-- †† а«йћ≈д аЅм…д≈йд∆н:йƒећ»г«т бћ«вћ…йƒйн мјт≈йр≈йрећ; †† рƒчјо«ъ, гћ«н-т¬б»г∆йк» д«щћ—»фећкј.
10.english: Wherefore should the nations say: 'Where is their God?' {N}Let the avenging of Thy servants' blood that is shed be made known among the nations in our sight.

11.hebrew: ††ъћ»бе…а мјф»р∆йк», а∆рјч«ъ а»сƒйш: †† лћјв…г∆м жјше…т¬к»--де…ъ≈ш, бћјр≈й ъјоећъ»д.
11.english: Let the groaning of the prisoner come before Thee; according to the greatness of Thy power set free those that are appointed to death;

12.hebrew: ††ејд»щ—≈б мƒщ—јл≈р≈йрећ щ—ƒбјт»ъ«йƒн, †† а∆м-з≈йч»н;з∆шјфћ»ъ»н а¬щ—∆ш з≈шјфећк» †† а¬г…р»й.
12.english: And render unto our neighbours sevenfold into their bosom their reproach, {N}wherewith they have reproached Thee, O Lord.

13.hebrew: ††е«а¬р«зјрећ т«оћјк», ејц…ап о«шјтƒйъ∆к»-- †† ре…г∆д мћјк», мјте…м»н:мјге…ш е»г…ш-- †† рјс«фћ≈ш, ъћјдƒмћ»ъ∆к».
13.english: So we that are Thy people and the flock of Thy pasture will give Thee thanks for ever; {N}we will tell of Thy praise to all generations. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ אֶל-שֹׁשַׁנִּים;    עֵדוּת לְאָסָף מִזְמוֹר.
1.english: For the Leader; upon Shoshannim. A testimony. A Psalm of Asaph.

2.hebrew: רֹעֵה יִשְׂרָאֵל, הַאֲזִינָה--    נֹהֵג כַּצֹּאן יוֹסֵף;יֹשֵׁב הַכְּרוּבִים    הוֹפִיעָה.
2.english: Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel, Thou that leadest Joseph like a flock; {N}Thou that art enthroned upon the cherubim, shine forth.

3.hebrew: לִפְנֵי אֶפְרַיִם, וּבִנְיָמִן וּמְנַשֶּׁה--    עוֹרְרָה אֶת-גְּבוּרָתֶךָ;וּלְכָה לִישֻׁעָתָה    לָּנוּ.
3.english: Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh, stir up Thy might, {N}and come to save us.

4.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים הֲשִׁיבֵנוּ;    וְהָאֵר פָּנֶיךָ, וְנִוָּשֵׁעָה.
4.english: O God, restore us; and cause Thy face to shine, and we shall be saved.

5.hebrew: יְהוָה אֱלֹהִים צְבָאוֹת--    עַד-מָתַי עָשַׁנְתָּ, בִּתְפִלַּת עַמֶּךָ.
5.english: O LORD God of hosts, how long wilt Thou be angry against the prayer of Thy people?

6.hebrew: הֶאֱכַלְתָּם, לֶחֶם דִּמְעָה;    וַתַּשְׁקֵמוֹ, בִּדְמָעוֹת שָׁלִישׁ.
6.english: Thou hast fed them with the bread of tears, and given them tears to drink in large measure.

7.hebrew: תְּשִׂימֵנוּ מָדוֹן, לִשְׁכֵנֵינוּ;    וְאֹיְבֵינוּ, יִלְעֲגוּ-לָמוֹ.
7.english: Thou makest us a strife unto our neighbours; and our enemies mock as they please.

8.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים צְבָאוֹת הֲשִׁיבֵנוּ;    וְהָאֵר פָּנֶיךָ, וְנִוָּשֵׁעָה.
8.english: O God of hosts, restore us; and cause Thy face to shine, and we shall be saved.

9.hebrew: גֶּפֶן, מִמִּצְרַיִם תַּסִּיעַ;    תְּגָרֵשׁ גּוֹיִם, וַתִּטָּעֶהָ.
9.english: Thou didst pluck up a vine out of Egypt; Thou didst drive out the nations, and didst plant it.

10.hebrew: פִּנִּיתָ לְפָנֶיהָ;    וַתַּשְׁרֵשׁ שָׁרָשֶׁיהָ, וַתְּמַלֵּא-אָרֶץ.
10.english: Thou didst clear a place before it, and it took deep root, and filled the land.

11.hebrew: כָּסּוּ הָרִים צִלָּהּ;    וַעֲנָפֶיהָ, אַרְזֵי-אֵל.
11.english: The mountains were covered with the shadow of it, and the mighty cedars with the boughs thereof.

12.hebrew: תְּשַׁלַּח קְצִירֶהָ עַד-יָם;    וְאֶל-נָהָר, יוֹנְקוֹתֶיהָ.
12.english: She sent out her branches unto the sea, and her shoots unto the River.

13.hebrew: לָמָּה, פָּרַצְתָּ גְדֵרֶיהָ;    וְאָרוּהָ, כָּל-עֹבְרֵי דָרֶךְ.
13.english: Why hast Thou broken down her fences, so that all they that pass by the way do pluck her?

14.hebrew: יְכַרְסְמֶנָּה חֲזִיר מִיָּעַר;    וְזִיז שָׂדַי יִרְעֶנָּה.
14.english: The boar out of the wood doth ravage it, that which moveth in the field feedeth on it.

15.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים צְבָאוֹת,    שׁוּב-נָא:הַבֵּט מִשָּׁמַיִם וּרְאֵה;    וּפְקֹד, גֶּפֶן זֹאת.
15.english: O God of hosts, return, we beseech Thee; {N}look from heaven, and behold, and be mindful of this vine,

16.hebrew: וְכַנָּה, אֲשֶׁר-נָטְעָה יְמִינֶךָ;    וְעַל-בֵּן, אִמַּצְתָּה לָּךְ.
16.english: And of the stock which Thy right hand hath planted, and the branch that Thou madest strong for Thyself.

17.hebrew: שְׂרֻפָה בָאֵשׁ כְּסוּחָה;    מִגַּעֲרַת פָּנֶיךָ יֹאבֵדוּ.
17.english: It is burned with fire, it is cut down; they perish at the rebuke of Thy countenance.

18.hebrew: תְּהִי-יָדְךָ, עַל-אִישׁ יְמִינֶךָ;    עַל-בֶּן-אָדָם, אִמַּצְתָּ לָּךְ.
18.english: Let Thy hand be upon the man of Thy right hand, upon the son of man whom Thou madest strong for Thyself.

19.hebrew: וְלֹא-נָסוֹג מִמֶּךָּ;    תְּחַיֵּנוּ, וּבְשִׁמְךָ נִקְרָא.
19.english: So shall we not turn back from Thee; quicken Thou us, and we will call upon Thy name.

20.hebrew: יְהוָה אֱלֹהִים צְבָאוֹת הֲשִׁיבֵנוּ;    הָאֵר פָּנֶיךָ, וְנִוָּשֵׁעָה.
20.english: O LORD God of hosts, restore us; cause Thy face to shine, and we shall be saved. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ עַל-הַגִּתִּית לְאָסָף.
1.english: For the Leader; upon the Gittith. [A Psalm] of Asaph.

2.hebrew: הַרְנִינוּ, לֵאלֹהִים עוּזֵּנוּ;    הָרִיעוּ, לֵאלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב.
2.english: Sing aloud unto God our strength; shout unto the God of Jacob.

3.hebrew: שְׂאוּ-זִמְרָה, וּתְנוּ-תֹף;    כִּנּוֹר נָעִים עִם-נָבֶל.
3.english: Take up the melody, and sound the timbrel, the sweet harp with the psaltery.

4.hebrew: תִּקְעוּ בַחֹדֶשׁ שׁוֹפָר;    בַּכֵּסֶה, לְיוֹם חַגֵּנוּ.
4.english: Blow the horn at the new moon, at the full moon for our feast-day.

5.hebrew: כִּי חֹק לְיִשְׂרָאֵל הוּא;    מִשְׁפָּט, לֵאלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב.
5.english: For it is a statute for Israel, an ordinance of the God of Jacob.

6.hebrew: עֵדוּת, בִּיהוֹסֵף שָׂמוֹ--    בְּצֵאתוֹ, עַל-אֶרֶץ מִצְרָיִם;שְׂפַת לֹא-יָדַעְתִּי    אֶשְׁמָע.
6.english: He appointed it in Joseph for a testimony, when He went forth against the land of Egypt. {N}The speech of one that I knew not did I hear:

7.hebrew: הֲסִירוֹתִי מִסֵּבֶל שִׁכְמוֹ;    כַּפָּיו, מִדּוּד תַּעֲבֹרְנָה.
7.english: 'I removed his shoulder from the burden; his hands were freed from the basket.

8.hebrew: בַּצָּרָה קָרָאתָ,    וָאֲחַלְּצֶךָּ:אֶעֶנְךָ, בְּסֵתֶר רַעַם;    אֶבְחָנְךָ עַל-מֵי מְרִיבָה סֶלָה.
8.english: Thou didst call in trouble, and I rescued thee; {N}I answered thee in the secret place of thunder; I proved thee at the waters of Meribah. Selah

9.hebrew: שְׁמַע עַמִּי, וְאָעִידָה בָּךְ;    יִשְׂרָאֵל, אִם-תִּשְׁמַע-לִי.
9.english: Hear, O My people, and I will admonish thee: O Israel, if thou wouldest hearken unto Me!

10.hebrew: לֹא-יִהְיֶה בְךָ, אֵל זָר;    וְלֹא תִשְׁתַּחֲוֶה, לְאֵל נֵכָר.
10.english: There shall no strange god be in thee; neither shalt thou worship any foreign god.

11.hebrew: אָנֹכִי, יְהוָה אֱלֹהֶיךָ--    הַמַּעַלְךָ, מֵאֶרֶץ מִצְרָיִם;הַרְחֶב-פִּיךָ,    וַאֲמַלְאֵהוּ.
11.english: I am the LORD thy God, who brought thee up out of the land of Egypt; {N}open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.

12.hebrew: וְלֹא-שָׁמַע עַמִּי לְקוֹלִי;    וְיִשְׂרָאֵל, לֹא-אָבָה לִי.
12.english: But My people hearkened not to My voice; and Israel would none of Me.

13.hebrew: וָאֲשַׁלְּחֵהוּ, בִּשְׁרִירוּת לִבָּם;    יֵלְכוּ, בְּמוֹעֲצוֹתֵיהֶם.
13.english: So I let them go after the stubbornness of their heart, that they might walk in their own counsels.

14.hebrew: לוּ--עַמִּי, שֹׁמֵעַ לִי;    יִשְׂרָאֵל, בִּדְרָכַי יְהַלֵּכוּ.
14.english: Oh that My people would hearken unto Me, that Israel would walk in My ways!

15.hebrew: כִּמְעַט, אוֹיְבֵיהֶם אַכְנִיעַ;    וְעַל צָרֵיהֶם, אָשִׁיב יָדִי.
15.english: I would soon subdue their enemies, and turn My hand against their adversaries.

16.hebrew: מְשַׂנְאֵי יְהוָה, יְכַחֲשׁוּ-לוֹ;    וִיהִי עִתָּם לְעוֹלָם.
16.english: The haters of the LORD should dwindle away before Him; and their punishment should endure for ever.

17.hebrew: וַיַּאֲכִילֵהוּ, מֵחֵלֶב חִטָּה;    וּמִצּוּר, דְּבַשׁ אַשְׂבִּיעֶךָ.
17.english: They should also be fed with the fat of wheat; and with honey out of the rock would I satisfy thee.' {P}

1.hebrew: מִזְמוֹר, לְאָסָף:אֱלֹהִים, נִצָּב בַּעֲדַת-אֵל;    בְּקֶרֶב אֱלֹהִים יִשְׁפֹּט.
1.english: A Psalm of Asaph. {N}God standeth in the congregation of God; in the midst of the judges He judgeth:

2.hebrew: עַד-מָתַי תִּשְׁפְּטוּ-עָוֶל;    וּפְנֵי רְשָׁעִים, תִּשְׂאוּ-סֶלָה.
2.english: 'How long will ye judge unjustly, and respect the persons of the wicked? Selah

3.hebrew: שִׁפְטוּ-דַל וְיָתוֹם;    עָנִי וָרָשׁ הַצְדִּיקוּ.
3.english: Judge the poor and fatherless; do justice to the afflicted and destitute.

4.hebrew: פַּלְּטוּ-דַל וְאֶבְיוֹן;    מִיַּד רְשָׁעִים הַצִּילוּ.
4.english: Rescue the poor and needy; deliver them out of the hand of the wicked.

5.hebrew: לֹא יָדְעוּ, וְלֹא יָבִינוּ--    בַּחֲשֵׁכָה יִתְהַלָּכוּ;יִמּוֹטוּ,    כָּל-מוֹסְדֵי אָרֶץ.
5.english: They know not, neither do they understand; they go about in darkness; {N}all the foundations of the earth are moved.

6.hebrew: אֲנִי-אָמַרְתִּי, אֱלֹהִים אַתֶּם;    וּבְנֵי עֶלְיוֹן כֻּלְּכֶם.
6.english: I said: Ye are godlike beings, and all of you sons of the Most High.

7.hebrew: אָכֵן, כְּאָדָם תְּמוּתוּן;    וּכְאַחַד הַשָּׂרִים תִּפֹּלוּ.
7.english: Nevertheless ye shall die like men, and fall like one of the princes.'

8.hebrew: קוּמָה אֱלֹהִים, שָׁפְטָה הָאָרֶץ:    כִּי-אַתָּה תִנְחַל, בְּכָל-הַגּוֹיִם.
8.english: Arise, O God, judge the earth; for Thou shalt possess all the nations. {P}

1.hebrew: שִׁיר מִזְמוֹר לְאָסָף.
1.english: A Song, a Psalm of Asaph.

2.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים אַל-דֳּמִי-לָךְ;    אַל-תֶּחֱרַשׁ וְאַל-תִּשְׁקֹט אֵל.
2.english: O God, keep not Thou silence; hold not Thy peace, and be not still, O God.

3.hebrew: כִּי-הִנֵּה אוֹיְבֶיךָ, יֶהֱמָיוּן;    וּמְשַׂנְאֶיךָ, נָשְׂאוּ רֹאשׁ.
3.english: For, lo, Thine enemies are in an uproar; and they that hate Thee have lifted up the head.

4.hebrew: עַל-עַמְּךָ, יַעֲרִימוּ סוֹד;    וְיִתְיָעֲצוּ, עַל-צְפוּנֶיךָ.
4.english: They hold crafty converse against Thy people, and take counsel against Thy treasured ones.

5.hebrew: אָמְרוּ--לְכוּ, וְנַכְחִידֵם מִגּוֹי;    וְלֹא-יִזָּכֵר שֵׁם-יִשְׂרָאֵל עוֹד.
5.english: They have said: 'Come, and let us cut them off from being a nation; that the name of Israel may be no more in remembrance.'

6.hebrew: כִּי נוֹעֲצוּ לֵב יַחְדָּו;    עָלֶיךָ, בְּרִית יִכְרֹתוּ.
6.english: For they have consulted together with one consent; against Thee do they make a covenant;

7.hebrew: אָהֳלֵי אֱדוֹם, וְיִשְׁמְעֵאלִים;    מוֹאָב וְהַגְרִים.
7.english: The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites; Moab, and the Hagrites;

8.hebrew: גְּבָל וְעַמּוֹן, וַעֲמָלֵק;    פְּלֶשֶׁת, עִם-יֹשְׁבֵי צוֹר.
8.english: Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek; Philistia with the inhabitants of Tyre;

9.hebrew: גַּם-אַשּׁוּר, נִלְוָה עִמָּם;    הָיוּ זְרוֹעַ לִבְנֵי-לוֹט סֶלָה.
9.english: Assyria also is joined with them; they have been an arm to the children of Lot. Selah

10.hebrew: עֲשֵׂה-לָהֶם כְּמִדְיָן;    כְּסִיסְרָא כְיָבִין, בְּנַחַל קִישׁוֹן.
10.english: Do Thou unto them as unto Midian; as to Sisera, as to Jabin, at the brook Kishon;

11.hebrew: נִשְׁמְדוּ בְעֵין-דֹּאר;    הָיוּ דֹּמֶן, לָאֲדָמָה.
11.english: Who were destroyed at En-dor; they became as dung for the earth.

12.hebrew: שִׁיתֵמוֹ נְדִיבֵימוֹ, כְּעֹרֵב וְכִזְאֵב;    וּכְזֶבַח וּכְצַלְמֻנָּע, כָּל-נְסִיכֵימוֹ.
12.english: Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb, and like Zebah and Zalmunna all their princes;

13.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר אָמְרוּ, נִירְשָׁה לָּנוּ--    אֵת, נְאוֹת אֱלֹהִים.
13.english: Who said: 'Let us take to ourselves in possession the habitations of God.'

14.hebrew: אֱלֹהַי, שִׁיתֵמוֹ כַגַּלְגַּל;    כְּקַשׁ, לִפְנֵי-רוּחַ.
14.english: O my God, make them like the whirling dust; as stubble before the wind.

15.hebrew: כְּאֵשׁ תִּבְעַר-יָעַר;    וּכְלֶהָבָה, תְּלַהֵט הָרִים.
15.english: As the fire that burneth the forest, and as the flame that setteth the mountains ablaze;

16.hebrew: כֵּן, תִּרְדְּפֵם בְּסַעֲרֶךָ;    וּבְסוּפָתְךָ תְבַהֲלֵם.
16.english: So pursue them with Thy tempest, and affright them with Thy storm.

17.hebrew: מַלֵּא פְנֵיהֶם קָלוֹן;    וִיבַקְשׁוּ שִׁמְךָ יְהוָה.
17.english: Fill their faces with shame; that they may seek Thy name, O LORD.

18.hebrew: יֵבֹשׁוּ וְיִבָּהֲלוּ עֲדֵי-עַד;    וְיַחְפְּרוּ וְיֹאבֵדוּ.
18.english: Let them be ashamed and affrighted for ever; yea, let them be abashed and perish;

19.hebrew: וְיֵדְעוּ--    כִּי-אַתָּה שִׁמְךָ יְהוָה לְבַדֶּךָ:עֶלְיוֹן,    עַל-כָּל-הָאָרֶץ.
19.english: That they may know that it is Thou alone whose name is the LORD, {N}the Most High over all the earth. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ עַל-הַגִּתִּית; לִבְנֵי-קֹרַח מִזְמוֹר.
1.english: For the Leader; upon the Gittith. A Psalm of the sons of Korah.

2.hebrew: מַה-יְּדִידוֹת מִשְׁכְּנוֹתֶיךָ--    יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת.
2.english: How lovely are Thy tabernacles, O LORD of hosts!

3.hebrew: נִכְסְפָה וְגַם-כָּלְתָה, נַפְשִׁי--    לְחַצְרוֹת יְהוָה:לִבִּי וּבְשָׂרִי--    יְרַנְּנוּ, אֶל אֵל-חָי.
3.english: My soul yearneth, yea, even pineth for the courts of the LORD; {N}my heart and my flesh sing for joy unto the living God.

4.hebrew: גַּם-צִפּוֹר מָצְאָה בַיִת, וּדְרוֹר קֵן לָהּ--    אֲשֶׁר-שָׁתָה אֶפְרֹחֶיהָ:אֶת-מִזְבְּחוֹתֶיךָ, יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת--    מַלְכִּי, וֵאלֹהָי.
4.english: Yea, the sparrow hath found a house, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young; {N}Thine altars, O LORD of hosts, my King, and my God--.

5.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵי, יוֹשְׁבֵי בֵיתֶךָ--    עוֹד, יְהַלְלוּךָ סֶּלָה.
5.english: Happy are they that dwell in Thy house, they are ever praising Thee. Selah

6.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵי אָדָם, עוֹז-לוֹ בָךְ;    מְסִלּוֹת, בִּלְבָבָם.
6.english: Happy is the man whose strength is in Thee; in whose heart are the highways.

7.hebrew: עֹבְרֵי, בְּעֵמֶק הַבָּכָא--    מַעְיָן יְשִׁיתוּהוּ;גַּם-בְּרָכוֹת,    יַעְטֶה מוֹרֶה.
7.english: Passing through the valley of Baca they make it a place of springs; {N}yea, the early rain clotheth it with blessings.

8.hebrew: יֵלְכוּ, מֵחַיִל אֶל-חָיִל;    יֵרָאֶה אֶל-אֱלֹהִים בְּצִיּוֹן.
8.english: They go from strength to strength, every one of them appeareth before God in Zion.

9.hebrew: יְהוָה אֱלֹהִים צְבָאוֹת,    שִׁמְעָה תְפִלָּתִי;הַאֲזִינָה אֱלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב    סֶלָה.
9.english: O LORD God of hosts, hear my prayer; {N}give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah

10.hebrew: מָגִנֵּנוּ, רְאֵה אֱלֹהִים;    וְהַבֵּט, פְּנֵי מְשִׁיחֶךָ.
10.english: Behold, O God our shield, and look upon the face of Thine anointed.

11.hebrew: כִּי טוֹב-יוֹם בַּחֲצֵרֶיךָ,    מֵאָלֶף:בָּחַרְתִּי--הִסְתּוֹפֵף, בְּבֵית אֱלֹהַי;    מִדּוּר, בְּאָהֳלֵי-רֶשַׁע.
11.english: For a day in Thy courts is better than a thousand; {N}I had rather stand at the threshold of the house of my God, than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.

12.hebrew: כִּי שֶׁמֶשׁ, וּמָגֵן--    יְהוָה אֱלֹהִים:חֵן וְכָבוֹד,    יִתֵּן יְהוָה;לֹא יִמְנַע-טוֹב,    לַהֹלְכִים בְּתָמִים.
12.english: For the LORD God is a sun and a shield; {N}the LORD giveth grace and glory; {N}no good thing will He withhold from them that walk uprightly.

13.hebrew: יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת--    אַשְׁרֵי אָדָם, בֹּטֵחַ בָּךְ.
13.english: O LORD of hosts, happy is the man that trusteth in Thee. {P}

1.english: For the Leader. A Psalm of the sons of Korah.

9.hebrew: ††а∆щ—јојт»д-- †† о«д-йјг«бћ≈ш, д»а≈м йјде»д:лћƒй, йјг«бћ≈ш щ—»ме…н--а∆м-т«оће… еја∆м-з¬сƒйг»йе; †† еја«м-й»щ—ећбећ мјлƒсјм»д.
