10.hebrew: ††а«кј ч»ше…б мƒйш≈а»йе йƒщ—јте…; †† мƒщ—јлћ…п лћ»бе…г бћја«шјц≈рећ.
10.english: Surely His salvation is nigh them that fear Him; that glory may dwell in our land.

11.hebrew: ††з∆с∆г-е∆аЅо∆ъ рƒфјвћ»щ—ећ; †† ц∆г∆ч ејщ—»ме…н р»щ—»чећ.
11.english: Mercy and truth are met together; righteousness and peace have kissed each other.

12.hebrew: ††аЅо∆ъ, о≈а∆ш∆х ъћƒцјо»з; †† ејц∆г∆ч, оƒщћ—»о«йƒн рƒщ—јч»у.
12.english: Truth springeth out of the earth; and righteousness hath looked down from heaven.

13.hebrew: ††вћ«н-йјде»д, йƒъћ≈п д«иће…б; †† еја«шјц≈рећ, ъћƒъћ≈п йјбећм»дћ.
13.english: Yea, the LORD will give that which is good; and our land shall yield her produce.

14.hebrew: ††ц∆г∆ч, мјф»р»йе йјд«мћ≈кј; †† ејй»щ“≈н мјг∆ш∆кј фћјт»о»йе.
14.english: Righteousness shall go before Him, and shall make His footsteps a way. {P}

1.hebrew: תְּפִלָּה, לְדָוִד:הַטֵּה-יְהוָה אָזְנְךָ עֲנֵנִי--    כִּי-עָנִי וְאֶבְיוֹן אָנִי.
1.english: A Prayer of David. {N}Incline Thine ear, O LORD, and answer me; for I am poor and needy.

2.hebrew: שָׁמְרָה נַפְשִׁי,    כִּי-חָסִיד אָנִי:הוֹשַׁע עַבְדְּךָ, אַתָּה אֱלֹהַי--    הַבּוֹטֵחַ אֵלֶיךָ.
2.english: Keep my soul, for I am godly; {N}O Thou my God, save Thy servant that trusteth in Thee.

3.hebrew: חָנֵּנִי אֲדֹנָי:    כִּי אֵלֶיךָ אֶקְרָא, כָּל-הַיּוֹם.
3.english: Be gracious unto me, O Lord; for unto Thee do I cry all the day.

4.hebrew: שַׂמֵּחַ, נֶפֶשׁ עַבְדֶּךָ:    כִּי אֵלֶיךָ אֲדֹנָי, נַפְשִׁי אֶשָּׂא.
4.english: Rejoice the soul of Thy servant; for unto Thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.

5.hebrew: כִּי-אַתָּה אֲדֹנָי, טוֹב וְסַלָּח;    וְרַב-חֶסֶד, לְכָל-קֹרְאֶיךָ.
5.english: For Thou, Lord, art good, and ready to pardon, and plenteous in mercy unto all them that call upon Thee.

6.hebrew: הַאֲזִינָה יְהוָה, תְּפִלָּתִי;    וְהַקְשִׁיבָה, בְּקוֹל תַּחֲנוּנוֹתָי.
6.english: Give ear, O LORD, unto my prayer; and attend unto the voice of my supplications.

7.hebrew: בְּיוֹם צָרָתִי, אֶקְרָאֶךָּ:    כִּי תַעֲנֵנִי.
7.english: In the day of my trouble I call upon Thee; for Thou wilt answer me.

8.hebrew: אֵין-כָּמוֹךָ בָאֱלֹהִים אֲדֹנָי;    וְאֵין כְּמַעֲשֶׂיךָ.
8.english: There is none like unto Thee among the gods, O Lord, and there are no works like Thine.

9.hebrew: כָּל-גּוֹיִם, אֲשֶׁר עָשִׂיתָ--יָבוֹאוּ וְיִשְׁתַּחֲווּ לְפָנֶיךָ אֲדֹנָי;    וִיכַבְּדוּ לִשְׁמֶךָ.
9.english: All nations whom Thou hast made shall come and prostrate themselves before Thee, O Lord; and they shall glorify Thy name.

10.hebrew: כִּי-גָדוֹל אַתָּה, וְעֹשֵׂה נִפְלָאוֹת;    אַתָּה אֱלֹהִים לְבַדֶּךָ.
10.english: For Thou art great, and doest wondrous things; Thou art God alone.

11.hebrew: הוֹרֵנִי יְהוָה, דַּרְכֶּךָ--    אֲהַלֵּךְ בַּאֲמִתֶּךָ;יַחֵד לְבָבִי,    לְיִרְאָה שְׁמֶךָ.
11.english: Teach me, O LORD, Thy way, that I may walk in Thy truth; {N}make one my heart to fear Thy name.

12.hebrew: אוֹדְךָ, אֲדֹנָי אֱלֹהַי--בְּכָל-לְבָבִי;    וַאֲכַבְּדָה שִׁמְךָ לְעוֹלָם.
12.english: I will thank Thee, O Lord my God, with my whole heart; and I will glorify Thy name for evermore.

13.hebrew: כִּי-חַסְדְּךָ, גָּדוֹל עָלָי;    וְהִצַּלְתָּ נַפְשִׁי, מִשְּׁאוֹל תַּחְתִּיָּה.
13.english: For great is Thy mercy toward me; and Thou hast delivered my soul from the lowest nether-world.

14.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים, זֵדִים קָמוּ-עָלַי,    וַעֲדַת עָרִיצִים, בִּקְשׁוּ נַפְשִׁי;וְלֹא שָׂמוּךָ    לְנֶגְדָּם.
14.english: O God, the proud are risen up against me, and the company of violent men have sought after my soul, {N}and have not set Thee before them.

15.hebrew: וְאַתָּה אֲדֹנָי, אֵל-רַחוּם וְחַנּוּן;    אֶרֶךְ אַפַּיִם, וְרַב-חֶסֶד וֶאֱמֶת.
15.english: But Thou, O Lord, art a God full of compassion and gracious, slow to anger, and plenteous in mercy and truth.

16.hebrew: פְּנֵה אֵלַי, וְחָנֵּנִי:    תְּנָה-עֻזְּךָ לְעַבְדֶּךָ; וְהוֹשִׁיעָה, לְבֶן-אֲמָתֶךָ.
16.english: O turn unto me, and be gracious unto me; give Thy strength unto Thy servant, and save the son of Thy handmaid.

17.hebrew: עֲשֵׂה-עִמִּי אוֹת,    לְטוֹבָה:וְיִרְאוּ שֹׂנְאַי וְיֵבֹשׁוּ--    כִּי-אַתָּה יְהוָה, עֲזַרְתַּנִי וְנִחַמְתָּנִי.
17.english: Work in my behalf a sign for good; {N}that they that hate me may see it, and be put to shame, because Thou, LORD, hast helped me, and comforted me. {P}

1.hebrew: לִבְנֵי-קֹרַח, מִזְמוֹר שִׁיר:    יְסוּדָתוֹ, בְּהַרְרֵי-קֹדֶשׁ.
1.english: A Psalm of the sons of Korah; a Song. His foundation is in the holy mountains.

2.hebrew: אֹהֵב יְהוָה, שַׁעֲרֵי צִיּוֹן--    מִכֹּל, מִשְׁכְּנוֹת יַעֲקֹב.
2.english: The LORD loveth the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.

3.hebrew: נִכְבָּדוֹת, מְדֻבָּר בָּךְ--    עִיר הָאֱלֹהִים סֶלָה.
3.english: Glorious things are spoken of thee, O city of God. Selah

4.hebrew: אַזְכִּיר, רַהַב וּבָבֶל--    לְיֹדְעָי:הִנֵּה פְלֶשֶׁת וְצֹר עִם-כּוּשׁ;    זֶה, יֻלַּד-שָׁם.
4.english: 'I will make mention of Rahab and Babylon as among them that know Me; {N}behold Philistia, and Tyre, with Ethiopia; this one was born there.'

5.hebrew: וּלְצִיּוֹן, יֵאָמַר--    אִישׁ וְאִישׁ, יֻלַּד-בָּהּ;וְהוּא יְכוֹנְנֶהָ    עֶלְיוֹן.
5.english: But of Zion it shall be said: 'This man and that was born in her; {N}and the Most High Himself doth establish her.'

6.hebrew: יְהוָה--יִסְפֹּר, בִּכְתוֹב עַמִּים:    זֶה יֻלַּד-שָׁם סֶלָה.
6.english: The LORD shall count in the register of the peoples: 'This one was born there.' Selah

7.hebrew: וְשָׁרִים כְּחֹלְלִים--    כָּל-מַעְיָנַי בָּךְ.
7.english: And whether they sing or dance, all my thoughts are in thee. {P}

1.hebrew: שִׁיר מִזְמוֹר, לִבְנֵי-קֹרַח:לַמְנַצֵּחַ עַל-מָחֲלַת לְעַנּוֹת;    מַשְׂכִּיל, לְהֵימָן הָאֶזְרָחִי.
1.english: A Song, a Psalm of the sons of Korah; {N}for the Leader; upon Mahalath Leannoth. Maschil of Heman the Ezrahite.

2.hebrew: יְהוָה, אֱלֹהֵי יְשׁוּעָתִי--    יוֹם-צָעַקְתִּי בַלַּיְלָה נֶגְדֶּךָ.
2.english: O LORD, God of my salvation, what time I cry in the night before Thee,

3.hebrew: תָּבוֹא לְפָנֶיךָ, תְּפִלָּתִי;    הַטֵּה אָזְנְךָ, לְרִנָּתִי.
3.english: Let my prayer come before Thee, incline Thine ear unto my cry.

4.hebrew: כִּי-שָׂבְעָה בְרָעוֹת נַפְשִׁי;    וְחַיַּי, לִשְׁאוֹל הִגִּיעוּ.
4.english: For my soul is sated with troubles, and my life draweth nigh unto the grave.

5.hebrew: נֶחְשַׁבְתִּי, עִם-יוֹרְדֵי בוֹר;    הָיִיתִי, כְּגֶבֶר אֵין-אֱיָל.
5.english: I am counted with them that go down into the pit; I am become as a man that hath no help;

6.hebrew: בַּמֵּתִים,    חָפְשִׁי:כְּמוֹ חֲלָלִים, שֹׁכְבֵי קֶבֶר--    אֲשֶׁר לֹא זְכַרְתָּם עוֹד;וְהֵמָּה,    מִיָּדְךָ נִגְזָרוּ.
6.english: Set apart among the dead, {N}like the slain that lie in the grave, whom Thou rememberest no more; {N}and they are cut off from Thy hand.

7.hebrew: שַׁתַּנִי, בְּבוֹר תַּחְתִּיּוֹת;    בְּמַחֲשַׁכִּים, בִּמְצֹלוֹת.
7.english: Thou hast laid me in the nethermost pit, in dark places, in the deeps.

8.hebrew: עָלַי, סָמְכָה חֲמָתֶךָ;    וְכָל-מִשְׁבָּרֶיךָ, עִנִּיתָ סֶּלָה.
8.english: Thy wrath lieth hard upon me, and all Thy waves Thou pressest down. Selah

9.hebrew: הִרְחַקְתָּ מְיֻדָּעַי, מִמֶּנִּי:    שַׁתַּנִי תוֹעֵבוֹת לָמוֹ; כָּלֻא, וְלֹא אֵצֵא.
9.english: Thou hast put mine acquaintance far from me; Thou hast made me an abomination unto them; I am shut up, and I cannot come forth.

10.hebrew: עֵינִי דָאֲבָה,    מִנִּי-עֹנִי:קְרָאתִיךָ יְהוָה בְּכָל-יוֹם;    שִׁטַּחְתִּי אֵלֶיךָ כַפָּי.
10.english: Mine eye languisheth by reason of affliction; {N}I have called upon Thee, O LORD, every day, I have spread forth my hands unto Thee.

11.hebrew: הֲלַמֵּתִים תַּעֲשֶׂה-פֶּלֶא:    אִם-רְפָאִים, יָקוּמוּ יוֹדוּךָ סֶּלָה.
11.english: Wilt Thou work wonders for the dead? Or shall the shades arise and give Thee thanks? Selah

12.hebrew: הַיְסֻפַּר בַּקֶּבֶר חַסְדֶּךָ;    אֱמוּנָתְךָ, בָּאֲבַדּוֹן.
12.english: Shall Thy mercy be declared in the grave? or Thy faithfulness in destruction?

13.hebrew: הֲיִוָּדַע בַּחֹשֶׁךְ פִּלְאֶךָ;    וְצִדְקָתְךָ, בְּאֶרֶץ נְשִׁיָּה.
13.english: Shall Thy wonders be known in the dark? and Thy righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?

14.hebrew: וַאֲנִי, אֵלֶיךָ יְהוָה שִׁוַּעְתִּי;    וּבַבֹּקֶר, תְּפִלָּתִי תְקַדְּמֶךָּ.
14.english: But as for me, unto Thee, O LORD, do I cry, and in the morning doth my prayer come to meet Thee.

15.hebrew: לָמָה יְהוָה, תִּזְנַח נַפְשִׁי;    תַּסְתִּיר פָּנֶיךָ מִמֶּנִּי.
15.english: LORD, why castest Thou off my soul? Why hidest Thou Thy face from me?

16.hebrew: עָנִי אֲנִי וְגֹוֵעַ מִנֹּעַר;    נָשָׂאתִי אֵמֶיךָ אָפוּנָה.
16.english: I am afflicted and at the point of death from my youth up; I have borne Thy terrors, I am distracted.

17.hebrew: עָלַי, עָבְרוּ חֲרוֹנֶיךָ;    בִּעוּתֶיךָ, צִמְּתוּתֻנִי.
17.english: Thy fierce wrath is gone over me; Thy terrors have cut me off.

18.hebrew: סַבּוּנִי כַמַּיִם, כָּל-הַיּוֹם;    הִקִּיפוּ עָלַי יָחַד.
18.english: They came round about me like water all the day; they compassed me about together.

19.hebrew: הִרְחַקְתָּ מִמֶּנִּי, אֹהֵב וָרֵעַ;    מְיֻדָּעַי מַחְשָׁךְ.
19.english: Friend and companion hast Thou put far from me, and mine acquaintance into darkness. {P}

1.hebrew: ††о«щ“јлћƒйм, мја≈йъ»п д»а∆жјш»зƒй.
1.english: Maschil of Ethan the Ezrahite.

2.hebrew: ††з«сјг≈й йјде»д, те…м»н а»щ—ƒйш»д; †† мјг…ш е»г…ш, ае…гƒйт« аЅоећр»ъјк» бћјфƒй.
2.english: I will sing of the mercies of the LORD for ever; to all generations will I make known Thy faithfulness with my mouth.

3.hebrew: ††лћƒй-а»о«шјъћƒй--те…м»н, з∆с∆г йƒбћ»р∆д; †† щ—»о«йƒн, ъћ»лƒп аЅоећр»ъјк» б»д∆н.
3.english: For I have said: 'For ever is mercy built; in the very heavens Thou dost establish Thy faithfulness.

4.hebrew: ††лћ»ш«ъћƒй бјшƒйъ, мƒбјзƒйшƒй; †† рƒщ—јбћ«тјъћƒй, мјг»еƒг т«бјгћƒй.
4.english: I have made a covenant with My chosen, I have sworn unto David My servant:

5.hebrew: ††т«г-те…м»н, а»лƒйп ж«шјт∆к»; †† ећб»рƒйъƒй мјг…ш-е»ге…ш лћƒсја¬к» с∆м»д.
5.english: For ever will I establish thy seed, and build up thy throne to all generations.' Selah

6.hebrew: ††ејйе…гећ щ—»о«йƒн фћƒмја¬к» йјде»д; †† а«у-аЅоећр»ъјк», бћƒчјд«м чјг…щ—ƒйн.
6.english: So shall the heavens praise Thy wonders, O LORD, Thy faithfulness also in the assembly of the holy ones.

7.hebrew: ††лћƒй оƒй б«щћ—«з«ч, й«т¬ш…кј м«йде»д; †† йƒгјо∆д м«йде»д, бћƒбјр≈й а≈мƒйн.
7.english: For who in the skies can be compared unto the LORD, who among the sons of might can be likened unto the LORD,

8.hebrew: ††а≈м р«т¬ш»х, бћјсе…г-чјг…щ—ƒйн ш«бћ»д; †† ејре…ш»а, т«м-лћ»м-сјбƒйб»йе.
8.english: A God dreaded in the great council of the holy ones, and feared of all them that are about Him?

9.hebrew: ††йјде»д, аЅм…д≈й цјб»ае…ъ--оƒй-л»ое…к» з¬сƒйп й»дћ; †† е∆аЅоећр»ъјк», сјбƒйбе…ъ∆йк».
9.english: O LORD God of hosts, who is a mighty one, like unto Thee, O LORD? And Thy faithfulness is round about Thee.

10.hebrew: ††а«ъћ»д ое…щ—≈м, бћјв≈аећъ д«йћ»н; †† бћјщ“е…а в«мћ»йе, а«ъћ»д ъјщ—«бћјз≈н.
10.english: Thou rulest the proud swelling of the sea; when the waves thereof arise, Thou stillest them.

11.hebrew: ††а«ъћ»д гƒлћƒаъ» л∆з»м»м ш»д«б; †† бћƒжјше…т« тЋжћјк», фћƒжћ«шјъћ» ае…йјб∆йк».
11.english: Thou didst crush Rahab, as one that is slain; Thou didst scatter Thine enemies with the arm of Thy strength.

12.hebrew: ††мјк» щ—»о«йƒн, а«у-мјк» а»ш∆х; †† ъћ≈б≈м ећојм…а»дћ, а«ъћ»д йјс«гјъћ»н.
12.english: Thine are the heavens, Thine also the earth; the world and the fulness thereof, Thou hast founded them.

13.hebrew: ††ц»фе…п ејй»оƒйп, а«ъћ»д бјш»аъ»н; †† ъћ»бе…ш ејз∆шјое…п, бћјщ—ƒојк» йјш«рћ≈рећ.
13.english: The north and the south, Thou hast created them; Tabor and Hermon rejoice in Thy name.

14.hebrew: ††мјк» жјше…т«, тƒн-вћјбећш»д; †† ъћ»т…ж й»гјк», ъћ»шећн йјоƒйр∆к».
14.english: Thine is an arm with might; strong is Thy hand, and exalted is Thy right hand.

15.hebrew: ††ц∆г∆ч ећоƒщ—јфћ»и, ојле…п лћƒсја∆к»; †† з∆с∆г е∆аЅо∆ъ, йјч«гћјоећ ф»р∆йк».
15.english: Righteousness and justice are the foundation of Thy throne; mercy and truth go before Thee.

16.hebrew: ††а«щ—јш≈й д»т»н, й…гјт≈й ъјшећт»д; †† йјде»д, бћјае…ш-фћ»р∆йк» йјд«мћ≈лећп.
16.english: Happy is the people that know the joyful shout; they walk, O LORD, in the light of Thy countenance.

17.hebrew: ††бћјщ—ƒојк», йјвƒймећп лћ»м-д«йће…н; †† ећбјцƒгјч»ъјк» й»шећоећ.
17.english: In Thy name do they rejoice all the day; and through Thy righteousness are they exalted.

18.hebrew: ††лћƒй-ъƒфја∆ш∆ъ тЋжћ»ое… а»ъћ»д; †† ећбƒшјце…рјк», ъшйн (ъћ»шећн) ч«шјр≈йрећ.
18.english: For Thou art the glory of their strength; and in Thy favour our horn is exalted.

19.hebrew: ††лћƒй м«йде»д, о»вƒрћ≈рећ; †† ејмƒчјге…щ— йƒщ“јш»а≈м о«мјлћ≈рећ.
19.english: For of the LORD is our shield; and the Holy One of Israel is our king.

20.hebrew: ††а»ж гћƒбћ«шјъћ» бјз»же…п, м«з¬сƒйг∆йк»-- †† е«ъћ…ао∆ш, щ—ƒећƒйъƒй т≈ж∆ш т«м-вћƒбће…ш;д¬шƒйое…ъƒй б»зећш †† о≈т»н.
20.english: Then Thou spokest in vision to Thy godly ones, and saidst: 'I have laid help upon one that is mighty; {N}I have exalted one chosen out of the people.

21.hebrew: ††о»ц»аъƒй, гћ»еƒг т«бјгћƒй; †† бћјщ—∆о∆п ч»гјщ—ƒй ојщ—«зјъћƒйе.
21.english: I have found David My servant; with My holy oil have I anointed him;

22.hebrew: ††а¬щ—∆ш й»гƒй, ъћƒлће…п тƒоће…; †† а«у-жјше…тƒй ъја«оћјц∆рћећ.
22.english: With whom My hand shall be established; Mine arm also shall strengthen him.

23.hebrew: ††м…а-й«щћ—ƒйа ае…й≈б бће…; †† ећб∆п-т«ејм»д, м…а йјт«рћ∆рћећ.
23.english: The enemy shall not exact from him; nor the son of wickedness afflict him.

24.english: And I will beat to pieces his adversaries before him, and smite them that hate him.

25.hebrew: ††е∆аЅоећр»ъƒй ејз«сјгћƒй тƒоће…; †† ећбƒщ—јоƒй, ъћ»шећн ч«шјре….
25.english: But My faithfulness and My mercy shall be with him; and through My name shall his horn be exalted.

26.english: I will set his hand also on the sea, and his right hand on the rivers.

27.hebrew: ††дећа йƒчјш»а≈рƒй, а»бƒй а»ъћ»д; †† а≈мƒй, ејцећш йјщ—ећт»ъƒй.
27.english: He shall call unto Me: Thou art my Father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.

28.english: I also will appoint him first-born, the highest of the kings of the earth.

29.hebrew: ††мјте…м»н, ащоеш- (а∆щ—јо»ш-) ме… з«сјгћƒй; †† ећбјшƒйъƒй, р∆аЅо∆р∆ъ ме….
29.english: For ever will I keep for him My mercy, and My covenant shall stand fast with him.

30.english: His seed also will I make to endure for ever, and his throne as the days of heaven.

31.english: If his children forsake My law, and walk not in Mine ordinances;

32.english: If they profane My statutes, and keep not My commandments;

33.english: Then will I visit their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with strokes.

34.english: But My mercy will I not break off from him, nor will I be false to My faithfulness.

35.english: My covenant will I not profane, nor alter that which is gone out of My lips.

36.english: Once have I sworn by My holiness: Surely I will not be false unto David;

37.english: His seed shall endure for ever, and his throne as the sun before Me.

38.hebrew: ††лћјй»ш≈з«, йƒлће…п те…м»н; †† ејт≈г бћ«щћ—«з«ч, р∆аЅо»п с∆м»д.
38.english: It shall be established for ever as the moon; and be stedfast as the witness in sky.' Selah

39.english: But Thou hast cast off and rejected, Thou hast been wroth with Thine anointed.

40.english: Thou hast abhorred the covenant of Thy servant; Thou hast profaned his crown even to the ground.

41.english: Thou hast broken down all his fences; Thou hast brought his strongholds to ruin.

42.english: All that pass by the way spoil him; he is become a taunt to his neighbours.

43.english: Thou hast exalted the right hand of his adversaries; Thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice.

44.english: Yea, Thou turnest back the edge of his sword, and hast not made him to stand in the battle.

45.english: Thou hast made his brightness to cease, and cast his throne down to the ground.

46.hebrew: ††дƒчјц«шјъћ», йјо≈й т¬мећо»йе; †† д∆тЅиƒйъ» т»м»йе бћећщ—»д с∆м»д.
46.english: The days of his youth hast Thou shortened; Thou hast covered him with shame. Selah

47.hebrew: ††т«г-о»д йјде»д, ъћƒсћ»ъ≈ш м»р∆ц«з; †† ъћƒбјт«ш лћјое…-а≈щ— з¬о»ъ∆к».
47.english: How long, O LORD, wilt Thou hide Thyself for ever? How long shall Thy wrath burn like fire?

48.english: O remember how short my time is; for what vanity hast Thou created all the children of men!

49.hebrew: ††оƒй в∆б∆ш йƒзјй∆д, ејм…а йƒшја∆д-оћ»е∆ъ; †† йјо«мћ≈и р«фјщ—е… оƒйћ«г-щ—јае…м с∆м»д.
49.english: What man is he that liveth and shall not see death, that shall deliver his soul from the power of the grave? Selah

50.hebrew: ††а«йћ≈д, з¬с»г∆йк» д»шƒащ—…рƒйн а¬г…р»й: †† рƒщ—јбћ«тјъћ» мјг»еƒг, бћ∆аЅоећр»ъ∆к».
50.english: Where are Thy former mercies, O Lord, which Thou didst swear unto David in Thy faithfulness?

51.hebrew: ††жјл…ш а¬г…р»й, з∆шјфћ«ъ т¬б»г∆йк»; †† щ“ја≈ъƒй бјз≈йчƒй, лћ»м-ш«бћƒйн т«оћƒйн.
51.english: Remember, Lord, the taunt of Thy servants; how I do bear in my bosom [the taunt of] so many peoples;

52.hebrew: ††а¬щ—∆ш з≈шјфећ ае…йјб∆йк» йјде»д: †† а¬щ—∆ш з≈шјфећ, тƒчћјбе…ъ ојщ—ƒйз∆к».
52.english: Wherewith Thine enemies have taunted, O LORD, wherewith they have taunted the footsteps of Thine anointed.

53.english: Blessed be the LORD for evermore. Amen, and Amen. {P}

1.hebrew: ††ъћјфƒмћ»д, мјо…щ—∆д аƒйщ—-д»аЅм…дƒйн:а¬г…р»й--о»те…п а«ъћ»д, д»йƒйъ» мћ»рећ; †† бћјг…ш е»г…ш.
1.english: A Prayer of Moses the man of God. {N}Lord, Thou hast been our dwelling-place in all generations.

2.hebrew: ††бћји∆ш∆н, д»шƒйн йЋмћ»гећ-- †† е«ъћјзе…м≈м а∆ш∆х ејъ≈б≈м;ећо≈те…м»н т«г-те…м»н, †† а«ъћ»д а≈м.
2.english: Before the mountains were brought forth, or ever Thou hadst formed the earth and the world, {N}even from everlasting to everlasting, Thou art God.

3.hebrew: ††ъћ»щ—≈б аЅре…щ—, т«г-гћ«лћ»а; †† е«ъћ…ао∆ш, щ—ећбећ бјр≈й-а»г»н.
3.english: Thou turnest man to contrition; and sayest: 'Return, ye children of men.'

4.hebrew: ††лћƒй а∆м∆у щ—»рƒйн, бћјт≈йр∆йк»-- †† лћјйе…н а∆ъјое…м, лћƒй й«т¬б…ш;еја«щ—јоећш»д †† б«мћ»йјм»д.
4.english: For a thousand years in Thy sight are but as yesterday when it is past, {N}and as a watch in the night.

5.hebrew: ††жјш«ојъћ»н, щ—≈р»д йƒдјйећ; †† бћ«бћ…ч∆ш, лћ∆з»цƒйш й«з¬м…у.
5.english: Thou carriest them away as with a flood; they are as a sleep; in the morning they are like grass which groweth up.

6.hebrew: ††бћ«бћ…ч∆ш, й»цƒйх ејз»м»у; †† м»т∆ш∆б, йјое…м≈м ејй»б≈щ—.
6.english: In the morning it flourisheth, and groweth up; in the evening it is cut down, and withereth.

7.hebrew: ††лћƒй-л»мƒйрећ бја«фћ∆к»; †† ећб«з¬о»ъјк» рƒбјд»мјрећ.
7.english: For we are consumed in Thine anger, and by Thy wrath are we hurried away.

8.hebrew: ††щъ (щ—«ъћ»д) т¬е р…ъ≈йрећ мјр∆вјгћ∆к»; †† т¬мЋо≈рећ, мƒојае…ш фћ»р∆йк».
8.english: Thou hast set our iniquities before Thee, our secret sins in the light of Thy countenance.

9.hebrew: ††лћƒй л»м-й»о≈йрећ, фћ»рећ бјт∆бјш»ъ∆к»; †† лћƒмћƒйрећ щ—»р≈йрећ лјое…-д∆в∆д.
9.english: For all our days are passed away in Thy wrath; we bring our years to an end as a tale that is told.

10.hebrew: ††йјо≈й-щ—јре…ъ≈йрећ б»д∆н щ—ƒбјтƒйн щ—»р»д, †† ејаƒн бћƒвјбећш…ъ щ—јое…рƒйн щ—»р»д--ејш»дјбћ»н, †† т»о»м е»а»е∆п:лћƒй-в»ж зƒйщ—, †† е«рћ»тЋф»д.
10.english: The days of our years are threescore years and ten, or even by reason of strength fourscore years; {N}yet is their pride but travail and vanity; {N}for it is speedily gone, and we fly away.

11.hebrew: ††оƒй-йе…г≈т«, т…ж а«фћ∆к»; †† ећлјйƒшја»ъјк», т∆бјш»ъ∆к».
11.english: Who knoweth the power of Thine anger, and Thy wrath according to the fear that is due unto Thee?

12.hebrew: ††мƒојре…ъ й»о≈йрећ, лћ≈п де…г«т; †† ејр»бƒа, мјб«б з»лјо»д.
12.english: So teach us to number our days, that we may get us a heart of wisdom.

13.hebrew: ††щ—ећб»д йјде»д, т«г-о»ъ»й; †† ејдƒрћ»з≈н, т«м-т¬б»г∆йк».
13.english: Return, O LORD; how long? And let it repent Thee concerning Thy servants.

14.hebrew: ††щ“«бћјт≈рећ б«бћ…ч∆ш з«сјгћ∆к»; †† ећрјш«рћјр»д ејрƒщ“јојз»д, бћјл»м-й»о≈йрећ.
14.english: O satisfy us in the morning with Thy mercy; that we may rejoice and be glad all our days.

15.hebrew: ††щ“«оћјз≈рећ, лћƒйое…ъ тƒрћƒйъ»рећ: †† щ—јре…ъ, ш»аƒйрећ ш»т»д.
15.english: Make us glad according to the days wherein Thou hast afflicted us, according to the years wherein we have seen evil.

16.hebrew: ††й≈ш»а∆д а∆м-т¬б»г∆йк» ф»т√м∆к»; †† е«д¬г»шјк», т«м-бћјр≈йд∆н.
16.english: Let Thy work appear unto Thy servants, and Thy glory upon their children.

17.hebrew: ††еƒйдƒй, р…т«н а¬г…р»й аЅм…д≈йрећ-- †† т»м≈йрећ:ећо«т¬щ“≈д й»г≈йрећ, лће…рјр»д т»м≈йрећ; †† ећо«т¬щ“≈д й»г≈йрећ, лће…рјр≈дећ.
17.english: And let the graciousness of the Lord our God be upon us; {N}establish Thou also upon us the work of our hands; yea, the work of our hands establish Thou it. {P}

1.hebrew: יֹשֵׁב, בְּסֵתֶר עֶלְיוֹן;    בְּצֵל שַׁדַּי, יִתְלוֹנָן.
1.english: O thou that dwellest in the covert of the Most High, and abidest in the shadow of the Almighty;

2.hebrew: אֹמַר--לַיהוָה, מַחְסִי וּמְצוּדָתִי;    אֱלֹהַי, אֶבְטַח-בּוֹ.
2.english: I will say of the LORD, who is my refuge and my fortress, my God, in whom I trust,

3.hebrew: כִּי הוּא יַצִּילְךָ, מִפַּח יָקוּשׁ;    מִדֶּבֶר הַוּוֹת.
3.english: That He will deliver thee from the snare of the fowler, and from the noisome pestilence.

4.hebrew: בְּאֶבְרָתוֹ, יָסֶךְ לָךְ--וְתַחַת-כְּנָפָיו תֶּחְסֶה;    צִנָּה וְסֹחֵרָה אֲמִתּוֹ.
4.english: He will cover thee with His pinions, and under His wings shalt thou take refuge; His truth is a shield and a buckler.

5.hebrew: לֹא-תִירָא, מִפַּחַד לָיְלָה;    מֵחֵץ, יָעוּף יוֹמָם.
5.english: Thou shalt not be afraid of the terror by night, nor of the arrow that flieth by day;

6.hebrew: מִדֶּבֶר, בָּאֹפֶל יַהֲלֹךְ;    מִקֶּטֶב, יָשׁוּד צָהֳרָיִם.
6.english: Of the pestilence that walketh in darkness, nor of the destruction that wasteth at noonday.

7.hebrew: יִפֹּל מִצִּדְּךָ, אֶלֶף--וּרְבָבָה מִימִינֶךָ:    אֵלֶיךָ, לֹא יִגָּשׁ.
7.english: A thousand may fall at thy side, and ten thousand at thy right hand; it shall not come nigh thee.

8.hebrew: רַק, בְּעֵינֶיךָ תַבִּיט;    וְשִׁלֻּמַת רְשָׁעִים תִּרְאֶה.
8.english: Only with thine eyes shalt thou behold, and see the recompense of the wicked.

9.hebrew: כִּי-אַתָּה יְהוָה מַחְסִי;    עֶלְיוֹן, שַׂמְתָּ מְעוֹנֶךָ.
9.english: For thou hast made the LORD who is my refuge, even the Most High, thy habitation.

10.hebrew: לֹא-תְאֻנֶּה אֵלֶיךָ רָעָה;    וְנֶגַע, לֹא-יִקְרַב בְּאָהֳלֶךָ.
10.english: There shall no evil befall thee, neither shall any plague come nigh thy tent.

11.hebrew: כִּי מַלְאָכָיו, יְצַוֶּה-לָּךְ;    לִשְׁמָרְךָ, בְּכָל-דְּרָכֶיךָ.
11.english: For He will give His angels charge over thee, to keep thee in all thy ways.

12.hebrew: עַל-כַּפַּיִם יִשָּׂאוּנְךָ:    פֶּן-תִּגֹּף בָּאֶבֶן רַגְלֶךָ.
12.english: They shall bear thee upon their hands, lest thou dash thy foot against a stone.

13.hebrew: עַל-שַׁחַל וָפֶתֶן, תִּדְרֹךְ;    תִּרְמֹס כְּפִיר וְתַנִּין.
13.english: Thou shalt tread upon the lion and asp; the young lion and the serpent shalt thou trample under feet.

14.hebrew: כִּי בִי חָשַׁק, וַאֲפַלְּטֵהוּ;    אֲשַׂגְּבֵהוּ, כִּי-יָדַע שְׁמִי.
14.english: 'Because he hath set his love upon Me, therefore will I deliver him; I will set him on high, because he hath known My name.

15.hebrew: יִקְרָאֵנִי, וְאֶעֱנֵהוּ--עִמּוֹ-אָנֹכִי בְצָרָה;    אֲחַלְּצֵהוּ, וַאֲכַבְּדֵהוּ.
15.english: He shall call upon Me, and I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble; I will rescue him, and bring him to honour.

16.hebrew: אֹרֶךְ יָמִים, אַשְׂבִּיעֵהוּ;    וְאַרְאֵהוּ, בִּישׁוּעָתִי.
16.english: With long life will I satisfy him, and make him to behold My salvation.' {P}

1.hebrew: מִזְמוֹר שִׁיר, לְיוֹם הַשַּׁבָּת.
1.english: A Psalm, a Song. For the sabbath day.

2.hebrew: טוֹב, לְהֹדוֹת לַיהוָה;    וּלְזַמֵּר לְשִׁמְךָ עֶלְיוֹן.
2.english: It is a good thing to give thanks unto the LORD, and to sing praises unto Thy name, O Most High;

3.hebrew: לְהַגִּיד בַּבֹּקֶר חַסְדֶּךָ;    וֶאֱמוּנָתְךָ, בַּלֵּילוֹת.
3.english: To declare Thy lovingkindness in the morning, and Thy faithfulness in the night seasons,

4.hebrew: עֲלֵי-עָשׂוֹר, וַעֲלֵי-נָבֶל;    עֲלֵי הִגָּיוֹן בְּכִנּוֹר.
4.english: With an instrument of ten strings, and with the psaltery; with a solemn sound upon the harp.

5.hebrew: כִּי שִׂמַּחְתַּנִי יְהוָה בְּפָעֳלֶךָ;    בְּמַעֲשֵׂי יָדֶיךָ אֲרַנֵּן.
5.english: For Thou, LORD, hast made me glad through Thy work; I will exult in the works of Thy hands.

6.hebrew: מַה-גָּדְלוּ מַעֲשֶׂיךָ יְהוָה;    מְאֹד, עָמְקוּ מַחְשְׁבֹתֶיךָ.
6.english: How great are Thy works, O LORD! Thy thoughts are very deep.

7.hebrew: אִישׁ-בַּעַר, לֹא יֵדָע;    וּכְסִיל, לֹא-יָבִין אֶת-זֹאת.
7.english: A brutish man knoweth not, neither doth a fool understand this.

8.hebrew: בִּפְרֹחַ רְשָׁעִים, כְּמוֹ עֵשֶׂב, וַיָּצִיצוּ, כָּל-פֹּעֲלֵי אָוֶן:    לְהִשָּׁמְדָם עֲדֵי-עַד.
8.english: When the wicked spring up as the grass, and when all the workers of iniquity do flourish; it is that they may be destroyed for ever.

9.hebrew: וְאַתָּה מָרוֹם--    לְעֹלָם יְהוָה.
9.english: But Thou, O LORD, art on high for evermore.

10.hebrew: כִּי הִנֵּה אֹיְבֶיךָ, יְהוָה--    כִּי-הִנֵּה אֹיְבֶיךָ יֹאבֵדוּ:יִתְפָּרְדוּ,    כָּל-פֹּעֲלֵי אָוֶן.
10.english: For, lo, Thine enemies, O LORD, for, lo, Thine enemies shall perish: {N}all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.

11.hebrew: וַתָּרֶם כִּרְאֵים קַרְנִי;    בַּלֹּתִי, בְּשֶׁמֶן רַעֲנָן.
11.english: But my horn hast Thou exalted like the horn of the wild-ox; I am anointed with rich oil.

12.hebrew: וַתַּבֵּט עֵינִי,    בְּשׁוּרָי:בַּקָּמִים עָלַי מְרֵעִים--    תִּשְׁמַעְנָה אָזְנָי.
12.english: Mine eye also hath gazed on them that lie in wait for me, {N}mine ears have heard my desire of the evil-doers that rise up against me.

13.hebrew: צַדִּיק, כַּתָּמָר יִפְרָח;    כְּאֶרֶז בַּלְּבָנוֹן יִשְׂגֶּה.
13.english: The righteous shall flourish like the palm-tree; he shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.

14.hebrew: שְׁתוּלִים, בְּבֵית יְהוָה;    בְּחַצְרוֹת אֱלֹהֵינוּ יַפְרִיחוּ.
14.english: Planted in the house of the LORD, they shall flourish in the courts of our God.

15.hebrew: עוֹד, יְנוּבוּן בְּשֵׂיבָה;    דְּשֵׁנִים וְרַעֲנַנִּים יִהְיוּ.
15.english: They shall still bring forth fruit in old age; they shall be full of sap and richness;

16.hebrew: לְהַגִּיד, כִּי-יָשָׁר יְהוָה;    צוּרִי, וְלֹא-עלתה (עַוְלָתָה) בּוֹ.
16.english: To declare that the LORD is upright, my Rock, in whom there is no unrighteousness. {P}

1.hebrew: יְהוָה מָלָךְ,    גֵּאוּת לָבֵשׁ:לָבֵשׁ יְהוָה, עֹז הִתְאַזָּר;    אַף-תִּכּוֹן תֵּבֵל, בַּל-תִּמּוֹט.
1.english: The LORD reigneth; He is clothed in majesty; {N}the LORD is clothed, He hath girded Himself with strength; yea, the world is established, that it cannot be moved.

2.hebrew: נָכוֹן כִּסְאֲךָ מֵאָז;    מֵעוֹלָם אָתָּה.
2.english: Thy throne is established of old; Thou art from everlasting.

3.hebrew: נָשְׂאוּ נְהָרוֹת, יְהוָה--נָשְׂאוּ נְהָרוֹת קוֹלָם;    יִשְׂאוּ נְהָרוֹת דָּכְיָם.
3.english: The floods have lifted up, O LORD, the floods have lifted up their voice; the floods lift up their roaring.

4.hebrew: מִקֹּלוֹת, מַיִם רַבִּים--אַדִּירִים מִשְׁבְּרֵי-יָם;    אַדִּיר בַּמָּרוֹם יְהוָה.
4.english: Above the voices of many waters, the mighty breakers of the sea, the LORD on high is mighty.

5.hebrew: עֵדֹתֶיךָ, נֶאֶמְנוּ מְאֹד--לְבֵיתְךָ נַאֲוָה-קֹדֶשׁ:    יְהוָה, לְאֹרֶךְ יָמִים.
5.english: Thy testimonies are very sure, holiness becometh Thy house, O LORD, for evermore. {P}

1.hebrew: אֵל-נְקָמוֹת יְהוָה;    אֵל נְקָמוֹת הוֹפִיעַ.
1.english: O LORD, Thou God to whom vengeance belongeth, Thou God to whom vengeance belongeth, shine forth.

2.hebrew: הִנָּשֵׂא, שֹׁפֵט הָאָרֶץ;    הָשֵׁב גְּמוּל, עַל-גֵּאִים.
2.english: Lift up Thyself, Thou Judge of the earth; render to the proud their recompense.

3.hebrew: עַד-מָתַי רְשָׁעִים יְהוָה:    עַד-מָתַי, רְשָׁעִים יַעֲלֹזוּ.
3.english: LORD, how long shall the wicked, how long shall the wicked exult?

4.hebrew: יַבִּיעוּ יְדַבְּרוּ עָתָק;    יִתְאַמְּרוּ, כָּל-פֹּעֲלֵי אָוֶן.
4.english: They gush out, they speak arrogancy; all the workers of iniquity bear themselves loftily.

5.hebrew: עַמְּךָ יְהוָה יְדַכְּאוּ;    וְנַחֲלָתְךָ יְעַנּוּ.
5.english: They crush Thy people, O LORD, and afflict Thy heritage.

6.hebrew: אַלְמָנָה וְגֵר יַהֲרֹגוּ;    וִיתוֹמִים יְרַצֵּחוּ.
6.english: They slay the widow and the stranger, and murder the fatherless.

7.hebrew: וַיֹּאמְרוּ, לֹא יִרְאֶה-יָּהּ;    וְלֹא-יָבִין, אֱלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב.
7.english: And they say: 'The LORD will not see, neither will the God of Jacob give heed.'

8.hebrew: בִּינוּ, בֹּעֲרִים בָּעָם;    וּכְסִילִים, מָתַי תַּשְׂכִּילוּ.
8.english: Consider, ye brutish among the people; and ye fools, when will ye understand?

9.hebrew: הֲנֹטַע אֹזֶן, הֲלֹא יִשְׁמָע;    אִם-יֹצֵר עַיִן, הֲלֹא יַבִּיט.
9.english: He that planted the ear, shall He not hear? He that formed the eye, shall He not see?

10.hebrew: הֲיֹסֵר גּוֹיִם, הֲלֹא יוֹכִיחַ:    הַמְלַמֵּד אָדָם דָּעַת.
10.english: He that instructeth nations, shall not He correct? even He that teacheth man knowledge?

11.hebrew: יְהוָה--יֹדֵעַ, מַחְשְׁבוֹת אָדָם:    כִּי-הֵמָּה הָבֶל.
11.english: The LORD knoweth the thoughts of man, that they are vanity.

12.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵי, הַגֶּבֶר אֲשֶׁר-תְּיַסְּרֶנּוּ יָּהּ;    וּמִתּוֹרָתְךָ תְלַמְּדֶנּוּ.
12.english: Happy is the man whom Thou instructest, O LORD, and teachest out of Thy law;

13.hebrew: לְהַשְׁקִיט לוֹ, מִימֵי רָע--    עַד יִכָּרֶה לָרָשָׁע שָׁחַת.
13.english: That Thou mayest give him rest from the days of evil, until the pit be digged for the wicked.

14.hebrew: כִּי, לֹא-יִטֹּשׁ יְהוָה עַמּוֹ;    וְנַחֲלָתוֹ, לֹא יַעֲזֹב.
14.english: For the LORD will not cast off His people, neither will He forsake His inheritance.

15.hebrew: כִּי-עַד-צֶדֶק, יָשׁוּב מִשְׁפָּט;    וְאַחֲרָיו, כָּל-יִשְׁרֵי-לֵב.
15.english: For right shall return unto justice, and all the upright in heart shall follow it.

16.hebrew: מִי-יָקוּם לִי, עִם-מְרֵעִים;    מִי-יִתְיַצֵּב לִי, עִם-פֹּעֲלֵי אָוֶן.
16.english: Who will rise up for me against the evil-doers? Who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity?

17.hebrew: לוּלֵי יְהוָה, עֶזְרָתָה לִּי--    כִּמְעַט, שָׁכְנָה דוּמָה נַפְשִׁי.
17.english: Unless the LORD had been my help, my soul had soon dwelt in silence.

18.hebrew: אִם-אָמַרְתִּי, מָטָה רַגְלִי;    חַסְדְּךָ יְהוָה, יִסְעָדֵנִי.
18.english: If I say: 'My foot slippeth', Thy mercy, O LORD, holdeth me up.

19.hebrew: בְּרֹב שַׂרְעַפַּי בְּקִרְבִּי--    תַּנְחוּמֶיךָ, יְשַׁעַשְׁעוּ נַפְשִׁי.
19.english: When my cares are many within me, Thy comforts delight my soul.

20.hebrew: הַיְחָבְרְךָ, כִּסֵּא הַוּוֹת;    יֹצֵר עָמָל עֲלֵי-חֹק.
20.english: Shall the seat of wickedness have fellowship with Thee, which frameth mischief by statute?

21.hebrew: יָגוֹדּוּ, עַל-נֶפֶשׁ צַדִּיק;    וְדָם נָקִי יַרְשִׁיעוּ.
21.english: They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous, and condemn innocent blood.

22.hebrew: וַיְהִי יְהוָה לִי לְמִשְׂגָּב;    וֵאלֹהַי, לְצוּר מַחְסִי.
22.english: But the LORD hath been my high tower, and my God the rock of my refuge.

23.hebrew: וַיָּשֶׁב עֲלֵיהֶם, אֶת אוֹנָם--    וּבְרָעָתָם יַצְמִיתֵם;יַצְמִיתֵם,    יְהוָה אֱלֹהֵינוּ.
23.english: And He hath brought upon them their own iniquity, and will cut them off in their own evil; {N}the LORD our God will cut them off. {P}

1.hebrew: לְכוּ, נְרַנְּנָה לַיהוָה;    נָרִיעָה, לְצוּר יִשְׁעֵנוּ.
1.english: O come, let us sing unto the LORD; let us shout for joy to the Rock of our salvation.

2.hebrew: נְקַדְּמָה פָנָיו בְּתוֹדָה;    בִּזְמִרוֹת, נָרִיעַ לוֹ.
2.english: Let us come before His presence with thanksgiving, let us shout for joy unto Him with psalms.

3.hebrew: כִּי אֵל גָּדוֹל יְהוָה;    וּמֶלֶךְ גָּדוֹל, עַל-כָּל-אֱלֹהִים.
3.english: For the LORD is a great God, and a great King above all gods;

4.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר בְּיָדוֹ, מֶחְקְרֵי-אָרֶץ;    וְתוֹעֲפֹת הָרִים לוֹ.
4.english: In whose hand are the depths of the earth; the heights of the mountains are His also.

5.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר-לוֹ הַיָּם, וְהוּא עָשָׂהוּ;    וְיַבֶּשֶׁת, יָדָיו יָצָרוּ.
5.english: The sea is His, and He made it; and His hands formed the dry land.

6.hebrew: בֹּאוּ, נִשְׁתַּחֲוֶה וְנִכְרָעָה;    נִבְרְכָה, לִפְנֵי-יְהוָה עֹשֵׂנוּ.
6.english: O come, let us bow down and bend the knee; let us kneel before the LORD our Maker;

7.hebrew: כִּי הוּא אֱלֹהֵינוּ--    וַאֲנַחְנוּ עַם מַרְעִיתוֹ, וְצֹאן יָדוֹ:הַיּוֹם,    אִם-בְּקֹלוֹ תִשְׁמָעוּ.
7.english: For He is our God, and we are the people of His pasture, and the flock of His hand. {N}To-day, if ye would but hearken to His voice!

8.hebrew: אַל-תַּקְשׁוּ לְבַבְכֶם, כִּמְרִיבָה;    כְּיוֹם מַסָּה, בַּמִּדְבָּר.
8.english: 'Harden not your heart, as at Meribah, as in the day of Massah in the wilderness;

9.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר נִסּוּנִי, אֲבוֹתֵיכֶם:    בְּחָנוּנִי, גַּם-רָאוּ פָעֳלִי.
9.english: When your fathers tried Me, proved Me, even though they saw My work.

10.hebrew: אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה, אָקוּט בְּדוֹר--    וָאֹמַר, עַם תֹּעֵי לֵבָב הֵם;וְהֵם,    לֹא-יָדְעוּ דְרָכָי.
10.english: For forty years was I wearied with that generation, and said: It is a people that do err in their heart, {N}and they have not known My ways;

11.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר-נִשְׁבַּעְתִּי בְאַפִּי;    אִם-יְבֹאוּן, אֶל-מְנוּחָתִי.
11.english: Wherefore I swore in My wrath, that they should not enter into My rest.' {P}

1.hebrew: שִׁירוּ לַיהוָה, שִׁיר חָדָשׁ;    שִׁירוּ לַיהוָה, כָּל-הָאָרֶץ.
1.english: O sing unto the LORD a new song; sing unto the LORD, all the earth.

2.hebrew: שִׁירוּ לַיהוָה, בָּרְכוּ שְׁמוֹ;    בַּשְּׂרוּ מִיּוֹם-לְיוֹם, יְשׁוּעָתוֹ.
2.english: Sing unto the LORD, bless His name; proclaim His salvation from day to day.

3.hebrew: סַפְּרוּ בַגּוֹיִם כְּבוֹדוֹ;    בְּכָל-הָעַמִּים, נִפְלְאוֹתָיו.
3.english: Declare His glory among the nations, His marvellous works among all the peoples.

4.hebrew: כִּי גָדוֹל יְהוָה וּמְהֻלָּל מְאֹד;    נוֹרָא הוּא, עַל-כָּל-אֱלֹהִים.
4.english: For great is the LORD, and highly to be praised; He is to be feared above all gods.

5.hebrew: כִּי, כָּל-אֱלֹהֵי הָעַמִּים אֱלִילִים;    וַיהוָה, שָׁמַיִם עָשָׂה.
5.english: For all the gods of the peoples are things of nought; but the LORD made the heavens.

6.hebrew: הוֹד-וְהָדָר לְפָנָיו;    עֹז וְתִפְאֶרֶת, בְּמִקְדָּשׁוֹ.
6.english: Honour and majesty are before Him; strength and beauty are in His sanctuary.

7.hebrew: הָבוּ לַיהוָה, מִשְׁפְּחוֹת עַמִּים;    הָבוּ לַיהוָה, כָּבוֹד וָעֹז.
7.english: Ascribe unto the LORD, ye kindreds of the peoples, ascribe unto the LORD glory and strength.

8.hebrew: הָבוּ לַיהוָה, כְּבוֹד שְׁמוֹ;    שְׂאוּ-מִנְחָה, וּבֹאוּ לְחַצְרוֹתָיו.
8.english: Ascribe unto the LORD the glory due unto His name; bring an offering, and come into His courts.

9.hebrew: הִשְׁתַּחֲווּ לַיהוָה, בְּהַדְרַת-קֹדֶשׁ;    חִילוּ מִפָּנָיו, כָּל-הָאָרֶץ.
9.english: O worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness; tremble before Him, all the earth.

10.hebrew: אִמְרוּ בַגּוֹיִם, יְהוָה מָלָךְ--    אַף-תִּכּוֹן תֵּבֵל, בַּל-תִּמּוֹט;יָדִין עַמִּים,    בְּמֵישָׁרִים.
10.english: Say among the nations: 'The LORD reigneth.' The world also is established that it cannot be moved; {N}He will judge the peoples with equity.

11.hebrew: יִשְׂמְחוּ הַשָּׁמַיִם, וְתָגֵל הָאָרֶץ;    יִרְעַם הַיָּם, וּמְלֹאוֹ.
11.english: Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice; let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof;

12.hebrew: יַעֲלֹז שָׂדַי, וְכָל-אֲשֶׁר-בּוֹ;    אָז יְרַנְּנוּ, כָּל-עֲצֵי-יָעַר.
12.english: Let the field exult; and all that is therein; then shall all the trees of the wood sing for joy;

13.hebrew: לִפְנֵי יְהוָה, כִּי בָא--    כִּי בָא, לִשְׁפֹּט הָאָרֶץ:יִשְׁפֹּט-תֵּבֵל בְּצֶדֶק;    וְעַמִּים, בֶּאֱמוּנָתוֹ.
13.english: Before the LORD, for He is come; for He is come to judge the earth; {N}He will judge the world with righteousness, and the peoples in His faithfulness. {P}

1.hebrew: יְהוָה מָלָךְ, תָּגֵל הָאָרֶץ;    יִשְׂמְחוּ, אִיִּים רַבִּים.
1.english: The LORD reigneth; let the earth rejoice; let the multitude of isles be glad.

2.hebrew: עָנָן וַעֲרָפֶל סְבִיבָיו;    צֶדֶק וּמִשְׁפָּט, מְכוֹן כִּסְאוֹ.
2.english: Clouds and darkness are round about Him; righteousness and justice are the foundation of His throne.

3.hebrew: אֵשׁ, לְפָנָיו תֵּלֵךְ;    וּתְלַהֵט סָבִיב צָרָיו.
3.english: A fire goeth before Him, and burneth up His adversaries round about.

4.hebrew: הֵאִירוּ בְרָקָיו תֵּבֵל;    רָאֲתָה וַתָּחֵל הָאָרֶץ.
4.english: His lightnings lighted up the world; the earth saw, and trembled.

5.hebrew: הָרִים--כַּדּוֹנַג, נָמַסּוּ מִלִּפְנֵי יְהוָה:    מִלִּפְנֵי, אֲדוֹן כָּל-הָאָרֶץ.
5.english: The mountains melted like wax at the presence of the LORD, at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.

6.hebrew: הִגִּידוּ הַשָּׁמַיִם צִדְקוֹ;    וְרָאוּ כָל-הָעַמִּים כְּבוֹדוֹ.
6.english: The heavens declared His righteousness, and all the peoples saw His glory.

7.hebrew: יֵבֹשׁוּ, כָּל-עֹבְדֵי פֶסֶל--    הַמִּתְהַלְלִים בָּאֱלִילִים;הִשְׁתַּחֲווּ-לוֹ,    כָּל-אֱלֹהִים.
7.english: Ashamed be all they that serve graven images, that boast themselves of things of nought; {N}bow down to Him, all ye gods.

8.hebrew: שָׁמְעָה וַתִּשְׂמַח, צִיּוֹן,    וַתָּגֵלְנָה, בְּנוֹת יְהוּדָה--לְמַעַן מִשְׁפָּטֶיךָ    יְהוָה.
8.english: Zion heard and was glad, and the daughters of Judah rejoiced; {N}because of Thy judgments, O LORD.

9.hebrew: כִּי-אַתָּה יְהוָה,    עֶלְיוֹן עַל-כָּל-הָאָרֶץ;מְאֹד נַעֲלֵיתָ,    עַל-כָּל-אֱלֹהִים.
9.english: For Thou, LORD, art most high above all the earth; {N}Thou art exalted far above all gods.

10.hebrew: אֹהֲבֵי יְהוָה,    שִׂנְאוּ-רָע:שֹׁמֵר, נַפְשׁוֹת חֲסִידָיו;    מִיַּד רְשָׁעִים, יַצִּילֵם.
10.english: O ye that love the LORD, hate evil; {N}He preserveth the souls of His saints; He delivered them out of the hand of the wicked.

11.hebrew: אוֹר, זָרֻעַ לַצַּדִּיק;    וּלְיִשְׁרֵי-לֵב שִׂמְחָה.
11.english: Light is sown for the righteous, and gladness for the upright in heart.

12.hebrew: שִׂמְחוּ צַדִּיקִים, בַּיהוָה;    וְהוֹדוּ, לְזֵכֶר קָדְשׁוֹ.
12.english: Be glad in the LORD, ye righteous; and give thanks to His holy name. {P}

1.hebrew: מִזְמוֹר, שִׁירוּ לַיהוָה שִׁיר חָדָשׁ--    כִּי-נִפְלָאוֹת עָשָׂה;הוֹשִׁיעָה-לּוֹ יְמִינוֹ,    וּזְרוֹעַ קָדְשׁוֹ.
1.english: A Psalm. O sing unto the LORD a new song; for He hath done marvellous things; {N}His right hand, and His holy arm, hath wrought salvation for Him.

2.hebrew: הוֹדִיעַ יְהוָה, יְשׁוּעָתוֹ;    לְעֵינֵי הַגּוֹיִם, גִּלָּה צִדְקָתוֹ.
2.english: The LORD hath made known His salvation; His righteousness hath He revealed in the sight of the nations.

3.hebrew: זָכַר חַסְדּוֹ, וֶאֱמוּנָתוֹ--    לְבֵית יִשְׂרָאֵל:רָאוּ כָל-אַפְסֵי-אָרֶץ--    אֵת, יְשׁוּעַת אֱלֹהֵינוּ.
3.english: He hath remembered His mercy and His faithfulness toward the house of Israel; {N}all the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.

4.hebrew: הָרִיעוּ לַיהוָה, כָּל-הָאָרֶץ;    פִּצְחוּ וְרַנְּנוּ וְזַמֵּרוּ.
4.english: Shout unto the LORD, all the earth; break forth and sing for joy, yea, sing praises.

5.hebrew: זַמְּרוּ לַיהוָה בְּכִנּוֹר;    בְּכִנּוֹר, וְקוֹל זִמְרָה.
5.english: Sing praises unto the LORD with the harp; with the harp and the voice of melody.

6.hebrew: בַּחֲצֹצְרוֹת, וְקוֹל שׁוֹפָר--    הָרִיעוּ, לִפְנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ יְהוָה.
6.english: With trumpets and sound of the horn shout ye before the King, the LORD.

7.hebrew: יִרְעַם הַיָּם, וּמְלֹאוֹ;    תֵּבֵל, וְיֹשְׁבֵי בָהּ.
7.english: Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof; the world, and they that dwell therein;

8.hebrew: נְהָרוֹת יִמְחֲאוּ-כָף;    יַחַד, הָרִים יְרַנֵּנוּ.
8.english: Let the floods clap their hands; let the mountains sing for joy together;

9.hebrew: לִפְנֵי יְהוָה--    כִּי בָא, לִשְׁפֹּט הָאָרֶץ:יִשְׁפֹּט-תֵּבֵל בְּצֶדֶק;    וְעַמִּים, בְּמֵישָׁרִים.
9.english: Before the LORD, for He is come to judge the earth; {N}He will judge the world with righteousness, and the peoples with equity. {P}

1.hebrew: יְהוָה מָלָךְ, יִרְגְּזוּ עַמִּים;    יֹשֵׁב כְּרוּבִים, תָּנוּט הָאָרֶץ.
1.english: The LORD reigneth; let the peoples tremble; He is enthroned upon the cherubim; let the earth quake.

2.hebrew: יְהוָה, בְּצִיּוֹן גָּדוֹל;    וְרָם הוּא, עַל-כָּל-הָעַמִּים.
2.english: The LORD is great in Zion; and He is high above all the peoples.

3.hebrew: יוֹדוּ שִׁמְךָ, גָּדוֹל וְנוֹרָא;    קָדוֹשׁ הוּא.
3.english: Let them praise Thy name as great and awful; Holy is He.

4.hebrew: וְעֹז מֶלֶךְ,    מִשְׁפָּט אָהֵב:אַתָּה, כּוֹנַנְתָּ מֵישָׁרִים;    מִשְׁפָּט וּצְדָקָה, בְּיַעֲקֹב אַתָּה עָשִׂיתָ.
4.english: The strength also of the king who loveth justice-- {N}Thou hast established equity, Thou hast executed justice and righteousness in Jacob.

5.hebrew: רוֹמְמוּ, יְהוָה אֱלֹהֵינוּ, וְהִשְׁתַּחֲווּ, לַהֲדֹם רַגְלָיו:    קָדוֹשׁ הוּא.
5.english: Exalt ye the LORD our God, and prostrate yourselves at His footstool; Holy is He.

6.hebrew: מֹשֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן, בְּכֹהֲנָיו,    וּשְׁמוּאֵל, בְּקֹרְאֵי שְׁמוֹ;קֹרִאים אֶל-יְהוָה,    וְהוּא יַעֲנֵם.
6.english: Moses and Aaron among His priests, and Samuel among them that call upon His name, {N}did call upon the LORD, and He answered them.

7.hebrew: בְּעַמּוּד עָנָן, יְדַבֵּר אֲלֵיהֶם;    שָׁמְרוּ עֵדֹתָיו, וְחֹק נָתַן-לָמוֹ.
7.english: He spoke unto them in the pillar of cloud; they kept His testimonies, and the statute that He gave them.

8.hebrew: יְהוָה אֱלֹהֵינוּ,    אַתָּה עֲנִיתָם:אֵל נֹשֵׂא, הָיִיתָ לָהֶם;    וְנֹקֵם, עַל-עֲלִילוֹתָם.
8.english: O LORD our God, Thou didst answer them; {N}a forgiving God wast Thou unto them, though Thou tookest vengeance of their misdeeds.

9.hebrew: רוֹמְמוּ, יְהוָה אֱלֹהֵינוּ,    וְהִשְׁתַּחֲווּ, לְהַר קָדְשׁוֹ:כִּי-קָדוֹשׁ,    יְהוָה אֱלֹהֵינוּ.
9.english: Exalt ye the LORD our God, and worship at His holy hill; {N}for the LORD our God is holy. {P}

1.hebrew: מִזְמוֹר לְתוֹדָה:    הָרִיעוּ לַיהוָה, כָּל-הָאָרֶץ.
1.english: A Psalm of thanksgiving. Shout unto the LORD, all the earth.

2.hebrew: עִבְדוּ אֶת-יְהוָה בְּשִׂמְחָה;    בֹּאוּ לְפָנָיו, בִּרְנָנָה.
2.english: Serve the LORD with gladness; come before His presence with singing.

3.hebrew: דְּעוּ--    כִּי יְהוָה, הוּא אֱלֹהִים:הוּא-עָשָׂנוּ, ולא (וְלוֹ) אֲנַחְנוּ--    עַמּוֹ, וְצֹאן מַרְעִיתוֹ.
3.english: Know ye that the LORD He is God; {N}it is He that hath made us, and we are His, His people, and the flock of His pasture.

4.hebrew: בֹּאוּ שְׁעָרָיו, בְּתוֹדָה--חֲצֵרֹתָיו בִּתְהִלָּה;    הוֹדוּ-לוֹ, בָּרְכוּ שְׁמוֹ.
4.english: Enter into His gates with thanksgiving, and into His courts with praise; give thanks unto Him, and bless His name.

5.hebrew: כִּי-טוֹב יְהוָה, לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ;    וְעַד-דֹּר וָדֹר, אֱמוּנָתוֹ.
5.english: For the LORD is good; His mercy endureth for ever; and His faithfulness unto all generations. {P}

1.hebrew: לְדָוִד, מִזְמוֹר:    חֶסֶד-וּמִשְׁפָּט אָשִׁירָה; לְךָ יְהוָה אֲזַמֵּרָה.
1.english: A Psalm of David. I will sing of mercy and justice; unto Thee, O LORD, will I sing praises.

2.hebrew: אַשְׂכִּילָה, בְּדֶרֶךְ תָּמִים--    מָתַי, תָּבוֹא אֵלָי;אֶתְהַלֵּךְ בְּתָם-לְבָבִי,    בְּקֶרֶב בֵּיתִי.
2.english: I will give heed unto the way of integrity; oh when wilt Thou come unto me? {N}I will walk within my house in the integrity of my heart.

3.hebrew: לֹא-אָשִׁית, לְנֶגֶד עֵינַי--    דְּבַר-בְּלִיָּעַל:עֲשֹׂה-סֵטִים שָׂנֵאתִי;    לֹא יִדְבַּק בִּי.
3.english: I will set no base thing before mine eyes; {N}I hate the doing of things crooked; it shall not cleave unto me.

4.hebrew: לֵבָב עִקֵּשׁ, יָסוּר מִמֶּנִּי;    רָע, לֹא אֵדָע.
4.english: A perverse heart shall depart from me; I will know no evil thing.

5.hebrew: מלושני (מְלָשְׁנִי) בַסֵּתֶר, רֵעֵהוּ--    אוֹתוֹ אַצְמִית:גְּבַהּ-עֵינַיִם, וּרְחַב לֵבָב--    אֹתוֹ, לֹא אוּכָל.
5.english: Whoso slandereth his neighbour in secret, him will I destroy; {N}whoso is haughty of eye and proud of heart, him will I not suffer.

6.hebrew: עֵינַי, בְּנֶאֶמְנֵי-אֶרֶץ--    לָשֶׁבֶת עִמָּדִי:הֹלֵךְ, בְּדֶרֶךְ תָּמִים--    הוּא, יְשָׁרְתֵנִי.
6.english: Mine eyes are upon the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me; {N}he that walketh in a way of integrity, he shall minister unto me.

7.hebrew: לֹא-יֵשֵׁב, בְּקֶרֶב בֵּיתִי--    עֹשֵׂה רְמִיָּה:דֹּבֵר שְׁקָרִים--    לֹא-יִכּוֹן, לְנֶגֶד עֵינָי.
7.english: He that worketh deceit shall not dwell within my house; {N}he that speaketh falsehood shall not be established before mine eyes.

8.hebrew: לַבְּקָרִים,    אַצְמִית כָּל-רִשְׁעֵי-אָרֶץ;לְהַכְרִית מֵעִיר-יְהוָה,    כָּל-פֹּעֲלֵי אָוֶן.
8.english: Morning by morning will I destroy all the wicked of the land; {N}to cut off all the workers of iniquity from the city of the LORD. {P}

1.hebrew: תְּפִלָּה, לְעָנִי כִי-יַעֲטֹף--    וְלִפְנֵי יְהוָה, יִשְׁפֹּךְ שִׂיחוֹ.
1.english: A Prayer of the afflicted, when he fainteth, and poureth out his complaint before the LORD.

2.hebrew: יְהוָה, שִׁמְעָה תְפִלָּתִי;    וְשַׁוְעָתִי, אֵלֶיךָ תָבוֹא.
2.english: O LORD, hear my prayer, and let my cry come unto Thee.

3.hebrew: אַל-תַּסְתֵּר פָּנֶיךָ, מִמֶּנִּי--    בְּיוֹם צַר-לִי:הַטֵּה-אֵלַי אָזְנֶךָ;    בְּיוֹם אֶקְרָא, מַהֵר עֲנֵנִי.
3.english: Hide not Thy face from me in the day of my distress; {N}incline Thine ear unto me; in the day when I call answer me speedily.

4.hebrew: כִּי-כָלוּ בְעָשָׁן יָמָי;    וְעַצְמוֹתַי, כְּמוֹקֵד נִחָרוּ.
4.english: For my days are consumed like smoke, and my bones are burned as a hearth.

5.hebrew: הוּכָּה-כָעֵשֶׂב וַיִּבַשׁ לִבִּי:    כִּי-שָׁכַחְתִּי, מֵאֲכֹל לַחְמִי.
5.english: My heart is smitten like grass, and withered; for I forget to eat my bread.

6.hebrew: מִקּוֹל אַנְחָתִי--    דָּבְקָה עַצְמִי, לִבְשָׂרִי.
6.english: By reason of the voice of my sighing my bones cleave to my flesh.

7.hebrew: דָּמִיתִי, לִקְאַת מִדְבָּר;    הָיִיתִי, כְּכוֹס חֳרָבוֹת.
7.english: I am like a pelican of the wilderness; I am become as an owl of the waste places.

8.hebrew: שָׁקַדְתִּי וָאֶהְיֶה--    כְּצִפּוֹר, בּוֹדֵד עַל-גָּג.
8.english: I watch, and am become like a sparrow that is alone upon the housetop.

9.hebrew: כָּל-הַיּוֹם, חֵרְפוּנִי אוֹיְבָי;    מְהוֹלָלַי, בִּי נִשְׁבָּעוּ.
9.english: Mine enemies taunt me all the day; they that are mad against me do curse by me.

10.hebrew: כִּי-אֵפֶר, כַּלֶּחֶם אָכָלְתִּי;    וְשִׁקֻּוַי, בִּבְכִי מָסָכְתִּי.
10.english: For I have eaten ashes like bread, and mingled my drink with weeping,

11.hebrew: מִפְּנֵי-זַעַמְךָ וְקִצְפֶּךָ--    כִּי נְשָׂאתַנִי, וַתַּשְׁלִיכֵנִי.
11.english: Because of Thine indignation and Thy wrath; for Thou hast taken me up, and cast me away.

12.hebrew: יָמַי, כְּצֵל נָטוּי;    וַאֲנִי, כָּעֵשֶׂב אִיבָשׁ.
12.english: My days are like a lengthening shadow; and I am withered like grass.

13.hebrew: וְאַתָּה יְהוָה, לְעוֹלָם תֵּשֵׁב;    וְזִכְרְךָ, לְדֹר וָדֹר.
13.english: But Thou, O LORD, sittest enthroned for ever; and Thy name is unto all generations.

14.hebrew: אַתָּה תָקוּם, תְּרַחֵם צִיּוֹן:    כִּי-עֵת לְחֶנְנָהּ, כִּי-בָא מוֹעֵד.
14.english: Thou wilt arise, and have compassion upon Zion; for it is time to be gracious unto her, for the appointed time is come.

15.hebrew: כִּי-רָצוּ עֲבָדֶיךָ, אֶת-אֲבָנֶיהָ;    וְאֶת-עֲפָרָהּ, יְחֹנֵנוּ.
15.english: For Thy servants take pleasure in her stones, and love her dust.

16.hebrew: וְיִירְאוּ גוֹיִם, אֶת-שֵׁם יְהוָה;    וְכָל-מַלְכֵי הָאָרֶץ, אֶת-כְּבוֹדֶךָ.
16.english: So the nations will fear the name of the LORD, and all the kings of the earth Thy glory;

17.hebrew: כִּי-בָנָה יְהוָה צִיּוֹן--    נִרְאָה, בִּכְבוֹדוֹ.
17.english: When the LORD hath built up Zion, when He hath appeared in His glory;

18.hebrew: פָּנָה, אֶל-תְּפִלַּת הָעַרְעָר;    וְלֹא-בָזָה, אֶת-תְּפִלָּתָם.
18.english: When He hath regarded the prayer of the destitute, and hath not despised their prayer.

19.hebrew: תִּכָּתֶב זֹאת, לְדוֹר אַחֲרוֹן;    וְעַם נִבְרָא, יְהַלֶּל-יָהּ.
19.english: This shall be written for the generation to come; and a people which shall be created shall praise the LORD.

20.hebrew: כִּי-הִשְׁקִיף, מִמְּרוֹם קָדְשׁוֹ;    יְהוָה, מִשָּׁמַיִם אֶל-אֶרֶץ הִבִּיט.
20.english: For He hath looked down from the height of His sanctuary; from heaven did the LORD behold the earth;

21.hebrew: לִשְׁמֹעַ, אֶנְקַת אָסִיר;    לְפַתֵּחַ, בְּנֵי תְמוּתָה.
21.english: To hear the groaning of the prisoner; to loose those that are appointed to death;

22.hebrew: לְסַפֵּר בְּצִיּוֹן, שֵׁם יְהוָה;    וּתְהִלָּתוֹ, בִּירוּשָׁלִָם.
22.english: That men may tell of the name of the LORD in Zion, and His praise in Jerusalem;

23.hebrew: בְּהִקָּבֵץ עַמִּים יַחְדָּו;    וּמַמְלָכוֹת, לַעֲבֹד אֶת-יְהוָה.
23.english: When the peoples are gathered together, and the kingdoms, to serve the LORD.

24.english: He weakened my strength in the way; He shortened my days.

25.hebrew: אֹמַר--אֵלִי, אַל תַּעֲלֵנִי בַּחֲצִי יָמָי:    בְּדוֹר דּוֹרִים שְׁנוֹתֶיךָ.
25.english: I say: 'O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days, Thou whose years endure throughout all generations.

26.hebrew: לְפָנִים, הָאָרֶץ יָסַדְתָּ;    וּמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיךָ שָׁמָיִם.
26.english: Of old Thou didst lay the foundation of the earth; and the heavens are the work of Thy hands.

27.hebrew: הֵמָּה, יֹאבֵדוּ--    וְאַתָּה תַעֲמֹד:וְכֻלָּם, כַּבֶּגֶד יִבְלוּ;    כַּלְּבוּשׁ תַּחֲלִיפֵם וְיַחֲלֹפוּ.
27.english: They shall perish, but Thou shalt endure; {N}yea, all of them shall wax old like a garment; as a vesture shalt Thou change them, and they shall pass away;

28.english: But Thou art the selfsame, and Thy years shall have no end.

29.english: The children of Thy servants shall dwell securely, and their seed shall be established before Thee.' {P}

1.hebrew: ††мјг»еƒг:† бћ»шјлƒй р«фјщ—ƒй, а∆ъ-йјде»д; †† ејл»м-чјш»б«й, а∆ъ-щ—≈н ч»гјщ—е….
1.english: [A Psalm] of David. Bless the LORD, O my soul; and all that is within me, bless His holy name.

2.hebrew: ††бћ»шјлƒй р«фјщ—ƒй, а∆ъ-йјде»д; †† еја«м-ъћƒщ—јлћјзƒй, лћ»м-вћјоећм»йе.
2.english: Bless the LORD, O my soul, and forget not all His benefits;

3.hebrew: ††д«сћ…м≈з« мјл»м-т¬е р≈лƒй; †† д»ш…ф≈а, мјл»м-ъћ«з¬мећа»йјлƒй.
3.english: Who forgiveth all thine iniquity; who healeth all thy diseases;

4.hebrew: ††д«вће…а≈м оƒщћ—«з«ъ з«йћ»йјлƒй; †† д«ојт«ићјш≈лƒй, з∆с∆г ејш«з¬оƒйн.
4.english: Who redeemeth thy life from the pit; who encompasseth thee with lovingkindness and tender mercies;

5.hebrew: ††д«оћ«щ“јбћƒйт« бћ«иће…б т∆гјй≈кј; †† ъћƒъјз«гћ≈щ— лћ«рћ∆щ—∆ш рјтећш»йјлƒй.
5.english: Who satisfieth thine old age with good things; so that thy youth is renewed like the eagle.

6.hebrew: ††т…щ“≈д цјг»че…ъ йјде»д; †† ећоƒщ—јфћ»иƒйн, мјл»м-т¬щ—ећчƒйн.
6.english: The LORD executeth righteousness, and acts of justice for all that are oppressed.

7.hebrew: ††йе…гƒйт« гћјш»л»йе мјо…щ—∆д; †† мƒбјр≈й йƒщ“јш»а≈м, т¬мƒйме…ъ»йе.
7.english: He made known His ways unto Moses, His doings unto the children of Israel.

8.hebrew: ††ш«зећн ејз«рћећп йјде»д; †† а∆ш∆кј а«фћ«йƒн ејш«б-з»с∆г.
8.english: The LORD is full of compassion and gracious, slow to anger, and plenteous in mercy.

9.hebrew: ††м…а-м»р∆ц«з й»шƒйб; †† ејм…а мјте…м»н йƒиће…ш.
9.english: He will not always contend; neither will He keep His anger for ever.

10.hebrew: ††м…а л«з¬и»а≈йрећ, т»щ“»д м»рећ; †† ејм…а л«т¬е р…ъ≈йрећ, вћ»о«м т»м≈йрећ.
10.english: He hath not dealt with us after our sins, nor requited us according to our iniquities.

11.hebrew: ††лћƒй лƒвјб…дћ« щ—»о«йƒн, т«м-д»а»ш∆х-- †† вћ»б«ш з«сјгће…, т«м-йјш≈а»йе.
11.english: For as the heaven is high above the earth, so great is His mercy toward them that fear Him.

12.hebrew: ††лћƒшјз…ч оƒжјш»з, оƒоћ«т¬ш»б-- †† дƒшјзƒйч оƒоћ∆рћећ, а∆ъ-фћјщ—»т≈йрећ.
12.english: As far as the east is from the west, so far hath He removed our transgressions from us.

13.hebrew: ††лћјш«з≈н а»б, т«м-бћ»рƒйн-- †† шƒз«н йјде»д, т«м-йјш≈а»йе.
13.english: Like as a father hath compassion upon his children, so hath the LORD compassion upon them that fear Him.

14.hebrew: ††лћƒй-дећа, й»г«т йƒцјш≈рећ; †† ж»лећш, лћƒй-т»ф»ш а¬р»зјрећ.
14.english: For He knoweth our frame; He remembereth that we are dust.

15.hebrew: ††аЅре…щ—, лћ∆з»цƒйш й»о»йе; †† лћјцƒйх д«щћ“»г∆д, лћ≈п й»цƒйх.
15.english: As for man, his days are as grass; as a flower of the field, so he flourisheth.

16.hebrew: ††лћƒй шећз« т»бјш»д-бће… еја≈йр∆рћећ; †† ејм…а-й«лћƒйш∆рћећ те…г ојче…ое….
16.english: For the wind passeth over it, and it is gone; and the place thereof knoweth it no more.

17.hebrew: ††ејз∆с∆г йјде»д, о≈те…м»н ејт«г-те…м»н-- †† т«м-йјш≈а»йе;ејцƒгјч»ъе…, †† мƒбјр≈й б»рƒйн.
17.english: But the mercy of the LORD is from everlasting to everlasting upon them that fear Him, {N}and His righteousness unto children's children;

18.hebrew: ††мјщ—…ојш≈й бјшƒйъе…; †† ећмјж…лјш≈й фƒчћЋг»йе, м«т¬щ“е…ъ»н.
18.english: To such as keep His covenant, and to those that remember His precepts to do them.

19.hebrew: ††йјде»д--бћ«щћ—»о«йƒн, д≈лƒйп лћƒсјае…; †† ећо«мјлећъе…, бћ«лћ…м о»щ—»м»д.
19.english: The LORD hath established His throne in the heavens; and His kingdom ruleth over all.

20.hebrew: ††бћ»шјлећ йјде»д, †† о«мја»л»йе:вћƒбћ…ш≈й л…з«, т…щ“≈й гјб»ше…; †† мƒщ—јо…т«, бћјче…м гћјб»ше….
20.english: Bless the LORD, ye angels of His, {N}ye mighty in strength, that fulfil His word, hearkening unto the voice of His word.

21.hebrew: ††бћ»шјлећ йјде»д, лћ»м-цјб»а»йе-- †† ојщ—»шјъ»йе, т…щ“≈й шјце…ре….
21.english: Bless the LORD, all ye His hosts; ye ministers of His, that do His pleasure.

22.hebrew: ††бћ»шјлећ йјде»д, лћ»м-о«т¬щ“»йе-- †† бћјл»м-ојч…ое…ъ о∆ојщ—«мјъће…;бћ»шјлƒй р«фјщ—ƒй, †† а∆ъ-йјде»д.
22.english: Bless the LORD, all ye His works, in all places of His dominion; {N}bless the LORD, O my soul. {P}

1.hebrew: בָּרְכִי נַפְשִׁי,    אֶת-יְהוָה:יְהוָה אֱלֹהַי, גָּדַלְתָּ מְּאֹד;    הוֹד וְהָדָר לָבָשְׁתָּ.
1.english: Bless the LORD, O my soul. {N}O LORD my God, Thou art very great; Thou art clothed with glory and majesty.

2.hebrew: עֹטֶה-אוֹר, כַּשַּׂלְמָה;    נוֹטֶה שָׁמַיִם, כַּיְרִיעָה.
2.english: Who coverest Thyself with light as with a garment, who stretchest out the heavens like a curtain;

3.hebrew: הַמְקָרֶה בַמַּיִם,    עֲלִיּוֹתָיו:הַשָּׂם-עָבִים רְכוּבוֹ;    הַמְהַלֵּךְ, עַל-כַּנְפֵי-רוּחַ.
3.english: Who layest the beams of Thine upper chambers in the waters, {N}who makest the clouds Thy chariot, who walkest upon the wings of the wind;

4.hebrew: עֹשֶׂה מַלְאָכָיו רוּחוֹת;    מְשָׁרְתָיו, אֵשׁ לֹהֵט.
4.english: Who makest winds Thy messengers, the flaming fire Thy ministers.

5.hebrew: יָסַד-אֶרֶץ, עַל-מְכוֹנֶיהָ;    בַּל-תִּמּוֹט, עוֹלָם וָעֶד.
5.english: Who didst establish the earth upon its foundations, that it should not be moved for ever and ever;

6.hebrew: תְּהוֹם, כַּלְּבוּשׁ כִּסִּיתוֹ;    עַל-הָרִים, יַעַמְדוּ מָיִם.
6.english: Thou didst cover it with the deep as with a vesture; the waters stood above the mountains.

7.hebrew: מִן-גַּעֲרָתְךָ יְנוּסוּן;    מִן-קוֹל רַעַמְךָ, יֵחָפֵזוּן.
7.english: At Thy rebuke they fled, at the voice of Thy thunder they hasted away--

8.hebrew: יַעֲלוּ הָרִים, יֵרְדוּ בְקָעוֹת--    אֶל-מְקוֹם, זֶה יָסַדְתָּ לָהֶם.
8.english: The mountains rose, the valleys sank down--unto the place which Thou hadst founded for them;

9.hebrew: גְּבוּל-שַׂמְתָּ, בַּל-יַעֲבֹרוּן;    בַּל-יְשֻׁבוּן, לְכַסּוֹת הָאָרֶץ.
9.english: Thou didst set a bound which they should not pass over, that they might not return to cover the earth.

10.hebrew: הַמְשַׁלֵּחַ מַעְיָנִים, בַּנְּחָלִים;    בֵּין הָרִים, יְהַלֵּכוּן.
10.english: Who sendest forth springs into the valleys; they run between the mountains;

11.hebrew: יַשְׁקוּ, כָּל-חַיְתוֹ שָׂדָי;    יִשְׁבְּרוּ פְרָאִים צְמָאָם.
11.english: They give drink to every beast of the field, the wild asses quench their thirst.

12.hebrew: עֲלֵיהֶם, עוֹף-הַשָּׁמַיִם יִשְׁכּוֹן;    מִבֵּין עֳפָאיִם, יִתְּנוּ-קוֹל.
12.english: Beside them dwell the fowl of the heaven, from among the branches they sing.

13.hebrew: מַשְׁקֶה הָרִים, מֵעֲלִיּוֹתָיו;    מִפְּרִי מַעֲשֶׂיךָ, תִּשְׂבַּע הָאָרֶץ.
13.english: Who waterest the mountains from Thine upper chambers; the earth is full of the fruit of Thy works.

14.hebrew: מַצְמִיחַ חָצִיר, לַבְּהֵמָה,    וְעֵשֶׂב, לַעֲבֹדַת הָאָדָם;לְהוֹצִיא לֶחֶם,    מִן-הָאָרֶץ.
14.english: Who causeth the grass to spring up for the cattle, and herb for the service of man; {N}to bring forth bread out of the earth,

15.hebrew: וְיַיִן, יְשַׂמַּח לְבַב-אֱנוֹשׁ--    לְהַצְהִיל פָּנִים מִשָּׁמֶן;וְלֶחֶם,    לְבַב-אֱנוֹשׁ יִסְעָד.
15.english: And wine that maketh glad the heart of man, making the face brighter than oil, {N}and bread that stayeth man's heart.

16.hebrew: יִשְׂבְּעוּ, עֲצֵי יְהוָה--    אַרְזֵי לְבָנוֹן, אֲשֶׁר נָטָע.
16.english: The trees of the LORD have their fill, the cedars of Lebanon, which He hath planted;

17.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר-שָׁם, צִפֳּרִים יְקַנֵּנוּ;    חֲסִידָה, בְּרוֹשִׁים בֵּיתָהּ.
17.english: Wherein the birds make their nests; as for the stork, the fir-trees are her house.

18.hebrew: הָרִים הַגְּבֹהִים, לַיְּעֵלִים;    סְלָעִים, מַחְסֶה לַשְׁפַנִּים.
18.english: The high mountains are for the wild goats; the rocks are a refuge for the conies.

19.hebrew: עָשָׂה יָרֵחַ, לְמוֹעֲדִים;    שֶׁמֶשׁ, יָדַע מְבוֹאוֹ.
19.english: Who appointedst the moon for seasons; the sun knoweth his going down.

20.hebrew: תָּשֶׁת-חֹשֶׁךְ, וִיהִי לָיְלָה--    בּוֹ-תִרְמֹשׂ, כָּל-חַיְתוֹ-יָעַר.
20.english: Thou makest darkness, and it is night, wherein all the beasts of the forest do creep forth.

21.hebrew: הַכְּפִירִים, שֹׁאֲגִים לַטָּרֶף;    וּלְבַקֵּשׁ מֵאֵל, אָכְלָם.
21.english: The young lions roar after their prey, and seek their food from God.

22.hebrew: תִּזְרַח הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ, יֵאָסֵפוּן;    וְאֶל-מְעוֹנֹתָם, יִרְבָּצוּן.
22.english: The sun ariseth, they slink away, and couch in their dens.

23.hebrew: יֵצֵא אָדָם לְפָעֳלוֹ;    וְלַעֲבֹדָתוֹ עֲדֵי-עָרֶב.
23.english: Man goeth forth unto his work and to his labour until the evening.

24.hebrew: מָה-רַבּוּ מַעֲשֶׂיךָ, יְהוָה--    כֻּלָּם, בְּחָכְמָה עָשִׂיתָ;מָלְאָה הָאָרֶץ,    קִנְיָנֶךָ.
24.english: How manifold are Thy works, O LORD! In wisdom hast Thou made them all; {N}the earth is full of Thy creatures.

25.hebrew: זֶה, הַיָּם גָּדוֹל--    וּרְחַב יָדָיִם:שָׁם-רֶמֶשׂ, וְאֵין מִסְפָּר;    חַיּוֹת קְטַנּוֹת, עִם-גְּדֹלוֹת.
25.english: Yonder sea, great and wide, {N}therein are creeping things innumerable, living creatures, both small and great.

26.hebrew: שָׁם, אֳנִיּוֹת יְהַלֵּכוּן;    לִוְיָתָן, זֶה-יָצַרְתָּ לְשַׂחֶק-בּוֹ.
26.english: There go the ships; there is leviathan, whom Thou hast formed to sport therein.

27.hebrew: כֻּלָּם, אֵלֶיךָ יְשַׂבֵּרוּן--    לָתֵת אָכְלָם בְּעִתּוֹ.
27.english: All of them wait for Thee, that Thou mayest give them their food in due season.

28.hebrew: תִּתֵּן לָהֶם, יִלְקֹטוּן;    תִּפְתַּח יָדְךָ, יִשְׂבְּעוּן טוֹב.
28.english: Thou givest it unto them, they gather it; Thou openest Thy hand, they are satisfied with good.

29.hebrew: תַּסְתִּיר פָּנֶיךָ,    יִבָּהֵלוּן:תֹּסֵף רוּחָם, יִגְוָעוּן;    וְאֶל-עֲפָרָם יְשׁוּבוּן.
29.english: Thou hidest Thy face, they vanish; {N}Thou withdrawest their breath, they perish, and return to their dust.

30.hebrew: תְּשַׁלַּח רוּחֲךָ, יִבָּרֵאוּן;    וּתְחַדֵּשׁ, פְּנֵי אֲדָמָה.
30.english: Thou sendest forth Thy spirit, they are created; and Thou renewest the face of the earth.

31.hebrew: יְהִי כְבוֹד יְהוָה לְעוֹלָם;    יִשְׂמַח יְהוָה בְּמַעֲשָׂיו.
31.english: May the glory of the LORD endure for ever; let the LORD rejoice in His works!

32.hebrew: הַמַּבִּיט לָאָרֶץ, וַתִּרְעָד;    יִגַּע בֶּהָרִים וְיֶעֱשָׁנוּ.
32.english: Who looketh on the earth, and it trembleth; He toucheth the mountains, and they smoke.

33.hebrew: אָשִׁירָה לַיהוָה בְּחַיָּי;    אֲזַמְּרָה לֵאלֹהַי בְּעוֹדִי.
33.english: I will sing unto the LORD as long as I live; I will sing praise to my God while I have any being.

34.hebrew: יֶעֱרַב עָלָיו שִׂיחִי;    אָנֹכִי, אֶשְׂמַח בַּיהוָה.
34.english: Let my musing be sweet unto Him; as for me, I will rejoice in the LORD.

35.hebrew: יִתַּמּוּ חַטָּאִים מִן-הָאָרֶץ,    וּרְשָׁעִים עוֹד אֵינָם--בָּרְכִי נַפְשִׁי,    אֶת-יְהוָה;הַלְלוּ-יָהּ.
35.english: Let sinners cease out of the earth, and let the wicked be no more. {N}Bless the LORD, O my soul. {N}Hallelujah.

1.hebrew: הוֹדוּ לַיהוָה, קִרְאוּ בִשְׁמוֹ;    הוֹדִיעוּ בָעַמִּים, עֲלִילוֹתָיו.
1.english: O give thanks unto the LORD, call upon His name; make known His doings among the peoples.

2.hebrew: שִׁירוּ-לוֹ, זַמְּרוּ-לוֹ;    שִׂיחוּ, בְּכָל-נִפְלְאוֹתָיו.
2.english: Sing unto Him, sing praises unto Him; speak ye of all His marvellous works.

3.hebrew: הִתְהַלְלוּ, בְּשֵׁם קָדְשׁוֹ;    יִשְׂמַח, לֵב מְבַקְשֵׁי יְהוָה.
3.english: Glory ye in His holy name; let the heart of them rejoice that seek the LORD.

4.hebrew: דִּרְשׁוּ יְהוָה וְעֻזּוֹ;    בַּקְּשׁוּ פָנָיו תָּמִיד.
4.english: Seek ye the LORD and His strength; seek His face continually.

5.hebrew: זִכְרוּ--נִפְלְאוֹתָיו אֲשֶׁר-עָשָׂה;    מֹפְתָיו, וּמִשְׁפְּטֵי-פִיו.
5.english: Remember His marvellous works that He hath done, His wonders, and the judgments of His mouth;

6.hebrew: זֶרַע, אַבְרָהָם עַבְדּוֹ:    בְּנֵי יַעֲקֹב בְּחִירָיו.
6.english: O ye seed of Abraham His servant, ye children of Jacob, His chosen ones.

7.hebrew: הוּא, יְהוָה אֱלֹהֵינוּ;    בְּכָל-הָאָרֶץ, מִשְׁפָּטָיו.
7.english: He is the LORD our God; His judgments are in all the earth.

8.hebrew: זָכַר לְעוֹלָם בְּרִיתוֹ;    דָּבָר צִוָּה, לְאֶלֶף דּוֹר.
8.english: He hath remembered His covenant for ever, the word which He commanded to a thousand generations;

9.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר כָּרַת, אֶת-אַבְרָהָם;    וּשְׁבוּעָתוֹ לְיִשְׂחָק.
9.english: [The covenant] which He made with Abraham, and His oath unto Isaac;

10.hebrew: וַיַּעֲמִידֶהָ לְיַעֲקֹב לְחֹק;    לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, בְּרִית עוֹלָם.
10.english: And He established it unto Jacob for a statute, to Israel for an everlasting covenant;

11.hebrew: לֵאמֹר--לְךָ, אֶתֵּן אֶת-אֶרֶץ-כְּנָעַן:    חֶבֶל, נַחֲלַתְכֶם.
11.english: Saying: 'Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance.'

12.hebrew: בִּהְיוֹתָם, מְתֵי מִסְפָּר;    כִּמְעַט, וְגָרִים בָּהּ.
12.english: When they were but a few men in number. Yea, very few, and sojourners in it,

13.hebrew: וַיִּתְהַלְּכוּ, מִגּוֹי אֶל-גּוֹי;    מִמַּמְלָכָה, אֶל-עַם אַחֵר.
13.english: And when they went about from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another people,

14.hebrew: לֹא-הִנִּיחַ אָדָם לְעָשְׁקָם;    וַיּוֹכַח עֲלֵיהֶם מְלָכִים.
14.english: He suffered no man to do them wrong, yea, for their sake He reproved kings:

15.hebrew: אַל-תִּגְּעוּ בִמְשִׁיחָי;    וְלִנְבִיאַי, אַל-תָּרֵעוּ.
15.english: 'Touch not Mine anointed ones, and do My prophets no harm.'

16.hebrew: וַיִּקְרָא רָעָב, עַל-הָאָרֶץ;    כָּל-מַטֵּה-לֶחֶם שָׁבָר.
16.english: And He called a famine upon the land; He broke the whole staff of bread.

17.hebrew: שָׁלַח לִפְנֵיהֶם אִישׁ;    לְעֶבֶד, נִמְכַּר יוֹסֵף.
17.english: He sent a man before them; Joseph was sold for a servant;

18.hebrew: עִנּוּ בַכֶּבֶל רגליו (רַגְלוֹ);    בַּרְזֶל, בָּאָה נַפְשׁוֹ.
18.english: His feet they hurt with fetters, his person was laid in iron;

19.hebrew: עַד-עֵת בֹּא-דְבָרוֹ--    אִמְרַת יְהוָה צְרָפָתְהוּ.
19.english: Until the time that his word came to pass, the word of the LORD tested him.

20.hebrew: שָׁלַח מֶלֶךְ, וַיַתִּירֵהוּ;    מֹשֵׁל עַמִּים, וַיְפַתְּחֵהוּ.
20.english: The king sent and loosed him; even the ruler of the peoples, and set him free.

21.hebrew: שָׂמוֹ אָדוֹן לְבֵיתוֹ;    וּמֹשֵׁל, בְּכָל-קִנְיָנוֹ.
21.english: He made him lord of his house, and ruler of all his possessions;

22.hebrew: לֶאְסֹר שָׂרָיו בְּנַפְשׁוֹ;    וּזְקֵנָיו יְחַכֵּם.
22.english: To bind his princes at his pleasure, and teach his elders wisdom.

23.hebrew: וַיָּבֹא יִשְׂרָאֵל מִצְרָיִם;    וְיַעֲקֹב, גָּר בְּאֶרֶץ-חָם.
23.english: Israel also came into Egypt; and Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.

24.english: And He increased His people greatly, and made them too mighty for their adversaries.

25.hebrew: הָפַךְ לִבָּם, לִשְׂנֹא עַמּוֹ;    לְהִתְנַכֵּל, בַּעֲבָדָיו.
25.english: He turned their heart to hate His people, to deal craftily with His servants.

26.hebrew: שָׁלַח, מֹשֶׁה עַבְדּוֹ;    אַהֲרֹן, אֲשֶׁר בָּחַר-בּוֹ.
26.english: He sent Moses His servant, and Aaron whom He had chosen.

27.hebrew: שָׂמוּ-בָם, דִּבְרֵי אֹתוֹתָיו;    וּמֹפְתִים, בְּאֶרֶץ חָם.
27.english: They wrought among them His manifold signs, and wonders in the land of Ham.

28.english: He sent darkness, and it was dark; and they rebelled not against His word.

29.english: He turned their waters into blood, and slew their fish.

30.english: Their land swarmed with frogs, in the chambers of their kings.

31.english: He spoke, and there came swarms of flies, and gnats in all their borders.

32.hebrew: נָתַן גִּשְׁמֵיהֶם בָּרָד;    אֵשׁ לֶהָבוֹת בְּאַרְצָם.
32.english: He gave them hail for rain, and flaming fire in their land.

33.hebrew: וַיַּךְ גַּפְנָם, וּתְאֵנָתָם;    וַיְשַׁבֵּר, עֵץ גְּבוּלָם.
33.english: He smote their vines also and their fig-trees; and broke the trees of their borders.

34.hebrew: אָמַר, וַיָּבֹא אַרְבֶּה;    וְיֶלֶק, וְאֵין מִסְפָּר.
34.english: He spoke, and the locust came, and the canker-worm without number,

35.hebrew: וַיֹּאכַל כָּל-עֵשֶׂב בְּאַרְצָם;    וַיֹּאכַל, פְּרִי אַדְמָתָם.
35.english: And did eat up every herb in their land, and did eat up the fruit of their ground.

36.english: He smote also all the first-born in their land, the first-fruits of all their strength.

37.hebrew: וַיּוֹצִיאֵם, בְּכֶסֶף וְזָהָב;    וְאֵין בִּשְׁבָטָיו כּוֹשֵׁל.
37.english: And He brought them forth with silver and gold; and there was none that stumbled among His tribes.

38.hebrew: שָׂמַח מִצְרַיִם בְּצֵאתָם:    כִּי-נָפַל פַּחְדָּם עֲלֵיהֶם.
38.english: Egypt was glad when they departed; for the fear of them had fallen upon them.

39.hebrew: פָּרַשׂ עָנָן לְמָסָךְ;    וְאֵשׁ, לְהָאִיר לָיְלָה.
39.english: He spread a cloud for a screen; and fire to give light in the night.

40.hebrew: שָׁאַל, וַיָּבֵא שְׂלָו;    וְלֶחֶם שָׁמַיִם, יַשְׂבִּיעֵם.
40.english: They asked, and He brought quails, and gave them in plenty the bread of heaven.

41.hebrew: פָּתַח צוּר, וַיָּזוּבוּ מָיִם;    הָלְכוּ, בַּצִּיּוֹת נָהָר.
41.english: He opened the rock, and waters gushed out; they ran, a river in the dry places.

42.english: For He remembered His holy word unto Abraham His servant;

43.english: And He brought forth His people with joy, His chosen ones with singing.

44.hebrew: וַיִּתֵּן לָהֶם, אַרְצוֹת גּוֹיִם;    וַעֲמַל לְאֻמִּים יִירָשׁוּ.
44.english: And He gave them the lands of the nations, and they took the labour of the peoples in possession;

45.english: That they might keep His statutes, and observe His laws. {N}Hallelujah.

2.english: Who can express the mighty acts of the LORD, or make all His praise to be heard?

4.hebrew: ††ж»лјш≈рƒй йјде»д, бћƒшјце…п т«оћ∆к»; †† фћ»чјг≈рƒй, бћƒйщ—ећт»ъ∆к».
4.english: Remember me, O LORD, when Thou favourest Thy people; O think of me at Thy salvation;
