5.english: That I may behold the prosperity of Thy chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of Thy nation, {N}that I may glory with Thine inheritance.

6.hebrew: ††з»и»арећ тƒн-а¬бе…ъ≈йрећ; †† д∆тЅеƒйрећ дƒшјщ—»тјрећ.
6.english: We have sinned with our fathers, we have done iniquitously, we have dealt wickedly.

7.hebrew: ††а¬бе…ъ≈йрећ бјоƒцјш«йƒн, †† м…а-дƒщ“јлћƒймећ рƒфјмјае…ъ∆йк»--м…а ж»лјшећ, †† а∆ъ-ш…б з¬с»г∆йк»;е«йћ«ојшећ т«м-й»н †† бћјй«н-сећу.
7.english: Our fathers in Egypt gave no heed unto Thy wonders; {N}they remembered not the multitude of Thy mercies; {N}but were rebellious at the sea, even at the Red Sea.

8.hebrew: ††е«йће…щ—ƒйт≈н, мјо«т«п щ—јое…-- †† мјде…гƒйт«, а∆ъ-вћјбећш»ъе….
8.english: Nevertheless He saved them for His name's sake, that He might make His mighty power to be known.

9.hebrew: ††е«йћƒвјт«ш бћјй«н-сећу, е«йћ∆зЅш»б; †† е«йће…мƒйл≈н бћ«ъћјд…ое…ъ, лћ«оћƒгјбћ»ш.
9.english: And He rebuked the Red Sea, and it was dried up; and He led them through the depths, as through a wilderness.

10.hebrew: ††е«йће…щ—ƒйт≈н, оƒйћ«г щ“е…р≈а; †† е«йћƒвја»м≈н, оƒйћ«г ае…й≈б.
10.english: And He saved them from the hand of him that hated them, and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

11.hebrew: ††е«йјл«сћећ-о«йƒн ц»ш≈йд∆н; †† а∆з»г о≈д∆н, м…а ре…ъ»ш.
11.english: And the waters covered their adversaries; there was not one of them left.

12.hebrew: ††е«йћ«а¬оƒйрећ бƒгјб»ш»йе; †† й»щ—ƒйшећ, ъћјдƒмћ»ъе….
12.english: Then believed they His words; they sang His praise.

13.hebrew: ††оƒд¬шећ, щ—»лјзећ о«т¬щ“»йе; †† м…а-зƒлћећ, м«т¬ц»ъе….
13.english: They soon forgot His works; they waited not for His counsel;

14.hebrew: ††е«йћƒъја«ећећ ъ«а¬е»д, бћ«оћƒгјбћ»ш; †† е«йјр«сћећ-а≈м, бћƒйщ—ƒйое…п.
14.english: But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, and tried God in the desert.

15.hebrew: ††е«йћƒъћ≈п м»д∆н, щ—∆аЅм»ъ»н; †† е«йјщ—«мћ«з ш»же…п бћјр«фјщ—»н.
15.english: And He gave them their request; but sent leanness into their soul.

16.hebrew: ††е«йјч«рјаећ мјо…щ—∆д, бћ«оћ«з¬р∆д; †† мја«д¬ш…п, чјге…щ— йјде»д.
16.english: They were jealous also of Moses in the camp, and of Aaron the holy one of the LORD.

17.hebrew: ††ъћƒфјъћ«з-а∆ш∆х, е«ъћƒбјм«т гћ»ъ»п; †† е«ъћјл«с, т«м-т¬г«ъ а¬бƒйш»н.
17.english: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram.

18.hebrew: ††е«ъћƒбјт«ш-а≈щ— бћ«т¬г»ъ»н; †† м∆д»б»д, ъћјм«д≈и шјщ—»тƒйн.
18.english: And a fire was kindled in their company; the flame burned up the wicked.

19.hebrew: ††й«т¬щ“ећ-т≈в∆м бћјз…ш≈б; †† е«йћƒщ—јъћ«з¬еећ, мјо«сћ≈л»д.
19.english: They made a calf in Horeb, and worshipped a molten image.

20.hebrew: ††е«йћ»оƒйшећ а∆ъ-лћјбе…г»н; †† бћјъ«бјрƒйъ щ—е…ш, а…л≈м т≈щ“∆б.
20.english: Thus they exchanged their glory for the likeness of an ox that eateth grass.

21.hebrew: ††щ—»лјзећ, а≈м ое…щ—ƒйт»н-- †† т…щ“∆д вјг…ме…ъ бћјоƒцјш»йƒн.
21.english: They forgot God their saviour, who had done great things in Egypt;

22.hebrew: ††рƒфјм»ае…ъ, бћја∆ш∆х з»н; †† ре…ш»ае…ъ, т«м-й«н-сећу.
22.english: Wondrous works in the land of Ham, terrible things by the Red Sea.

23.hebrew: ††е«йћ…ао∆ш, †† мјд«щ—јоƒйг»н:мећм≈й, о…щ—∆д бјзƒйше…-- †† т»о«г бћ«фћ∆ш∆х мјф»р»йе;мјд»щ—ƒйб з¬о»ъе…, †† о≈д«щ—јзƒйъ.
23.english: Therefore He said that He would destroy them, {N}had not Moses His chosen stood before Him in the breach, {N}to turn back His wrath, lest He should destroy them.

24.english: Moreover, they scorned the desirable land, they believed not His word;

25.hebrew: ††е«йћ≈ш»вјрећ бја»д√м≈йд∆н; †† м…а щ—»ојтећ, бћјче…м йјде»д.
25.english: And they murmured in their tents, they hearkened not unto the voice of the LORD.

26.english: Therefore He swore concerning them, that He would overthrow them in the wilderness;

27.english: And that He would cast out their seed among the nations, and scatter them in the lands.

28.english: They joined themselves also unto Baal of Peor, and ate the sacrifices of the dead.

29.english: Thus they provoked Him with their doings, and the plague broke in upon them.

30.english: Then stood up Phinehas, and wrought judgment, and so the plague was stayed.

31.english: And that was counted unto him for righteousness, unto all generations for ever.

32.english: They angered Him also at the waters of Meribah, and it went ill with Moses because of them;

33.english: For they embittered his spirit, and he spoke rashly with his lips.

34.english: They did not destroy the peoples, as the LORD commanded them;

35.english: But mingled themselves with the nations, and learned their works;

36.english: And they served their idols, which became a snare unto them;

37.english: Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto demons,

38.hebrew: ††е«йћƒщ—јфћјлећ г»н р»чƒй, гћ«н-бћјр≈йд∆н ећбјре…ъ≈йд∆н-- †† а¬щ—∆ш жƒбћјзећ, м«т¬ц«бћ≈й лјр»т«п;е«ъћ∆зЅр«у д»а»ш∆х, †† бћ«гћ»оƒйн.
38.english: And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan; {N}and the land was polluted with blood.

39.english: Thus were they defiled with their works, and went astray in their doings.

40.english: Therefore was the wrath of the LORD kindled against His people, and He abhorred His inheritance.

41.english: And He gave them into the hand of the nations; and they that hated them ruled over them.

42.english: Their enemies also oppressed them, and they were subdued under their hand.

43.hebrew: ††фћјт»оƒйн ш«бће…ъ, †† й«цћƒйм≈н:ејд≈оћ»д, й«ојшећ б«т¬ц»ъ»н; †† е«йћ»о…лћећ, бћ«т¬е р»н.
43.english: Many times did He deliver them; {N}but they were rebellious in their counsel, and sank low through their iniquity.

44.english: Nevertheless He looked upon their distress, when He heard their cry;

45.english: And He remembered for them His covenant, and repented according to the multitude of His mercies.

46.english: He made them also to be pitied of all those that carried them captive.

47.hebrew: ††де…щ—ƒйт≈рећ, йјде»д аЅм…д≈йрећ, †† ејч«бћјц≈рећ, оƒп-д«вће…йƒн:мјд…ге…ъ, мјщ—≈н ч»гјщ—∆к»; †† мјдƒщ—јъћ«бћ≈з«, бћƒъјдƒмћ»ъ∆к».
47.english: Save us, O LORD our God, and gather us from among the nations, {N}that we may give thanks unto Thy holy name, that we may triumph in Thy praise.

48.hebrew: ††бћ»шећкј йјде»д аЅм…д≈й йƒщ“јш»а≈м, †† оƒп-д»те…м»н ејт«г д»те…м»н--еја»о«ш лћ»м-д»т»н †† а»о≈п:д«мјмећ-й»дћ.
48.english: Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, from everlasting even to everlasting, {N}and let all the people say: 'Amen.' {N}Hallelujah. {P}

1.hebrew: ††д…гећ м«йде»д лћƒй-ие…б: †† лћƒй мјте…м»н з«сјгће….
1.english: 'O give thanks unto the LORD, for He is good, for His mercy endureth for ever.'

2.hebrew: ††й…аојшећ, вћјаећм≈й йјде»д-- †† а¬щ—∆ш вћја»м»н, оƒйћ«г-ц»ш.
2.english: So let the redeemed of the LORD say, whom He hath redeemed from the hand of the adversary;

3.hebrew: ††ећо≈а¬ш»це…ъ, чƒбћјц»н: †† оƒоћƒжјш»з ећоƒоћ«т¬ш»б; оƒцћ»фе…п ећоƒйћ»н.
3.english: And gathered them out of the lands, from the east and from the west, from the north and from the sea.

4.hebrew: ††ъћ»тећ б«оћƒгјбћ»ш, бћƒйщ—ƒйое…п гћ»ш∆кј; †† тƒйш ое…щ—»б, м…а о»ц»аећ.
4.english: They wandered in the wilderness in a desert way; they found no city of habitation.

5.hebrew: ††шјт≈бƒйн вћ«н-цјо≈аƒйн-- †† р«фјщ—»н, бћ»д∆н ъћƒъјт«ић»у.
5.english: Hungry and thirsty, their soul fainted in them.

6.hebrew: ††е«йћƒцјт¬чећ а∆м-йјде»д, бћ«цћ«ш м»д∆н; †† оƒоћјцећче…ъ≈йд∆н, й«цћƒйм≈н.
6.english: Then they cried unto the LORD in their trouble, and He delivered them out of their distresses.

7.hebrew: ††е«йћ«гјшƒйл≈н, бћјг∆ш∆кј йјщ—»ш»д-- †† м»м∆л∆ъ, а∆м-тƒйш ое…щ—»б.
7.english: And He led them by a straight way, that they might go to a city of habitation.

8.hebrew: ††йе…гећ м«йде»д з«сјгће…; †† ејрƒфјмјае…ъ»йе, мƒбјр≈й а»г»н.
8.english: Let them give thanks unto the LORD for His mercy, and for His wonderful works to the children of men!

9.hebrew: ††лћƒй-дƒщ“јбћƒйт«, р∆ф∆щ— щ—…ч≈ч»д; †† ејр∆ф∆щ— шјт≈б»д, оƒмћ≈а-ие…б.
9.english: For He hath satisfied the longing soul, and the hungry soul He hath filled with good.

10.hebrew: ††й…щ—јб≈й, з…щ—∆кј ејц«мјо»е∆ъ; †† а¬сƒйш≈й т√рƒй ећб«шјж∆м.
10.english: Such as sat in darkness and in the shadow of death, being bound in affliction and iron--

11.hebrew: ††лћƒй-дƒојшећ аƒојш≈й-а≈м; †† е«т¬ц«ъ т∆мјйе…п р»а»цећ.
11.english: Because they rebelled against the words of God, and contemned the counsel of the Most High.

12.hebrew: ††е«йћ«лјр«т бћ∆т»о»м мƒбћ»н; †† лћ»щ—јмећ, еја≈йп т…ж≈ш.
12.english: Therefore He humbled their heart with travail, they stumbled, and there was none to help--

13.hebrew: ††е«йћƒжјт¬чећ а∆м-йјде»д, бћ«цћ«ш м»д∆н; †† оƒоћјцЋче…ъ≈йд∆н, йе…щ—ƒйт≈н.
13.english: They cried unto the LORD in their trouble, and He saved them out of their distresses.

14.hebrew: ††йе…цƒйа≈н, о≈з…щ—∆кј ејц«мјо»е∆ъ; †† ећое…сјше…ъ≈йд∆н йјр«ъћ≈ч.
14.english: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, and broke their bands in sunder.

15.hebrew: ††йе…гећ м«йде»д з«сјгће…; †† ејрƒфјмјае…ъ»йе, мƒбјр≈й а»г»н.
15.english: Let them give thanks unto the LORD for His mercy, and for His wonderful works to the children of men!

16.hebrew: ††лћƒй-щ—ƒбћ«ш, гћ«мјъе…ъ рјз…щ—∆ъ; †† ећбјшƒйз≈й б«шјж∆м вћƒгћ≈т«.
16.english: For He hath broken the gates of brass, and cut the bars of iron in sunder.

17.hebrew: ††аЅеƒмƒйн, оƒгћ∆ш∆кј фћƒщ—јт»н; †† ећо≈т¬е р…ъ≈йд∆н, йƒъјт«рћећ.
17.english: Crazed because of the way of their transgression, and afflicted because of their iniquities--

18.hebrew: ††лћ»м-а…л∆м, ъћјъ«т≈б р«фјщ—»н; †† е«йћ«вћƒйтећ, т«г-щ—«т¬ш≈й о»е∆ъ.
18.english: Their soul abhorred all manner of food, and they drew near unto the gates of death--

19.hebrew: ††е«йћƒжјт¬чећ а∆м-йјде»д, бћ«цћ«ш м»д∆н; †† оƒоћјцЋче…ъ≈йд∆н йе…щ—ƒйт≈н.
19.english: They cried unto the LORD in their trouble, and He saved them out of their distresses;

20.hebrew: ††йƒщ—јм«з гћјб»ше…, ејйƒшјфћ»а≈н; †† еƒйо«мћ≈и, оƒщћ—јзƒйъе…ъ»н.
20.english: He sent His word, and healed them, and delivered them from their graves.

21.hebrew: ††йе…гећ м«йде»д з«сјгће…; †† ејрƒфјмјае…ъ»йе, мƒбјр≈й а»г»н.
21.english: Let them give thanks unto the LORD for His mercy, and for His wonderful works to the children of men!

22.hebrew: ††ејйƒжјбћјзећ, жƒбјз≈й ъе…г»д; †† еƒйс«фћјшећ о«т¬щ“»йе бћјшƒрћ»д.
22.english: And let them offer the sacrifices of thanksgiving, and declare His works with singing.

23.hebrew: ††йе…шјг≈й д«йћ»н, бћ»а√рƒйће…ъ; †† т…щ“≈й ојм»ал»д, бћјо«йƒн ш«бћƒйн.
23.english: They that go down to the sea in ships, that do business in great waters--

24.english: These saw the works of the LORD, and His wonders in the deep;

25.hebrew: ††е«йћ…ао∆ш--е«йћ«т¬о≈г, шећз« сјт»ш»д; †† е«ъћјше…о≈н вћ«мћ»йе.
25.english: For He commanded, and raised the stormy wind, which lifted up the waves thereof;

26.hebrew: ††й«т¬мећ щ—»о«йƒн, й≈шјгећ ъјде…ое…ъ; †† р«фјщ—»н, бћјш»т»д ъƒъјое…в»в.
26.english: They mounted up to the heaven, they went down to the deeps; their soul melted away because of trouble;

27.english: They reeled to and fro, and staggered like a drunken man, and all their wisdom was swallowed up--

28.english: They cried unto the LORD in their trouble, and He brought them out of their distresses.

29.english: He made the storm a calm, so that the waves thereof were still.

30.english: Then were they glad because they were quiet, and He led them unto their desired haven.

31.english: Let them give thanks unto the LORD for His mercy, and for His wonderful works to the children of men!

32.english: Let them exalt Him also in the assembly of the people, and praise Him in the seat of the elders.

33.english: He turneth rivers into a wilderness, and watersprings into a thirsty ground;

34.english: A fruitful land into a salt waste, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.

35.hebrew: ††й»щ“≈н оƒгјбћ»ш, м«а¬в«н-о«йƒн; †† еја∆ш∆х цƒйћ»д, мјо…ц»а≈й о»йƒн.
35.english: He turneth a wilderness into a pool of water, and a dry land into watersprings.

36.english: And there He maketh the hungry to dwell, and they establish a city of habitation;

37.hebrew: ††е«йћƒжјшјтећ щ“»ге…ъ, е«йћƒићјтећ лјш»оƒйн; †† е«йћ«т¬щ“ећ, фћјшƒй ъјбећа»д.
37.english: And sow fields, and plant vineyards, which yield fruits of increase.

38.english: He blesseth them also, so that they are multiplied greatly, and suffereth not their cattle to decrease.

39.english: Again, they are minished and dwindle away through oppression of evil and sorrow.

40.english: He poureth contempt upon princes, and causeth them to wander in the waste, where there is no way.

41.english: Yet setteth He the needy on high from affliction, and maketh his families like a flock.

42.english: The upright see it, and are glad; and all iniquity stoppeth her mouth.

43.english: Whoso is wise, let him observe these things, and let them consider the mercies of the LORD. {P}

1.hebrew: שִׁיר מִזְמוֹר לְדָוִד.    נָכוֹן לִבִּי אֱלֹהִים; אָשִׁירָה וַאֲזַמְּרָה, אַף-כְּבוֹדִי.
1.english: A Song, a Psalm of David.  2 My heart is steadfast, O God; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises, even with my glory.

2.hebrew: עוּרָה, הַנֵּבֶל וְכִנּוֹר;    אָעִירָה שָּׁחַר.
2.english: Awake, psaltery and harp; I will awake the dawn.

3.hebrew: אוֹדְךָ בָעַמִּים יְהוָה;    וַאֲזַמֶּרְךָ, בַּלְאֻמִּים.
3.english: I will give thanks unto Thee, O LORD, among the peoples; and I will sing praises unto Thee among the nations.

4.hebrew: כִּי-גָדוֹל מֵעַל-שָׁמַיִם חַסְדֶּךָ;    וְעַד-שְׁחָקִים אֲמִתֶּךָ.
4.english: For Thy mercy is great above the heavens, and Thy truth reacheth unto the skies.

5.hebrew: רוּמָה עַל-שָׁמַיִם אֱלֹהִים;    וְעַל כָּל-הָאָרֶץ כְּבוֹדֶךָ.
5.english: Be Thou exalted, O God, above the heavens; and Thy glory be above all the earth.

6.hebrew: לְמַעַן, יֵחָלְצוּן יְדִידֶיךָ;    הוֹשִׁיעָה יְמִינְךָ וַעֲנֵנִי.
6.english: That Thy beloved may be delivered, save with Thy right hand, and answer me.

7.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים, דִּבֶּר בְּקָדְשׁוֹ--אֶעְלֹזָה:    אֲחַלְּקָה שְׁכֶם; וְעֵמֶק סֻכּוֹת אֲמַדֵּד.
7.english: God spoke in His holiness, that I would exult; that I would divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.

8.hebrew: לִי גִלְעָד, לִי מְנַשֶּׁה, וְאֶפְרַיִם, מָעוֹז רֹאשִׁי;    יְהוּדָה, מְחֹקְקִי.
8.english: Gilead is mine, Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the defence of my head; Judah is my sceptre.

9.hebrew: מוֹאָב, סִיר רַחְצִי--עַל-אֱדוֹם, אַשְׁלִיךְ נַעֲלִי;    עֲלֵי-פְלֶשֶׁת, אֶתְרוֹעָע.
9.english: Moab is my washpot; upon Edom do I cast my shoe; over Philistia do I cry aloud.

10.hebrew: מִי יֹבִלֵנִי, עִיר מִבְצָר;    מִי נָחַנִי עַד-אֱדוֹם.
10.english: Who will bring me into the fortified city? Who will lead me unto Edom?

11.hebrew: הֲלֹא-אֱלֹהִים זְנַחְתָּנוּ;    וְלֹא-תֵצֵא אֱלֹהִים, בְּצִבְאֹתֵינוּ.
11.english: Hast not Thou cast us off, O God? and Thou goest not forth, O God, with our hosts?

12.hebrew: הָבָה-לָּנוּ עֶזְרָת מִצָּר;    וְשָׁוְא, תְּשׁוּעַת אָדָם.
12.english: Give us help against the adversary; for vain is the help of man.

13.hebrew: בֵּאלֹהִים נַעֲשֶׂה-חָיִל;    וְהוּא, יָבוּס צָרֵינוּ.
13.english: Through God we shall do valiantly; for He it is that will tread down our adversaries. {P}

1.hebrew: ††м«ојр«цћ≈з«, мјг»еƒг оƒжјое…ш:аЅм…д≈й ъјдƒмћ»ъƒй, †† а«м-ъћ∆зЅш«щ—.
1.english: For the Leader. A Psalm of David. {N}O God of my praise, keep not silence;

2.hebrew: ††лћƒй фƒй ш»щ—»т, ећфƒй-оƒшјо»д--т»м«й фћ»ъ»зећ; †† гћƒбћјшећ аƒъћƒй, мјщ—е…п щ—»ч∆ш.
2.english: For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of deceit have they opened against me; they have spoken unto me with a lying tongue.

3.hebrew: ††ејгƒбјш≈й щ“ƒрја»д сјб»бећрƒй; †† е«йћƒмћ»з¬оећрƒй зƒрћ»н.
3.english: They compassed me about also with words of hatred, and fought against me without a cause.

4.hebrew: ††ъћ«з«ъ-а«д¬б»ъƒй йƒщ“јијрећрƒй; †† е«а¬рƒй ъјфƒмћ»д.
4.english: In return for my love they are my adversaries; but I am all prayer.

5.hebrew: ††е«йћ»щ“ƒйоећ т»м«й ш»т»д, ъћ«з«ъ ие…б»д; †† ејщ“ƒрја»д, ъћ«з«ъ а«д¬б»ъƒй.
5.english: And they have laid upon me evil for good, and hatred for my love:

6.hebrew: ††д«фјч≈г т»м»йе ш»щ—»т; †† ејщ“»и»п, й«т¬о…г т«м-йјоƒйре….
6.english: 'Set Thou a wicked man over him; and let an adversary stand at his right hand.

7.hebrew: ††бћјдƒщћ—»фјие…, й≈ц≈а ш»щ—»т; †† ећъјфƒмћ»ъе…, ъћƒдјй∆д м«з¬и»а»д.
7.english: When he is judged, let him go forth condemned; and let his prayer be turned into sin.

8.hebrew: ††йƒдјйећ-й»о»йе ојт«ићƒйн; †† фћјчЋгћ»ъе…, йƒчћ«з а«з≈ш.
8.english: Let his days be few; let another take his charge.

9.hebrew: ††йƒдјйећ-б»р»йе йјъе…оƒйн; †† ејаƒщ—јъће…, а«мјо»р»д.
9.english: Let his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.

10.hebrew: ††ејре…т« й»рећтећ б»р»йе ејщ—ƒа≈мећ; †† ејг»шјщ—ећ, о≈з»шјбе…ъ≈йд∆н.
10.english: Let his children be vagabonds, and beg; and let them seek their bread out of their desolate places.

11.hebrew: ††йјр«чћ≈щ— ре…щ—∆д, мјл»м-а¬щ—∆ш-ме…; †† ејй»б…жћећ ж»шƒйн йјвƒйте….
11.english: Let the creditor distrain all that he hath; and let strangers make spoil of his labour.

12.hebrew: ††а«м-йјдƒй-ме…, о…щ—≈кј з»с∆г; †† еја«м-йјдƒй зе…р≈п, мƒйъе…о»йе.
12.english: Let there be none to extend kindness unto him; neither let there be any to be gracious unto his fatherless children.

13.hebrew: ††йјдƒй-а«з¬шƒйъе… мјд«лјшƒйъ; †† бћјге…ш а«з≈ш, йƒоћ«з щ—јо»н.
13.english: Let his posterity be cut off; in the generation following let their name be blotted out.

14.hebrew: ††йƒжћ»л≈ш, т¬е п а¬б…ъ»йе--а∆м-йјде»д; †† ејз«ић«аъ аƒоће…, а«м-ъћƒоћ»з.
14.english: Let the iniquity of his fathers be brought to remembrance unto the LORD; and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.

15.hebrew: ††йƒдјйећ р∆в∆г-йјде»д ъћ»оƒйг; †† ејй«лјш≈ъ о≈а∆ш∆х жƒлјш»н.
15.english: Let them be before the LORD continually, that He may cut off the memory of them from the earth.

16.hebrew: ††й«т«п-- †† а¬щ—∆ш м…а ж»л«ш, т¬щ“е…ъ з»с∆г:е«йћƒшјгћ…у, аƒйщ—-т»рƒй еја∆бјйе…п--ејрƒлја≈д м≈б»б; †† мјое…ъ≈ъ.
16.english: Because that he remembered not to do kindness, {N}but persecuted the poor and needy man, and the broken in heart he was ready to slay.

17.hebrew: ††е«йћ∆аЅд«б чјм»м»д, е«ъћјбе…а≈дећ; †† ејм…а-з»ф≈х бћƒбјш»л»д, е«ъћƒшјз«ч оƒоћ∆рћећ.
17.english: Yea, he loved cursing, and it came unto him; and he delighted not in blessing, and it is far from him.

18.hebrew: ††е«йћƒмјбћ«щ— чјм»м»д, лћјо«гће…: †† е«ъћ»б…а л«оћ«йƒн бћјчƒшјбће…; ејл«щћ—∆о∆п, бћјт«цјое…ъ»йе.
18.english: He clothed himself also with cursing as with his raiment, and it is come into his inward parts like water, and like oil into his bones.

19.hebrew: ††ъћјдƒй-ме…, лћјб∆в∆г й«тји∆д; †† ећмјо≈ж«з, ъћ»оƒйг й«зјвћјш∆д».
19.english: Let it be unto him as the garment which he putteth on, and for the girdle wherewith he is girded continually.'

20.hebrew: ††ж…аъ фћјтЋмћ«ъ щ“…ијр«й, о≈а≈ъ йјде»д; †† ејд«гћ…бјшƒйн ш»т, т«м-р«фјщ—ƒй.
20.english: This would mine adversaries effect from the LORD, and they that speak evil against my soul.

21.hebrew: ††еја«ъћ»д, йјдеƒд а¬г…р»й-- †† т¬щ“≈д-аƒъћƒй, мјо«т«п щ—јо∆к»;лћƒй-ие…б з«сјгћјк», †† д«цћƒйм≈рƒй.
21.english: But Thou, O GOD the Lord, deal with me for Thy name's sake; {N}because Thy mercy is good, deliver Thou me.

22.hebrew: ††лћƒй-т»рƒй еја∆бјйе…п а»р…лƒй; †† ејмƒбћƒй, з»м«м бћјчƒшјбћƒй.
22.english: For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.

23.hebrew: ††лћјц≈м-лћƒрјие…ъе… р∆дЅм»лјъћƒй; †† рƒрјт«шјъћƒй, лћ»а«шјбћ∆д.
23.english: I am gone like the shadow when it lengtheneth; I am shaken off as the locust.

24.english: My knees totter through fasting; and my flesh is lean, and hath no fatness.

25.hebrew: ††е«а¬рƒй, д»йƒйъƒй з∆шјфћ»д м»д∆н; †† йƒшјаећрƒй, йјрƒйтећп ш…ащ—»н.
25.english: I am become also a taunt unto them; when they see me, they shake their head.

26.english: Help me, O LORD my God; O save me according to Thy mercy;

27.english: That they may know that this is Thy hand; that Thou, LORD, hast done it.

28.english: Let them curse, but bless Thou; when they arise, they shall be put to shame, but Thy servant shall rejoice.

29.english: Mine adversaries shall be clothed with confusion, and shall put on their own shame as a robe.

30.hebrew: ††ае…г∆д йјде»д оја…г бћјфƒй; †† ећбјъе…кј ш«бћƒйн а¬д«мјм∆рћећ.
30.english: I will give great thanks unto the LORD with my mouth; yea, I will praise Him among the multitude;

31.english: Because He standeth at the right hand of the needy, to save him from them that judge his soul. {P}

1.hebrew: לְדָוִד, מִזְמוֹר:נְאֻם יְהוָה, לַאדֹנִי--שֵׁב לִימִינִי;    עַד-אָשִׁית אֹיְבֶיךָ, הֲדֹם לְרַגְלֶיךָ.
1.english: A Psalm of David. {N}The LORD saith unto my lord: 'Sit thou at My right hand, until I make thine enemies thy footstool.'

2.hebrew: מַטֵּה-עֻזְּךָ--יִשְׁלַח יְהוָה, מִצִּיּוֹן;    רְדֵה, בְּקֶרֶב אֹיְבֶיךָ.
2.english: The rod of Thy strength the LORD will send out of Zion: 'Rule thou in the midst of thine enemies.'

3.hebrew: עַמְּךָ נְדָבֹת,    בְּיוֹם חֵילֶךָ:בְּהַדְרֵי-קֹדֶשׁ, מֵרֶחֶם מִשְׁחָר;    לְךָ, טַל יַלְדֻתֶיךָ.
3.english: Thy people offer themselves willingly in the day of thy warfare; {N}in adornments of holiness, from the womb of the dawn, thine is the dew of thy youth.

4.hebrew: נִשְׁבַּע יְהוָה, וְלֹא יִנָּחֵם--    אַתָּה-כֹהֵן לְעוֹלָם;עַל-דִּבְרָתִי,    מַלְכִּי-צֶדֶק.
4.english: The LORD hath sworn, and will not repent: 'Thou art a priest for ever {N}after the manner of Melchizedek.'

5.hebrew: אֲדֹנָי עַל-יְמִינְךָ;    מָחַץ בְּיוֹם-אַפּוֹ מְלָכִים.
5.english: The Lord at thy right hand doth crush kings in the day of His wrath.

6.hebrew: יָדִין בַּגּוֹיִם, מָלֵא גְוִיּוֹת;    מָחַץ רֹאשׁ, עַל-אֶרֶץ רַבָּה.
6.english: He will judge among the nations; He filleth it with dead bodies, He crusheth the head over a wide land.

7.hebrew: מִנַּחַל, בַּדֶּרֶךְ יִשְׁתֶּה;    עַל-כֵּן, יָרִים רֹאשׁ.
7.english: He will drink of the brook in the way; therefore will he lift up the head. {P}

1.hebrew: הַלְלוּ-יָהּ:אוֹדֶה יְהוָה, בְּכָל-לֵבָב;    בְּסוֹד יְשָׁרִים וְעֵדָה.
1.english: Hallelujah. {N}I will give thanks unto the LORD with my whole heart, in the council of the upright, and in the congregation.

2.hebrew: גְּדֹלִים, מַעֲשֵׂי יְהוָה;    דְּרוּשִׁים, לְכָל-חֶפְצֵיהֶם.
2.english: The works of the LORD are great, sought out of all them that have delight therein.

3.hebrew: הוֹד-וְהָדָר פָּעֳלוֹ;    וְצִדְקָתוֹ, עֹמֶדֶת לָעַד.
3.english: His work is glory and majesty; and His righteousness endureth for ever.

4.hebrew: זֵכֶר עָשָׂה, לְנִפְלְאוֹתָיו;    חַנּוּן וְרַחוּם יְהוָה.
4.english: He hath made a memorial for His wonderful works; the LORD is gracious and full of compassion.

5.hebrew: טֶרֶף, נָתַן לִירֵאָיו;    יִזְכֹּר לְעוֹלָם בְּרִיתוֹ.
5.english: He hath given food unto them that fear Him; He will ever be mindful of His covenant.

6.hebrew: כֹּחַ מַעֲשָׂיו, הִגִּיד לְעַמּוֹ--    לָתֵת לָהֶם, נַחֲלַת גּוֹיִם.
6.english: He hath declared to His people the power of His works, in giving them the heritage of the nations.

7.hebrew: מַעֲשֵׂי יָדָיו, אֱמֶת וּמִשְׁפָּט;    נֶאֱמָנִים, כָּל-פִּקּוּדָיו.
7.english: The works of His hands are truth and justice; all His precepts are sure.

8.hebrew: סְמוּכִים לָעַד לְעוֹלָם;    עֲשׂוּיִם, בֶּאֱמֶת וְיָשָׁר.
8.english: They are established for ever and ever, they are done in truth and uprightness.

9.hebrew: פְּדוּת, שָׁלַח לְעַמּוֹ--    צִוָּה-לְעוֹלָם בְּרִיתוֹ;קָדוֹשׁ וְנוֹרָא    שְׁמוֹ.
9.english: He hath sent redemption unto His people; He hath commanded His covenant for ever; {N}Holy and awful is His name.

10.hebrew: רֵאשִׁית חָכְמָה, יִרְאַת יְהוָה--    שֵׂכֶל טוֹב, לְכָל-עֹשֵׂיהֶם;תְּהִלָּתוֹ,    עֹמֶדֶת לָעַד.
10.english: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom; a good understanding have all they that do thereafter; {N}His praise endureth for ever. {P}

10.english: The wicked shall see it, and be vexed; he shall gnash with his teeth, and melt away; {N}the desire of the wicked shall perish. {P}

1.hebrew: הַלְלוּ-יָהּ:הַלְלוּ, עַבְדֵי יְהוָה;    הַלְלוּ, אֶת-שֵׁם יְהוָה.
1.english: Hallelujah. {N}Praise, O ye servants of the LORD, praise the name of the LORD.

2.hebrew: יְהִי שֵׁם יְהוָה מְבֹרָךְ--    מֵעַתָּה, וְעַד-עוֹלָם.
2.english: Blessed be the name of the LORD from this time forth and for ever.

3.hebrew: מִמִּזְרַח-שֶׁמֶשׁ עַד-מְבוֹאוֹ--    מְהֻלָּל, שֵׁם יְהוָה.
3.english: From the rising of the sun unto the going down thereof the LORD'S name is to be praised.

4.hebrew: רָם עַל-כָּל-גּוֹיִם יְהוָה;    עַל הַשָּׁמַיִם כְּבוֹדוֹ.
4.english: The LORD is high above all nations, His glory is above the heavens.

5.hebrew: מִי, כַּיהוָה אֱלֹהֵינוּ--    הַמַּגְבִּיהִי לָשָׁבֶת.
5.english: Who is like unto the LORD our God, that is enthroned on high,

6.hebrew: הַמַּשְׁפִּילִי לִרְאוֹת--    בַּשָּׁמַיִם וּבָאָרֶץ.
6.english: That looketh down low upon heaven and upon the earth?

7.hebrew: מְקִימִי מֵעָפָר דָּל;    מֵאַשְׁפֹּת, יָרִים אֶבְיוֹן.
7.english: Who raiseth up the poor out of the dust, and lifteth up the needy out of the dunghill;

8.hebrew: לְהוֹשִׁיבִי עִם-נְדִיבִים;    עִם, נְדִיבֵי עַמּוֹ.
8.english: That He may set him with princes, even with the princes of His people.

9.hebrew: מוֹשִׁיבִי, עֲקֶרֶת הַבַּיִת--    אֵם-הַבָּנִים שְׂמֵחָה:הַלְלוּ-יָהּ.
9.english: Who maketh the barren woman to dwell in her house as a joyful mother of children. {N}Hallelujah.

1.hebrew: בְּצֵאת יִשְׂרָאֵל, מִמִּצְרָיִם;    בֵּית יַעֲקֹב, מֵעַם לֹעֵז.
1.english: When Israel came forth out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of strange language;

2.hebrew: הָיְתָה יְהוּדָה לְקָדְשׁוֹ;    יִשְׂרָאֵל, מַמְשְׁלוֹתָיו.
2.english: Judah became His sanctuary, Israel His dominion.

3.hebrew: הַיָּם רָאָה, וַיָּנֹס;    הַיַּרְדֵּן, יִסֹּב לְאָחוֹר.
3.english: The sea saw it, and fled; the Jordan turned backward.

4.hebrew: הֶהָרִים, רָקְדוּ כְאֵילִים;    גְּבָעוֹת, כִּבְנֵי-צֹאן.
4.english: The mountains skipped like rams, the hills like young sheep.

5.hebrew: מַה-לְּךָ הַיָּם, כִּי תָנוּס;    הַיַּרְדֵּן, תִּסֹּב לְאָחוֹר.
5.english: What aileth thee, O thou sea, that thou fleest? thou Jordan, that thou turnest backward?

6.hebrew: הֶהָרִים, תִּרְקְדוּ כְאֵילִים;    גְּבָעוֹת, כִּבְנֵי-צֹאן.
6.english: Ye mountains, that ye skip like rams; ye hills, like young sheep?

7.hebrew: מִלִּפְנֵי אָדוֹן, חוּלִי אָרֶץ;    מִלִּפְנֵי, אֱלוֹהַּ יַעֲקֹב.
7.english: Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob;

8.hebrew: הַהֹפְכִי הַצּוּר אֲגַם-מָיִם;    חַלָּמִישׁ, לְמַעְיְנוֹ-מָיִם.
8.english: Who turned the rock into a pool of water, the flint into a fountain of waters.

1.hebrew: לֹא לָנוּ יְהוָה, לֹא-לָנוּ:    כִּי-לְשִׁמְךָ, תֵּן כָּבוֹד--עַל-חַסְדְּךָ, עַל-אֲמִתֶּךָ.
1.english: Not unto us, O LORD, not unto us, but unto Thy name give glory, for Thy mercy, and for Thy truth's sake.

2.hebrew: לָמָּה, יֹאמְרוּ הַגּוֹיִם:    אַיֵּה-נָא, אֱלֹהֵיהֶם.
2.english: Wherefore should the nations say: 'Where is now their God?'

3.hebrew: וֵאלֹהֵינוּ בַשָּׁמָיִם--    כֹּל אֲשֶׁר-חָפֵץ עָשָׂה.
3.english: But our God is in the heavens; whatsoever pleased Him He hath done.

4.hebrew: עֲצַבֵּיהֶם, כֶּסֶף וְזָהָב;    מַעֲשֵׂה, יְדֵי אָדָם.
4.english: Their idols are silver and gold, the work of men's hands.

5.hebrew: פֶּה-לָהֶם, וְלֹא יְדַבֵּרוּ;    עֵינַיִם לָהֶם, וְלֹא יִרְאוּ.
5.english: They have mouths, but they speak not; eyes have they, but they see not;

6.hebrew: אָזְנַיִם לָהֶם, וְלֹא יִשְׁמָעוּ;    אַף לָהֶם, וְלֹא יְרִיחוּן.
6.english: They have ears, but they hear not; noses have they, but they smell not;

7.hebrew: יְדֵיהֶם, וְלֹא יְמִישׁוּן--רַגְלֵיהֶם, וְלֹא יְהַלֵּכוּ;    לֹא-יֶהְגּוּ, בִּגְרוֹנָם.
7.english: They have hands, but they handle not; feet have they, but they walk not; neither speak they with their throat.

8.hebrew: כְּמוֹהֶם, יִהְיוּ עֹשֵׂיהֶם--    כֹּל אֲשֶׁר-בֹּטֵחַ בָּהֶם.
8.english: They that make them shall be like unto them; yea, every one that trusteth in them.

9.hebrew: יִשְׂרָאֵל, בְּטַח בַּיהוָה;    עֶזְרָם וּמָגִנָּם הוּא.
9.english: O Israel, trust thou in the LORD! He is their help and their shield!

10.hebrew: בֵּית אַהֲרֹן, בִּטְחוּ בַיהוָה;    עֶזְרָם וּמָגִנָּם הוּא.
10.english: O house of Aaron, trust ye in the LORD! He is their help and their shield!

11.hebrew: יִרְאֵי יְהוָה, בִּטְחוּ בַיהוָה;    עֶזְרָם וּמָגִנָּם הוּא.
11.english: Ye that fear the LORD, trust in the LORD! He is their help and their shield.

12.hebrew: יְהוָה,    זְכָרָנוּ יְבָרֵךְ:יְבָרֵךְ, אֶת-בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל;    יְבָרֵךְ, אֶת-בֵּית אַהֲרֹן.
12.english: The LORD hath been mindful of us, He will bless-- {N}He will bless the house of Israel; He will bless the house of Aaron.

13.hebrew: יְבָרֵךְ, יִרְאֵי יְהוָה--    הַקְּטַנִּים, עִם-הַגְּדֹלִים.
13.english: He will bless them that fear the LORD, both small and great.

14.hebrew: יֹסֵף יְהוָה עֲלֵיכֶם;    עֲלֵיכֶם, וְעַל בְּנֵיכֶם.
14.english: The LORD increase you more and more, you and your children.

15.hebrew: בְּרוּכִים אַתֶּם, לַיהוָה--    עֹשֵׂה, שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ.
15.english: Blessed be ye of the LORD who made heaven and earth.

16.hebrew: הַשָּׁמַיִם שָׁמַיִם, לַיהוָה;    וְהָאָרֶץ, נָתַן לִבְנֵי-אָדָם.
16.english: The heavens are the heavens of the LORD; but the earth hath He given to the children of men.

17.hebrew: לֹא הַמֵּתִים, יְהַלְלוּ-יָהּ;    וְלֹא, כָּל-יֹרְדֵי דוּמָה.
17.english: The dead praise not the LORD, neither any that go down into silence;

18.hebrew: וַאֲנַחְנוּ, נְבָרֵךְ יָהּ--    מֵעַתָּה וְעַד-עוֹלָם:הַלְלוּ-יָהּ.
18.english: But we will bless the LORD from this time forth and for ever. {N}Hallelujah.

1.hebrew: אָהַבְתִּי, כִּי-יִשְׁמַע יְהוָה--    אֶת-קוֹלִי, תַּחֲנוּנָי.
1.english: I love that the LORD should hear my voice and my supplications.

2.hebrew: כִּי-הִטָּה אָזְנוֹ לִי;    וּבְיָמַי אֶקְרָא.
2.english: Because He hath inclined His ear unto me, therefore will I call upon Him all my days.

3.hebrew: אֲפָפוּנִי, חֶבְלֵי-מָוֶת--וּמְצָרֵי שְׁאוֹל מְצָאוּנִי;    צָרָה וְיָגוֹן אֶמְצָא.
3.english: The cords of death compassed me, and the straits of the nether-world got hold upon me; I found trouble and sorrow.

4.hebrew: וּבְשֵׁם-יְהוָה אֶקְרָא:    אָנָּה יְהוָה, מַלְּטָה נַפְשִׁי.
4.english: But I called upon the name of the LORD: 'I beseech thee, O LORD, deliver my soul.'

5.hebrew: חַנּוּן יְהוָה וְצַדִּיק;    וֵאלֹהֵינוּ מְרַחֵם.
5.english: Gracious is the LORD, and righteous; yea, our God is compassionate.

6.hebrew: שֹׁמֵר פְּתָאיִם יְהוָה;    דַּלֹּתִי, וְלִי יְהוֹשִׁיעַ.
6.english: The LORD preserveth the simple; I was brought low, and He saved me.

7.hebrew: שׁוּבִי נַפְשִׁי, לִמְנוּחָיְכִי:    כִּי-יְהוָה, גָּמַל עָלָיְכִי.
7.english: Return, O my soul, unto thy rest; for the LORD hath dealt bountifully with thee.

8.hebrew: כִּי חִלַּצְתָּ נַפְשִׁי, מִמָּוֶת:    אֶת-עֵינִי מִן-דִּמְעָה; אֶת-רַגְלִי מִדֶּחִי.
8.english: For Thou hast delivered my soul from death, mine eyes from tears, and my feet from stumbling.

9.hebrew: אֶתְהַלֵּךְ, לִפְנֵי יְהוָה--    בְּאַרְצוֹת, הַחַיִּים.
9.english: I shall walk before the LORD in the lands of the living.

10.hebrew: הֶאֱמַנְתִּי, כִּי אֲדַבֵּר;    אֲנִי, עָנִיתִי מְאֹד.
10.english: I trusted even when I spoke: 'I am greatly afflicted.'

11.hebrew: אֲנִי, אָמַרְתִּי בְחָפְזִי:    כָּל-הָאָדָם כֹּזֵב.
11.english: I said in my haste: 'All men are liars.'

12.hebrew: מָה-אָשִׁיב לַיהוָה--    כָּל-תַּגְמוּלוֹהִי עָלָי.
12.english: How can I repay unto the LORD all His bountiful dealings toward me?

13.hebrew: כּוֹס-יְשׁוּעוֹת אֶשָּׂא;    וּבְשֵׁם יְהוָה אֶקְרָא.
13.english: I will lift up the cup of salvation, and call upon the name of the LORD.

14.hebrew: נְדָרַי, לַיהוָה אֲשַׁלֵּם;    נֶגְדָה-נָּא, לְכָל-עַמּוֹ.
14.english: My vows will I pay unto the LORD, yea, in the presence of all His people.

15.hebrew: יָקָר, בְּעֵינֵי יְהוָה--    הַמָּוְתָה, לַחֲסִידָיו.
15.english: Precious in the sight of the LORD is the death of His saints.

16.hebrew: אָנָּה יְהוָה,    כִּי-אֲנִי עַבְדֶּךָ:אֲנִי-עַבְדְּךָ, בֶּן-אֲמָתֶךָ;    פִּתַּחְתָּ, לְמוֹסֵרָי.
16.english: I beseech Thee, O LORD, for I am Thy servant; {N}I am Thy servant, the son of Thy handmaid; Thou hast loosed my bands.

17.hebrew: לְךָ-אֶזְבַּח, זֶבַח תּוֹדָה;    וּבְשֵׁם יְהוָה אֶקְרָא.
17.english: I will offer to thee the sacrifice of thanksgiving, and will call upon the name of the LORD.

18.hebrew: נְדָרַי, לַיהוָה אֲשַׁלֵּם;    נֶגְדָה-נָּא, לְכָל-עַמּוֹ.
18.english: I will pay my vows unto the LORD, yea, in the presence of all His people;

19.hebrew: בְּחַצְרוֹת, בֵּית יְהוָה--    בְּתוֹכֵכִי יְרוּשָׁלִָם:הַלְלוּ-יָהּ.
19.english: In the courts of the LORD'S house, in the midst of thee, O Jerusalem. {N}Hallelujah.

1.hebrew: הַלְלוּ אֶת-יְהוָה, כָּל-גּוֹיִם;    שַׁבְּחוּהוּ, כָּל-הָאֻמִּים.
1.english: O praise the LORD, all ye nations; laud Him, all ye peoples.

2.hebrew: כִּי גָבַר עָלֵינוּ, חַסְדּוֹ--    וֶאֱמֶת-יְהוָה לְעוֹלָם:הַלְלוּ-יָהּ.
2.english: For His mercy is great toward us; and the truth of the LORD endureth for ever. {N}Hallelujah.

1.hebrew: הוֹדוּ לַיהוָה כִּי-טוֹב:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
1.english: 'O give thanks unto the LORD, for He is good, for His mercy endureth for ever.'

2.hebrew: יֹאמַר-נָא יִשְׂרָאֵל:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
2.english: So let Israel now say, for His mercy endureth for ever,

3.hebrew: יֹאמְרוּ-נָא בֵית-אַהֲרֹן:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
3.english: So let the house of Aaron now say, for His mercy endureth for ever.

4.hebrew: יֹאמְרוּ-נָא יִרְאֵי יְהוָה:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
4.english: So let them now that fear the LORD say, for His mercy endureth for ever.

5.hebrew: מִן-הַמֵּצַר, קָרָאתִי יָּהּ;    עָנָנִי בַמֶּרְחָב יָהּ.
5.english: Out of my straits I called upon the LORD; He answered me with great enlargement.

6.hebrew: יְהוָה לִי, לֹא אִירָא;    מַה-יַּעֲשֶׂה לִי אָדָם.
6.english: The LORD is for me; I will not fear; what can man do unto me?

7.hebrew: יְהוָה לִי, בְּעֹזְרָי;    וַאֲנִי, אֶרְאֶה בְשֹׂנְאָי.
7.english: The LORD is for me as my helper; and I shall gaze upon them that hate me.

8.hebrew: טוֹב, לַחֲסוֹת בַּיהוָה--    מִבְּטֹחַ, בָּאָדָם.
8.english: It is better to take refuge in the LORD than to trust in man.

9.hebrew: טוֹב, לַחֲסוֹת בַּיהוָה--    מִבְּטֹחַ, בִּנְדִיבִים.
9.english: It is better to take refuge in the LORD than to trust in princes.

10.hebrew: כָּל-גּוֹיִם סְבָבוּנִי;    בְּשֵׁם יְהוָה, כִּי אֲמִילַם.
10.english: All nations compass me about; verily, in the name of the LORD I will cut them off.

11.hebrew: סַבּוּנִי גַם-סְבָבוּנִי;    בְּשֵׁם יְהוָה, כִּי אֲמִילַם.
11.english: They compass me about, yea, they compass me about; verily, in the name of the LORD I will cut them off.

12.hebrew: סַבּוּנִי כִדְבוֹרִים--    דֹּעֲכוּ, כְּאֵשׁ קוֹצִים;בְּשֵׁם יְהוָה,    כִּי אֲמִילַם.
12.english: They compass me about like bees; they are quenched as the fire of thorns; {N}verily, in the name of the LORD I will cut them off.

13.hebrew: דַּחֹה דְחִיתַנִי לִנְפֹּל;    וַיהוָה עֲזָרָנִי.
13.english: Thou didst thrust sore at me that I might fall; but the LORD helped me.

14.hebrew: עָזִּי וְזִמְרָת יָהּ;    וַיְהִי-לִי, לִישׁוּעָה.
14.english: The LORD is my strength and song; and He is become my salvation.

15.hebrew: קוֹל, רִנָּה וִישׁוּעָה--בְּאָהֳלֵי צַדִּיקִים;    יְמִין יְהוָה, עֹשָׂה חָיִל.
15.english: The voice of rejoicing and salvation is in the tents of the righteous; the right hand of the LORD doeth valiantly.

16.hebrew: יְמִין יְהוָה, רוֹמֵמָה;    יְמִין יְהוָה, עֹשָׂה חָיִל.
16.english: The right hand of the LORD is exalted; the right hand of the LORD doeth valiantly.

17.hebrew: לֹא-אָמוּת כִּי-אֶחְיֶה;    וַאֲסַפֵּר, מַעֲשֵׂי יָהּ.
17.english: I shall not die, but live, and declare the works of the LORD.

18.hebrew: יַסֹּר יִסְּרַנִּי יָּהּ;    וְלַמָּוֶת, לֹא נְתָנָנִי.
18.english: The LORD hath chastened me sore; but He hath not given me over unto death.

19.hebrew: פִּתְחוּ-לִי שַׁעֲרֵי-צֶדֶק;    אָבֹא-בָם, אוֹדֶה יָהּ.
19.english: Open to me the gates of righteousness; I will enter into them, I will give thanks unto the LORD.

20.hebrew: זֶה-הַשַּׁעַר לַיהוָה;    צַדִּיקִים, יָבֹאוּ בוֹ.
20.english: This is the gate of the LORD; the righteous shall enter into it.

21.hebrew: אוֹדְךָ, כִּי עֲנִיתָנִי;    וַתְּהִי-לִי, לִישׁוּעָה.
21.english: I will give thanks unto Thee, for Thou hast answered me, and art become my salvation.

22.hebrew: אֶבֶן, מָאֲסוּ הַבּוֹנִים--    הָיְתָה, לְרֹאשׁ פִּנָּה.
22.english: The stone which the builders rejected is become the chief corner-stone.

23.hebrew: מֵאֵת יְהוָה, הָיְתָה זֹּאת;    הִיא נִפְלָאת בְּעֵינֵינוּ.
23.english: This is the LORD'S doing; it is marvellous in our eyes.

24.hebrew: זֶה-הַיּוֹם, עָשָׂה יְהוָה;    נָגִילָה וְנִשְׂמְחָה בוֹ.
24.english: This is the day which the LORD hath made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.

25.hebrew: אָנָּא יְהוָה, הוֹשִׁיעָה נָּא;    אָנָּא יְהוָה, הַצְלִיחָה נָּא.
25.english: We beseech Thee, O LORD, save now! We beseech Thee, O LORD, make us now to prosper!

26.hebrew: בָּרוּךְ הַבָּא, בְּשֵׁם יְהוָה;    בֵּרַכְנוּכֶם, מִבֵּית יְהוָה.
26.english: Blessed be he that cometh in the name of the LORD; we bless you out of the house of the LORD.

27.hebrew: אֵל, יְהוָה--וַיָּאֶר-לָנוּ:    אִסְרוּ-חַג בַּעֲבֹתִים--עַד קַרְנוֹת, הַמִּזְבֵּחַ.
27.english: The LORD is God, and hath given us light; order the festival procession with boughs, even unto the horns of the altar.

28.english: Thou art my God, and I will give thanks unto Thee; Thou art my God, I will exalt Thee.

29.hebrew: הוֹדוּ לַיהוָה כִּי-טוֹב:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
29.english: O give thanks unto the LORD, for He is good, for His mercy endureth for ever. {P}

1.hebrew: àÇùÑÀøÅé úÀîÄéîÅé-ãÈøÆêÀ--    äÇäÉìÀëÄéí, áÌÀúåÉøÇú éÀäåÈä.

9.english: BETH. Wherewithal shall a young man keep his way pure? By taking heed thereto according to Thy word.

10.hebrew: áÌÀëÈì-ìÄáÌÄé ãÀøÇùÑÀúÌÄéêÈ;    àÇì-úÌÇùÑÀâÌÅğÄé, îÄîÌÄöÀåÊúÆéêÈ.
10.english: With my whole heart have I sought Thee; O let me not err from Thy commandments.

11.hebrew: áÌÀìÄáÌÄé, öÈôÇğÀúÌÄé àÄîÀøÈúÆêÈ--    ìÀîÇòÇï, ìÉà àÆçÁèÈà-ìÈêÀ.
11.english: Thy word have I laid up in my heart, that I might not sin against Thee.

12.hebrew: áÌÈøåÌêÀ àÇúÌÈä éÀäåÈä--    ìÇîÌÀãÅğÄé çË÷ÌÆéêÈ.
12.english: Blessed art Thou, O LORD; teach me Thy statutes.

13.hebrew: áÌÄùÒÀôÈúÇé ñÄôÌÇøÀúÌÄé--    ëÌÉì, îÄùÑÀôÌÀèÅé-ôÄéêÈ.
13.english: With my lips have I told all the ordinances of Thy mouth.

14.hebrew: áÌÀãÆøÆêÀ òÅãÀåÊúÆéêÈ ùÒÇùÒÀúÌÄé--    ëÌÀòÇì ëÌÈì-äåÉï.
14.english: I have rejoiced in the way of Thy testimonies, as much as in all riches.

15.hebrew: áÌÀôÄ÷ÌåÌãÆéêÈ àÈùÒÄéçÈä;    åÀàÇáÌÄéèÈä, àÉøÀçÉúÆéêÈ.
15.english: I will meditate in Thy precepts, and have respect unto Thy ways.

16.hebrew: áÌÀçË÷ÌÉúÆéêÈ àÆùÑÀúÌÇòÂùÑÈò;    ìÉà àÆùÑÀëÌÇç ãÌÀáÈøÆêÈ.
16.english: I will delight myself in Thy statutes; I will not forget Thy word. {P}

17.hebrew: âÌÀîÉì òÇì-òÇáÀãÌÀêÈ àÆçÀéÆä;    åÀàÆùÑÀîÀøÈä ãÀáÈøÆêÈ.
17.english: GIMEL. Deal bountifully with Thy servant that I may live, and I will observe Thy word.

18.hebrew: âÌÇì-òÅéğÇé åÀàÇáÌÄéèÈä--    ğÄôÀìÈàåÉú, îÄúÌåÉøÈúÆêÈ.
18.english: Open Thou mine eyes, that I may behold wondrous things out of Thy law.

19.hebrew: âÌÅø àÈğÉëÄé áÈàÈøÆõ;    àÇì-úÌÇñÀúÌÅø îÄîÌÆğÌÄé, îÄöÀåÊúÆéêÈ.
19.english: I am a sojourner in the earth; hide not Thy commandments from me.

20.hebrew: âÌÈøÀñÈä ğÇôÀùÑÄé ìÀúÇàÂáÈä--    àÆì-îÄùÑÀôÌÈèÆéêÈ áÀëÈì-òÅú.
20.english: My soul breaketh for the longing that it hath unto Thine ordinances at all times.

21.hebrew: âÌÈòÇøÀúÌÈ, æÅãÄéí àÂøåÌøÄéí--    äÇùÌÑÉâÄéí, îÄîÌÄöÀåÊúÆéêÈ.
21.english: Thou hast rebuked the proud that are cursed, that do err from Thy commandments.

22.hebrew: âÌÇì îÅòÈìÇé, çÆøÀôÌÈä åÈáåÌæ:    ëÌÄé òÅãÉúÆéêÈ ğÈöÈøÀúÌÄé.
22.english: Take away from me reproach and contempt; for I have kept Thy testimonies.

23.hebrew: âÌÇí éÈùÑÀáåÌ ùÒÈøÄéí, áÌÄé ğÄãÀáÌÈøåÌ--    òÇáÀãÌÀêÈ, éÈùÒÄéçÇ áÌÀçË÷ÌÆéêÈ.
23.english: Even though princes sit and talk against me, thy servant doth meditate in Thy statutes.

24.english: Yea, Thy testimonies are my delight, they are my counsellors. {P}

25.hebrew: ãÌÈáÀ÷Èä ìÆòÈôÈø ğÇôÀùÑÄé;    çÇéÌÅğÄé, ëÌÄãÀáÈøÆêÈ.
25.english: DALETH. My soul cleaveth unto the dust; quicken Thou me according to Thy word.

26.english: I told of my ways, and Thou didst answer me; teach me Thy statutes.

27.english: Make me to understand the way of Thy precepts, that I may talk of Thy wondrous works.

28.english: My soul melteth away for heaviness; sustain me according unto Thy word.

29.english: Remove from me the way of falsehood; and grant me Thy law graciously.

30.english: I have chosen the way of faithfulness; Thine ordinances have I set [before me].

31.english: I cleave unto Thy testimonies; O LORD, put me not to shame.

32.english: I will run the way of Thy commandments, for Thou dost enlarge my heart. {P}

33.hebrew: äåÉøÅğÄé éÀäåÈä, ãÌÆøÆêÀ çË÷ÌÆéêÈ;    åÀàÆöÌÀøÆğÌÈä òÅ÷Æá.
33.english: HE. Teach me, O LORD, the way of Thy statutes; and I will keep it at every step.

34.english: Give me understanding, that I keep Thy law and observe it with my whole heart.

35.english: Make me to tread in the path of Thy commandments; for therein do I delight.

36.english: Incline my heart unto Thy testimonies, and not to covetousness.

37.hebrew: äÇòÂáÅø òÅéğÇé, îÅøÀàåÉú ùÑÈåÀà;    áÌÄãÀøÈëÆêÈ çÇéÌÅğÄé.
37.english: Turn away mine eyes from beholding vanity, and quicken me in Thy ways.

38.english: Confirm Thy word unto Thy servant, which pertaineth unto the fear of Thee.

39.hebrew: äÇòÂáÅø çÆøÀôÌÈúÄé, àÂùÑÆø éÈâÉøÀúÌÄé:    ëÌÄé îÄùÑÀôÌÈèÆéêÈ èåÉáÄéí.
39.english: Turn away my reproach which I dread; for Thine ordinances are good.

40.english: Behold, I have longed after Thy precepts; quicken me in Thy righteousness. {P}

41.english: VAU. Let Thy mercies also come unto me, O LORD, even Thy salvation, according to Thy word;

42.english: That I may have an answer for him that taunteth me; for I trust in Thy word.

43.hebrew: åÀàÇì-úÌÇöÌÅì îÄôÌÄé ãÀáÇø-àÁîÆú òÇã-îÀàÉã:    ëÌÄé ìÀîÄùÑÀôÌÈèÆêÈ, éÄçÈìÀúÌÄé.
43.english: And take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth; for I hope in Thine ordinances;

44.english: So shall I observe Thy law continually for ever and ever;

45.english: And I will walk at ease, for I have sought Thy precepts;

46.hebrew: åÇàÂãÇáÌÀøÈä áÀòÅãÉúÆéêÈ, ğÆâÆã îÀìÈëÄéí;    åÀìÉà àÅáåÉùÑ.
46.english: I will also speak of Thy testimonies before kings, and will not be ashamed.

47.english: And I will delight myself in Thy commandments, which I have loved.

48.english: I will lift up my hands also unto Thy commandments, which I have loved; and I will meditate in Thy statutes. {P}

49.english: ZAIN. Remember the word unto Thy servant, because Thou hast made me to hope.

50.hebrew: æÉàú ğÆçÈîÈúÄé áÀòÈğÀéÄé:    ëÌÄé àÄîÀøÈúÀêÈ çÄéÌÈúÀğÄé.
50.english: This is my comfort in my affliction, that Thy word hath quickened me.

51.hebrew: æÅãÄéí, äÁìÄéöËğÄé òÇã-îÀàÉã;    îÄúÌåÉøÈúÀêÈ, ìÉà ğÈèÄéúÄé.
51.english: The proud have had me greatly in derision; yet have I not turned aside from Thy law.

52.english: I have remembered Thine ordinances which are of old, O LORD, and have comforted myself.

53.english: Burning indignation hath taken hold upon me, because of the wicked that forsake Thy law.

54.english: Thy statutes have been my songs in the house of my pilgrimage.

55.hebrew: æÈëÇøÀúÌÄé áÇìÌÇéÀìÈä ùÑÄîÀêÈ éÀäåÈä;    åÈàÆùÑÀîÀøÈä, úÌåÉøÈúÆêÈ.
55.english: I have remembered Thy name, O LORD, in the night, and have observed Thy law.

56.english: This I have had, that I have kept Thy precepts. {P}

57.english: HETH. My portion is the LORD, I have said that I would observe Thy words.

58.english: I have entreated Thy favour with my whole heart; be gracious unto me according to Thy word.

59.english: I considered my ways, and turned my feet unto Thy testimonies.

60.english: I made haste, and delayed not, to observe Thy commandments.

61.hebrew: çÆáÀìÅé øÀùÑÈòÄéí òÄåÌÀãËğÄé;    úÌåÉøÈúÀêÈ, ìÉà ùÑÈëÈçÀúÌÄé.
61.english: The bands of the wicked have enclosed me; but I have not forgotten Thy law.

62.hebrew: çÂöåÉú-ìÇéÀìÈä--àÈ÷åÌí, ìÀäåÉãåÉú ìÈêÀ:    òÇì, îÄùÑÀôÌÀèÅé öÄãÀ÷ÆêÈ.
62.english: At midnight I will rise to give thanks unto Thee because of Thy righteous ordinances.

63.hebrew: çÈáÅø àÈğÄé, ìÀëÈì-àÂùÑÆø éÀøÅàåÌêÈ;    åÌìÀùÑÉîÀøÅé, ôÌÄ÷ÌåÌãÆéêÈ.
63.english: I am a companion of all them that fear Thee, and of them that observe Thy precepts.

64.hebrew: çÇñÀãÌÀêÈ éÀäåÈä, îÈìÀàÈä äÈàÈøÆõ;    çË÷ÌÆéêÈ ìÇîÌÀãÅğÄé.
64.english: The earth, O LORD, is full of Thy mercy; teach me Thy statutes. {P}

65.english: TETH. Thou hast dealt well with Thy servant, O LORD, according unto Thy word.

66.hebrew: èåÌá èÇòÇí åÈãÇòÇú ìÇîÌÀãÅğÄé:    ëÌÄé áÀîÄöÀåÊúÆéêÈ äÆàÁîÈğÀúÌÄé.

68.english: Thou art good, and doest good; teach me Thy statutes.

71.english: It is good for me that I have been afflicted, in order that I might learn Thy statutes.

72.english: The law of Thy mouth is better unto me than thousands of gold and silver. {P}

73.hebrew: éÈãÆéêÈ òÈùÒåÌğÄé, åÇéÀëåÉğÀğåÌğÄé;    äÂáÄéğÅğÄé, åÀàÆìÀîÀãÈä îÄöÀåÊúÆéêÈ.

74.english: They that fear Thee shall see me and be glad, because I have hope in Thy word.

75.hebrew: éÈãÇòÀúÌÄé éÀäåÈä, ëÌÄé-öÆãÆ÷ îÄùÑÀôÌÈèÆéêÈ;    åÆàÁîåÌğÈä, òÄğÌÄéúÈğÄé.
75.english: I know, O LORD, that Thy judgments are righteous, and that in faithfulness Thou hast afflicted me.

76.english: Let, I pray Thee, Thy lovingkindness be ready to comfort me, according to Thy promise unto Thy servant.

77.english: Let Thy tender mercies come unto me, that I may live; for Thy law is my delight.

78.hebrew: éÅáÉùÑåÌ æÅãÄéí, ëÌÄé-ùÑÆ÷Æø òÄåÌÀúåÌğÄé;    àÂğÄé, àÈùÒÄéçÇ áÌÀôÄ÷ÌåÌãÆéêÈ.
78.english: Let the proud be put to shame, for they have distorted my cause with falsehood; but I will meditate in Thy precepts.

79.english: Let those that fear Thee return unto me, and they that know Thy testimonies.

84.english: How many are the days of Thy servant? When wilt Thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?

85.english: The proud have digged pits for me, which is not according to Thy law.

86.english: All Thy commandments are faithful; they persecute me for nought; help Thou me.

87.hebrew: ëÌÄîÀòÇè, ëÌÄìÌåÌğÄé áÈàÈøÆõ;    åÇàÂğÄé, ìÉà-òÈæÇáÀúÌÄé ôÄ÷ÌËãÆéêÈ.
87.english: They had almost consumed me upon earth; but as for me, I forsook not Thy precepts.

88.english: Quicken me after Thy lovingkindness, and I will observe the testimony of Thy mouth. {P}

89.english: LAMED. For ever, O LORD, Thy word standeth fast in heaven.

90.hebrew: ìÀãÉø åÈãÉø, àÁîåÌğÈúÆêÈ;    ëÌåÉğÇğÀúÌÈ àÆøÆõ, åÇúÌÇòÂîÉã.

94.english: I am Thine, save me; for I have sought Thy precepts.

95.english: The wicked have waited for me to destroy me; but I will consider Thy testimonies.

96.english: I have seen an end to every purpose; but Thy commandment is exceeding broad. {P}

97.english: MEM. O how love I Thy law! It is my meditation all the day.

102.english: I have not turned aside from Thine ordinances; for Thou hast instructed me.

113.english: SAMECH. I hate them that are of a double mind; but Thy law do I love.

114.english: Thou art my covert and my shield; in Thy word do I hope.

115.english: Depart from me, ye evildoers; that I may keep the commandments of my God.

116.english: Uphold me according unto Thy word, that I may live; and put me not to shame in my hope.

117.english: Support Thou me, and I shall be saved; and I will occupy myself with Thy statutes continually.

118.english: Thou hast made light of all them that err from Thy statutes; for their deceit is vain.

119.english: Thou puttest away all the wicked of the earth like dross; therefore I love Thy testimonies.

120.english: My flesh shuddereth for fear of Thee; and I am afraid of Thy judgments. {P}

121.english: AIN. I have done justice and righteousness; leave me not to mine oppressors.

122.english: Be surety for Thy servant for good; let not the proud oppress me.

123.english: Mine eyes fail for Thy salvation, and for Thy righteous word.

124.english: Deal with Thy servant according unto Thy mercy, and teach me Thy statutes.

125.english: I am Thy servant, give me understanding, that I may know Thy testimonies.

126.english: It is time for the LORD to work; they have made void Thy law.

127.english: Therefore I love Thy commandments above gold, yea, above fine gold.

128.hebrew: òÇì-ëÌÅï, ëÌÈì-ôÌÄ÷ÌåÌãÅé ëÉì éÄùÌÑÈøÀúÌÄé;    ëÌÈì-àÉøÇç ùÑÆ÷Æø ùÒÈğÅàúÄé.

129.english: PE. Thy testimonies are wonderful; therefore doth my soul keep them.

130.english: The opening of Thy words giveth light; it giveth understanding unto the simple.

131.english: I opened wide my mouth, and panted; for I longed for Thy commandments.

132.english: Turn Thee towards me, and be gracious unto me, as is Thy wont to do unto those that love Thy name.

133.english: Order my footsteps by Thy word; and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.

134.english: Redeem me from the oppression of man, and I will observe Thy precepts.

135.english: Make Thy face to shine upon Thy servant; and teach me Thy statutes.

136.hebrew: ôÌÇìÀâÅé-îÇéÄí, éÈøÀãåÌ òÅéğÈé--    òÇì, ìÉà-ùÑÈîÀøåÌ úåÉøÈúÆêÈ.
136.english: Mine eyes run down with rivers of water, because they observe not Thy law. {P}

137.english: TZADE. Righteous art Thou, O LORD, and upright are Thy judgments.

138.english: Thou hast commanded Thy testimonies in righteousness and exceeding faithfulness.

139.english: My zeal hath undone me, because mine adversaries have forgotten Thy words.

140.english: Thy word is tried to the uttermost, and Thy servant loveth it.

141.hebrew: öÈòÄéø àÈğÉëÄé åÀğÄáÀæÆä;    ôÌÄ÷ÌËãÆéêÈ, ìÉà ùÑÈëÈçÀúÌÄé.
141.english: I am small and despised; yet have I not forgotten Thy precepts.

142.english: Thy righteousness is an everlasting righteousness, and Thy law is truth.

143.english: Trouble and anguish have overtaken me; yet Thy commandments are my delight.

144.english: Thy testimonies are righteous for ever; give me understanding, and I shall live. {P}

145.english: KOPH. I have called with my whole heart; answer me, O LORD; I will keep Thy statutes.

146.english: I have called Thee, save me, and I will observe Thy testimonies.

147.english: I rose early at dawn, and cried; I hoped in Thy word.

148.english: Mine eyes forestalled the night-watches, that I might meditate in Thy word.

149.english: Hear my voice according unto Thy lovingkindness; quicken me, O LORD, as Thou art wont.

150.english: They draw nigh that follow after wickedness; they are far from Thy law.

151.english: Thou art nigh, O LORD; and all Thy commandments are truth.

152.english: Of old have I known from Thy testimonies that Thou hast founded them for ever. {P}

153.english: RESH. O see mine affliction, and rescue me; for I do not forget Thy law.

154.english: Plead Thou my cause, and redeem me; quicken me according to Thy word.

155.hebrew: øÈçåÉ÷ îÅøÀùÑÈòÄéí éÀùÑåÌòÈä:    ëÌÄé çË÷ÌÆéêÈ, ìÉà ãÈøÈùÑåÌ.
155.english: Salvation is far from the wicked; for they seek not Thy statutes.

156.english: Great are Thy compassions, O LORD; quicken me as Thou art wont.

157.hebrew: øÇáÌÄéí, øÉãÀôÇé åÀöÈøÈé;    îÅòÅãÀåÊúÆéêÈ, ìÉà ğÈèÄéúÄé.
157.english: Many are my persecutors and mine adversaries; yet have I not turned aside from Thy testimonies.

158.hebrew: øÈàÄéúÄé áÉâÀãÄéí, åÈàÆúÀ÷åÉèÈèÈä--    àÂùÑÆø àÄîÀøÈúÀêÈ, ìÉà ùÑÈîÈøåÌ.
158.english: I beheld them that were faithless, and strove with them; because they observed not Thy word.

159.hebrew: øÀàÅä, ëÌÄé-ôÄ÷ÌåÌãÆéêÈ àÈäÈáÀúÌÄé;    éÀäåÈä, ëÌÀçÇñÀãÌÀêÈ çÇéÌÅğÄé.
159.english: O see how I love Thy precepts; quicken me, O LORD, according to Thy lovingkindness.

160.english: The beginning of Thy word is truth; and all Thy righteous ordinance endureth for ever. {P}

161.hebrew: ùÒÈøÄéí, øÀãÈôåÌğÄé çÄğÌÈí;    åîãáøéê (åÌîÄãÌÀáÈøÀêÈ), ôÌÈçÇã ìÄáÌÄé.
161.english: SHIN. Princes have persecuted me without a cause; but my heart standeth in awe of Thy words.

162.hebrew: ùÒÈùÒ àÈğÉëÄé, òÇì-àÄîÀøÈúÆêÈ--    ëÌÀîåÉöÅà, ùÑÈìÈì øÈá.
162.english: I rejoice at Thy word, as one that findeth great spoil.

163.english: I hate and abhor falsehood; Thy law do I love.

164.hebrew: ùÑÆáÇò áÌÇéÌåÉí, äÄìÌÇìÀúÌÄéêÈ--    òÇì, îÄùÑÀôÌÀèÅé öÄãÀ÷ÆêÈ.
164.english: Seven times a day do I praise Thee, because of Thy righteous ordinances.

165.hebrew: ùÑÈìåÉí øÈá, ìÀàÉäÂáÅé úåÉøÈúÆêÈ;    åÀàÅéï-ìÈîåÉ îÄëÀùÑåÉì.
165.english: Great peace have they that love Thy law; and there is no stumbling for them.

166.english: I have hoped for Thy salvation, O LORD, and have done Thy commandments.

167.english: My soul hath observed Thy testimonies; and I love them exceedingly.

168.hebrew: ùÑÈîÇøÀúÌÄé ôÄ÷ÌåÌãÆéêÈ, åÀòÅãÉúÆéêÈ:    ëÌÄé ëÈì-ãÌÀøÈëÇé ğÆâÀãÌÆêÈ.
168.english: I have observed Thy precepts and Thy testimonies; for all my ways are before Thee. {P}

169.hebrew: úÌÄ÷ÀøÇá øÄğÌÈúÄé ìÀôÈğÆéêÈ éÀäåÈä;    ëÌÄãÀáÈøÀêÈ äÂáÄéğÅğÄé.
169.english: TAU. Let my cry come near before Thee, O LORD; give me understanding according to Thy word.

170.english: Let my supplication come before Thee; deliver me according to Thy word.

171.hebrew: úÌÇáÌÇòÀğÈä ùÒÀôÈúÇé úÌÀäÄìÌÈä:    ëÌÄé úÀìÇîÌÀãÅğÄé çË÷ÌÆéêÈ.
171.english: Let my lips utter praise: because Thou teachest me Thy statutes.

172.hebrew: úÌÇòÇï ìÀùÑåÉğÄé, àÄîÀøÈúÆêÈ:    ëÌÄé ëÈì-îÄöÀåÊúÆéêÈ öÌÆãÆ÷.
172.english: Let my tongue sing of Thy word; for all Thy commandments are righteousness.

173.english: Let Thy hand be ready to help me; for I have chosen Thy precepts.

174.english: I have longed for Thy salvation, O LORD; and Thy law is my delight.

175.english: Let my soul live, and it shall praise Thee; and let Thine ordinances help me.

176.hebrew: úÌÈòÄéúÄé--    ëÌÀùÒÆä àÉáÅã, áÌÇ÷ÌÅùÑ òÇáÀãÌÆêÈ:ëÌÄé îÄöÀåÊúÆéêÈ,    ìÉà ùÑÈëÈçÀúÌÄé.
176.english: I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek Thy servant; {N}for I have not forgotten Thy commandments. {P}

1.hebrew: שִׁיר, הַמַּעֲלוֹת:אֶל-יְהוָה, בַּצָּרָתָה לִּי--    קָרָאתִי, וַיַּעֲנֵנִי.
1.english: A Song of Ascents. {N}In my distress I called unto the LORD, and He answered me.

2.hebrew: יְהוָה--הַצִּילָה נַפְשִׁי, מִשְּׂפַת-שֶׁקֶר:    מִלָּשׁוֹן רְמִיָּה.
2.english: O LORD, deliver my soul from lying lips, from a deceitful tongue.

3.hebrew: מַה-יִּתֵּן לְךָ, וּמַה-יֹּסִיף לָךְ--    לָשׁוֹן רְמִיָּה.
3.english: What shall be given unto thee, and what shall be done more unto thee, thou deceitful tongue?

4.hebrew: חִצֵּי גִבּוֹר שְׁנוּנִים;    עִם, גַּחֲלֵי רְתָמִים.
4.english: Sharp arrows of the mighty, with coals of broom.

5.hebrew: אוֹיָה-לִי, כִּי-גַרְתִּי מֶשֶׁךְ;    שָׁכַנְתִּי, עִם-אָהֳלֵי קֵדָר.
5.english: Woe is me, that I sojourn with Meshech, that I dwell beside the tents of Kedar!

6.hebrew: רַבַּת, שָׁכְנָה-לָּהּ נַפְשִׁי--    עִם, שׂוֹנֵא שָׁלוֹם.
6.english: My soul hath full long had her dwelling with him that hateth peace.

7.hebrew: אֲנִי-שָׁלוֹם, וְכִי אֲדַבֵּר;    הֵמָּה, לַמִּלְחָמָה.
7.english: I am all peace; but when I speak, they are for war. {P}

1.hebrew: שִׁיר, לַמַּעֲלוֹת:אֶשָּׂא עֵינַי, אֶל-הֶהָרִים--    מֵאַיִן, יָבֹא עֶזְרִי.
1.english: A Song of Ascents. {N}I will lift up mine eyes unto the mountains: from whence shall my help come?

2.hebrew: עֶזְרִי, מֵעִם יְהוָה--    עֹשֵׂה, שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ.
2.english: My help cometh from the LORD, who made heaven and earth.

3.hebrew: אַל-יִתֵּן לַמּוֹט רַגְלֶךָ;    אַל-יָנוּם, שֹׁמְרֶךָ.
3.english: He will not suffer thy foot to be moved; He that keepeth thee will not slumber.

4.hebrew: הִנֵּה לֹא-יָנוּם, וְלֹא יִישָׁן--    שׁוֹמֵר, יִשְׂרָאֵל.
4.english: Behold, He that keepeth Israel doth neither slumber nor sleep.

5.hebrew: יְהוָה שֹׁמְרֶךָ;    יְהוָה צִלְּךָ, עַל-יַד יְמִינֶךָ.
5.english: The LORD is thy keeper; the LORD is thy shade upon thy right hand.

6.hebrew: יוֹמָם, הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ לֹא-יַכֶּכָּה;    וְיָרֵחַ בַּלָּיְלָה.
6.english: The sun shall not smite thee by day, nor the moon by night.

7.hebrew: יְהוָה, יִשְׁמָרְךָ מִכָּל-רָע:    יִשְׁמֹר, אֶת-נַפְשֶׁךָ.
7.english: The LORD shall keep thee from all evil; He shall keep thy soul.

8.hebrew: יְהוָה, יִשְׁמָר-צֵאתְךָ וּבוֹאֶךָ--    מֵעַתָּה, וְעַד-עוֹלָם.
8.english: The LORD shall guard thy going out and thy coming in, from this time forth and for ever. {P}

1.hebrew: שִׁיר הַמַּעֲלוֹת, לְדָוִד:שָׂמַחְתִּי, בְּאֹמְרִים לִי--    בֵּית יְהוָה נֵלֵךְ.
1.english: A Song of Ascents; of David. {N}I rejoiced when they said unto me: 'Let us go unto the house of the LORD.'

2.hebrew: עֹמְדוֹת, הָיוּ רַגְלֵינוּ--    בִּשְׁעָרַיִךְ, יְרוּשָׁלִָם.
2.english: Our feet are standing within thy gates, O Jerusalem;

3.hebrew: יְרוּשָׁלִַם הַבְּנוּיָה--    כְּעִיר, שֶׁחֻבְּרָה-לָּהּ יַחְדָּו.
3.english: Jerusalem, that art builded as a city that is compact together;

4.hebrew: שֶׁשָּׁם עָלוּ שְׁבָטִים, שִׁבְטֵי-יָהּ--עֵדוּת לְיִשְׂרָאֵל:    לְהֹדוֹת, לְשֵׁם יְהוָה.
4.english: Whither the tribes went up, even the tribes of the LORD, as a testimony unto Israel, to give thanks unto the name of the LORD.

5.hebrew: כִּי שָׁמָּה, יָשְׁבוּ כִסְאוֹת לְמִשְׁפָּט:    כִּסְאוֹת, לְבֵית דָּוִד.
5.english: For there were set thrones for judgment, the thrones of the house of David.

6.hebrew: שַׁאֲלוּ, שְׁלוֹם יְרוּשָׁלִָם;    יִשְׁלָיוּ, אֹהֲבָיִךְ.
6.english: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem; may they prosper that love thee.

7.hebrew: יְהִי-שָׁלוֹם בְּחֵילֵךְ;    שַׁלְוָה, בְּאַרְמְנוֹתָיִךְ.
7.english: Peace be within thy walls, and prosperity within thy palaces.

8.hebrew: לְמַעַן, אַחַי וְרֵעָי--    אֲדַבְּרָה-נָּא שָׁלוֹם בָּךְ.
8.english: For my brethren and companions' sakes, I will now say: 'Peace be within thee.'

9.hebrew: לְמַעַן, בֵּית-יְהוָה אֱלֹהֵינוּ--    אֲבַקְשָׁה טוֹב לָךְ.
9.english: For the sake of the house of the LORD our God I will seek thy good. {P}

1.hebrew: שִׁיר, הַמַּעֲלוֹת:אֵלֶיךָ, נָשָׂאתִי אֶת-עֵינַי--    הַיֹּשְׁבִי, בַּשָּׁמָיִם.
1.english: A Song of Ascents. {N}Unto Thee I lift up mine eyes, O Thou that art enthroned in the heavens.

2.hebrew: הִנֵּה כְעֵינֵי עֲבָדִים,    אֶל-יַד אֲדוֹנֵיהֶם--כְּעֵינֵי שִׁפְחָה,    אֶל-יַד גְּבִרְתָּהּ:כֵּן עֵינֵינוּ, אֶל-יְהוָה אֱלֹהֵינוּ--    עַד, שֶׁיְּחָנֵּנוּ.
2.english: Behold, as the eyes of servants unto the hand of their master, {N}as the eyes of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress; {N}so our eyes look unto the LORD our God, until He be gracious unto us.

3.hebrew: חָנֵּנוּ יְהוָה חָנֵּנוּ:    כִּי-רַב, שָׂבַעְנוּ בוּז.
3.english: Be gracious unto us, O LORD, be gracious unto us; for we are full sated with contempt.

4.hebrew: רַבַּת,    שָׂבְעָה-לָּהּ נַפְשֵׁנוּ:הַלַּעַג הַשַּׁאֲנַנִּים;    הַבּוּז, לגאיונים (לִגְאֵי יוֹנִים).
4.english: Our soul is full sated {N}with the scorning of those that are at ease, and with the contempt of the proud oppressors. {P}

1.hebrew: שִׁיר הַמַּעֲלוֹת, לְדָוִד:לוּלֵי יְהוָה, שֶׁהָיָה לָנוּ--    יֹאמַר-נָא, יִשְׂרָאֵל.
1.english: A Song of Ascents; of David. {N}'If it had not been the LORD who was for us', let Israel now say;

2.hebrew: לוּלֵי יְהוָה, שֶׁהָיָה לָנוּ--    בְּקוּם עָלֵינוּ אָדָם.
2.english: 'If it had not been the LORD who was for us, when men rose up against us,

3.hebrew: אֲזַי, חַיִּים בְּלָעוּנוּ--    בַּחֲרוֹת אַפָּם בָּנוּ.
3.english: Then they had swallowed us up alive, when their wrath was kindled against us;

4.hebrew: אֲזַי, הַמַּיִם שְׁטָפוּנוּ--    נַחְלָה, עָבַר עַל-נַפְשֵׁנוּ.
4.english: Then the waters had overwhelmed us, the stream had gone over our soul;

5.hebrew: אֲזַי, עָבַר עַל-נַפְשֵׁנוּ--    הַמַּיִם, הַזֵּידוֹנִים.
5.english: Then the proud waters had gone over our soul.'

6.hebrew: בָּרוּךְ יְהוָה--    שֶׁלֹּא נְתָנָנוּ טֶרֶף, לְשִׁנֵּיהֶם.
6.english: Blessed be the LORD, who hath not given us as a prey to their teeth.

7.hebrew: נַפְשֵׁנוּ--    כְּצִפּוֹר נִמְלְטָה, מִפַּח יוֹקְשִׁים:הַפַּח נִשְׁבָּר,    וַאֲנַחְנוּ נִמְלָטְנוּ.
7.english: Our soul is escaped as a bird out of the snare of the fowlers; {N}the snare is broken, and we are escaped.

8.hebrew: עֶזְרֵנוּ, בְּשֵׁם יְהוָה--    עֹשֵׂה, שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ.
8.english: Our help is in the name of the LORD, who made heaven and earth. {P}

1.hebrew: שִׁיר, הַמַּעֲלוֹת:הַבֹּטְחִים בַּיהוָה--    כְּהַר-צִיּוֹן לֹא-יִמּוֹט, לְעוֹלָם יֵשֵׁב.
1.english: A Song of Ascents. {N}They that trust in the LORD are as mount Zion, which cannot be moved, but abideth for ever.

2.hebrew: יְרוּשָׁלִַם--    הָרִים, סָבִיב לָהּ:וַיהוָה, סָבִיב לְעַמּוֹ--    מֵעַתָּה, וְעַד-עוֹלָם.
2.english: As the mountains are round about Jerusalem, {N}so the LORD is round about His people, from this time forth and for ever.

3.hebrew: כִּי לֹא יָנוּחַ, שֵׁבֶט הָרֶשַׁע--    עַל, גּוֹרַל הַצַּדִּיקִים:לְמַעַן, לֹא-יִשְׁלְחוּ הַצַּדִּיקִים בְּעַוְלָתָה    יְדֵיהֶם.
3.english: For the rod of wickedness shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous; {N}that the righteous put not forth their hands unto iniquity.

4.hebrew: הֵיטִיבָה יְהוָה, לַטּוֹבִים;    וְלִישָׁרִים, בְּלִבּוֹתָם.
4.english: Do good, O LORD, unto the good, and to them that are upright in their hearts.

5.hebrew: וְהַמַּטִּים עֲקַלְקַלּוֹתָם--    יוֹלִיכֵם יְהוָה, אֶת-פֹּעֲלֵי הָאָוֶן:שָׁלוֹם,    עַל-יִשְׂרָאֵל.
5.english: But as for such as turn aside unto their crooked ways, the LORD will lead them away with the workers of iniquity. {N}Peace be upon Israel. {P}

1.hebrew: שִׁיר, הַמַּעֲלוֹת:בְּשׁוּב יְהוָה, אֶת-שִׁיבַת צִיּוֹן--    הָיִינוּ, כְּחֹלְמִים.
1.english: A Song of Ascents. {N}When the LORD brought back those that returned to Zion, we were like unto them that dream.

2.hebrew: אָז יִמָּלֵא שְׂחוֹק, פִּינוּ--    וּלְשׁוֹנֵנוּ רִנָּה:אָז, יֹאמְרוּ בַגּוֹיִם--    הִגְדִּיל יְהוָה, לַעֲשׂוֹת עִם-אֵלֶּה.
2.english: Then was our mouth filled with laughter, and our tongue with singing; {N}then said they among the nations: 'The LORD hath done great things with these.'

3.hebrew: הִגְדִּיל יְהוָה, לַעֲשׂוֹת עִמָּנוּ--    הָיִינוּ שְׂמֵחִים.
3.english: The LORD hath done great things with us; we are rejoiced.

4.hebrew: שׁוּבָה יְהוָה, אֶת-שבותנו (שְׁבִיתֵנוּ)--    כַּאֲפִיקִים בַּנֶּגֶב.
4.english: Turn our captivity, O LORD, as the streams in the dry land.

5.hebrew: הַזֹּרְעִים בְּדִמְעָה--    בְּרִנָּה יִקְצֹרוּ.
5.english: They that sow in tears shall reap in joy.

6.hebrew: הָלוֹךְ יֵלֵךְ, וּבָכֹה--    נֹשֵׂא מֶשֶׁךְ-הַזָּרַע:בֹּא-יָבֹא בְרִנָּה--    נֹשֵׂא, אֲלֻמֹּתָיו.
6.english: Though he goeth on his way weeping that beareth the measure of seed, {N}he shall come home with joy, bearing his sheaves. {P}

1.hebrew: שִׁיר הַמַּעֲלוֹת, לִשְׁלֹמֹה:אִם-יְהוָה, לֹא-יִבְנֶה בַיִת--    שָׁוְא עָמְלוּ בוֹנָיו בּוֹ;אִם-יְהוָה לֹא-יִשְׁמָר-עִיר,    שָׁוְא שָׁקַד שׁוֹמֵר.
1.english: A Song of Ascents; of Solomon. {N}Except the LORD build the house, they labour in vain that build it; {N}except the LORD keep the city, the watchman waketh but in vain.

2.hebrew: שָׁוְא לָכֶם מַשְׁכִּימֵי קוּם,    מְאַחֲרֵי-שֶׁבֶת--אֹכְלֵי,    לֶחֶם הָעֲצָבִים;כֵּן יִתֵּן לִידִידוֹ    שֵׁנָא.
2.english: It is vain for you that ye rise early, and sit up late, {N}ye that eat the bread of toil; {N}so He giveth unto His beloved in sleep.

3.hebrew: הִנֵּה נַחֲלַת יְהוָה בָּנִים:    שָׂכָר, פְּרִי הַבָּטֶן.
3.english: Lo, children are a heritage of the LORD; the fruit of the womb is a reward.

4.hebrew: כְּחִצִּים בְּיַד-גִּבּוֹר--    כֵּן, בְּנֵי הַנְּעוּרִים.
4.english: As arrows in the hand of a mighty man, so are the children of one's youth.

5.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵי הַגֶּבֶר--    אֲשֶׁר מִלֵּא אֶת-אַשְׁפָּתוֹ, מֵהֶם:לֹא-יֵבֹשׁוּ--    כִּי-יְדַבְּרוּ אֶת-אוֹיְבִים בַּשָּׁעַר.
5.english: Happy is the man that hath his quiver full of them; {N}they shall not be put to shame, when they speak with their enemies in the gate. {P}

1.hebrew: שִׁיר, הַמַּעֲלוֹת:אַשְׁרֵי, כָּל-יְרֵא יְהוָה--    הַהֹלֵךְ, בִּדְרָכָיו.
1.english: A Song of Ascents. {N}Happy is every one that feareth the LORD, that walketh in His ways.

2.hebrew: יְגִיעַ כַּפֶּיךָ, כִּי תֹאכֵל;    אַשְׁרֶיךָ, וְטוֹב לָךְ.
2.english: When thou eatest the labour of thy hands, happy shalt thou be, and it shall be well with thee.

3.hebrew: אֶשְׁתְּךָ, כְּגֶפֶן פֹּרִיָּה--    בְּיַרְכְּתֵי בֵיתֶךָ:בָּנֶיךָ, כִּשְׁתִלֵי זֵיתִים--    סָבִיב, לְשֻׁלְחָנֶךָ.
3.english: Thy wife shall be as a fruitful vine, in the innermost parts of thy house; {N}thy children like olive plants, round about thy table.

4.hebrew: הִנֵּה כִי-כֵן, יְבֹרַךְ גָּבֶר--    יְרֵא יְהוָה.
4.english: Behold, surely thus shall the man be blessed that feareth the LORD.

5.hebrew: יְבָרֶכְךָ יְהוָה, מִצִּיּוֹן:    וּרְאֵה, בְּטוּב יְרוּשָׁלִָם--כֹּל, יְמֵי חַיֶּיךָ.
5.english: The LORD bless thee out of Zion; and see thou the good of Jerusalem all the days of thy life;

6.hebrew: וּרְאֵה-בָנִים לְבָנֶיךָ:    שָׁלוֹם, עַל-יִשְׂרָאֵל.
6.english: And see thy children's children. Peace be upon Israel! {P}

1.hebrew: שִׁיר, הַמַּעֲלוֹת:רַבַּת, צְרָרוּנִי מִנְּעוּרַי--    יֹאמַר-נָא, יִשְׂרָאֵל.
1.english: A Song of Ascents. {N}'Much have they afflicted me from my youth up', let Israel now say;

2.hebrew: רַבַּת, צְרָרוּנִי מִנְּעוּרָי;    גַּם, לֹא-יָכְלוּ לִי.
2.english: 'Much have they afflicted me from my youth up; but they have not prevailed against me.

3.hebrew: עַל-גַּבִּי, חָרְשׁוּ חֹרְשִׁים;    הֶאֱרִיכוּ, למענותם (לְמַעֲנִיתָם).
3.english: The plowers plowed upon my back; they made long their furrows.

4.hebrew: יְהוָה צַדִּיק;    קִצֵּץ, עֲבוֹת רְשָׁעִים.
4.english: The LORD is righteous; He hath cut asunder the cords of the wicked.'

5.hebrew: יֵבֹשׁוּ, וְיִסֹּגוּ אָחוֹר--    כֹּל, שֹׂנְאֵי צִיּוֹן.
5.english: Let them be ashamed and turned backward, all they that hate Zion.

6.hebrew: יִהְיוּ, כַּחֲצִיר גַּגּוֹת--    שֶׁקַּדְמַת שָׁלַף יָבֵשׁ.
6.english: Let them be as the grass upon the housetops, which withereth afore it springeth up;

7.hebrew: שֶׁלֹּא מִלֵּא כַפּוֹ קוֹצֵר;    וְחִצְנוֹ מְעַמֵּר.
7.english: Wherewith the reaper filleth not his hand, nor he that bindeth sheaves his bosom.

8.hebrew: וְלֹא אָמְרוּ, הָעֹבְרִים--    בִּרְכַּת-יְהוָה אֲלֵיכֶם;בֵּרַכְנוּ אֶתְכֶם,    בְּשֵׁם יְהוָה.
8.english: Neither do they that go by say: 'The blessing of the LORD be upon you; {N}we bless you in the name of the LORD.' {P}

1.hebrew: ††щ—ƒйш д«оћ«т¬ме…ъ:оƒоћ«т¬о«чћƒйн чјш»аъƒйк» †† йјде»д.
1.english: A Song of Ascents. {N}Out of the depths have I called Thee, O LORD.

2.hebrew: ††а¬г…р»й, †† щ—ƒојт»д бјче…мƒй:ъћƒдјй∆йр»д а»жјр∆йк», ч«щћ—Ћбе…ъ-- †† мјче…м, ъћ«з¬рећр»й.
2.english: Lord, hearken unto my voice; {N}let Thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.

3.hebrew: ††аƒн-т¬е ре…ъ ъћƒщ—јо»ш-й»дћ-- †† а¬г…р»й, оƒй й«т¬о…г.
