4.english: For with Thee there is forgiveness, that Thou mayest be feared.

5.hebrew: ††чƒећƒйъƒй йјде»д, чƒећјъ»д р«фјщ—ƒй; †† ејмƒгјб»ше… де…з»мјъћƒй.
5.english: I wait for the LORD, my soul doth wait, and in His word do I hope.

6.hebrew: ††р«фјщ—ƒй м«аг…р»й-- †† оƒщћ—…ојшƒйн м«бћ…ч∆ш, щ—…ојшƒйн м«бћ…ч∆ш.
6.english: My soul waiteth for the Lord, more than watchmen for the morning; yea, more than watchmen for the morning.

7.hebrew: ††й«з≈м йƒщ“јш»а≈м, а∆м-йјде»д: †† лћƒй-тƒн-йјде»д д«з∆с∆г; ејд«шјбћ≈д тƒоће… фјгећъ.
7.english: O Israel, hope in the LORD; for with the LORD there is mercy, and with Him is plenteous redemption.

8.hebrew: ††ејдећа, йƒфјгћ∆д а∆ъ-йƒщ“јш»а≈м-- †† оƒлћ…м, т¬е р…ъ»йе.
8.english: And He will redeem Israel from all his iniquities. {P}

1.hebrew: שִׁיר הַמַּעֲלוֹת, לְדָוִד:יְהוָה, לֹא-גָבַהּ לִבִּי--    וְלֹא-רָמוּ עֵינַי;וְלֹא-הִלַּכְתִּי,    בִּגְדֹלוֹת וּבְנִפְלָאוֹת מִמֶּנִּי.
1.english: A Song of Ascents; of David. {N}LORD, my heart is not haughty, nor mine eyes lofty; {N}neither do I exercise myself in things too great, or in things too wonderful for me.

2.hebrew: אִם-לֹא שִׁוִּיתִי, וְדוֹמַמְתִּי--    נַפְשִׁי:כְּגָמֻל, עֲלֵי אִמּוֹ;    כַּגָּמֻל עָלַי נַפְשִׁי.
2.english: Surely I have stilled and quieted my soul; {N}like a weaned child with his mother; my soul is with me like a weaned child.

3.hebrew: יַחֵל יִשְׂרָאֵל, אֶל-יְהוָה--    מֵעַתָּה, וְעַד-עוֹלָם.
3.english: O Israel, hope in the LORD from this time forth and for ever. {P}

1.hebrew: שִׁיר, הַמַּעֲלוֹת:זְכוֹר-יְהוָה לְדָוִד--    אֵת, כָּל-עֻנּוֹתוֹ.
1.english: A Song of Ascents. {N}LORD, remember unto David all his affliction;

2.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר נִשְׁבַּע, לַיהוָה;    נָדַר, לַאֲבִיר יַעֲקֹב.
2.english: How he swore unto the LORD, and vowed unto the Mighty One of Jacob:

3.hebrew: אִם-אָבֹא, בְּאֹהֶל בֵּיתִי;    אִם-אֶעֱלֶה, עַל-עֶרֶשׂ יְצוּעָי.
3.english: 'Surely I will not come into the tent of my house, nor go up into the bed that is spread for me;

4.hebrew: אִם אֶתֵּן שְׁנַת לְעֵינָי;    לְעַפְעַפַּי תְּנוּמָה.
4.english: I will not give sleep to mine eyes, nor slumber to mine eyelids;

5.hebrew: עַד-אֶמְצָא מָקוֹם, לַיהוָה;    מִשְׁכָּנוֹת, לַאֲבִיר יַעֲקֹב.
5.english: Until I find out a place for the LORD, a dwelling-place for the Mighty One of Jacob.'

6.hebrew: הִנֵּה-שְׁמַעֲנוּהָ בְאֶפְרָתָה;    מְצָאנוּהָ, בִּשְׂדֵי-יָעַר.
6.english: Lo, we heard of it as being in Ephrath; we found it in the field of the wood.

7.hebrew: נָבוֹאָה לְמִשְׁכְּנוֹתָיו;    נִשְׁתַּחֲוֶה, לַהֲדֹם רַגְלָיו.
7.english: Let us go into His dwelling-place; let us worship at His footstool.

8.hebrew: קוּמָה יְהוָה, לִמְנוּחָתֶךָ:    אַתָּה, וַאֲרוֹן עֻזֶּךָ.
8.english: Arise, O LORD, unto Thy resting-place; Thou, and the ark of Thy strength.

9.hebrew: כֹּהֲנֶיךָ יִלְבְּשׁוּ-צֶדֶק;    וַחֲסִידֶיךָ יְרַנֵּנוּ.
9.english: Let Thy priests be clothed with righteousness; and let Thy saints shout for joy.

10.hebrew: בַּעֲבוּר, דָּוִד עַבְדֶּךָ--    אַל-תָּשֵׁב, פְּנֵי מְשִׁיחֶךָ.
10.english: For Thy servant David's sake turn not away the face of Thine anointed.

11.hebrew: נִשְׁבַּע-יְהוָה, לְדָוִד אֱמֶת--    לֹא-יָשׁוּב מִמֶּנָּה:מִפְּרִי בִטְנְךָ--    אָשִׁית, לְכִסֵּא-לָךְ.
11.english: The LORD swore unto David in truth; He will not turn back from it: {N}'Of the fruit of thy body will I set upon thy throne.

12.hebrew: אִם-יִשְׁמְרוּ בָנֶיךָ, בְּרִיתִי--    וְעֵדֹתִי זוֹ, אֲלַמְּדֵם:גַּם-בְּנֵיהֶם עֲדֵי-עַד--    יֵשְׁבוּ, לְכִסֵּא-לָךְ.
12.english: If thy children keep My covenant and My testimony that I shall teach them, {N}their children also for ever shall sit upon thy throne.'

13.hebrew: כִּי-בָחַר יְהוָה בְּצִיּוֹן;    אִוָּהּ, לְמוֹשָׁב לוֹ.
13.english: For the LORD hath chosen Zion; He hath desired it for His habitation:

14.hebrew: זֹאת-מְנוּחָתִי עֲדֵי-עַד:    פֹּה-אֵשֵׁב, כִּי אִוִּתִיהָ.
14.english: 'This is My resting-place for ever; here will I dwell; for I have desired it.

15.hebrew: צֵידָהּ, בָּרֵךְ אֲבָרֵךְ;    אֶבְיוֹנֶיהָ, אַשְׂבִּיעַ לָחֶם.
15.english: I will abundantly bless her provision; I will give her needy bread in plenty.

16.hebrew: וְכֹהֲנֶיהָ, אַלְבִּישׁ יֶשַׁע;    וַחֲסִידֶיהָ, רַנֵּן יְרַנֵּנוּ.
16.english: Her priests also will I clothe with salvation; and her saints shall shout aloud for joy.

17.hebrew: שָׁם אַצְמִיחַ קֶרֶן לְדָוִד;    עָרַכְתִּי נֵר, לִמְשִׁיחִי.
17.english: There will I make a horn to shoot up unto David, there have I ordered a lamp for Mine anointed.

18.hebrew: אוֹיְבָיו, אַלְבִּישׁ בֹּשֶׁת;    וְעָלָיו, יָצִיץ נִזְרוֹ.
18.english: His enemies will I clothe with shame; but upon himself shall his crown shine.' {P}

1.hebrew: שִׁיר הַמַּעֲלוֹת, לְדָוִד:הִנֵּה מַה-טּוֹב, וּמַה-נָּעִים--    שֶׁבֶת אַחִים גַּם-יָחַד.
1.english: A Song of Ascents; of David. {N}Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity!

2.hebrew: כַּשֶּׁמֶן הַטּוֹב,    עַל-הָרֹאשׁ--יֹרֵד,    עַל-הַזָּקָן זְקַן-אַהֲרֹן:שֶׁיֹּרֵד,    עַל-פִּי מִדּוֹתָיו.
2.english: It is like the precious oil upon the head, {N}coming down upon the beard; even Aaron's beard, {N}that cometh down upon the collar of his garments;

3.hebrew: כְּטַל-חֶרְמוֹן--    שֶׁיֹּרֵד, עַל-הַרְרֵי צִיּוֹן:כִּי שָׁם צִוָּה יְהוָה,    אֶת-הַבְּרָכָה--חַיִּים,    עַד-הָעוֹלָם.
3.english: Like the dew of Hermon, that cometh down upon the mountains of Zion; {N}for there the LORD commanded the blessing, {N}even life for ever. {P}

1.hebrew: שִׁיר, הַמַּעֲלוֹת:הִנֵּה בָּרְכוּ אֶת-יְהוָה,    כָּל-עַבְדֵי יְהוָה--הָעֹמְדִים בְּבֵית-יְהוָה,    בַּלֵּילוֹת.
1.english: A Song of Ascents. {N}Behold, bless ye the LORD, all ye servants of the LORD, {N}that stand in the house of the LORD in the night seasons.

2.hebrew: שְׂאוּ-יְדֵכֶם קֹדֶשׁ;    וּבָרְכוּ, אֶת-יְהוָה.
2.english: Lift up your hands to the sanctuary, and bless ye the LORD.

3.hebrew: יְבָרֶכְךָ יְהוָה, מִצִּיּוֹן:    עֹשֵׂה, שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ.
3.english: The LORD bless thee out of Zion; even He that made heaven and earth. {P}

1.hebrew: הַלְלוּ-יָהּ:הַלְלוּ, אֶת-שֵׁם יְהוָה;    הַלְלוּ, עַבְדֵי יְהוָה.
1.english: Hallelujah. {N}Praise ye the name of the LORD; give praise, O ye servants of the LORD,

2.hebrew: שֶׁעֹמְדִים, בְּבֵית יְהוָה--    בְּחַצְרוֹת, בֵּית אֱלֹהֵינוּ.
2.english: Ye that stand in the house of the LORD, in the courts of the house of our God.

3.hebrew: הַלְלוּ-יָהּ, כִּי-טוֹב יְהוָה;    זַמְּרוּ לִשְׁמוֹ, כִּי נָעִים.
3.english: Praise ye the LORD, for the LORD is good; sing praises unto His name, for it is pleasant.

4.hebrew: כִּי-יַעֲקֹב, בָּחַר לוֹ יָהּ;    יִשְׂרָאֵל, לִסְגֻלָּתוֹ.
4.english: For the LORD hath chosen Jacob unto Himself, and Israel for His own treasure.

5.hebrew: כִּי אֲנִי יָדַעְתִּי, כִּי-גָדוֹל יְהוָה;    וַאֲדֹנֵינוּ, מִכָּל-אֱלֹהִים.
5.english: For I know that the LORD is great, and that our Lord is above all gods.

6.hebrew: כֹּל אֲשֶׁר-חָפֵץ יְהוָה,    עָשָׂה:בַּשָּׁמַיִם וּבָאָרֶץ--    בַּיַּמִּים, וְכָל-תְּהֹמוֹת.
6.english: Whatsoever the LORD pleased, that hath He done, {N}in heaven and in earth, in the seas and in all deeps;

7.hebrew: מַעֲלֶה נְשִׂאִים,    מִקְצֵה הָאָרֶץ:בְּרָקִים לַמָּטָר עָשָׂה;    מוֹצֵא-רוּחַ, מֵאוֹצְרוֹתָיו.
7.english: Who causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth; {N}He maketh lightnings for the rain; He bringeth forth the wind out of His treasuries.

8.hebrew: שֶׁהִכָּה, בְּכוֹרֵי מִצְרָיִם--    מֵאָדָם, עַד-בְּהֵמָה.
8.english: Who smote the first-born of Egypt, both of man and beast.

9.hebrew: שָׁלַח, אוֹתֹת וּמֹפְתִים--בְּתוֹכֵכִי מִצְרָיִם:    בְּפַרְעֹה, וּבְכָל-עֲבָדָיו.
9.english: He sent signs and wonders into the midst of thee, O Egypt, upon Pharaoh, and upon all his servants.

10.hebrew: שֶׁהִכָּה, גּוֹיִם רַבִּים;    וְהָרַג, מְלָכִים עֲצוּמִים.
10.english: Who smote many nations, and slew mighty kings:

11.hebrew: לְסִיחוֹן, מֶלֶךְ הָאֱמֹרִי, וּלְעוֹג, מֶלֶךְ הַבָּשָׁן;    וּלְכֹל, מַמְלְכוֹת כְּנָעַן.
11.english: Sihon king of the Amorites, and Og king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan;

12.hebrew: וְנָתַן אַרְצָם נַחֲלָה--    נַחֲלָה, לְיִשְׂרָאֵל עַמּוֹ.
12.english: And gave their land for a heritage, a heritage unto Israel His people.

13.hebrew: יְהוָה, שִׁמְךָ לְעוֹלָם;    יְהוָה, זִכְרְךָ לְדֹר-וָדֹר.
13.english: O LORD, Thy name endureth for ever; thy memorial, O LORD, throughout all generations.

14.hebrew: כִּי-יָדִין יְהוָה עַמּוֹ;    וְעַל-עֲבָדָיו, יִתְנֶחָם.
14.english: For the LORD will judge His people, and repent Himself for His servants.

15.hebrew: עֲצַבֵּי הַגּוֹיִם, כֶּסֶף וְזָהָב;    מַעֲשֵׂה, יְדֵי אָדָם.
15.english: The idols of the nations are silver and gold, the work of men's hands.

16.hebrew: פֶּה-לָהֶם, וְלֹא יְדַבֵּרוּ;    עֵינַיִם לָהֶם, וְלֹא יִרְאוּ.
16.english: They have mouths, but they speak not; eyes have they, but they see not;

17.hebrew: אָזְנַיִם לָהֶם, וְלֹא יַאֲזִינוּ;    אַף, אֵין-יֶשׁ-רוּחַ בְּפִיהֶם.
17.english: They have ears, but they hear not; neither is there any breath in their mouths.

18.hebrew: כְּמוֹהֶם, יִהְיוּ עֹשֵׂיהֶם--    כֹּל אֲשֶׁר-בֹּטֵחַ בָּהֶם.
18.english: They that make them shall be like unto them; yea, every one that trusteth in them.

19.hebrew: בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל, בָּרְכוּ אֶת-יְהוָה;    בֵּית אַהֲרֹן, בָּרְכוּ אֶת-יְהוָה.
19.english: O house of Israel, bless ye the LORD; O house of Aaron, bless ye the LORD;

20.hebrew: בֵּית הַלֵּוִי, בָּרְכוּ אֶת-יְהוָה;    יִרְאֵי יְהוָה, בָּרְכוּ אֶת-יְהוָה.
20.english: O house of Levi, bless ye the LORD; ye that fear the LORD, bless ye the LORD.

21.hebrew: בָּרוּךְ יְהוָה, מִצִּיּוֹן--    שֹׁכֵן יְרוּשָׁלִָם:הַלְלוּ-יָהּ.
21.english: Blessed be the LORD out of Zion, who dwelleth at Jerusalem. Hallelujah. {P}

1.hebrew: הוֹדוּ לַיהוָה כִּי-טוֹב:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
1.english: O give thanks unto the LORD, for He is good, for His mercy endureth for ever.

2.hebrew: הוֹדוּ, לֵאלֹהֵי הָאֱלֹהִים:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
2.english: O give thanks unto the God of gods, for His mercy endureth for ever.

3.hebrew: הוֹדוּ, לַאֲדֹנֵי הָאֲדֹנִים:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
3.english: O give thanks unto the Lord of lords, for His mercy endureth for ever.

4.hebrew: לְעֹשֵׂה נִפְלָאוֹת גְּדֹלוֹת לְבַדּוֹ:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
4.english: To Him who alone doeth great wonders, for His mercy endureth for ever.

5.hebrew: לְעֹשֵׂה הַשָּׁמַיִם, בִּתְבוּנָה:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
5.english: To Him that by understanding made the heavens, for His mercy endureth for ever.

6.hebrew: לְרֹקַע הָאָרֶץ, עַל-הַמָּיִם:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
6.english: To Him that spread forth the earth above the waters, for His mercy endureth for ever.

7.hebrew: לְעֹשֵׂה, אוֹרִים גְּדֹלִים:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
7.english: To Him that made great lights, for His mercy endureth for ever;

8.hebrew: אֶת-הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ, לְמֶמְשֶׁלֶת בַּיּוֹם:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
8.english: The sun to rule by day, for His mercy endureth for ever;

9.hebrew: אֶת-הַיָּרֵחַ וְכוֹכָבִים, לְמֶמְשְׁלוֹת בַּלָּיְלָה:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
9.english: The moon and stars to rule by night, for His mercy endureth for ever.

10.hebrew: לְמַכֵּה מִצְרַיִם, בִּבְכוֹרֵיהֶם:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
10.english: To Him that smote Egypt in their first-born, for His mercy endureth for ever;

11.hebrew: וַיּוֹצֵא יִשְׂרָאֵל, מִתּוֹכָם:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
11.english: And brought out Israel from among them, for His mercy endureth for ever;

12.hebrew: בְּיָד חֲזָקָה, וּבִזְרוֹעַ נְטוּיָה:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
12.english: With a strong hand, and with an outstretched arm, for His mercy endureth for ever.

13.hebrew: לְגֹזֵר יַם-סוּף, לִגְזָרִים:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
13.english: To Him who divided the Red Sea in sunder, for His mercy endureth for ever;

14.hebrew: וְהֶעֱבִיר יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּתוֹכוֹ:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
14.english: And made Israel to pass through the midst of it, for His mercy endureth for ever;

15.hebrew: וְנִעֵר פַּרְעֹה וְחֵילוֹ בְיַם-סוּף:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
15.english: But overthrew Pharaoh and his host in the Red Sea, for His mercy endureth for ever.

16.hebrew: לְמוֹלִיךְ עַמּוֹ, בַּמִּדְבָּר:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
16.english: To Him that led His people through the wilderness, for His mercy endureth for ever.

17.hebrew: לְמַכֵּה, מְלָכִים גְּדֹלִים:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
17.english: To Him that smote great kings; for His mercy endureth for ever;

18.hebrew: וַיַּהֲרֹג, מְלָכִים אַדִּירִים:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
18.english: And slew mighty kings, for His mercy endureth for ever.

19.hebrew: לְסִיחוֹן, מֶלֶךְ הָאֱמֹרִי:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
19.english: Sihon king of the Amorites, for His mercy endureth for ever;

20.hebrew: וּלְעוֹג, מֶלֶךְ הַבָּשָׁן:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
20.english: And Og king of Bashan, for His mercy endureth for ever;

21.hebrew: וְנָתַן אַרְצָם לְנַחֲלָה:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
21.english: And gave their land for a heritage, for His mercy endureth for ever;

22.hebrew: נַחֲלָה, לְיִשְׂרָאֵל עַבְדּוֹ:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
22.english: Even a heritage unto Israel His servant, for His mercy endureth for ever.

23.hebrew: שֶׁבְּשִׁפְלֵנוּ, זָכַר לָנוּ:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
23.english: Who remembered us in our low estate, for His mercy endureth for ever;

24.english: And hath delivered us from our adversaries, for His mercy endureth for ever.

25.hebrew: נֹתֵן לֶחֶם, לְכָל-בָּשָׂר:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
25.english: Who giveth food to all flesh, for His mercy endureth for ever.

26.hebrew: הוֹדוּ, לְאֵל הַשָּׁמָיִם:    כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ.
26.english: O give thanks unto the God of heaven, for His mercy endureth for ever. {P}

1.hebrew: עַל נַהֲרוֹת, בָּבֶל--שָׁם יָשַׁבְנוּ, גַּם-בָּכִינוּ:    בְּזָכְרֵנוּ, אֶת-צִיּוֹן.
1.english: By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down, yea, we wept, when we remembered Zion.

2.hebrew: עַל-עֲרָבִים בְּתוֹכָהּ--    תָּלִינוּ, כִּנֹּרוֹתֵינוּ.
2.english: Upon the willows in the midst thereof we hanged up our harps.

3.hebrew: כִּי שָׁם שְׁאֵלוּנוּ שׁוֹבֵינוּ, דִּבְרֵי-שִׁיר--    וְתוֹלָלֵינוּ שִׂמְחָה:שִׁירוּ לָנוּ,    מִשִּׁיר צִיּוֹן.
3.english: For there they that led us captive asked of us words of song, and our tormentors asked of us mirth: {N}'Sing us one of the songs of Zion.'

4.hebrew: אֵיךְ--נָשִׁיר אֶת-שִׁיר-יְהוָה:    עַל, אַדְמַת נֵכָר.
4.english: How shall we sing the LORD'S song in a foreign land?

5.hebrew: אִם-אֶשְׁכָּחֵךְ יְרוּשָׁלִָם--    תִּשְׁכַּח יְמִינִי.
5.english: If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget her cunning.

6.hebrew: תִּדְבַּק-לְשׁוֹנִי, לְחִכִּי--    אִם-לֹא אֶזְכְּרֵכִי:אִם-לֹא אַעֲלֶה, אֶת-יְרוּשָׁלִַם--    עַל, רֹאשׁ שִׂמְחָתִי.
6.english: Let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth, if I remember thee not; {N}if I set not Jerusalem above my chiefest joy.

7.hebrew: זְכֹר יְהוָה, לִבְנֵי אֱדוֹם--    אֵת, יוֹם יְרוּשָׁלִָם:הָאֹמְרִים, עָרוּ עָרוּ--    עַד, הַיְסוֹד בָּהּ.
7.english: Remember, O LORD, against the children of Edom the day of Jerusalem; {N}who said: 'Rase it, rase it, even to the foundation thereof.'

8.hebrew: בַּת-בָּבֶל,    הַשְּׁדוּדָה:אַשְׁרֵי שֶׁיְשַׁלֶּם-לָךְ--    אֶת-גְּמוּלֵךְ, שֶׁגָּמַלְתְּ לָנוּ.
8.english: O daughter of Babylon, that art to be destroyed; {N}happy shall he be, that repayeth thee as thou hast served us.

9.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵי, שֶׁיֹּאחֵז וְנִפֵּץ אֶת-עֹלָלַיִךְ--    אֶל-הַסָּלַע.
9.english: Happy shall he be, that taketh and dasheth thy little ones against the rock. {P}

1.hebrew: לְדָוִד:  אוֹדְךָ בְכָל-לִבִּי;    נֶגֶד אֱלֹהִים אֲזַמְּרֶךָּ.
1.english: [A Psalm] of David. I will give Thee thanks with my whole heart, in the presence of the mighty will I sing praises unto Thee.

2.hebrew: אֶשְׁתַּחֲוֶה אֶל-הֵיכַל קָדְשְׁךָ,    וְאוֹדֶה אֶת-שְׁמֶךָ--עַל-חַסְדְּךָ    וְעַל-אֲמִתֶּךָ:כִּי-הִגְדַּלְתָּ עַל-כָּל-שִׁמְךָ,    אִמְרָתֶךָ.
2.english: I will bow down toward Thy holy temple, and give thanks unto Thy name {N}for Thy mercy and for Thy truth; {N}for Thou hast magnified Thy word above all Thy name.

3.hebrew: בְּיוֹם קָרָאתִי, וַתַּעֲנֵנִי;    תַּרְהִבֵנִי בְנַפְשִׁי עֹז.
3.english: In the day that I called, Thou didst answer me; Thou didst encourage me in my soul with strength.

4.hebrew: יוֹדוּךָ יְהוָה, כָּל-מַלְכֵי-אָרֶץ:    כִּי שָׁמְעוּ, אִמְרֵי-פִיךָ.
4.english: All the kings of the earth shall give Thee thanks, O LORD, for they have heard the words of Thy mouth.

5.hebrew: וְיָשִׁירוּ, בְּדַרְכֵי יְהוָה:    כִּי-גָדוֹל, כְּבוֹד יְהוָה.
5.english: Yea, they shall sing of the ways of the LORD; for great is the glory of the LORD.

6.hebrew: כִּי-רָם יְהוָה, וְשָׁפָל יִרְאֶה;    וְגָבֹהַּ, מִמֶּרְחָק יְיֵדָע.
6.english: For though the LORD be high, yet regardeth He the lowly, and the haughty He knoweth from afar.

7.hebrew: אִם-אֵלֵךְ, בְּקֶרֶב צָרָה--    תְּחַיֵּנִי:עַל אַף אֹיְבַי, תִּשְׁלַח יָדֶךָ;    וְתוֹשִׁיעֵנִי יְמִינֶךָ.
7.english: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, Thou quickenest me; {N}Thou stretchest forth Thy hand against the wrath of mine enemies, and Thy right hand doth save me.

8.hebrew: יְהוָה, יִגְמֹר בַּעֲדִי:    יְהוָה, חַסְדְּךָ לְעוֹלָם; מַעֲשֵׂי יָדֶיךָ אַל-תֶּרֶף.
8.english: The LORD will accomplish that which concerneth me; Thy mercy, O LORD, endureth for ever; forsake not the work of Thine own hands. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ, לְדָוִד מִזְמוֹר:יְהוָה חֲקַרְתַּנִי,    וַתֵּדָע.
1.english: For the Leader. A Psalm of David. {N}O LORD, Thou hast searched me, and known me.

2.hebrew: אַתָּה יָדַעְתָּ, שִׁבְתִּי וְקוּמִי;    בַּנְתָּה לְרֵעִי, מֵרָחוֹק.
2.english: Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising, Thou understandest my thought afar off.

3.hebrew: אָרְחִי וְרִבְעִי זֵרִיתָ;    וְכָל-דְּרָכַי הִסְכַּנְתָּה.
3.english: Thou measurest my going about and my lying down, and art acquainted with all my ways.

4.hebrew: כִּי אֵין מִלָּה, בִּלְשׁוֹנִי;    הֵן יְהוָה, יָדַעְתָּ כֻלָּהּ.
4.english: For there is not a word in my tongue, but, lo, O LORD, Thou knowest it altogether.

5.hebrew: אָחוֹר וָקֶדֶם צַרְתָּנִי;    וַתָּשֶׁת עָלַי כַּפֶּכָה.
5.english: Thou hast hemmed me in behind and before, and laid Thy hand upon me.

6.hebrew: פלאיה (פְּלִיאָה) דַעַת מִמֶּנִּי;    נִשְׂגְּבָה, לֹא-אוּכַל לָהּ.
6.english: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; too high, I cannot attain unto it.

7.hebrew: אָנָה, אֵלֵךְ מֵרוּחֶךָ;    וְאָנָה, מִפָּנֶיךָ אֶבְרָח.
7.english: Whither shall I go from Thy spirit? or whither shall I flee from Thy presence?

8.hebrew: אִם אֶסַּק שָׁמַיִם, שָׁם אָתָּה;    וְאַצִּיעָה שְּׁאוֹל הִנֶּךָּ.
8.english: If I ascend up into heaven, Thou art there; if I make my bed in the nether-world, behold, Thou art there.

9.hebrew: אֶשָּׂא כַנְפֵי-שָׁחַר;    אֶשְׁכְּנָה, בְּאַחֲרִית יָם.
9.english: If I take the wings of the morning, and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea;

10.hebrew: גַּם-שָׁם, יָדְךָ תַנְחֵנִי;    וְתֹאחֲזֵנִי יְמִינֶךָ.
10.english: Even there would Thy hand lead me, and Thy right hand would hold me.

11.hebrew: וָאֹמַר, אַךְ-חֹשֶׁךְ יְשׁוּפֵנִי;    וְלַיְלָה, אוֹר בַּעֲדֵנִי.
11.english: And if I say: 'Surely the darkness shall envelop me, and the light about me shall be night';

12.hebrew: גַּם-חֹשֶׁךְ,    לֹא-יַחְשִׁיךְ מִמֶּךָּ:וְלַיְלָה, כַּיּוֹם יָאִיר--    כַּחֲשֵׁיכָה, כָּאוֹרָה.
12.english: Even the darkness is not too dark for Thee, {N}but the night shineth as the day; the darkness is even as the light.

13.hebrew: כִּי-אַתָּה, קָנִיתָ כִלְיֹתָי;    תְּסֻכֵּנִי, בְּבֶטֶן אִמִּי.
13.english: For Thou hast made my reins; Thou hast knit me together in my mother's womb.

14.hebrew: אוֹדְךָ--    עַל כִּי נוֹרָאוֹת, נִפְלֵיתִי:נִפְלָאִים מַעֲשֶׂיךָ;    וְנַפְשִׁי, יֹדַעַת מְאֹד.
14.english: I will give thanks unto Thee, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made; {N}wonderful are Thy works; and that my soul knoweth right well.

15.hebrew: לֹא-נִכְחַד עָצְמִי,    מִמֶּךָּ:אֲשֶׁר-עֻשֵּׂיתִי בַסֵּתֶר;    רֻקַּמְתִּי, בְּתַחְתִּיּוֹת אָרֶץ.
15.english: My frame was not hidden from Thee, {N}when I was made in secret, and curiously wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.

16.hebrew: גָּלְמִי, רָאוּ עֵינֶיךָ,    וְעַל-סִפְרְךָ, כֻּלָּם יִכָּתֵבוּ:יָמִים יֻצָּרוּ;    ולא (וְלוֹ) אֶחָד בָּהֶם.
16.english: Thine eyes did see mine unformed substance, and in Thy book they were all written-- {N}even the days that were fashioned, when as yet there was none of them.

17.hebrew: וְלִי--מַה-יָּקְרוּ רֵעֶיךָ אֵל;    מֶה עָצְמוּ, רָאשֵׁיהֶם.
17.english: How weighty also are Thy thoughts unto me, O God! How great is the sum of them!

18.hebrew: אֶסְפְּרֵם, מֵחוֹל יִרְבּוּן;    הֱקִיצֹתִי, וְעוֹדִי עִמָּךְ.
18.english: If I would count them, they are more in number than the sand; were I to come to the end of them, I would still be with Thee.

19.hebrew: אִם-תִּקְטֹל אֱלוֹהַּ רָשָׁע;    וְאַנְשֵׁי דָמִים, סוּרוּ מֶנִּי.
19.english: If Thou but wouldest slay the wicked, O God--depart from me therefore, ye men of blood;

20.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר יֹמְרוּךָ, לִמְזִמָּה;    נָשׂוּא לַשָּׁוְא עָרֶיךָ.
20.english: Who utter Thy name with wicked thought, they take it for falsehood, even Thine enemies--

21.hebrew: הֲלוֹא-מְשַׂנְאֶיךָ יְהוָה אֶשְׂנָא;    וּבִתְקוֹמְמֶיךָ, אֶתְקוֹטָט.
21.english: Do not I hate them, O LORD, that hate Thee? And do not I strive with those that rise up against Thee?

22.hebrew: תַּכְלִית שִׂנְאָה שְׂנֵאתִים;    לְאוֹיְבִים, הָיוּ לִי.
22.english: I hate them with utmost hatred; I count them mine enemies.

23.hebrew: חָקְרֵנִי אֵל, וְדַע לְבָבִי;    בְּחָנֵנִי, וְדַע שַׂרְעַפָּי.
23.english: Search me, O God, and know my heart, try me, and know my thoughts;

24.hebrew: וּרְאֵה, אִם-דֶּרֶךְ-עֹצֶב בִּי;    וּנְחֵנִי, בְּדֶרֶךְ עוֹלָם.
24.english: And see if there be any way in me that is grievous, and lead me in the way everlasting. {P}

1.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּחַ, מִזְמוֹר לְדָוִד.
1.english: For the Leader. A Psalm of David.

2.hebrew: חַלְּצֵנִי יְהוָה, מֵאָדָם רָע;    מֵאִישׁ חֲמָסִים תִּנְצְרֵנִי.
2.english: Deliver me, O LORD, from the evil man; preserve me from the violent man;

3.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר חָשְׁבוּ רָעוֹת בְּלֵב;    כָּל-יוֹם, יָגוּרוּ מִלְחָמוֹת.
3.english: Who devise evil things in their heart; every day do they stir up wars.

4.hebrew: שָׁנְנוּ לְשׁוֹנָם, כְּמוֹ-נָחָשׁ:    חֲמַת עַכְשׁוּב--תַּחַת שְׂפָתֵימוֹ סֶלָה.
4.english: They have sharpened their tongue like a serpent; vipers' venom is under their lips. Selah

5.hebrew: שָׁמְרֵנִי יְהוָה, מִידֵי רָשָׁע--    מֵאִישׁ חֲמָסִים תִּנְצְרֵנִי:אֲשֶׁר חָשְׁבוּ,    לִדְחוֹת פְּעָמָי.
5.english: Keep me, O LORD, from the hands of the wicked; preserve me from the violent man; {N}who have purposed to make my steps slip.

6.hebrew: טָמְנוּ גֵאִים, פַּח לִי--    וַחֲבָלִים, פָּרְשׂוּ רֶשֶׁת לְיַד-מַעְגָּל;מֹקְשִׁים שָׁתוּ-לִי    סֶלָה.
6.english: The proud have hid a snare for me, and cords; they have spread a net by the wayside; {N}they have set gins for me. Selah

7.hebrew: אָמַרְתִּי לַיהוָה, אֵלִי אָתָּה;    הַאֲזִינָה יְהוָה, קוֹל תַּחֲנוּנָי.
7.english: I have said unto the LORD: 'Thou art my God'; give ear, O LORD, unto the voice of my supplications.

8.hebrew: יְהוִה אֲדֹנָי, עֹז יְשׁוּעָתִי;    סַכֹּתָה לְרֹאשִׁי, בְּיוֹם נָשֶׁק.
8.english: O GOD the Lord, the strength of my salvation, who hast screened my head in the day of battle,

9.hebrew: אַל-תִּתֵּן יְהוָה, מַאֲוַיֵּי רָשָׁע;    זְמָמוֹ אַל-תָּפֵק, יָרוּמוּ סֶלָה.
9.english: Grant not, O LORD, the desires of the wicked; further not his evil device, so that they exalt themselves. Selah

10.hebrew: רֹאשׁ מְסִבָּי--    עֲמַל שְׂפָתֵימוֹ יכסומו (יְכַסֵּימוֹ).
10.english: As for the head of those that compass me about, let the mischief of their own lips cover them.

11.hebrew: ימיטו (יִמּוֹטוּ) עֲלֵיהֶם, גֶּחָלִים:    בָּאֵשׁ יַפִּלֵם; בְּמַהֲמֹרוֹת, בַּל-יָקוּמוּ.
11.english: Let burning coals fall upon them; let them be cast into the fire, into deep pits, that they rise not up again.

12.hebrew: אִישׁ לָשׁוֹן, בַּל-יִכּוֹן בָּאָרֶץ:    אִישׁ-חָמָס רָע--יְצוּדֶנּוּ, לְמַדְחֵפֹת.
12.english: A slanderer shall not be established in the earth; the violent and evil man shall be hunted with thrust upon thrust.

13.hebrew: ידעת (יָדַעְתִּי)--כִּי-יַעֲשֶׂה יְהוָה, דִּין עָנִי:    מִשְׁפַּט, אֶבְיֹנִים.
13.english: I know that the LORD will maintain the cause of the poor, and the right of the needy.

14.hebrew: אַךְ צַדִּיקִים, יוֹדוּ לִשְׁמֶךָ;    יֵשְׁבוּ יְשָׁרִים, אֶת-פָּנֶיךָ.
14.english: Surely the righteous shall give thanks unto Thy name; the upright shall dwell in Thy presence. {P}

1.hebrew: מִזְמוֹר, לְדָוִד:יְהוָה קְרָאתִיךָ, חוּשָׁה לִּי;    הַאֲזִינָה קוֹלִי, בְּקָרְאִי-לָךְ.
1.english: A Psalm of David. {N}LORD, I have called Thee; make haste unto me; give ear unto my voice, when I call unto Thee.

2.hebrew: תִּכּוֹן תְּפִלָּתִי קְטֹרֶת לְפָנֶיךָ;    מַשְׂאַת כַּפַּי, מִנְחַת-עָרֶב.
2.english: Let my prayer be set forth as incense before Thee, the lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.

3.hebrew: שִׁיתָה יְהוָה, שָׁמְרָה לְפִי;    נִצְּרָה, עַל-דַּל שְׂפָתָי.
3.english: Set a guard, O LORD, to my mouth; keep watch at the door of my lips.

4.hebrew: אַל-תַּט-לִבִּי    לְדָבָר רָע,לְהִתְעוֹלֵל עֲלִלוֹת    בְּרֶשַׁע--אֶת-אִישִׁים    פֹּעֲלֵי-אָוֶן;וּבַל-אֶלְחַם,    בְּמַנְעַמֵּיהֶם.
4.english: Incline not my heart to any evil thing, {N}to be occupied in deeds of wickedness {N}with men that work iniquity; {N}and let me not eat of their dainties.

5.hebrew: יֶהֶלְמֵנִי צַדִּיק חֶסֶד,    וְיוֹכִיחֵנִי--שֶׁמֶן רֹאשׁ,    אַל-יָנִי רֹאשִׁי:כִּי-עוֹד וּתְפִלָּתִי,    בְּרָעוֹתֵיהֶם.
5.english: Let the righteous smite me in kindness, and correct me; {N}oil so choice let not my head refuse; {N}for still is my prayer because of their wickedness.

6.hebrew: נִשְׁמְטוּ בִידֵי-סֶלַע, שֹׁפְטֵיהֶם;    וְשָׁמְעוּ אֲמָרַי, כִּי נָעֵמוּ.
6.english: Their judges are thrown down by the sides of the rock; and they shall hear my words, that they are sweet.

7.hebrew: כְּמוֹ פֹלֵחַ וּבֹקֵעַ בָּאָרֶץ--    נִפְזְרוּ עֲצָמֵינוּ, לְפִי שְׁאוֹל.
7.english: As when one cleaveth and breaketh up the earth, our bones are scattered at the grave's mouth.

8.hebrew: כִּי אֵלֶיךָ, יְהוִה אֲדֹנָי עֵינָי;    בְּכָה חָסִיתִי, אַל-תְּעַר נַפְשִׁי.
8.english: For mine eyes are unto Thee, O GOD the Lord; in Thee have I taken refuge, O pour not out my soul.

9.hebrew: שָׁמְרֵנִי--מִידֵי פַח, יָקְשׁוּ לִי;    וּמֹקְשׁוֹת, פֹּעֲלֵי אָוֶן.
9.english: Keep me from the snare which they have laid for me, and from the gins of the workers of iniquity.

10.hebrew: יִפְּלוּ בְמַכְמֹרָיו רְשָׁעִים;    יַחַד אָנֹכִי, עַד-אֶעֱבוֹר.
10.english: Let the wicked fall into their own nets, whilst I withal escape. {P}

1.hebrew: מַשְׂכִּיל לְדָוִד;בִּהְיוֹתוֹ בַמְּעָרָה    תְפִלָּה.
1.english: Maschil of David, {N}when he was in the cave; a Prayer.

2.hebrew: קוֹלִי, אֶל-יְהוָה אֶזְעָק;    קוֹלִי, אֶל-יְהוָה אֶתְחַנָּן.
2.english: With my voice I cry unto the LORD; with my voice I make supplication unto the LORD.

3.hebrew: אֶשְׁפֹּךְ לְפָנָיו שִׂיחִי;    צָרָתִי, לְפָנָיו אַגִּיד.
3.english: I pour out my complaint before Him, I declare before Him my trouble;

4.hebrew: בְּהִתְעַטֵּף עָלַי, רוּחִי--    וְאַתָּה, יָדַעְתָּ נְתִיבָתִי:בְּאֹרַח-זוּ אֲהַלֵּךְ--    טָמְנוּ פַח לִי.
4.english: When my spirit fainteth within me--Thou knowest my path-- {N}in the way wherein I walk have they hidden a snare for me.

5.hebrew: הַבֵּיט יָמִין, וּרְאֵה--    וְאֵין-לִי מַכִּיר:אָבַד מָנוֹס מִמֶּנִּי;    אֵין דּוֹרֵשׁ לְנַפְשִׁי.
5.english: Look on my right hand, and see, for there is no man that knoweth me; {N}I have no way to flee; no man careth for my soul.

6.hebrew: זָעַקְתִּי אֵלֶיךָ,    יְהוָה:אָמַרְתִּי, אַתָּה מַחְסִי;    חֶלְקִי, בְּאֶרֶץ הַחַיִּים.
6.english: I have cried unto Thee, O LORD; {N}I have said: 'Thou art my refuge, my portion in the land of the living.'

7.hebrew: הַקְשִׁיבָה, אֶל-רִנָּתִי--    כִּי-דַלּוֹתִי-מְאֹד:הַצִּילֵנִי מֵרֹדְפַי--    כִּי אָמְצוּ מִמֶּנִּי.
7.english: Attend unto my cry; for I am brought very low; {N}deliver me from my persecutors; for they are too strong for me.

8.hebrew: הוֹצִיאָה מִמַּסְגֵּר, נַפְשִׁי--    לְהוֹדוֹת אֶת-שְׁמֶךָ:בִּי, יַכְתִּרוּ צַדִּיקִים--    כִּי תִגְמֹל עָלָי.
8.english: Bring my soul out of prison, that I may give thanks unto Thy name; {N}the righteous shall crown themselves because of me; for Thou wilt deal bountifully with me. {P}

1.hebrew: מִזְמוֹר, לְדָוִד:יְהוָה, שְׁמַע תְּפִלָּתִי--    הַאֲזִינָה אֶל-תַּחֲנוּנַי;בֶּאֱמֻנָתְךָ עֲנֵנִי,    בְּצִדְקָתֶךָ.
1.english: A Psalm of David. {N}O LORD, hear my prayer, give ear to my supplications; {N}in Thy faithfulness answer me, and in Thy righteousness.

2.hebrew: וְאַל-תָּבוֹא בְמִשְׁפָּט,    אֶת-עַבְדֶּךָ:כִּי לֹא-יִצְדַּק לְפָנֶיךָ    כָל-חָי.
2.english: And enter not into judgment with Thy servant; {N}for in Thy sight shall no man living be justified.

3.hebrew: כִּי רָדַף אוֹיֵב, נַפְשִׁי--    דִּכָּא לָאָרֶץ, חַיָּתִי;הוֹשִׁבַנִי בְמַחֲשַׁכִּים,    כְּמֵתֵי עוֹלָם.
3.english: For the enemy hath persecuted my soul; he hath crushed my life down to the ground; {N}he hath made me to dwell in darkness, as those that have been long dead.

4.hebrew: וַתִּתְעַטֵּף עָלַי רוּחִי;    בְּתוֹכִי, יִשְׁתּוֹמֵם לִבִּי.
4.english: And my spirit fainteth within me; my heart within me is appalled.

5.hebrew: זָכַרְתִּי יָמִים, מִקֶּדֶם--    הָגִיתִי בְכָל-פָּעֳלֶךָ;בְּמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיךָ    אֲשׂוֹחֵחַ.
5.english: I remember the days of old; I meditate on all Thy doing; {N}I muse on the work of Thy hands.

6.hebrew: פֵּרַשְׂתִּי יָדַי אֵלֶיךָ;    נַפְשִׁי, כְּאֶרֶץ-עֲיֵפָה לְךָ סֶלָה.
6.english: I spread forth my hands unto Thee; my soul [thirsteth] after Thee, as a weary land. Selah

7.hebrew: מַהֵר עֲנֵנִי, יְהוָה--    כָּלְתָה רוּחִי:אַל-תַּסְתֵּר פָּנֶיךָ מִמֶּנִּי;    וְנִמְשַׁלְתִּי, עִם-יֹרְדֵי בוֹר.
7.english: Answer me speedily, O LORD, my spirit faileth; {N}hide not Thy face from me; lest I become like them that go down into the pit.

8.hebrew: הַשְׁמִיעֵנִי בַבֹּקֶר, חַסְדֶּךָ--    כִּי-בְךָ בָטָחְתִּי:הוֹדִיעֵנִי, דֶּרֶךְ-זוּ אֵלֵךְ--    כִּי-אֵלֶיךָ, נָשָׂאתִי נַפְשִׁי.
8.english: Cause me to hear Thy lovingkindness in the morning, for in Thee do I trust; {N}cause me to know the way wherein I should walk, for unto Thee have I lifted up my soul.

9.hebrew: הַצִּילֵנִי מֵאֹיְבַי יְהוָה--    אֵלֶיךָ כִסִּתִי.
9.english: Deliver me from mine enemies, O LORD; with Thee have I hidden myself.

10.hebrew: לַמְּדֵנִי, לַעֲשׂוֹת רְצוֹנֶךָ--    כִּי-אַתָּה אֱלוֹהָי:רוּחֲךָ טוֹבָה;    תַּנְחֵנִי, בְּאֶרֶץ מִישׁוֹר.
10.english: Teach me to do Thy will, for Thou art my God; {N}let Thy good spirit lead me in an even land.

11.hebrew: לְמַעַן-שִׁמְךָ יְהוָה תְּחַיֵּנִי;    בְּצִדְקָתְךָ, תּוֹצִיא מִצָּרָה נַפְשִׁי.
11.english: For Thy name's sake, O LORD, quicken me; in Thy righteousness bring my soul out of trouble.

12.hebrew: וּבְחַסְדְּךָ, תַּצְמִית אֹיְבָי:    וְהַאֲבַדְתָּ, כָּל-צֹרְרֵי נַפְשִׁי--כִּי, אֲנִי עַבְדֶּךָ.
12.english: And in Thy mercy cut off mine enemies, and destroy all them that harass my soul; for I am Thy servant. {P}

1.hebrew: לְדָוִד:  בָּרוּךְ יְהוָה, צוּרִי--    הַמְלַמֵּד יָדַי לַקְרָב;אֶצְבְּעוֹתַי,    לַמִּלְחָמָה.
1.english: [A Psalm] of David. Blessed be the LORD my Rock, who traineth my hands for war, {N}and my fingers for battle;

2.hebrew: חַסְדִּי וּמְצוּדָתִי,    מִשְׂגַּבִּי וּמְפַלְטִי-לִי:מָגִנִּי, וּבוֹ חָסִיתִי;    הָרוֹדֵד עַמִּי תַחְתָּי.
2.english: My lovingkindness, and my fortress, my high tower, and my deliverer; {N}my shield, and He in whom I take refuge; who subdueth my people under me.

3.hebrew: יְהוָה--מָה-אָדָם, וַתֵּדָעֵהוּ:    בֶּן-אֱנוֹשׁ, וַתְּחַשְּׁבֵהוּ.
3.english: LORD, what is man, that Thou takest knowledge of him? or the son of man, that Thou makest account of him?

4.hebrew: אָדָם, לַהֶבֶל דָּמָה;    יָמָיו, כְּצֵל עוֹבֵר.
4.english: Man is like unto a breath; his days are as a shadow that passeth away.

5.hebrew: יְהוָה, הַט-שָׁמֶיךָ וְתֵרֵד;    גַּע בֶּהָרִים וְיֶעֱשָׁנוּ.
5.english: O LORD, bow Thy heavens, and come down; touch the mountains, that they may smoke.

6.hebrew: בְּרוֹק בָּרָק, וּתְפִיצֵם;    שְׁלַח חִצֶּיךָ, וּתְהֻמֵּם.
6.english: Cast forth lightning, and scatter them; send out Thine arrows, and discomfit them.

7.hebrew: שְׁלַח יָדֶיךָ, מִמָּרוֹם:    פְּצֵנִי וְהַצִּילֵנִי, מִמַּיִם רַבִּים; מִיַּד, בְּנֵי נֵכָר.
7.english: Stretch forth Thy hands from on high; rescue me, and deliver me out of many waters, out of the hand of strangers;

8.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר פִּיהֶם, דִּבֶּר-שָׁוְא;    וִימִינָם, יְמִין שָׁקֶר.
8.english: Whose mouth speaketh falsehood, and their right hand is a right hand of lying.

9.hebrew: אֱלֹהִים--שִׁיר חָדָשׁ, אָשִׁירָה לָּךְ;    בְּנֵבֶל עָשׂוֹר, אֲזַמְּרָה-לָּךְ.
9.english: O God, I will sing a new song unto Thee, upon a psaltery of ten strings will I sing praises unto Thee;

10.hebrew: הַנּוֹתֵן תְּשׁוּעָה, לַמְּלָכִים:    הַפּוֹצֶה, אֶת-דָּוִד עַבְדּוֹ--מֵחֶרֶב רָעָה.
10.english: Who givest salvation unto kings, who rescuest David Thy servant from the hurtful sword.

11.hebrew: פְּצֵנִי וְהַצִּילֵנִי,    מִיַּד בְּנֵי-נֵכָר:אֲשֶׁר פִּיהֶם, דִּבֶּר-שָׁוְא;    וִימִינָם, יְמִין שָׁקֶר.
11.english: Rescue me, and deliver me out of the hand of strangers, {N}whose mouth speaketh falsehood, and their right hand is a right hand of lying.

12.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר בָּנֵינוּ, כִּנְטִעִים--    מְגֻדָּלִים בִּנְעוּרֵיהֶם:בְּנוֹתֵינוּ כְזָוִיֹּת--    מְחֻטָּבוֹת, תַּבְנִית הֵיכָל.
12.english: We whose sons are as plants grown up in their youth; {N}whose daughters are as corner-pillars carved after the fashion of a palace;

13.hebrew: מְזָוֵינוּ מְלֵאִים--    מְפִיקִים מִזַּן, אֶל-זַן:צֹאונֵנוּ מַאֲלִיפוֹת, מְרֻבָּבוֹת--    בְּחוּצוֹתֵינוּ.
13.english: Whose garners are full, affording all manner of store; {N}whose sheep increase by thousands and ten thousands in our fields;

14.hebrew: אַלּוּפֵינוּ, מְסֻבָּלִים:    אֵין-פֶּרֶץ, וְאֵין יוֹצֵאת; וְאֵין צְוָחָה, בִּרְחֹבֹתֵינוּ.
14.english: Whose oxen are well laden; with no breach, and no going forth, and no outcry in our broad places;

15.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵי הָעָם, שֶׁכָּכָה לּוֹ:    אַשְׁרֵי הָעָם, שֱׁיְהוָה אֱלֹהָיו.
15.english: Happy is the people that is in such a case. Yea, happy is the people whose God is the LORD. {P}

1.hebrew: תְּהִלָּה, לְדָוִד:אֲרוֹמִמְךָ אֱלוֹהַי הַמֶּלֶךְ;    וַאֲבָרְכָה שִׁמְךָ, לְעוֹלָם וָעֶד.
1.english: [A Psalm of] praise; of David. {N}I will extol Thee, my God, O King; and I will bless Thy name for ever and ever.

2.hebrew: בְּכָל-יוֹם אֲבָרְכֶךָּ;    וַאֲהַלְלָה שִׁמְךָ, לְעוֹלָם וָעֶד.
2.english: Every day will I bless Thee; and I will praise Thy name for ever and ever.

3.hebrew: גָּדוֹל יְהוָה וּמְהֻלָּל מְאֹד;    וְלִגְדֻלָּתוֹ, אֵין חֵקֶר.
3.english: Great is the LORD, and highly to be praised; and His greatness is unsearchable.

4.hebrew: דּוֹר לְדוֹר, יְשַׁבַּח מַעֲשֶׂיךָ;    וּגְבוּרֹתֶיךָ יַגִּידוּ.
4.english: One generation shall laud Thy works to another, and shall declare Thy mighty acts.

5.hebrew: הֲדַר, כְּבוֹד הוֹדֶךָ--    וְדִבְרֵי נִפְלְאֹתֶיךָ אָשִׂיחָה.
5.english: The glorious splendour of Thy majesty, and Thy wondrous works, will I rehearse.

6.hebrew: וֶעֱזוּז נוֹרְאֹתֶיךָ יֹאמֵרוּ;    וגדלותיך (וּגְדֻלָּתְךָ) אֲסַפְּרֶנָּה.
6.english: And men shall speak of the might of Thy tremendous acts; and I will tell of Thy greatness.

7.hebrew: זֵכֶר רַב-טוּבְךָ יַבִּיעוּ;    וְצִדְקָתְךָ יְרַנֵּנוּ.
7.english: They shall utter the fame of Thy great goodness, and shall sing of Thy righteousness.

8.hebrew: חַנּוּן וְרַחוּם יְהוָה;    אֶרֶךְ אַפַּיִם, וּגְדָל-חָסֶד.
8.english: The LORD is gracious, and full of compassion; slow to anger, and of great mercy.

9.hebrew: טוֹב-יְהוָה לַכֹּל;    וְרַחֲמָיו, עַל-כָּל-מַעֲשָׂיו.
9.english: The LORD is good to all; and His tender mercies are over all His works.

10.hebrew: יוֹדוּךָ יְהוָה, כָּל-מַעֲשֶׂיךָ;    וַחֲסִידֶיךָ, יְבָרְכוּכָה.
10.english: All Thy works shall praise Thee, O LORD; and Thy saints shall bless Thee.

11.hebrew: כְּבוֹד מַלְכוּתְךָ יֹאמֵרוּ;    וּגְבוּרָתְךָ יְדַבֵּרוּ.
11.english: They shall speak of the glory of Thy kingdom, and talk of Thy might;

12.hebrew: לְהוֹדִיעַ, לִבְנֵי הָאָדָם--גְּבוּרֹתָיו;    וּכְבוֹד, הֲדַר מַלְכוּתוֹ.
12.english: To make known to the sons of men His mighty acts, and the glory of the majesty of His kingdom.

13.hebrew: מַלְכוּתְךָ, מַלְכוּת כָּל-עֹלָמִים;    וּמֶמְשַׁלְתְּךָ, בְּכָל-דּוֹר וָדֹר.
13.english: Thy kingdom is a kingdom for all ages, and Thy dominion endureth throughout all generations.

14.hebrew: סוֹמֵךְ יְהוָה, לְכָל-הַנֹּפְלִים;    וְזוֹקֵף, לְכָל-הַכְּפוּפִים.
14.english: The LORD upholdeth all that fall, and raiseth up all those that are bowed down.

15.hebrew: עֵינֵי-כֹל, אֵלֶיךָ יְשַׂבֵּרוּ;    וְאַתָּה נוֹתֵן-לָהֶם אֶת-אָכְלָם בְּעִתּוֹ.
15.english: The eyes of all wait for Thee, and Thou givest them their food in due season.

16.hebrew: פּוֹתֵחַ אֶת-יָדֶךָ;    וּמַשְׂבִּיעַ לְכָל-חַי רָצוֹן.
16.english: Thou openest Thy hand, and satisfiest every living thing with favour.

17.hebrew: צַדִּיק יְהוָה, בְּכָל-דְּרָכָיו;    וְחָסִיד, בְּכָל-מַעֲשָׂיו.
17.english: The LORD is righteous in all His ways, and gracious in all His works.

18.hebrew: קָרוֹב יְהוָה, לְכָל-קֹרְאָיו--    לְכֹל אֲשֶׁר יִקְרָאֻהוּ בֶאֱמֶת.
18.english: The LORD is nigh unto all them that call upon Him, to all that call upon Him in truth.

19.hebrew: רְצוֹן-יְרֵאָיו יַעֲשֶׂה;    וְאֶת-שַׁוְעָתָם יִשְׁמַע, וְיוֹשִׁיעֵם.
19.english: He will fulfil the desire of them that fear Him; He also will hear their cry, and will save them.

20.hebrew: שׁוֹמֵר יְהוָה, אֶת-כָּל-אֹהֲבָיו;    וְאֵת כָּל-הָרְשָׁעִים יַשְׁמִיד.
20.english: The LORD preserveth all them that love Him; but all the wicked will He destroy.

21.hebrew: תְּהִלַּת יְהוָה, יְדַבֶּר-פִּי:    וִיבָרֵךְ כָּל-בָּשָׂר, שֵׁם קָדְשׁוֹ--לְעוֹלָם וָעֶד.
21.english: My mouth shall speak the praise of the LORD; and let all flesh bless His holy name for ever and ever. {P}

1.hebrew: הַלְלוּ-יָהּ:הַלְלִי נַפְשִׁי,    אֶת-יְהוָה.
1.english: Hallelujah. {N}Praise the LORD, O my soul.

2.hebrew: אֲהַלְלָה יְהוָה בְּחַיָּי;    אֲזַמְּרָה לֵאלֹהַי בְּעוֹדִי.
2.english: I will praise the LORD while I live; I will sing praises unto my God while I have my being.

3.hebrew: אַל-תִּבְטְחוּ בִנְדִיבִים--    בְּבֶן-אָדָם, שֶׁאֵין לוֹ תְשׁוּעָה.
3.english: Put not your trust in princes, nor in the son of man, in whom there is no help.

4.hebrew: תֵּצֵא רוּחוֹ, יָשֻׁב לְאַדְמָתוֹ;    בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, אָבְדוּ עֶשְׁתֹּנֹתָיו.
4.english: His breath goeth forth, he returneth to his dust; in that very day his thoughts perish.

5.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵי--שֶׁאֵל יַעֲקֹב בְּעֶזְרוֹ:    שִׂבְרוֹ, עַל-יְהוָה אֱלֹהָיו.
5.english: Happy is he whose help is the God of Jacob, whose hope is in the LORD his God,

6.hebrew: עֹשֶׂה, שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ--    אֶת-הַיָּם וְאֶת-כָּל-אֲשֶׁר-בָּם;הַשֹּׁמֵר אֱמֶת    לְעוֹלָם.
6.english: Who made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that in them is; {N}who keepeth truth for ever;

7.hebrew: עֹשֶׂה מִשְׁפָּט, לָעֲשׁוּקִים--נֹתֵן לֶחֶם, לָרְעֵבִים;    יְהוָה, מַתִּיר אֲסוּרִים.
7.english: Who executeth justice for the oppressed; who giveth bread to the hungry. The LORD looseth the prisoners;

8.hebrew: יְהוָה, פֹּקֵחַ עִוְרִים--יְהוָה, זֹקֵף כְּפוּפִים;    יְהוָה, אֹהֵב צַדִּיקִים.
8.english: The LORD openeth the eyes of the blind; the LORD raiseth up them that are bowed down; the LORD loveth the righteous;

9.hebrew: יְהוָה, שֹׁמֵר אֶת-גֵּרִים--יָתוֹם וְאַלְמָנָה יְעוֹדֵד;    וְדֶרֶךְ רְשָׁעִים יְעַוֵּת.
9.english: The LORD preserveth the strangers; He upholdeth the fatherless and the widow; but the way of the wicked He maketh crooked.

10.hebrew: יִמְלֹךְ יְהוָה, לְעוֹלָם--    אֱלֹהַיִךְ צִיּוֹן, לְדֹר וָדֹר:הַלְלוּ-יָהּ.
10.english: The LORD will reign for ever, thy God, O Zion, unto all generations. {N}Hallelujah.

1.hebrew: הַלְלוּ-יָהּ:כִּי-טוֹב, זַמְּרָה אֱלֹהֵינוּ--    כִּי-נָעִים, נָאוָה תְהִלָּה.
1.english: Hallelujah; {N}for it is good to sing praises unto our God; for it is pleasant, and praise is comely.

2.hebrew: בּוֹנֵה יְרוּשָׁלִַם יְהוָה;    נִדְחֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל יְכַנֵּס.
2.english: The LORD doth build up Jerusalem, He gathereth together the dispersed of Israel;

3.hebrew: הָרֹפֵא, לִשְׁבוּרֵי לֵב;    וּמְחַבֵּשׁ, לְעַצְּבוֹתָם.
3.english: Who healeth the broken in heart, and bindeth up their wounds.

4.hebrew: מוֹנֶה מִסְפָּר, לַכּוֹכָבִים;    לְכֻלָּם, שֵׁמוֹת יִקְרָא.
4.english: He counteth the number of the stars; He giveth them all their names.

5.hebrew: גָּדוֹל אֲדוֹנֵינוּ וְרַב-כֹּחַ;    לִתְבוּנָתוֹ, אֵין מִסְפָּר.
5.english: Great is our Lord, and mighty in power; His understanding is infinite.

6.hebrew: מְעוֹדֵד עֲנָוִים יְהוָה;    מַשְׁפִּיל רְשָׁעִים עֲדֵי-אָרֶץ.
6.english: The LORD upholdeth the humble; He bringeth the wicked down to the ground.

7.hebrew: עֱנוּ לַיהוָה בְּתוֹדָה;    זַמְּרוּ לֵאלֹהֵינוּ בְכִנּוֹר.
7.english: Sing unto the LORD with thanksgiving, sing praises upon the harp unto our God;

8.hebrew: הַמְכַסֶּה שָׁמַיִם, בְּעָבִים--    הַמֵּכִין לָאָרֶץ מָטָר;הַמַּצְמִיחַ הָרִים    חָצִיר.
8.english: Who covereth the heaven with clouds, who prepareth rain for the earth, {N}who maketh the mountains to spring with grass.

9.hebrew: נוֹתֵן לִבְהֵמָה לַחְמָהּ;    לִבְנֵי עֹרֵב, אֲשֶׁר יִקְרָאוּ.
9.english: He giveth to the beast his food, and to the young ravens which cry.

10.hebrew: לֹא בִגְבוּרַת הַסּוּס יֶחְפָּץ;    לֹא-בְשׁוֹקֵי הָאִישׁ יִרְצֶה.
10.english: He delighteth not in the strength of the horse; He taketh no pleasure in the legs of a man.

11.hebrew: רוֹצֶה יְהוָה, אֶת-יְרֵאָיו--    אֶת-הַמְיַחֲלִים לְחַסְדּוֹ.
11.english: The LORD taketh pleasure in them that fear Him, in those that wait for His mercy.

12.hebrew: שַׁבְּחִי יְרוּשָׁלִַם, אֶת-יְהוָה;    הַלְלִי אֱלֹהַיִךְ צִיּוֹן.
12.english: Glorify the LORD, O Jerusalem; praise thy God, O Zion.

13.hebrew: כִּי-חִזַּק, בְּרִיחֵי שְׁעָרָיִךְ;    בֵּרַךְ בָּנַיִךְ בְּקִרְבֵּךְ.
13.english: For He hath made strong the bars of thy gates; He hath blessed thy children within thee.

14.hebrew: הַשָּׂם-גְּבוּלֵךְ שָׁלוֹם;    חֵלֶב חִטִּים, יַשְׂבִּיעֵךְ.
14.english: He maketh thy borders peace; He giveth thee in plenty the fat of wheat.

15.hebrew: הַשֹּׁלֵחַ אִמְרָתוֹ אָרֶץ;    עַד-מְהֵרָה, יָרוּץ דְּבָרוֹ.
15.english: He sendeth out His commandment upon earth; His word runneth very swiftly.

16.hebrew: הַנֹּתֵן שֶׁלֶג כַּצָּמֶר;    כְּפוֹר, כָּאֵפֶר יְפַזֵּר.
16.english: He giveth snow like wool; He scattereth the hoar-frost like ashes.

17.hebrew: מַשְׁלִיךְ קַרְחוֹ כְפִתִּים;    לִפְנֵי קָרָתוֹ, מִי יַעֲמֹד.
17.english: He casteth forth His ice like crumbs; who can stand before His cold?

18.hebrew: יִשְׁלַח דְּבָרוֹ וְיַמְסֵם;    יַשֵּׁב רוּחוֹ, יִזְּלוּ-מָיִם.
18.english: He sendeth forth His word, and melteth them; He causeth His wind to blow, and the waters flow.

19.hebrew: מַגִּיד דְּבָרָו לְיַעֲקֹב;    חֻקָּיו וּמִשְׁפָּטָיו, לְיִשְׂרָאֵל.
19.english: He declareth His word unto Jacob, His statutes and His ordinances unto Israel.

20.hebrew: לֹא עָשָׂה כֵן, לְכָל-גּוֹי--    וּמִשְׁפָּטִים בַּל-יְדָעוּם:הַלְלוּ-יָהּ.
20.english: He hath not dealt so with any nation; and as for His ordinances, they have not known them. {N}Hallelujah.

1.hebrew: הַלְלוּ-יָהּ:הַלְלוּ אֶת-יְהוָה, מִן-הַשָּׁמַיִם;    הַלְלוּהוּ, בַּמְּרוֹמִים.
1.english: Hallelujah. {N}Praise ye the LORD from the heavens; praise Him in the heights.

2.hebrew: הַלְלוּהוּ כָל-מַלְאָכָיו;    הַלְלוּהוּ, כָּל-צְבָאָו.
2.english: Praise ye Him, all His angels; praise ye Him, all His hosts.

3.hebrew: הַלְלוּהוּ, שֶׁמֶשׁ וְיָרֵחַ;    הַלְלוּהוּ, כָּל-כּוֹכְבֵי אוֹר.
3.english: Praise ye Him, sun and moon; praise Him, all ye stars of light.

4.hebrew: הַלְלוּהוּ, שְׁמֵי הַשָּׁמָיִם;    וְהַמַּיִם, אֲשֶׁר מֵעַל הַשָּׁמָיִם.
4.english: Praise Him, ye heavens of heavens, and ye waters that are above the heavens.

5.hebrew: יְהַלְלוּ, אֶת-שֵׁם יְהוָה:    כִּי הוּא צִוָּה וְנִבְרָאוּ.
5.english: Let them praise the name of the LORD; for He commanded, and they were created.

6.hebrew: וַיַּעֲמִידֵם לָעַד לְעוֹלָם;    חָק-נָתַן, וְלֹא יַעֲבוֹר.
6.english: He hath also established them for ever and ever; He hath made a decree which shall not be transgressed.

7.hebrew: הַלְלוּ אֶת-יְהוָה, מִן-הָאָרֶץ--    תַּנִּינִים, וְכָל-תְּהֹמוֹת.
7.english: Praise the LORD from the earth, ye sea-monsters, and all deeps;

8.hebrew: אֵשׁ וּבָרָד, שֶׁלֶג וְקִיטוֹר;    רוּחַ סְעָרָה, עֹשָׂה דְבָרוֹ.
8.english: Fire and hail, snow and vapour, stormy wind, fulfilling His word;

9.hebrew: הֶהָרִים וְכָל-גְּבָעוֹת;    עֵץ פְּרִי, וְכָל-אֲרָזִים.
9.english: Mountains and all hills, fruitful trees and all cedars;

10.hebrew: הַחַיָּה וְכָל-בְּהֵמָה;    רֶמֶשׂ, וְצִפּוֹר כָּנָף.
10.english: Beasts and all cattle, creeping things and winged fowl;

11.hebrew: מַלְכֵי-אֶרֶץ, וְכָל-לְאֻמִּים;    שָׂרִים, וְכָל-שֹׁפְטֵי אָרֶץ.
11.english: Kings of the earth and all peoples, princes and all judges of the earth;

12.hebrew: בַּחוּרִים וְגַם-בְּתוּלוֹת;    זְקֵנִים, עִם-נְעָרִים.
12.english: Both young men and maidens, old men and children;

13.hebrew: יְהַלְלוּ, אֶת-שֵׁם יְהוָה--    כִּי-נִשְׂגָּב שְׁמוֹ לְבַדּוֹ:הוֹדוֹ,    עַל-אֶרֶץ וְשָׁמָיִם.
13.english: Let them praise the name of the LORD, for His name alone is exalted; {N}His glory is above the earth and heaven.

14.hebrew: וַיָּרֶם קֶרֶן לְעַמּוֹ,    תְּהִלָּה לְכָל-חֲסִידָיו--לִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל,    עַם קְרֹבוֹ:הַלְלוּ-יָהּ.
14.english: And He hath lifted up a horn for His people, a praise for all His saints, {N}even for the children of Israel, a people near unto Him. {N}Hallelujah.

1.hebrew: הַלְלוּ-יָהּ:שִׁירוּ לַיהוָה, שִׁיר חָדָשׁ;    תְּהִלָּתוֹ, בִּקְהַל חֲסִידִים.
1.english: Hallelujah. {N}Sing unto the LORD a new song, and His praise in the assembly of the saints.

2.hebrew: יִשְׂמַח יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּעֹשָׂיו;    בְּנֵי-צִיּוֹן, יָגִילוּ בְמַלְכָּם.
2.english: Let Israel rejoice in his Maker; let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.

3.hebrew: יְהַלְלוּ שְׁמוֹ בְמָחוֹל;    בְּתֹף וְכִנּוֹר, יְזַמְּרוּ-לוֹ.
3.english: Let them praise His name in the dance; let them sing praises unto Him with the timbrel and harp.

4.hebrew: כִּי-רוֹצֶה יְהוָה בְּעַמּוֹ;    יְפָאֵר עֲנָוִים, בִּישׁוּעָה.
4.english: For the LORD taketh pleasure in His people; He adorneth the humble with salvation.

5.hebrew: יַעְלְזוּ חֲסִידִים בְּכָבוֹד;    יְרַנְּנוּ, עַל-מִשְׁכְּבוֹתָם.
5.english: Let the saints exult in glory; let them sing for joy upon their beds.

6.hebrew: רוֹמְמוֹת אֵל, בִּגְרוֹנָם;    וְחֶרֶב פִּיפִיּוֹת בְּיָדָם.
6.english: Let the high praises of God be in their mouth, and a two-edged sword in their hand;

7.hebrew: לַעֲשׂוֹת נְקָמָה, בַּגּוֹיִם;    תּוֹכֵחוֹת, בַּלְאֻמִּים.
7.english: To execute vengeance upon the nations, and chastisements upon the peoples;

8.hebrew: לֶאְסֹר מַלְכֵיהֶם בְּזִקִּים;    וְנִכְבְּדֵיהֶם, בְּכַבְלֵי בַרְזֶל.
8.english: To bind their kings with chains, and their nobles with fetters of iron;

9.hebrew: לַעֲשׂוֹת בָּהֶם, מִשְׁפָּט כָּתוּב--    הָדָר הוּא, לְכָל-חֲסִידָיו:הַלְלוּ-יָהּ.
9.english: To execute upon them the judgment written; He is the glory of all His saints. {N}Hallelujah.

1.hebrew: הַלְלוּ-יָהּ:הַלְלוּ-אֵל בְּקָדְשׁוֹ;    הַלְלוּהוּ, בִּרְקִיעַ עֻזּוֹ.
1.english: Hallelujah. {N}Praise God in His sanctuary; praise Him in the firmament of His power.

2.hebrew: הַלְלוּהוּ בִגְבוּרֹתָיו;    הַלְלוּהוּ, כְּרֹב גֻּדְלוֹ.
2.english: Praise Him for His mighty acts; praise Him according to His abundant greatness.

3.hebrew: הַלְלוּהוּ, בְּתֵקַע שׁוֹפָר;    הַלְלוּהוּ, בְּנֵבֶל וְכִנּוֹר.
3.english: Praise Him with the blast of the horn; praise Him with the psaltery and harp.

4.hebrew: הַלְלוּהוּ, בְּתֹף וּמָחוֹל;    הַלְלוּהוּ, בְּמִנִּים וְעֻגָב.
4.english: Praise Him with the timbrel and dance; praise Him with stringed instruments and the pipe.

5.hebrew: הַלְלוּהוּ בְצִלְצְלֵי-שָׁמַע;    הַלְלוּהוּ, בְּצִלְצְלֵי תְרוּעָה.
5.english: Praise Him with the loud-sounding cymbals; praise Him with the clanging cymbals.

6.hebrew: כֹּל הַנְּשָׁמָה, תְּהַלֵּל יָהּ:            הַלְלוּ-יָהּ.
6.english: Let every thing that hath breath praise the LORD. {S} Hallelujah. {P}

1.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵי הָאִישׁ--    אֲשֶׁר לֹא הָלַךְ, בַּעֲצַת רְשָׁעִים;וּבְדֶרֶךְ חַטָּאִים, לֹא עָמָד,    וּבְמוֹשַׁב לֵצִים, לֹא יָשָׁב.
1.english: Happy is the man that hath not walked in the counsel of the wicked, {N}nor stood in the way of sinners, nor sat in the seat of the scornful.

2.hebrew: כִּי אִם בְּתוֹרַת יְהוָה, חֶפְצוֹ;    וּבְתוֹרָתוֹ יֶהְגֶּה, יוֹמָם וָלָיְלָה.
2.english: But his delight is in the law of the LORD; and in His law doth he meditate day and night.

3.hebrew: וְהָיָה--    כְּעֵץ, שָׁתוּל עַל-פַּלְגֵי-מָיִם:אֲשֶׁר פִּרְיוֹ, יִתֵּן בְּעִתּוֹ--וְעָלֵהוּ לֹא-יִבּוֹל;    וְכֹל אֲשֶׁר-יַעֲשֶׂה יַצְלִיחַ.
3.english: And he shall be like a tree planted by streams of water, {N}that bringeth forth its fruit in its season, and whose leaf doth not wither; and in whatsoever he doeth he shall prosper.

4.hebrew: לֹא-כֵן הָרְשָׁעִים:    כִּי אִם-כַּמֹּץ, אֲשֶׁר-תִּדְּפֶנּוּ רוּחַ.
4.english: Not so the wicked; but they are like the chaff which the wind driveth away.

5.hebrew: עַל-כֵּן, לֹא-יָקֻמוּ רְשָׁעִים--בַּמִּשְׁפָּט;    וְחַטָּאִים, בַּעֲדַת צַדִּיקִים.
5.english: Therefore the wicked shall not stand in the judgment, nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous.

6.hebrew: כִּי-יוֹדֵעַ יְהוָה, דֶּרֶךְ צַדִּיקִים;    וְדֶרֶךְ רְשָׁעִים תֹּאבֵד.
6.english: For the LORD regardeth the way of the righteous; but the way of the wicked shall perish. {P}
